data.what_is: Keap is an all-in-one CRM and sales & marketing automation platform designed to grow your business. With Keap, you'll easily capture, organize, track, and nurture all of your leads to increase sales and revenue. To ensure your success, Keap also offers expert coaching, in-depth training, outstanding support, and a dedicated community of entrepreneurs.
data.product_description: Small business CRM, e-commerce, email and social marketing solution all in one placeWe founded Keap after enduring the same business struggles you do.More than 50% of our employees have owned or worked in small business.Your success is at the core of our culture. That's why we offer plans to grow your business:ProOur all-in-one CRM, sales and marketing automation software offers repeatable sales processes and marketing campaigns that give a proMax and Max ClassicOur top-tier offering helps grow businesses who need a CRM with advanced sales and marketing automation, and fully customizable campaigns that easily integrate with a host of powerful apps.

features.name: Customization
features.content: Based on 177 Keap reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Allows administrators to customize to accomodate their unique processes.  Includes ability to create custom objects, fields, rules, calculations, and views.

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: Based on 169 Keap reviews and verified by the G2 Product R&D team. Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

initial_reviews.review_title: Customizable, Organized, and Lots of Features
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Above all, I am incredibly grateful that Keap helps me stay on top of industry regulations and best practices. It keeps up with current trends and relevant features, helps me stay organized, and when I have needed customer service in the past, they have been incredibly helpful. We use it for both internal marketing and emailing our patients, and it is easy to use and track our metrics as well.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I can't really think of any. It does the job and I don't have any suggestions for improvements at this time!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before Keap, we didn't communicate with our patients via email on a large scale. I love the HIPAA compliance, being able to contact all of our patients at once, and that I was able to monitor replies from my Outlook email. We also love sending welcome emails to all of our new evaluations, which came with the added benefit of being able to track how every patient heard about us, what they're being seen for, etc.

initial_reviews.review_title: One of the best CRMS on the market!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I absolutely love the versatility of Keap. Whatever I can imagine in terms of an automation/workflow, I have been able to create inside of Keap. I also love that it works in the same way I think, very logical, analytical and WYSIWYG. If I have a question, customer support is only one click away and are readily available to assist. It integrates with so many programs and the endless feature make it an asset to any small business.

What do you dislike about Keap?
While they have worked out a lot of them, a few years ago - it hit a point where it was REALLY buggy. I haven't had any problems sense then so I can't think of anything I dislike right now.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
As an administrator for Keap, it has helped my clients easily onboard new clients, convert potential leads, keep contact lists warm with nurturing campaigns, and ease the checkout process with an intuitive shopping cart.

initial_reviews.review_title: Powerful enough to handle anything if you're willing to learn how
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I use this every day and Keap's automation & email capabilities have met all of my needs marketing our agency the last 6 years. The company has made consistent efforts to improve that along the way. What it doesn't do natively I can do through integrations such as Zapier or Plusthis and they always play nicely together. Customer support has also always been very helpful even recording videos to send me to help. Contact & company records are all completely customizable as well which makes a lot of things possible.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Because of the depth of what Keap CAN do, it takes a good while for team members to be fully trained in how to do all those things and if someone isn't tech savvy, they may not find it user-friendly. That said, I would never give up the capabilities for a simpler experience because they're worth it. Any other complaint I have is super minor like some search/filter settings only being available on select reports.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap helps us manage and automate promotions to our lists of thousands of prospective clients

initial_reviews.review_title: Good for Small Business
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Chat support is a great resourse for immediate answers to basic Keap functions. I use it fairly frequently.

The alerts on email deliverability health to keep our emails from being blacklisted have been very helpful.

Once we learned how how to build automation campaigns, building out new campaigns and automating our processes has been very useful. And one of the best features in the campaigns is the "Test" action in the builder's decision diamonds.

The Keap academy contains a plethora of information. I was able to eaily set up and implement the Opportunities feature which keeps our salesmen happy with the round-robin distribution.

There are numerous Keap partners available to hire for easy project integration. We use ours fairly frequently to help us with large projects.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Although the chat support is a great feature, the respondants seem to only have base knowledge of their software. My inquiries generally involve how to find Keap features, and I usually have to explain myself multiple times (in various ways) before they understand my question.

There are some functionality features of Keap that should be improved, such as:
- being able to manually create invoices that include a product AND a subscription.
- if a manual subscription-only invoice is sent, the original payment method should be applied for subsequent billing, but it's not. This creates unnecessary MANUAL checks and balances.

Concerns like these (and others) are often times "escalated to the development team" but I never know if they actuall see (or ever fix) the addressed suggestions.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have been able to build insightful reports to keep tabs on progress of marketing, sales, support, etc.

initial_reviews.review_title: Not as intuitive and comprehensive as basic competitors.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
At first glance, it IS user-friendly. It is easy accessible, has a training program, and is good at letting users know about new training offerings. It manually reminds you not to over-market to customers that haven't provided explicit permissions, which is ideal.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It seems so invested in its 'training' programs' yet it doesn't appear to translate to the actual user experience. It is not as comprehensive and integrative as a medium-sized business would care for, and so much that several of our employees are put off by the idea of using it. As the person tasked with becoming the company-Keap-'guru'', I personally found it very confusing. Even when diving into the 'training' programs, they appeared to be more content-based and focused on the 'why' and not the 'how' to use such a supposedly basic program. It's hard to navigate at first glance unless you've become accustomed to it after a while, so hence, not a intuitive as we would like.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's a nice customer-centric tool to capture leads and track email marketing efforts.

initial_reviews.review_title: Tag! You're It
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love that I can apply "tags" to my customers.  It makes it very easy to search for customers who match the criteria I am looking for in order to generate leads to fill my sales pipeline.  It also allows me to quickly see what the customer's history with us by searching tags rather than manually looking in the "person notes."  I also think its great that I can see if a customer has viewed an email I sent or not.

What do you dislike about Keap?
When the quick search goes down it is hard because I often use Keap when I am in the middle of online meetings and the quick search is very convenient to quickly pull up a customer.  I also wish that you could use quick search to search companies rather than having to go to the Nav menu.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I highly reccommend that any new users integrate their Microsoft Outlook emails to Keap to keep track of who is a hot prospect and who is cold.  I also reccommend that users get all users in their organization to put notes in Person Notes the same way as everyone in the company. I also reccommend that every user who puts an entry in the "person notes" section attach a date to their note, as there is no automatic date stamp for the notes.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem we have solved with Keap, for me, is the ability to track the emails I send.  It allows me to see if a customer has actually opened an email from me.  Sometimes a customer will say that they called references that I may have sent in an email at their request, but when I look it is easy for me to see if they are not telling me the truth.  Or if they say they did not get an email, I can look to see if that is really the case.

initial_reviews.review_title: My first year with Keap
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I struggle to answer this because I haven't been able to even build a campaign yet because we are still trying to work out all the bugs just to keep track of my client base!

What do you dislike about Keap?
We have had nothing but challenges in every area of Keap. Glitches, painfully slow access, data not saving, searches not giving accurate results, mobile app issues, voicemail issues, texting problems, support taking forever to resolve problems if they even address them at all! Not to mention monetary losses due to Keap that Keap refused to reimburse!!!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is not solving any of my problems; rather it seems every time I log in there is a new challenge/problem with Keap. The only way Keap helps me is that it allows more than one person to access all the client data and connect with clients.

The last thing is whenever we are typing up quotes if you accidentally click out of the quote, it does not save the draft, it just deletes the whole thing which is pretty frustrating when putting together extensive quotes

We get good help with respect to keeping the team together during the integration. It is usually the most good help with potential customer administration and support ticketing.

initial_reviews.review_title: Keap is the CRM that revolutionized our needs
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Because it helped me reduce the amount of different apps I needed, Keap is wonderful. With just one study experience, I now have them all in one space. Keap makes the integral component of the advertising and front-end run smoothly and simultaneously offers the excellent user experiences that we are valued for. In fact, it ended up being cheaper compared to all my different tools from before combined. Keap is an extraordinary help for campaigns and innovative marketing strategies due to the diversity of links to other systems. Keap fits all the requests we have, including lead management, internet usage, video calling and Gmail integrations, and it is feasible to connect to other requests as needed.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The billing procedure has been difficult; There have been some problems with entering credit card data and Keap's email transmission tracking has not shown all the links that were visited, but only shows the initial link. As far as this was implemented, it was not possible to have an exact control of the advertising revenue. A double-subscription email has certain customization possibilities.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I would like to see an improved web builder that is more powerful and easier to use, as well as having more options available for those who want to trigger campaign objectives based on specific fields in the builder. Also, there are some difficulties when doing the handoff of customer data into the system; a more automatic way to accomplish this needs to be found. Keap is a surface that mixes a CRM with marketing and advertising automation in order to assist companies in their expansion.

I've gone automation crazy. As a busy CEO who is both marketing and sales, Keap has helped me take a lot of follow-up tasks off my plate. Huge win.

initial_reviews.review_title: A tool suitable for small teams with decent automation goals
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
A simple, minimalistic interface makes Keap intuitive and easily adaptable. The time spent on the learning curve while interacting with a new tool is noticeably low with Keap. All options are easy to navigate and walk through!

What do you dislike about Keap?
- The list view, known as Groups, in Keap is a bit restricted in terms of applying filters.
- The Deal view can be improved for pipeline visibility. The platform also currently does not allow creating Groups/Lists using Deal-related filers like deal stages, activity, etc.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Problem: Keap is helping our small Sales maintain a pipeline to keep their work organized and Marketing to have visibility on deals and overall progress.

Benefit: Better visibility is helping us get a grip on our Sales and Marketing efforts combined.

initial_reviews.review_title: Old School to the New School
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
By far, the feature that brought me to Keap and that I rely most heavily upon is task automation.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is defintely a learning curve invovled and some features I do not use as routinely as others.  Those lesser used features I usually need to re-learn.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
What I know about business is that there are two ways you can scale which are automation and delegation to other team members.  My first choice is almost always to automate the task, even if some of it needs to be delegated to a person.  Keap allows me to move beyond automation of e-mail campaigns and document the entire sales process from lead collection, assignment to team members for follow-up, automated marketing sequences, e-commerce functionality, and more.

initial_reviews.review_title: One of the most amazing busienss tools out there!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I have been using Keap for several years and it is one of the best choices for my business that I made. As a business coach and consultant, I see so many email marketing and CRM systems used by my clients, and so many have limitations to the way they are used. With Keap, you can create customized funnels, amazing landing pages, and world-class emails. Not only that, I teach Keap to clients and one of the things I use and teach is the pipeline, which allows me to move people through my process and into a sale. I always know where my money is and what I need to focus on.

I use Keap daily and rarely have a problem with the software. But when I do, the customer service is amazing. They resolve any problems quickly and efficiently and in one call. I highly recommend this product and would love to talk to anyone who has questions.

What do you dislike about Keap?
One thing that does need improvement is when there is an update in the emails and landing pages. You have to recreate them and cannot copy them into the new integration. This is frustrating and causes rework, which I hate.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Keap for lead generation activities, and moving them through my emails sequences and sales pipeline.

initial_reviews.review_title: Great core platform, powerful automation, but many disjointed and incomplete features persist.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap (Ulitmate) has a very powerful and robust automation engine that is highly configurable by advanced users. It has excellent integration with Zapier, which adds in-depth cross-platform functionallity. Keap does have an API for more advanced users and developers, which is welcomed. Keap's Contact records are also highly customizable allowing for unique field additions and tagging.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap (Ultimate) is currently experiencing challenges due to system overload in my opinion. Over the past year, backend performance has declined, leading to slower page load times for end-users, which are now noticeably less efficient. The platform offers an abundance of features, but many seem superfluous, catering only to a limited range of business types and lacking in maturity. Additionally, the user interface (UI) transition is incomplete, falling short of what one might expect from a near-final release, and it appears to have undergone insufficient user testing.

Crucially, several features fundamental to the platform's core functionality are not yet fully operational. For instance, the email designer (builder) is missing modern capabilities that have been standard on comparable platforms for some time. Similarly, the landing page functionality does not meet current standards as it lacks essential features required for effectiveness. The documentation is another area of concern, with a significant portion appearing outdated. Keap should refocus on it core strengths and refine these features to a high degree and then branch out to other features in my opinion.

The mobile app has posed persistent issues for users over many years. Furthermore, Keap's attempt to integrate AI assistance in content creation is currently subpar and falls short of being practically useful at the time of this review. This feature, in its present state, should be considered for removal from the app in favor of implementing a third-party solution, as seen with other platforms.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Keap to automate some of our marketing efforts, but not all. We do not market via SMS but use it for client reminders. We keep most client data in Keap and use this for client retention marketing. We use automation along with integrations and some API transactions to help reduce staff workflow fatigue. We could use the platform for more and would like to. However, until core features reach a more robust state, we are still using other platforms and services.

initial_reviews.review_title: All The Best with No Fluff
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I enjoy the flexibility and management of Keap Ultimate. It's simple and easy to start using and once you understand the nomeclature of Automation, you'll never go back. Seriously, this was easy to impliment with a responsive Support Team who are available for specific questions when they come up. I use Keap Ultimate everyday as a way to manage Customers, Merchant Accounts and Products.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap Ultimate is the full package and they've thought about many different things related to what it takes to run a CRM. What is the most difficult thing about Keap is that there are limitations of certain custom fields and application of Permissions to different users. At the end of the previous version, you could create Groups and assign users to Groups (much like the Active Directory paradigm) but that is no longer the case.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap is solving the challenge of managaging, maintaining and curating a database of customers, products and emails. When it comes to emails its both about Transactional and Marketing messages. This heavy-lifiting is vital for our business and Keap is doing a great job of managing all of it from a centralzied location.

initial_reviews.review_title: Unmatched in automation and flexibility
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I have run my way through a few email marketing services and CRMs through my own business and through client work. They all have their own little quirks and peccadilloes, so choosing the right one for your business is going to depend on what specific services you need and what frustrates you the least.

For me, the visual logic of Keap's Campaign Builder is what won me over. It is the most flexible way to build an email campaign that I've seen, and once you learn it, it's pretty easy to use. (Hot Tip: watch the Monkeypod training videos, which are now a part of Keap Academy to learn how to use the features you need. They're easy to understand and Greg is a delight). If you DON'T want to learn it, there are plenty of experts for hire and pre-made campaigns in the marketplace that will probably do for your needs.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Sometimes they announce features in development prematurely and then abandon them. One such feature was native Shopify integration, which I was really excited about. I can still connect my shop to my Keap using Zapier, so it's not a problem so much as it is a disappointment.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
My business has two major arms that are largely unrelated to each other. I have my ecommerce shop, and I have creative services for clients. I need to be able to keep communications to those two segments separate, and I like being able to do that in exactly the way I want it done. Keap allows me the precision and flexibility to keep my clients sorted and organized, and not overlapping.

What do you dislike about Keap?

Keap has helped me grow my sales without growing my staff since 2008. We live in a global economy that runs 24/7. Keap helps me support thousands of customers in dozens of nations with a small support team while working from home.

all_reviews.review_title: Customizable, Organized, and Lots of Features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Above all, I am incredibly grateful that Keap helps me stay on top of industry regulations and best practices. It keeps up with current trends and relevant features, helps me stay organized, and when I have needed customer service in the past, they have been incredibly helpful. We use it for both internal marketing and emailing our patients, and it is easy to use and track our metrics as well.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I can't really think of any. It does the job and I don't have any suggestions for improvements at this time!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before Keap, we didn't communicate with our patients via email on a large scale. I love the HIPAA compliance, being able to contact all of our patients at once, and that I was able to monitor replies from my Outlook email. We also love sending welcome emails to all of our new evaluations, which came with the added benefit of being able to track how every patient heard about us, what they're being seen for, etc.

review_question_answers.answer: Above all, I am incredibly grateful that Keap helps me stay on top of industry regulations and best practices. It keeps up with current trends and relevant features, helps me stay organized, and when I have needed customer service in the past, they have been incredibly helpful. We use it for both internal marketing and emailing our patients, and it is easy to use and track our metrics as well.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: I can't really think of any. It does the job and I don't have any suggestions for improvements at this time!

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Before Keap, we didn't communicate with our patients via email on a large scale. I love the HIPAA compliance, being able to contact all of our patients at once, and that I was able to monitor replies from my Outlook email. We also love sending welcome emails to all of our new evaluations, which came with the added benefit of being able to track how every patient heard about us, what they're being seen for, etc.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful enough to handle anything if you're willing to learn how
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I use this every day and Keap's automation & email capabilities have met all of my needs marketing our agency the last 6 years. The company has made consistent efforts to improve that along the way. What it doesn't do natively I can do through integrations such as Zapier or Plusthis and they always play nicely together. Customer support has also always been very helpful even recording videos to send me to help. Contact & company records are all completely customizable as well which makes a lot of things possible.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Because of the depth of what Keap CAN do, it takes a good while for team members to be fully trained in how to do all those things and if someone isn't tech savvy, they may not find it user-friendly. That said, I would never give up the capabilities for a simpler experience because they're worth it. Any other complaint I have is super minor like some search/filter settings only being available on select reports.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap helps us manage and automate promotions to our lists of thousands of prospective clients

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Chat support is a great resourse for immediate answers to basic Keap functions. I use it fairly frequently.

The alerts on email deliverability health to keep our emails from being blacklisted have been very helpful.

Once we learned how how to build automation campaigns, building out new campaigns and automating our processes has been very useful. And one of the best features in the campaigns is the "Test" action in the builder's decision diamonds.

The Keap academy contains a plethora of information. I was able to eaily set up and implement the Opportunities feature which keeps our salesmen happy with the round-robin distribution.

There are numerous Keap partners available to hire for easy project integration. We use ours fairly frequently to help us with large projects.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Although the chat support is a great feature, the respondants seem to only have base knowledge of their software. My inquiries generally involve how to find Keap features, and I usually have to explain myself multiple times (in various ways) before they understand my question.

There are some functionality features of Keap that should be improved, such as:
- being able to manually create invoices that include a product AND a subscription.
- if a manual subscription-only invoice is sent, the original payment method should be applied for subsequent billing, but it's not. This creates unnecessary MANUAL checks and balances.

Concerns like these (and others) are often times "escalated to the development team" but I never know if they actuall see (or ever fix) the addressed suggestions.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have been able to build insightful reports to keep tabs on progress of marketing, sales, support, etc.

all_reviews.review_title: Not as intuitive and comprehensive as basic competitors.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
At first glance, it IS user-friendly. It is easy accessible, has a training program, and is good at letting users know about new training offerings. It manually reminds you not to over-market to customers that haven't provided explicit permissions, which is ideal.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It seems so invested in its 'training' programs' yet it doesn't appear to translate to the actual user experience. It is not as comprehensive and integrative as a medium-sized business would care for, and so much that several of our employees are put off by the idea of using it. As the person tasked with becoming the company-Keap-'guru'', I personally found it very confusing. Even when diving into the 'training' programs, they appeared to be more content-based and focused on the 'why' and not the 'how' to use such a supposedly basic program. It's hard to navigate at first glance unless you've become accustomed to it after a while, so hence, not a intuitive as we would like.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's a nice customer-centric tool to capture leads and track email marketing efforts.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love that I can apply "tags" to my customers.  It makes it very easy to search for customers who match the criteria I am looking for in order to generate leads to fill my sales pipeline.  It also allows me to quickly see what the customer's history with us by searching tags rather than manually looking in the "person notes."  I also think its great that I can see if a customer has viewed an email I sent or not.

What do you dislike about Keap?
When the quick search goes down it is hard because I often use Keap when I am in the middle of online meetings and the quick search is very convenient to quickly pull up a customer.  I also wish that you could use quick search to search companies rather than having to go to the Nav menu.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I highly reccommend that any new users integrate their Microsoft Outlook emails to Keap to keep track of who is a hot prospect and who is cold.  I also reccommend that users get all users in their organization to put notes in Person Notes the same way as everyone in the company. I also reccommend that every user who puts an entry in the "person notes" section attach a date to their note, as there is no automatic date stamp for the notes.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem we have solved with Keap, for me, is the ability to track the emails I send.  It allows me to see if a customer has actually opened an email from me.  Sometimes a customer will say that they called references that I may have sent in an email at their request, but when I look it is easy for me to see if they are not telling me the truth.  Or if they say they did not get an email, I can look to see if that is really the case.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap is the CRM that revolutionized our needs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Because it helped me reduce the amount of different apps I needed, Keap is wonderful. With just one study experience, I now have them all in one space. Keap makes the integral component of the advertising and front-end run smoothly and simultaneously offers the excellent user experiences that we are valued for. In fact, it ended up being cheaper compared to all my different tools from before combined. Keap is an extraordinary help for campaigns and innovative marketing strategies due to the diversity of links to other systems. Keap fits all the requests we have, including lead management, internet usage, video calling and Gmail integrations, and it is feasible to connect to other requests as needed.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The billing procedure has been difficult; There have been some problems with entering credit card data and Keap's email transmission tracking has not shown all the links that were visited, but only shows the initial link. As far as this was implemented, it was not possible to have an exact control of the advertising revenue. A double-subscription email has certain customization possibilities.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I would like to see an improved web builder that is more powerful and easier to use, as well as having more options available for those who want to trigger campaign objectives based on specific fields in the builder. Also, there are some difficulties when doing the handoff of customer data into the system; a more automatic way to accomplish this needs to be found. Keap is a surface that mixes a CRM with marketing and advertising automation in order to assist companies in their expansion.

all_reviews.review_title: A tool suitable for small teams with decent automation goals

What do you like best about Keap?
A simple, minimalistic interface makes Keap intuitive and easily adaptable. The time spent on the learning curve while interacting with a new tool is noticeably low with Keap. All options are easy to navigate and walk through!

What do you dislike about Keap?
- The list view, known as Groups, in Keap is a bit restricted in terms of applying filters.
- The Deal view can be improved for pipeline visibility. The platform also currently does not allow creating Groups/Lists using Deal-related filers like deal stages, activity, etc.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Problem: Keap is helping our small Sales maintain a pipeline to keep their work organized and Marketing to have visibility on deals and overall progress.

Benefit: Better visibility is helping us get a grip on our Sales and Marketing efforts combined.

all_reviews.review_title: Old School to the New School
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
By far, the feature that brought me to Keap and that I rely most heavily upon is task automation.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is defintely a learning curve invovled and some features I do not use as routinely as others.  Those lesser used features I usually need to re-learn.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
What I know about business is that there are two ways you can scale which are automation and delegation to other team members.  My first choice is almost always to automate the task, even if some of it needs to be delegated to a person.  Keap allows me to move beyond automation of e-mail campaigns and document the entire sales process from lead collection, assignment to team members for follow-up, automated marketing sequences, e-commerce functionality, and more.

all_reviews.review_title: One of the most amazing busienss tools out there!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I have been using Keap for several years and it is one of the best choices for my business that I made. As a business coach and consultant, I see so many email marketing and CRM systems used by my clients, and so many have limitations to the way they are used. With Keap, you can create customized funnels, amazing landing pages, and world-class emails. Not only that, I teach Keap to clients and one of the things I use and teach is the pipeline, which allows me to move people through my process and into a sale. I always know where my money is and what I need to focus on.

I use Keap daily and rarely have a problem with the software. But when I do, the customer service is amazing. They resolve any problems quickly and efficiently and in one call. I highly recommend this product and would love to talk to anyone who has questions.

What do you dislike about Keap?
One thing that does need improvement is when there is an update in the emails and landing pages. You have to recreate them and cannot copy them into the new integration. This is frustrating and causes rework, which I hate.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Keap for lead generation activities, and moving them through my emails sequences and sales pipeline.

all_reviews.review_title: Great core platform, powerful automation, but many disjointed and incomplete features persist.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap (Ulitmate) has a very powerful and robust automation engine that is highly configurable by advanced users. It has excellent integration with Zapier, which adds in-depth cross-platform functionallity. Keap does have an API for more advanced users and developers, which is welcomed. Keap's Contact records are also highly customizable allowing for unique field additions and tagging.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap (Ultimate) is currently experiencing challenges due to system overload in my opinion. Over the past year, backend performance has declined, leading to slower page load times for end-users, which are now noticeably less efficient. The platform offers an abundance of features, but many seem superfluous, catering only to a limited range of business types and lacking in maturity. Additionally, the user interface (UI) transition is incomplete, falling short of what one might expect from a near-final release, and it appears to have undergone insufficient user testing.

Crucially, several features fundamental to the platform's core functionality are not yet fully operational. For instance, the email designer (builder) is missing modern capabilities that have been standard on comparable platforms for some time. Similarly, the landing page functionality does not meet current standards as it lacks essential features required for effectiveness. The documentation is another area of concern, with a significant portion appearing outdated. Keap should refocus on it core strengths and refine these features to a high degree and then branch out to other features in my opinion.

The mobile app has posed persistent issues for users over many years. Furthermore, Keap's attempt to integrate AI assistance in content creation is currently subpar and falls short of being practically useful at the time of this review. This feature, in its present state, should be considered for removal from the app in favor of implementing a third-party solution, as seen with other platforms.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Keap to automate some of our marketing efforts, but not all. We do not market via SMS but use it for client reminders. We keep most client data in Keap and use this for client retention marketing. We use automation along with integrations and some API transactions to help reduce staff workflow fatigue. We could use the platform for more and would like to. However, until core features reach a more robust state, we are still using other platforms and services.

all_reviews.review_title: All The Best with No Fluff
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I enjoy the flexibility and management of Keap Ultimate. It's simple and easy to start using and once you understand the nomeclature of Automation, you'll never go back. Seriously, this was easy to impliment with a responsive Support Team who are available for specific questions when they come up. I use Keap Ultimate everyday as a way to manage Customers, Merchant Accounts and Products.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap Ultimate is the full package and they've thought about many different things related to what it takes to run a CRM. What is the most difficult thing about Keap is that there are limitations of certain custom fields and application of Permissions to different users. At the end of the previous version, you could create Groups and assign users to Groups (much like the Active Directory paradigm) but that is no longer the case.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap is solving the challenge of managaging, maintaining and curating a database of customers, products and emails. When it comes to emails its both about Transactional and Marketing messages. This heavy-lifiting is vital for our business and Keap is doing a great job of managing all of it from a centralzied location.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I have run my way through a few email marketing services and CRMs through my own business and through client work. They all have their own little quirks and peccadilloes, so choosing the right one for your business is going to depend on what specific services you need and what frustrates you the least.

For me, the visual logic of Keap's Campaign Builder is what won me over. It is the most flexible way to build an email campaign that I've seen, and once you learn it, it's pretty easy to use. (Hot Tip: watch the Monkeypod training videos, which are now a part of Keap Academy to learn how to use the features you need. They're easy to understand and Greg is a delight). If you DON'T want to learn it, there are plenty of experts for hire and pre-made campaigns in the marketplace that will probably do for your needs.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Sometimes they announce features in development prematurely and then abandon them. One such feature was native Shopify integration, which I was really excited about. I can still connect my shop to my Keap using Zapier, so it's not a problem so much as it is a disappointment.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
My business has two major arms that are largely unrelated to each other. I have my ecommerce shop, and I have creative services for clients. I need to be able to keep communications to those two segments separate, and I like being able to do that in exactly the way I want it done. Keap allows me the precision and flexibility to keep my clients sorted and organized, and not overlapping.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the progress they're making on updating the builder tools with the new email builder and new landing page builder. It's very user-friendly and you're able to create some excellent looking emails.
I also appreciate the community of users they're working on building. With a Facebook group and their own online community, it's easy to get answers and support from other users as well as Keap representatives.
My company does not keep our products or customer purchase information in Keap, so I have not used those features much, but I can see how they would be helpful for businesses with fewer products.
Keap Academy is also enjoyable. I've attended one in-person event as well as a few online events and always learn new things.

What do you dislike about Keap?
For some reason it's not highly recognized in the market. Every job posting for an email marketing specialist that I've seen lists specific softwares they prefer candidates to have experience with, typically Hubspot, Salesforce, and Klaviyo, among others. Literally not a single one has mentioned Keap or Infusionsoft. It also does not integrate very easily with very many other common softwares.
Some features are still missing. The new email builder is excellent for design, but for some reason can't do A/B testing, where the old builder could. I can't think of why they wouldn't make sure that was available right at launch because it's such a crucial marketing tool.
Also, this may have been a one-off situation, but while going through the process to authenticate the domains used in my account I was given incorrect information by a representative that resulted in my ability to send broadcasts being disabled. A new representive I'm working with has been very helpful in trying to get it resolved, but it's still a frustration.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The biggest benefit is providing a way to automate constant contact with our customers. The automations tool works very well for our needs and lets me create custom paths based on customer profiles and behavior.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
I love the progress they're making on updating the builder tools with the new email builder and new landing page builder. It's very user-friendly and you're able to create some excellent looking emails.
I also appreciate the community of users they're working on building. With a Facebook group and their own online community, it's easy to get answers and support from other users as well as Keap representatives.
My company does not keep our products or customer purchase information in Keap, so I have not used those features much, but I can see how they would be helpful for businesses with fewer products.
Keap Academy is also enjoyable. I've attended one in-person event as well as a few online events and always learn new things.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is extremely reliable. The Keap leadership focuses on being the best CRM for small business instead of trying to be a jack of all trades. They continue to update their features while maintaining their core competencies. It has a great ecosystem of apps, consultants, and integrations. Keap is like the conductor that manages the automations for what happens when, so you deliver the right message to the right person at the right time. Their support is very helpful and listens to feedback. Nearly any marketing campaign can be created using their Automation Builder.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap went through leadership changes, which led to shifting focus away from their original version. They created more introductory level versions which forked their development and shifted their attention away from the Ultimate version. That meant new features for the Ultimate version weren being released slowly. However, after some refocusing and streamlining, they are back to rolling out features for all versions at a good pace.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap serves as our CRM and marketing automation software.

all_reviews.review_title: Archaic is How I Would Describe Keap
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Relatively simple to use, good support, well-established company.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It's a very outdated system not in tune with present technologies. Having used multiple different marketing automation/CRM tools in the past, like Close.com, Highlevel, and Hubspot, I can confidently say that Keap has fallen back from them by a mile. Very little external integrations, no use of AI anywhere on the platform, etc. Functional, just archaic.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Manage incoming leads so that I can follow up and nurture them effectively.

all_reviews.review_title: Disappointed in the advice received frm AE @ KEAP that would have avoided a contentious cancellation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
KEAP is designed to follow internet leads and convert them to customers. It was not suited for maintaining relationships with existing customers.

We were very excited about the demos and recommendations not when it came to using it as a CRM it was way short of what we needed and we canceled after the first counseling session.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Mostly the way the cancellation was handled. We paid initial fees and cancellation fees which I thought were not warranted given the lack of understanding of our business and how much of a misfit this was for what we were trying to do.

We never heard from the original account executive addressing any concerns we had and only got routed to a closer who made a self-assessment that they had no responsibility for it. It's only money but it was also a couple of hours time arguing with their " loss mitigation" person. A horrible experience.

More detail ...

I spent the better part of the weekend between signing up for Keap and our first meeting with the coach Dawn to make sure I was prepared myself. If you look at the account I added contacts and went through the entire outline to be in the best position to get this project going right away.

In the demo process with Colin everything looked really really good and I was assured that I had an opportunity to try it out in our environment to make sure everything worked within our company the way we expected it. The focus and the demos was all the great things Keap does but I didn't think to try and test some pretty basic things that we rely upon on a daily basis.

I was assured by Colin that if there were issues we could unwind this thing. I'm certainly not interested in paying for Keap and unable to use it. I'm also not interested in trying to wrap Keap around our current CRM at this point.  Well I lost that battle simply because they had my credit card ... It's Only Money but it was also a dozen hours time ...

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
None. It failed miserably. Clients we have have a primary and a partner and we could not send emails to both parties at the same time. Some incredibly basic things it wouldn't do and there was not a solution so we would have to retain our existing CRM.  Made no sense to us at all.

all_reviews.review_title: There is no better Support Team then Keap
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
For the past four years, we have utilized Keap for our needs. Although the initial learning process was challenging, the support team was readily available with US-based assistance, just a phone call away. We were able to connect with a tech representative in under a minute, and all members of the support team were polite, understanding, well-informed, and proficient in their comprehension of the product.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It took me some time to get the hang of things, but I was grateful for the support that was available during regular business hours. Unfortunately, the chat support was not very helpful outside of those hours. While I understand that 24/7 live support may not be feasible, I would be willing to pay extra for human support that is just as effective as the support provided during business hours.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Having numerous online courses being marketed at the same time, in different time zones, Keap has made the process organized and we have seen continued growth due to the automation.

all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use & top notch support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like having trainings available for me to learn ho tot create automation on my own time. Support is always there to walk me through anything, answer questions as well. I like the functionality and the ease of use with Keap.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap has some opportunities to improve the calendar function. Right now, I can't customize my availability as much as I would like. I would like to be able to set availability for a Tuesday and have different availability for the following Tuesday. Right now, once I set it, it's the same for all the upcoming Tuesdays. Also, it would be great to have a place to create a membership in Keap and to house content. I was buying Keap as a way to replace several systems and platforms. For the most part, it works that way. However, I want to create a membership, and I have to do that elsewhere. I have written and video content I want to share with clients and there's no place to house any content. So, I have to do that elsewhere. I'm ending up spending just as much if not more than Kajabi or Cartra, etc. to piecemeal things together and would love an all-in-one solution in Keap.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I get to capture leads with the landing pages to grow my list. I also get to create payment links and track sales. I also get to automate email sequences and send broadcast emails to my community.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap has helped me grow my business in ways I never thought I could
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap allows small business owners like me to create systems and automation to run, grow and scale our businesses. As a solopreneur just starting out, I couldn't hire an assistant to help me schedule appointments or to send out my emails. I was losing potential clients due to lack of follow-up. My business was chaotic. Keap helped me create processes that run, practically on autopilot, while I am working on my business and working for my clients. It is like having a couple of extra employees.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap is a very robust platform, which means it does have a bit of a learning curve. They provide training and plenty of resources to help you learn, but it takes a little time to understand all its abilities fully.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap helps me create processes for collecting leads, following up with them and converting them to customers. It automates all of the things that I routinely do, freeing up more of my time. It helps me automate my appointment scheduling so that I do not have to keep emailing back and forth to find times that work. Instead, my prospects and clients can just choose a time from my calendar availability and schedule themselves - AND my Keap account sends out email reminders for those appointments. It has helped me run my business more efficiently.

all_reviews.review_title: Securely store customer data and simplify operations
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love KEAP's ability to store my customers' data, such as service history, billing information, note details, and contact information, in a secure and centralized location. It has allowed us to make a smooth transition away from paper files while still having easy access to all relevant customer information. I especially appreciate the ability to track conversations via SMS without needing my phone; it keeps everything secure, but also readily available for reference when needed.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I am not completely satisfied with Keap, despite their investment in providing extensive training. There is a steep learning curve and many features are still inaccessible, such as the use of emoticons or proper customization to reflect my brand's tone. In addition, they charge a high monthly fee, yet we have to pay extra for add-ons from other companies like gospiffy to properly personalize and create branding elements within KEAP.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap helps me save time and energy when it comes to managing follow-up tasks and onboarding new clients. Automating processes allows us to give each client more individual attention without doubling or tripling our workload - that's something I'm really excited about!

all_reviews.review_title: Completely automated my business, increased profits and free time
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The Campaign Builder is an amazing tool that allows you to automate the interaction with your prospects and clients to be sure that they are only getting the content that is relevant to them, and personalize it so the whole experience feels organic.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft is pretty time intensive to get to master.  I'm updating this review, as they have released a new version of Keap since my original review.  Keap used to be called Infusionsoft and the Keap Max Classic version is what used to be the original Infusisnoft version.  That is my preferred version of the software, as it has all of the power and tools that I like to use to build.  The newer Max version of Keap has a newer user interface that is more modern and sleeker, and is probably easier for a new user to adopt, but as a power-user of the software who loves to build 3rd party integrations and use the full power of the software, I find the Max version to be too stripped down for my liking.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
The use of Infusinosoft has allowed me to completely automate my internal operation (as well as those of my clients), to ensure that nobody "falls through the cracks".  Infusionsoft has allowed us to track every step of the client journey and be sure that no step is missed.  By doing this, it has provided a better client experience and completely streamlined our operations.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have automated my entire business from lead gen and sales, to my operational processes.  Everything I do now is driven by just one or two button clicks.  Most people don't have any sort of system to really keep track of their leads or sales, and this provides a great way to do it.

all_reviews.review_title: For power users only - not for novices
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It is an extremely - and I do mean extremely - powerful program to automate your marketing.

This includes everything from emails, SMS, funnels, etc. The way you can customize your "funnels" is truly astounding.

What do you dislike about Keap?
"Keap" (formerly Infusionsoft) is really designed for power users. The learning curve on this software is immense. I've likened it to building a sandcastle with a bulldozer.

It is highly complex, and there are features (such as integrating SMS) that you need special codes for - which Keap does NOT give you without their "assistance."

The platform is so complex that you're almost forced to buy their "training" packages.

Even if you are highly skilled at coding, etc., I would strongly recommend staying away from this platform unless you want to spend a BUNCH of money to accomplish relatively simple tasks.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm using Keap for marketing automation when someone purchases one of my products (either one-time, or a subscription). This includes sending emails, SMS notifications, receipts, etc.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap is an excellent choice for project management
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
We like the Keap platform's ability to automate emails and the tasks that are assigned daily. One of the best tools that this platform has is to allow us to create segmentation types according to the requirements already coordinated in advance based on the campaigns that are launched, so we have the opportunity to segment the audience according to what we are offering, so we do not have everyone mixed, and we gather all potential customers in the same session to provide a little more attention to it.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It is a platform with efficient results thanks to the number of tools that offer management automation within the organization. However, I consider that it has a relatively large learning curve where it is crucial to previously achieved training for its interface and correctly use the functions of each tool. The support for this time of adaptation to the platform plays a fundamental role in providing solutions to problems encountered while carrying out their work. They take a long time to respond to and address our requests.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
One of the most significant benefits we appreciate about Keap's platform is that it makes it easier for us to capture leads with greater accuracy thanks to the tracking and reporting that the platform provides us with. Another thing we like is that we can now offer quality and completely dynamic contact to our customers, something much more professional that ends up providing them with more excellent reliability.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
usually don't leave negative reviews, as being a business owner myself, I am well aware that mistakes can happen. Though our experience with Keap went beyond an accidental mistake and after debating for a long time, I feel sharing my experience is absolutely necessary.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I usually don't leave negative reviews, as being a business owner myself, I am well aware that mistakes can happen. Though our experience with Keap went beyond an accidental mistake and after debating for a long time, I feel sharing my experience is absolutely necessary.

Long story short:

- We first spoke with a guy named Colin who was in charge of closing the sale. He seemed a very nice and friendly guy, though sometimes he sounded slightly generic about what our migration from our current autoresponder to Keap would entail.

- He was so nice we even bought an extra $500 of Keap coaching calls (shame on us for not waiting).

- He reassured us that our packed came with 15 hours of migration included and that everything we had on our current autoresponder, would be easily migrated within those 15 hours. Just to be sure, I repeatedly asked him confirmation (both on the call and in written form) that all our sequences, automations, contacts, templates etc could be migrated within those 15 hours. I am NOT a specialist person so clearly I trusted what he said. We submitted everything that we needed to migrate and were confident we were all on the same page.

- A few weeks later, out of the blue, Keap asked us to pay more money, as the 15 hours were done and over with.

- At this point we still had quite a few assets to migrate. They claimed they had already went beyond the 15 hours and while some extra hours had been ''gifted'' now we had to pay extra or take care of the migration internally (which clearly we were not equipped to handle considering it wasn't part pf the plan).

- Even though I was already quite annoyed (considering the guy confirmed already multiple times that in 15 hours they could do everything) I reluctantly asked how much would that extra be. The answer was mind boggling: don't even wanna share the final priced we would have to pay as it was just ridiculous (thousands and thousands of dollars).

- At this point Colin had started to ignore our emails. I called him several times and was told that our team was trying to take advantage of Keap migration team. Wait what?!? I kept my cool and asked to please meet in the middle (even tho this whole situation was entirely created by them) and he seemed confident we'd find a solution. After a few days of back and forth, and the Keap renewal approaching, we had no choice but to stop everything and close our account.

- We requested a partial refund (since they had done some work anyway and I wanted to acknowledge that) so I was referred to this lady called Lisa, who was supposed to ''help'' with this. After speaking to her, instead of being issued a refund, we were charged PS200 termination fee -- like seriously?!?

- After complaining about that (since it was not written anywhere btw), we got refunded these PS200 and that was the end of it.

- So we spent (wasted) 1200 - then got charged an extra PS200 early termination fee and then refunded just that fee.

- At this point I was so annoyed but I was also determined to move on as quickly as possible. So I simply requested at least refund of the $500 ''Keap coaching calls'' that we never even started  (we were supposed to use them after migration was over).

- Our request was ignored and never addressed.

Again, I don't leave this review light hearted, but this experience was really BAD. We wasted money and precious time (including the 30 mins spent to write this review).

Pls be very careful before you sign up with Keap, especially if the assets you got to migrate are quite articulated. Don't just talk to the the sales person, whoever they are, and request to speak to the tech team and have a further confirmation on the migration costs (the REAL ones). Not sure that will be enough to spare you a similar saga, but one thing is for sure: we are migrating elsewhere.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
They only wasted our time

all_reviews.review_title: Great price but lacks support and functionality
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keaps is great for your first CRM...if you're a small business and don't plan on growing rapidly.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keaps lacks Support and many features that any growing business requires. All emails sent through the CRM were instantly marked as spam. Their template builders also were ugly to use.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap helps consolidate notes and does the basic jobs of a CRM system. For the price, it does everything that a much pricier multi-integrated CRM system would do. It combines email marketing, lead tracking, and notes.

all_reviews.review_title: A versatile CRM that meets the needs of businesses of all shapes and sizes!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The vast number of integrations with other solutions makes Keap an excellent resource for creative campaigns and business solutions. From lead management to email campaigns, to VOIP and Gmail integrations, Keap covers all of our specific needs and makes it easy to integrate beyond those immediate needs when necessary.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There isn't really anything that I dislike, however it would be a time saver to be able to import multiple emails into a campaign rather than building each email individually, and for basic users that require only access to contact records, a simpler contact view would be nice to see. I think there is a very nice basic view availabe to lower level Keap users, but for those users that require all the bells and whistles available within the Keap/Infusionsoft solution, the basic user view is not available.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Use it regularly and research all of the cool features available to make the most of your account.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead management, prospect and client nurturing. It's easy to create automation and develop relationsships with other companies and solutions as a result of the versatile options available.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The ability to create almost endless automation of emails and other business tasks is incredible.
For me what was overwhelming was where to start, but thanks to the community and the availability of endless examples and articles I could quickly figure out where to focus my efforts.
For anyone starting with Keap, I highly recommend doing one of the Keap Academy workshops to get you going!

What do you dislike about Keap?
The only thing that I have struggled with so far is that the double opt-in email is not very customisable and therefore I struggled to implement it into my workflow but that's where the community came in and helped with suggestions.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap is making it easier for me to provide a "high touch" experience for my customers which I was lacking in before.
I am hoping that over time it will help me generate more leads and assist in the "nurturing" process.
I would like to look back and say that thanks to Keap I was able to get "true fans" faster with less effort by automating a lot of the repetitive tasks involved in creating a community.

all_reviews.review_title: The best for all in one place
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is wonderful because it consolidated so many different applications for me. Now I have them all in one place with only one learning curve. It actually also came out cheaper for me than all my other software combined.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Learning the automations is definitely a learning curve. Trying to understand how everything works together and how to set it up has been a challenge. But Keap also has a wonderful training site that you get access too and they are constantly putting on webinars and trainings to help all of us get a better grasp on how to use it best.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap helps my entire marketing and front-end piece roll smoothly while also giving a great client experience that we are known for. I don't have to manually do all the things anymore which has freed me up to be able to wake up in the morning to a new client meeting I never expected. It is freeing in that way alone.

all_reviews.review_title: Generally solid CRM tool, some rough edges at times.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
As a web app, iterations are generally fairly regular. Automation options are fairly plentiful and can be shared amongst users of the platform. Good support community, with staff there to answers questions and take action as needed.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Some functionaility missing between versions of the app, classic/Pro/Max/Max Classic, etc. Some basic functions missing like emoji in email, importing data can be problematic, managing mailing list subscriptions/unsubs is clunky at best, business card reader on iOS app is inaccurate. Zapier integration can be challenging, both when using Keap as a trigger and sending data to Keap via Zapier.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Plan before you jump in and import customer/lead data. Plan your customer tags, custom fields, etc. Plan for contigencies, as with any new system. Do all the free training they offer, it helps.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I will be able to combine several tools I use now, into workflows that run only in Keap. The ability to replicate current manual workflows from my existing CRM tool, and build complex workflows that will run automatically is a big bonus. I will save time and money, plus my data should be more accurate as I am less involved in hands on management of it.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: As a web app, iterations are generally fairly regular. Automation options are fairly plentiful and can be shared amongst users of the platform. Good support community, with staff there to answers questions and take action as needed.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: Some functionaility missing between versions of the app, classic/Pro/Max/Max Classic, etc. Some basic functions missing like emoji in email, importing data can be problematic, managing mailing list subscriptions/unsubs is clunky at best, business card reader on iOS app is inaccurate. Zapier integration can be challenging, both when using Keap as a trigger and sending data to Keap via Zapier.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Keap:
review_question_answers.answer: Plan before you jump in and import customer/lead data. Plan your customer tags, custom fields, etc. Plan for contigencies, as with any new system. Do all the free training they offer, it helps.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: I will be able to combine several tools I use now, into workflows that run only in Keap. The ability to replicate current manual workflows from my existing CRM tool, and build complex workflows that will run automatically is a big bonus. I will save time and money, plus my data should be more accurate as I am less involved in hands on management of it.

all_reviews.review_title: Not a bad solution, just not what we needed
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The all-in-one aspect of email, CRM, and sales integration. If you're looking for a more simplified solution for managing a comprehensive email marketing department, this is a pretty good option.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The two biggest drawbacks of Keap were the lack of customization available in the drag-and-drop builder, plus the used of shared IPs. It was easy to get punished for other users' mistakes.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
While we have largely migrated from Keap over to Iterable, we still do use Keap for one email marketing project. We maintained that account just because we had integrated it with our initial lead gen and weren't running into any issues. But, as soon as users had made it in, we then exported their data for continued follow-up and initiatives in our Iterable account(s).

all_reviews.review_title: A Robust Platform for Small and Big Companies
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It is a complete platform for everything you need. It has a scheduling feature that does help with the lead capture process. The landing pages are very nice looking, and I love the old email builder. I didn't stay long enough to see the new email builder though, only the Beta. It was tough to set up the whole system at first, but once done I didn't really spend much time on it every day. I could rely on it to work seamlessly.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Sometimes it just seems too much. The platform can be overwhelming. If one has no experience with this kind of platform before one needs the training they offer. I was lucky to get the training with my subscription, but I understand most people have to pay for the training to be able to use Keap properly. And it can be costly for small operators like me.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
You have to make sure that you got your financial numbers right if you want to use Keap. For a small user like me it was good while I was working well, but when business was slow Keap could seem to be overkill.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap was my "business partner" -- once I set up all the campaigns it would take care of the lead flow from lead capture, and nurturing, to conversion. I am a one-person operation. And Keap did help me use my time more efficiently.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I have been using Keap (InfusionSoft) for over ten years.
Keap does it all. Automation is critical when running a successful business! Keap allows you to create marketing campaigns that you can use over and over for multiple customers.
It also allows for tracking. You can see where your lead came in from, how they got there, and what is the next step to close the deal.
Not only do you have a fantastic software, but the support behind the software is just as outstanding. There is ALWAYS someone who is there to answer your questions either on chat or a phone call away. Every person I've ever talked to with Keap is friendly and has the knowledge to help you resolve any confusion you might have.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Learning the ins and outs of the system can be confusing in the beginning. Especially creating a campaign.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Bite the bullet and do it!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap helps keep our prospects and clients highly organized. If I need to pull a specific list, it's so simple and easy.

What do you dislike about Keap?
In my experience, the customer support is almost always quick to respond, but the first-tier techs too often have difficulties grasping the nuances of the Keap app. It can be frustrating when the tech is tunnel visioned on a solution that isn't actually a solution for the specific problem.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The biggest benefit I've realized with Keap is turning prospects into customers who become clients via a well-planned customer journey. I used to use an email service that depended on autoresponders, but the problem was that once a prospect made a purchase, I would have to manually remove them from the autoresponses. With Keap, when a prospect makes a purchase, they are instantly removed from one email sequence and they are moved into nurture sequence that eventually moves them from a customer to a client.

all_reviews.review_title: Knowing its limitations can save you time and money.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap has an easy-to-use campaign builder if you are at all familiar with campaign builders. The features are plenty if you are a small to medium-sized business.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap clearly does not have an organized rollout strategy and it shows in their products. Errors, workarounds and glitches can be a major headache. When they happen, you can't count on their support staff to know how to fix the problems and the Facebook group may be a hit or miss as well.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap tries to solve the problem of providing a robust CRM for small and medium-sized businesses. They hit the mark on that front. Apps are inexpensive and offer a lot of features, it would be great if they could just better manage the issues and glitches that seem to happen constantly.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It's a very powerful tool. The campaign builder, though overwhelming at first, is very powerful with lots of customization options. It's much less expensive than other CRMs/campaign planners we've considered. Also highly recommend joining the Keap users group on Facebook for the quickest access to support.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap is very hard to learn how to use, and practically guarantees the need to pay for training on how to use it. The support has also gotten less responsive/worse over time, should you need them.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap saves us so much time through automating our email campaigns and easy segmenting of email audiences. Tags and customizable fields when collecting contact data are incredibly useful for campaign building and segmenting.
