all_reviews.review_title: Innovative, easy to use, and with an amazing community that surrounds it.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The interface is extremely user-friendly and intuitive.  Keap will provide help along the way - especially the double-check tool before publishing Campaigns. I've used other automation through Mailchimp and constant contact. Keap has a way of making it way more manageable than the others. The user groups and community that surround it are also really helpful.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Changes can come through quickly and not with a lot of notice.  As someone who uses it both for my personal business and clients, sometimes being able to have a week or two heads up would be beneficial.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Find a Keap certified partner to work with if possible, or get involved within the Keap Users groups on social media.  There are fantastic resources available for every industry out there, and having someone to work with you as you start your automation journey is priceless.  Keap also encourages you to be creative and innovative yourself - don't be afraid to test, try, and experiment! You can learn so much more about what the system can do by diving in and getting your hands dirty.  Remember - things within the software can be fixed easier than trying to take care of all your automation needs by hand.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Client follow up & retention.  Feedback gathering from clients.  Lead gathering and follow-up.  These have saved us countless billable staff hours. Having easy automation that can follow up for us and send reminders for onboarding tasks is the biggest help.

all_reviews.review_title: Great System With Everything You Need
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap allows you to do everything you would need to as a marketer. It has an easy interface to work with, customizable widgets on your home screen, and a straightforward campaign builder. I've been using it for over two years (when it was formerly Infusionsoft), and they are constantly updating it to have better and more features. I can't see myself using any other CRM software at this point.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is a learning curve if you've never worked in Keep before. Some of my colleagues think the interface is not very clear because there are many settings and buttons to choose from. I think after using it for a month, you will find value in this great CRM.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're looking for a new CRM or automation platform, get Keap! You will not regret it. You will have everything you need in one system.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Everything you need as a marketer is in one software. You can build and automate campaigns, schedule email broadcasts, organize your data, create excel sheets, link your website form's to Keap, and more. You don't even need to leave this software to do anything else other than run ads and post on social media.

Everything is automated and tagged. Now, we never miss following up on a lead. We appreciate the way the pipeline looks and how we can document all our contact with clients easily within their records.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Sometimes there can be some glitches that can be confusing. And still do not really use the group texting feature as we are having a hard time getting people to opt in. We wish there was a way for us to opt clients in, if they have already opted in through our former platform.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Highly recommend. We did have an outside consultant set up our automations as they were more complicated. Easy automations are exactly that...easy to set up! I wish I knew about Keap sooner!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Keap, we no longer lose any leads. We used to try to track with Google Sheets and it got overwhelming. We like that we can tag customers and retarget whenever we want. Also, I now know if my FB Ads are working since it tracks all my leads to one landing page.

all_reviews.review_title: Thank you Graig sharing you knoledge on Campaign builder with us
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I liked the clear structure of the CB trilogy class that Graig and his team put together for Keap / Infusion soft community. Each video was on point and with clear explanations about the subject. I have done a 1.5 hr training class on Keap emails and Landing pages with another company and I was really confused after that class. But after going through only 2 videos recorded from the CB trilogy class, each of about 10 min done by Graig Jenkins from Monkeypod/Keap all become much more clear. So thank you! I would definitely recommend any class done by Graig.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The class the Graig made, has no downsides. There are some downsides on Keap part with regards to How Order forms display for clients, I wish this would be improved. Another thing is the User Permission internally with Keap , there are so many options there, I wish we would have 3 main access by default that will link to some GDPR risks as ... so we can have a View only, View only with limited editing on some fields, and admin, or something along the lines.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
From collecting clients' details when we onboard them for our services to following on different stages along the client journey, collecting payments, and running various reports, are all great powerful tools.

We can use the data in numerous ways to optimize marketing campaigns and business planning activities. The people and Keap are professional and have an excellent understanding of how we can get the most out of their software.

We can streamline our outreach activities and boost promotions, news and other information more quickly with Keap.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful yet inflexible CRM; Great for campaigns, not great for design
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Ease of use. It's very easy to create emails despite the fact there are some limitations. The ability to build campaigns is something we plan to delve into more over time as well, particularly drip campaigns. I'm impressed with what I've seen with regard to how robust campaigns can be, such that they can be made to achieve multiple goals or even layered goals.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Inflexible email templates. I am very frustrated with the limitations of the Keap/Infusionsoft email templates. While it is very easy to build emails in Keap, the constraints placed upon the email presentation are frankly quite discouraging. Honestly, I can't believe any CRM would provide such inflexible templates in this day and age, with no option for word-wrapping around an image, more spacing than necessary between paragraphs, allowing for too much white space, and content blocks that can't be easily adjusted for a more appealing design and/or ideal widths. For as much as Infusionsoft is a step forward for us in terms of the capability to build campaigns and harvest important data for the purpose of targeting, etc., the limitations imposed on our email layouts and design are actually a step backward. As someone who hasn't gotten far with campaigns yet and who is constantly using Keap to build emails for other teams with specific desires with regard to how their emails look, this is extremely disappointing. These templates are behind the times by nearly 10 years.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Time savings and ease of use in building emails. Despite the limitations of the templates I described above, creating emails takes little time and is easy and straightforward to manage. The potential for building campaigns is a benefit we haven't yet realized, but hope to soon.

Before upgrading to Keap Max, I used the Pro plan. First, I was amazed and blown away by the skill, kindness, and promptness of the tech support team. If it wasn't for customer support, I wouldn't know how to use Keap. Next, I'm blown away by the Live weekly automation hour webinars. They are everything I've always wanted wrapped into one simple thing. Grady is fantastic, and the training is excellent! Then, the skill of the Keap developers is mind-blowing because they're constantly managing glitches and things that go wrong, as well as adding great new features. And, lastly, I appreciate the check-out feature in Keap Max because I'm gonna use it often, and it's easy to use. P.S.- the reporting features are superb. Tech support is too!

What do you dislike about Keap?
I don't particularly like that we can't use emoj's in our weekly email broadcasts, and there isn't a bi-weekly recurring payment option. The bi-weekly recurring payment option would help gain new clients because I could substantially lower their upfront costs.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Before using Keap, get a designated notebook for note-taking during automation hour, use the plethora of learning resources available, ask questions, and be nice to tech support.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm streamlining my client onboarding process, check-out process, weekly newsletter, and making my life so much easier. As a stress-free life coach, it helps to know with certainty that everything is running smoothly with or without my direct touch.

all_reviews.review_title: You can create a Google Sheet and use free software to do the equivalent of this expensive software.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The scheduling app and extra phone number are the most helpful tools of this software for me personally. I think the functionality is smooth and easy to learn. You can keep track of tasks and clients in a clear and concise way with labels. The automatic payments that you can integrate with PayPal are helpful too.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The software is missing a lot of necessary customization and features to make it worth the price tag and ditching other business software. For instance, with the invoicing - it is irritating that invoices can't be customized to 1) look different than the generic layout provided and 2) writing the line items for the invoice is frustrating. As a designer for both graphic and web design, I like to write out descriptions of my hours, and there isn't a memo section on the item lines. It automatically sends invoice emails sometimes without any indication, which can come off as rude to clients without a follow-up email. I also can't even use the feature that tracks my Google reviews because, for whatever reason, my business doesn't show up in their search results. I can tell that in the future, this will be a great tool for me, especially because they are so coherent to feedback. However, right now, it feels a bit underdeveloped.

And most importantly - you will pay the price if you want to get out of this software. Don't be tricked into a year contract like I was. The "credits" they offered me that covered a month or so when I wanted to quit, later showed up in my mailbox from a debt collector. Super irritated with my entire experience with them.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
This software is expensive and all of its features can be done by other software for either free, or cheaper than $80 a month. Plus, the features it does provide didn't work how I needed them to. Also, requires a year contract to join, and you must pay for training sessions initially, unless you talk personally with customer service.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
None anymore. Use Zelle and Checks people - even though these payment links are convenient, fees and the format of them are not worth it.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
I love thay Keap brings so many essential pieces of your business operations into one place -- Sales pipeline, CRM, invoicing, email marketing, phone, scheduled, and so much more.

It's truly our secret weapon!

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: I don't have any true complaints. Like with any software, there's room for improvement. I've seen the Q3 and Q4 roadmap and it's awesome! Many of the gaps are being addressed.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
We've streamlined our sales process and automated key steps so leads have an awesome experience. Keap makes it easy for clients to pay!

Keap also helps us more easily check in with leads and clients.

We have more visibility into our sales pipeline. We know exactly where leads are in the process and we didn't have that before.

We've also eliminated dozens of manual tasks leveraging the easy automation feature.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like that automations are simple to set up and take hours off the work load by systematically delivering messages. If agents or clients use the automations that are allowed through the email it can really help take hours off of work per week. This system is more suited for clients so that you can also track revenue, accept payments, and create invoices. Their customer service is wonderful and always ready and willing to help with questions, billing or issues.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The downside of Keap is the number of authorized users that the account can have. I have multiple managers and wish that my Pro version would support more admins. I wish they had a cheaper option if you weren't using it as a client management service and using it more for employee management.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am automating onboarding of new recruits, tracking new prospects through the process, engaging with customers on a more automated system, and tracking flow of income and bonuses through the deals pipelines.

all_reviews.review_title: CRM Built for Email Marketing Automations with Easy Automations
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is an affordable marketing platform that helps to automate business marketing sales, and email campaigns. Easily Create beautiful landing pages for automated workflows, and send messages to business leads. Keap enabled to test out multiple versions of marketing messages to see which converts the highest. Take control over marketing with Keap in low budget.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap is the secure CRM built for email marketing automations. With Keap i can send automated text message broadcasts and capture leads.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
We recommend it because Keap automates everything that is related to business sales process and makes it easy for you to supercharge email marketing.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap is an email marketing platform that enables you to create, send and track emails. Send new emails, text message broadcasts and newsletters with ease. Keap's advanced automation tools allow you to build complex sales funnels that help bring leads into your sales pipeline and convert them into customers. Build an automated sales pipeline that automatically sends series of emails to warm up your prospects and get them interested in products.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is a very powerful and diverse CRM software and does pretty much everything you would ever need your CRM to do for a better price than something like a Salesforce. After their UX redesign and rebranding (formally Infusionsoft) Keap retained all the power with a simpler interface. Keap also has great customer service and an extensive knowledge base for support so the answers to your question are never far from reach.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap still falls short of some of the more popular CRMs, specifically Salesforce. While Keap has many features and a cleaner interface they still aren't as robust or popular as Salesforce. That being said Keap is much easier to navigate then something like a Salesforce so may be more appropriate for small and medium-sized businesses.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
No matter the size of your organization if you are looking for a quality CRM at a good price with excellent customer service and room to scale as your business grows. Keap is a no-brainer because of its great pricing and an awesome team of customer support. They also give back and are constantly trying to make their platform better. The move from Infusionsoft to Keap is proof of how much the platform is continuously evolving for the better. Keap also integrates with almost everything and has a highly in-depth knowledge base so answers are always close by,

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Managing your customer database, segmentation, custom feilds all work great with Keap. Other benefits such as a robust email marketing interface and powerful invoicing tools make business alot easier and more efficient with Keap. You can manage 100s or 1000s of customers using Keap and even automate some of your reoccurring tasks. Keap is also made to scale. With a price that fits most small businesses and the power to grow with your business Keap has solve many of the core functions of the business.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap has it's place for a specific subset of soloprenuers and entreprenuers.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It's got a lot of features to communicate in a variety of ways, stay ahead of tasks, and reminders to follow up. Much of this can be automated in a way to make you seem like a team of support when it's just a programmed journey through marketing.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Slow adoption of tech and leading from behind. In its original form, competitors were playing catch up to Infusionsoft. Now as Keap, it seems the shoe is on the other foot.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
One man powerhouse. I can do the tasks of multiple people by crafting the product to each customer journey. Much more personalized and the prospect has a great professional journey like with any large corporation. This evens the playing field somewhat for small businesses.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap is the key to our growth and success
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I finally have the data I need to run my business. I know what my leads are doing and how my audience is interacting with our business and we can create a predictable customer journey for all of our leads and customers.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It is a very robust platform, and it does take some specific knowledge to get started and to navigate, but, as the owner of the business, my limited understanding of the platform forced me to delegate the maintenance  of the platform to my team, which gives me my time back. There's not much I dislike about Keap.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We know exactly how to improve our products and because of the reporting, we know what new products and services to create. The benefits are it's super easy to have the data I need to run my business, and I love seeing what's working and what's not. We never had that ability before we switched to Keap.

all_reviews.review_title: Game Changer for Us and Our Clients
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love that we can take a dream experience we want someone to have and create that with automation in the campaign builder. The newer addition in text messaging capabilities has been huge as many of our clients would come to us for support in developing text message campaigns and we found ourselves hitting walls trying to find suitable 3rd party options that were within budget for clients.

What do you dislike about Keap?
We and most of our clients are in Keap Max Classic and right now the limitations with the landing page builder can be frustrating.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I recommend investing in it and getting started, especially now with the different packages. So much easier to grow within one platform than it is to get set up in a cheaper, less robust alternative to only have to invest time and money into getting transferred over later.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Consistent follow up to leads and giving our clients the experience we want them to have. Being able to streamline communication and ensure that clients are hearing from us even as we grow and manual follow ups gets more and more unrealistic. We're eliminating communication issues and large amounts of payroll going to simple follow up.

all_reviews.review_title: Designing and putting your customer journey on auto-pilot while keeping track of leads!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Awesome features to design your customer journey, keep track of leads, and put everyday business processes on auto-pilot.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Waiting for some features that aren't yet available or are supposed to be coming. Key features like being able to see "pending opt ins" for texting, change the "from" email address for the new email builder, and more.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're looking to design your dream customer journey, you should definitely consider using Keap! Creating automated systems that put everyday processes for your business on auto-pilot- saving you money and helping to ensure no leads fall through the crack!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automated tasks to remind me to reach out or complete certain things at different steps of the customer journey. Collecting leads' info all in one place. Being able to tag contacts as they enter Keap and have them sent to certain campaigns based on tags.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I loved the 6th Division presentation. The concept of "Automatic" vs "Automated" really resinated with me. Taking a deeper dive at our customer journey and making it "automatic" is a major goal of ours in 2022.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Most of the presentations were geared around entrepreneurs. I would have liked to see more advanced Keap campaigns broken down. We use it in a company that has 700 employees and have been using it for a few years now, things like how to clean up contact records, how to avoid over tagging, things like that.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main issue we solve is using Keap as a bridge between multiple ad platforms and lead channels to our internal sales software and database. We have limited resources when it comes to database developers so using Keap as a reporting database is something that has been a game-changer in our department. It's something anyone on my team is able to access and pull contact record reports without a developer needed.

Keap helps keep our contact list organized and updated. Their marketing campaign capabilities are some of the best I've seen, along with the tagging system. Putting our marketing on autopilot saves us time and headaches.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The best part about Keap is the pipeline and the automations. I love that my clients get email and text reminders about our appointments. The pipeline itself is super user-friendly and allows drag-and-drop, which is great for my neurodivergent brain.
The upsides of using keap is that everything stays organized with very little work from the user. And I love the calendar integration. It makes my life so much simpler.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I wish keap could use my normal phone number. Also the time zones don't switch automatically with daylight savings. Also, I had an issue where the automated reminders were telling people the wrong date. That may just be a bug.
I wish the appointment setting were easier - its kind of annoying that i can't send someone a calendar link and i have to go in to the site every time depending on how long the appointment is. So my clients can never pick the length of an appointment.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're considering using Keap, think of all the systems you're currently using and how automation can help you. If you manually send emails, texts, appointment reminders - that can all be automated. If you struggle with organization, you can input contacts and label them, and their history with you will show. You can assign dollar amounts to clients and keep track of sales. Try it for a month, and see how much time you save every day.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm solving scheduling problems; I know I'm way more organized. It is definitely helping my business and helps me onboard new team members easier. My schedule is much more full with no differing effort from me.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Max Classic has a very flexible system. The campaign builder is mainly a drag-and-drop whiteboard. It can perform simple and easy tasks or highly complex processes. You can track engagement, you can manage access to products and services, you can follow through, you can manage subscriptions and single payments, track all the CRM data, etc., etc., etc.

It can start very simple and straightforward, but it is designed to layer and cover nearly anything where automation is needed.

I love that I can replicate myself in the repetitive

What do you dislike about Keap?
Getting the logic connected properly and running smoothly can be tricky with some processes. Because KEAP Max Classic can do very robust and complicated tasks, and very personalized, it can get sticky and problematic.

Make sure that you invest in training. Take the time to learn the platform. Start simple and layer on top. Have a master plan drawn out and prioritize your build.

Once you build a campaign, test it! Make sure it works as desired or you can make a very complicated mess to diagnose and fix.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use KEAP Max Classic as our main hub for everything in our business.
We segment our audience to be able to communicate personally and to our customer's specific needs.
We use it as a management and responsibility system for customer service.
We use it to manage our courses enrollment.
We use it to onboard customers, add value to products, and follow through with them.
We use it to collect testimonials.

Any ongoing repetitive task/email we use KEAP to help us out. Largely to save us time and creative energy writing these messages out again and again. And trying to track who needs what, when, and why.

We use different funnels depending on what our customers need and are interested in. We can write a main sales funnel or follow-through series, but with experience and fine-tuning, and saved time we layer additional campaigns. We are able to have multiple sales campaigns for a single product depending on customer status and interest.

We use it to solve a lot of issues and problems for us. I'm always seeking new trainings and looking for new methods to simplify and improve my business life.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Partner - Mentor - Administrator - Project Manager - KEAP Specialist

all_reviews.review_title: Been using Infusionsoft (now Keap) for 15+ years
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I found automation flows confusing at first.  When tags get applied, when they're used as triggers, how to make sure people aren't being triggered into too many campaigns simultaneously, etc.  But it really is powerful to be able to put so much automation in.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Sometimes it's challenging to find a support person who understands what it is that I'm looking for.  However, in the past year or so, I feel like this has gotten a lot better, and I now have a dedicated rep I can speak with as well.  The affiliate program leaves something to be desired as it uses confusing language, so there's a steeper learning curve than I think needs to be, but there are tutorials as well for learning how to use their referral/affiliate section...  It works.  Just takes some time to learn.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It lets us pre-design funnels and walk people through an indoctrination sequence where they go from cold lead to biggest fan. (or they sort themselves into buckets along the way, without a lot of direct interaction from us.

The transfer did not correctly pre-populate the phone and email fields into KEAP from our prior CRM, but we did not fully realize this until the old software was removed.  Now we have over 500 client files to fix (update) from old paper files before we can attempt any mass campaign.

The cost per seat for my 3-5 seats is prohibitive when we must manually check and change every clients' profile in KEAP.  What a rough start. Costly labour to redo

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is a cost effective tool since it combines a CRM and a Marketing management tool. It is a very good option for small businesses since you get almost all the features you need at a very good price (if you compare it with other well known CRMs). Also the customer service is very good, they have a chat feature with very friendly employees!

What do you dislike about Keap?
I would like to see more options and templates on the Marketing feature ex. more options for the creation of broadcasts and emails. Other than that the CRM feature has worked well for us.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Keap is a CRM and Marketing tool all in one at an attractive price! It is good for small to medium-sized businesses.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap is a very nice option for small and medium-sized businesses. We use it as a CRM but also as a valuable Marketing tool, to create campaigns and broadcasts, newsletters etc.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
There's not a lot that I like about Infusionsoft - even after 2 years. It is relatively easy to set up automated email campaigns and send broadcast emails. Compared to competitors, they have really fallen behind.

What do you dislike about Keap?
We are using Max Classic so keep that in mind:

1. Reporting is poor and it's hard to determine ROI from email activities
2. You need a lot of add-on tools to do basic CRM activities like PlusThis, Zapier, iTracker360 and Reporting software
3. Their landing page builder is incredibly slow
4. Pipeline - in Max classic, there is no max classic
5. SMS - it's 2021 and their SMS is still in beta
6. Yahoo and AOL have completely blocked their servers so now I need to pay for and manage ANOTHER tool to use other email servers

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Like any automation software, sending automated emails to leads and prospects helps you save time but Infusiosoft just isn't the best option for lead generation businesses to target messages at the right time.

all_reviews.review_title: So much potential, but really lacks robust marketing tools
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love that you can set up advanced automation and workflows. The sales pipeline and the automation that comes along with them are a great way to simplify the sales process.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The least helpful part about Keap is the lack of real marketing tools. Having dozens of email marketing templates, but lacking a way to see the analytics from the forms you create, is absolutely backward. On a daily basis, I have to submit feedback on features that aren't there or don't work properly. Combine all this with the fact that our first marketing outreach to about 100k contacts had a bug that messed up the merge features. Kinda embarrassing.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you are a small business and need to have to invoice and track sales and have a small contact list, this might be good for you. If you have a  few thousand contacts or more, Keap is really lacking. Hopefully, it gets better.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our sales team was spending so much time on follow-ups that we couldn't work on getting new sales leads. The automation that is part of Keap allows us to spend more time cultivating leads. It also makes sure that all of our leads stay out of the cracks.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
By far, the ability to use Keap to quickly create and build landing pages and email campaigns that drive new prospects into our company gives us a far better chance to grow than blindly "marketing" on social media.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There's really nothing to dislike in Keap.  If you need something, chances are, Keap can do it.  The only challenges I ever have are realizing how powerful it is, and keeping my imagination in check.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It is a really great piece of software, and it has allowed us to create and launch far quicker than I ever thought possible.  It's important to understand that it requires you to learn things, and to have a reliable plan you can follow, but that's part of your job anyway.  It's changed how we think about the business.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The speed of conversions.  Prior to adopting Keap, it took us, on average, 3 weeks to convert a prospect.  Now, with text messaging, the email follow up, and the ease of scheduling sales calls, we're closing new leads in five-6 business days.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
What I like best about KEAP is... EVERYTHING!!!  Like, I love that I can text AND email in the same system.  I love using KEAP to set my appointments, create invoices and integrate my online merchant provider to receive payments.  I love setting up marketing automation that frees up my time to do the recurring tasks that I no longer have to do or hire someone to do for me!  I love that KEAP has integrated landing pages, so I don't have to re-invent the wheel each time I want or need to launch a new targeted campaign.  Frankly, I invested over ten years of my life and over $850,000 in building my own SMS & email platform... I am now using KEAP... what's that communicate to you?  It should share everything because it matters!!!!

What do you dislike about Keap?
What I don't like so much about KEAP is... well... as a newer certified partner, I feel like there are too many logins and places to go to get the information I need when I need it.  Admittedly, KEAP is an extremely robust platform, so I come with compassion and understanding, but there are just too many places to get information.  Then, when training for my Certified Partner certification, I was redirected to too many different places to watch training videos.  Also, I feel that KEAP could allow us to purchase additional characters in the SMS platform.  If we submit 160 characters, the cost is $.04 each SMS message, but if my SMS is between 160 and 320 characters, I would love the option to pay $.08 each.

Furthermore, I think KEAP should combine their SMS text box with their eMail system at the time of broadcast so I can do it all in one window.  Also, I would like to be able to edit multiple contacts all at once.  But, besides these minor inconveniences, there is NOTHING I would change.   It was a lot, but that is my ONLY complaint.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're considering KEAP, I can personally attest to its stability and ease of use.  It's helping to make my life a LOT more simple, and I can generate additional income from using it properly.  Such an incredibly powerful tool!!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The main problem we're solving by using KEAP is combing our systems together in one place... It's a CRM tool, a communication tool, a workflow tool, an appointment tool and much, much more... all in one simple system!!!!

all_reviews.review_title: To Keap or not to Keap
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is one of the most flexible options out there in the small business world.  As a Keap certified development partner  (KDP) I see so many different types of businesses use Keap to handle communications, followup, marketing and positive relationship management with ease.  And there's a great mix of features and ease of use between the different versions.  Just pick what works best for you.  Many medical fields, law offices, direct and internet sales, marketing and services, all use Keap to save time/money on the things that normally someone would have to pay staff to spend each day doing.  The support and the community is a key difference from other services, because each person in the groups truly wants to see others succeed as much as they do.  And if your needs are more advanced, there is amazing support and developers (like myself) to help integrate or connect other custom services and products.  Most of all though, it works for small businesses right out of the box!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Affiliate marketing and online sales support (order pages, shopping cart, affiliate content support).  Functionally Keap is great and it can be made to do quite a bit but those are the areas it could improve on.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Keap provides a range of flexibility and simplicity that competitively compares well against other services.  For the price, dollar for dollar, it's the best offered tool for managing online marketing for any small to medium sized business.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I create custom integrations.  We've used Keap/IS for marketing but also for workflow management automations.  Part of my business is custom integration development and Keap is the product I know best so it fits right in!

all_reviews.review_title: The Ultimate Sales and Marketing Automation Software for Entrepreneurs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Having worked with over 1000+ businesses over the past 8 years, I've seen the ins and outs of almost every sales and marketing automation software on the market. Most entrepreneurs and small businesses we've worked with turn to Keap as their software of choice because their current solution lacks many of the features/functionality that Keap has built into it natively. Some of the features I like best about Keap are the powerful and customizable customer relationship management (CRM), sales and marketing automations, sales pipeline, broadcasting via email or text message, a business phone line, and appointment setting system - just to name a few! Keap continues to innovate with new features to blend ease-of-use with their powerful tool to make it easy for all entrepreneurs to start, grow, and scale with Keap.

What do you dislike about Keap?
A few years ago the development and innovation of the software seemed to have really slowed down. This created frustration for us and we openly shared this with Keap. Over the past year, we've seen a 180 on the product development speed and have been delighted with the number of new features and product innovation that's being consistently released!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
As an entrepreneurial small business, you need a robust and agile software to function as the tech backbone of your business - and Keap checks all the boxes! The best part of this software is that it's so versatile we've seen success leveraging Keap to capture and convert leads more efficiently, along with getting paid faster and making more money for every type of business (product-based, service-based, online, or brick-and-mortar businesses).

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful Solution For Small Business Marketing And Sales Automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The Campaign Builder (Advanced Automations) is a super powerful tool for automating tasks, including marketing.  Because I know certain leads are very likely to be interested in certain products, I can use this feature to automate the delivery of timely emails.  Putting the offer in front of these leads at the exact right time increases conversion rates.  Now that I have the campaign created, I don't have to do anything -- I just receive the order received notifications!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Not a lot to dislike here, it's a very capable system, and the support options (online documentation, chat, phone, facebook, etc.) make it possible to overcome any challenges you run into.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's a sales and marketing automation solution, and no doubt it helps me take care of both of those handily.  Keap helps me keep in touch with my clients with the right message at the right time, and that, for me, translates into increased sales.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap Is The Best Sales & Marketing Automation Platform Out There!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I've been using Keap for 15 years.  Although many new tools have come out in that timeframe, nothing can match the power you get with you connect the CRM with the automation engine, and all the marketing & sales data flows into the CRM.  Absolutely amazing.  For the last 9 years I've been helping other small businesses implement Keap and they're getting amazing results.  I'm super impressed lately with the amount of new features,  innovation, and ease-of-use.  It's clear that Keap is dedicated to remaining the best option out there for small businesses.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There was a period a few years ago when the development of the product was REALLY slow.  The good news is, that has changed big time in the last 18 months.  They seemed to have turned a corner and development has picked up speed.  New features are coming out every month and the product has really improved a ton.

I would highly recommend that all small businesses take a look at Keap.  Whether you're in a service-based business or a product-based business, whether you're selling online or with a sales team, Keap has solutions that can better optimize your time and your conversions.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I run a small team, but we're able to operate like a much bigger business.  The automation power of Keap allows us to automated a TON of our daily, repetitive tasks.  It also helps us convert many more leads to customers because of the great marketing & sales follow up abilities.  We can stay in contact with leads and customers, which builds stronger relationships, even though we're a really small team.

all_reviews.review_content:

There are definitely a lot of ways to do different things as far as tracking leads and storing contacts. I did particularly like the ability to set up automated email campaigns to follow up with prospects when a certain tag was added to their contact.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I think there's so much in there that we just don't know how to use or the functionality isn't intuitive. There are times we try to do something new and it takes lots of searching and googling and testing things to figure out how to do what it is we want to do. Also, For actual lead tracking and lead tracking time, it doesn't seem to be easy. The ways that can be done in there are complex and still require a lot of manual calculations.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Tracking leads, looking at past lead history when people come back for something new. Sending email blasts to contacts is easy enough and helps us quickly get some lead responses.

all_reviews.review_title: Since 2012, Keap has been critical to helping our business scale and grow
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap has been the backbone of our tech stack in our small business since 2012.  There is so much to like about it as it has many features being an all-in-one CRM & Marketing Automation tool.  We specifically use the CRM, email broadcast tool, campaign builder, sales pipeline, eCommerce, subscriptions, affiliates, appointments, and reporting.  My favourite feature is the Campaign Builder.  Being a visual person, I love the ability to map out and build automation that saves hours every week.  It's probably saved me from having to employee a full-time resource as we don't have to do things manually.  The system helps convert additional sales through the automated follow-up and reminders we have setup.  Being a long-term user, it's exciting to see Keap back to the good old days and re-investing back into developing small (but meaningful) and bigger feature releases.

What do you dislike about Keap?
As with any software, there is always room for improvement.  Being an Australian user, I'm specifically looking forward to some of the new features being rolled out in the future that have successfully launched in the US.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
There can be a learning curve, particularly if you are new to the world of marketing automation.  I think with any software, you need to get clear about what you're trying to achieve and then looking at how the tool can help you get there.  Sometimes with all the bells and whistles you can easily get distracted by features that won't impact your bottom line.  I know I have over the years, so don't let that be you! ;-)

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap solves many problems for our business, but the main ones are, being able to communicate at mass with our database, being able to segment and create targeted messages, following up with leads, selling and taking payments online 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, recording and tracking sales activities, setting reminders to follow up with leads, automating invoices and customer onboarding for new purchases and so much more.  It's helped generate thousands in extra revenue, save having to employee a staff member and also reduced the number of hours I spend working at night and on weekends with boring admin work.

all_reviews.review_title: The definition of Keap: Efficiency and Timely
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
KEAP has a resource for every aspect of our company.  It covers our CRM, Quoting system, and Pipeline. We can easliy access evey one of our customers. We store the contact information, email them through the system, and never forget where our sales are at. Without KEAP we would be lost as a company. We enjoy the resources that we can have right at our fingertips. Customers can also stay connected through the broadcasting system. We dont need another email software to contact our customers. The tagging system is also great, with the tags we can email select customers information on the product or choose the right group to selectively market to. With KEAP we never miss a call because of the task system we can use to organize our days. No matter if it is a salesman, an office assistant, or an accountant, we can all stay on top our tasks with the tasks system in KEAP. This system makes our jobs easier, its not just a website that we sometimes go on. It is always open and always providing us all the information we need to succeed.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The downside of using KEAP is that we still need a system to track our finances separately. It would be excellent to have everything in this one excellent resource! It would also be great to place the customers into separate boxes on one screen if there weren't always in one long list. If there was a way to make the customers all seen at once, this would benefit our company.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
KEAP solves any problems we have with keeping track of our leads. We also have each of our quotes attached to the customer when we email them out of the system. This makes it very efficient and timely. We never have to waste time looking for quotes again. We realized we can save time with KEAP.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We stopped having all our process be manual. Our customer's sign up to their subscription, sign all documents through a Parsey/Docusign Integration; documents are saved to their file box, initiate the joining to the customers local association also via DocuSign and PlusThis, triggering text reminders to both customers and staff as necessary, through a Zapier connection our Swag Up welcome kits are automatically shipped to our customer. all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I tried at least four different companies before choosing and staying with Keap. That was eight years ago. I found it intuitive and straightforward to use. A few months after the switch, my business went over six figures. I know a lot of that had to do with Keap.

The BEST, rare and unique thing about Keap is that they care about you as a person. You are assigned a Customer Success Manager who ensures you're getting the most out of Keap and supports you through the ups and downs of business. Over the last two years, so many companies failed to support their business owner and entrepreneur customers. Keap is one of the few that went (and continues to go) above and beyond with fierce loyalty and support.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I can't say there is anything I dislike. There is so much you can do with Keap, that you need a team member who can dedicate the necessary time to get the most out of it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
One challenge I had with other offerings was being able to segment subscribers and create intelligent follow-up sequences. Keap allows me to do that and so much more.

all_reviews.review_title: IKON was just what I needed!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
As a new user/organization, attending Ikon was very helpful in getting me up to speed on the possibilities of Keap.  We have an API that creates contacts through our donor giving platform and we do email and text campaigns to our donors, so learning about the new text product and being able to be a part of the pilot is great for us.  I'm looking forward to the new landing page builder too!

What do you dislike about Keap?
The landing page text tool covers the letters as you type, so a new builder will be great. The contact search doesn't always return all of the information and it is frustrating at times. Also, I would love some configuration in labels as they are not descriptive of our business.  It seems like a relatively easy option, but it's not on the road map.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We had 5 databases that are now in one place so we can communicate with our members and donors. We send out reminders and invitations on a frequent basis.  Keap has made it easy to build drip campaigns and web forms that allow us to capture leads.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the email builder/broadcasts! Easy to use and make well-designed templates that look good. Aggressive spam detector (a blessing and a curse in one). Advanced, sophisticated targeting options.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The spam detector in the email can be helpful and annoying. It works but when you're an IT/MSP company warning your clients about phishing and malware, lots of alerts about our emails getting flagged for spam can get frustrating. Also, there's been an email deliverability issue to Yahoo and Aol accounts. Keap support is working on a fix, but this is something we actively have to work around. So the email works but only to certain domains, at least as of November 2021. Also dislike the complicated admin back end - granting permissions to users is a real minefield and tough to navigate.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Tracking lots of info on customers and targets. Love all the capabilities - texting, campaign builder, landing pages, emails, automation - lots of great benefits to using. Keap is also constantly innovating and adding new features.

all_reviews.review_title: Best marketing and sales automation tool available.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It's powerful but simple. I use in small business about $100k, medium business about $15M and large business about $100M. I'm loving the new Keap Pro UX. Designed for small business owners.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I'd like some of the robustness of Infusionsoft back in the new keap product. and get your deliverability to @yahoo ESPs fixed.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Just implemented Keap pro for my new venture: a private school in CA. we start in a year officially, but the waiting list is already full, the momentum is building quick, and we have pilot student cohorts already running.
I'm hiring, communicating with existing parents, educating future parents, and communicating with potential partners and donors.

And the chaos came fast.

Full inboxes, calls and texts from unknown numbers, appointments double booked and falling through the cracks, repeated conversations, manual billing and deposits and missed opportunities for follow up after our interest nights.

We were using phones, Google sheets, gmail, Google calendar, Google sites for a landing page, hubspot free crm, and an event booking tool to do the above.

We began conquering the chaos first by consolidating our contact data then segmenting. I know who is who, customers, prospects, partners, spouses, and kids.
And immediately we could broadcast with confidence.

I also am in the community meeting hundreds of new people every week, their spouses, their kids (from toddlers to teenagers.)

So the mobile app lets me double check names, notes, and context sometimes seconds before I reconnect with someone. And lets  me build strong relationships where people feel seen and remembered. Which is what I always want to do but as a mere mortal simply couldn't do without the crm.

Then we started automating a new interest intake and follow up.
I have the same conversations and now interested parents can fill out a form and receive all that info in an email & text, all linking to a video series we host in wistia that gives them everything they need on their time while I lead in the company and stay present in my own home and family.

Next step is moving our billing from an event software we use to keap. They will eliminate using 3 systems to execute and track monthly payments and daily new deposits for next year.

Last week we had a huge live event with two calls to action - one a link to opt in for next years start. And two a text to my keap business number to opt in for the January pilot cohort.

My business calls, voicemails and texts are starting to be separated into keap only while I keep my personal channels for personal communications.

I also got a local number for my business line which makes our leads have even more confidence when they reach out.

This is all ONE week of using Keap Pro. And I set it up myself.

As you know I've used Infusionsoft successfully and at both small a large scales since 2012, but this is my first personal use of the keap suite.

It is literally the perfect solution for me and our business.

And it's actually fun to use.

Loving this product. And the decisions you're making that make it easier for Entrepreneuers to grow calm and organized business.

all_reviews.review_title: Keeping track of your Business it's easier than ever!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The ability to keep track of clients' services, invoices, details on notes, and their contact, as well as all other info all in one place, is fantastic. This software made our office change the way we kept client data and started our process of going paperless. I love the feature that allows me to text my clients and keep a log of our communication. It is a much safer place to keep all this personal information and avoid using my cell phone. The software is easy to use, and the coordination team at KEAP made it simple and easy to learn. They continuously send webinars over emails that enhance your knowledge and ability to use the software, applying all of its features to the success of your business venture. I love it.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The only thing I wish KEAP would have is the ability to process payments by ACH. I love the integrated payment feature it has. It makes it easy to process payments. However, we prefer the ACH processing for recurring clients because it does not require updates of card numbers every time we run payments.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I haven't had many problems with KEAP, mostly benefits. A major benefit we had is the invoice management with clients that asked to make multiple payments for services or to come to pay later. Before KEAP I'd forget which clients owed us what, now I'm able to see all the money people owe us and I'm surprised at how many pending invoices we have still. Thanks to KEAP.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The campaign builder is incredible. If you're creative enough and know how to use the software (takes time) you can automate ANYTHING for your marketing strategies. One thing that doesn't get much attention is the Actionsets module. It's a legacy tool in the system but man does it do a lot! Actionsets expand all possibilities.

The amount of third-party software available is definitely necessary for most campaigns and worth the cost, especially the integration ones such as PlusThis, Zapier, LeadsBridge.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The Email Broadcasts interface should offer more options to customize the marketing emails. Right now it does enough but there's so much more it needs. I often have to add my own code to the email to make things look a certain way.

The Legacy Email Templates deserve a little upgrade too, the interface looks very 2000s and often breaks the formatting if you don't know how to use it.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Be mindful it's a lot to set up because it offers so much more than other CRMs. Pro tip: The Marketing Settings recommends to add DKIM to the records of the domain you'll be using to send marketing emails, but please contact your hosting company to help you set up an SPF record and possibly DMARC records, this will improve your email deliverability significantly!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The interface update for the My Day page looks good but has many issues that are affecting the sales people's performance. We're working with our account manager and tech support to get them to fix it.

all_reviews.review_title: A must have CRM for any entrepreneur and business owner who's looking to have EPIC results.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Campaigns and automation are where Keap outshines many CRMs I used in the past. I love that I set up campaigns 3 years ago, and new subs are finding me on my blog and still getting those same emails I wrote 3 years ago. Set it up once, get results for a lifetime.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It can be overwhelming to learn, but Keap offers amazing support through their online portal and live chat. I have always been able to find the support I needed on these two ways to get in touch with Keap. There's a phone line to call, but I am a millennial and prefer chat or DIY tutorials over calls.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're a business owner who needs a robust email marketing system and a high-quality CRM, then Keap is the one. Throughout my 10+ years as an entrepreneur, I have used different CRMs and finally found Keap to be the one. Been a happy Keap member since 2016. Woot woot.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. Automation. Before Keap, I was constantly trying to stay on top of things. With Keap's automation tools, I created different campaigns to keep my clients happy and use broadcasts when I have something new to share.
2. Keap can be a GREAT tool if you're looking for all in one CRM. Keap handles your contacts; you can send invoices, collect payments, and much more with keap.
3. Keap stays up to the industry standards with the latest email marketing regulations, so you as a business owner can trust that you won't break any rules with the big tech email giants. Thank you, Team Keap!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap provides  a flexible and dynamic product that helps small businesses capitalize on marketing automation to remove the time-consuming tasks that we all have.  Because of the flexible nature - I used 2 seperate applications - one for my events company and one for my digital agency.  Since there are many redundant tasks and processes with events - booking speakers, reminders to speakers, attendees etc, I found that Keap helped me stay on track and on task so that I could focus on the really important stuff - like ticket sales.  As a past systems integrator with many years of marketing experience, I find Keap has the right balance of technical power and ease of use.  It has so many different versions now that there is a version for your business growth.

What do you dislike about Keap?
System emails do not use the templates that I create and store elsewhere.  And the email builder need the option to send a text-only email.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Take advantage of all the free training offered to clients - and if it seems overwhelming, work with a certified partner to get it up and running correctly.  This tool is way more powerful than it appears, but once it is up and running, you will have so much more free time.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
One of my companies - until recently - ran 14 live events per month.  We needed a dynamic system where;
*	Each attendee could bring up to 10 guests -
*	We could market every week to previous ticket purchasers.
*	Track ongoing attendance to upsell repeat attendees to be a speaker
*	Sell our membership subscription for those that became a speaker
*	Sell more franchises.
*	And manage all of the speakers - applications, volunteers for all of these events.
I looked for a complete solution, and Keap ensured that we could keep our tech stack as small as possible.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for the Highly Creative Person -
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Like a lot of highly creative people, I am usually going in 15 different directions at once. Keap gives my business the STRUCTURE that it needs to succeed. The automated campaigns are the bomb. I love them most for Marketing and Sales, but also for content delivery. (Like, "Hey, our call is today!" email, then the next day, "Here's the recording for you," etc) My customers feel so loved and cared for. It's so great to be able to set up my emails in advance, and know that my clients are getting what they need, when they need it.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I use Keap Max Classic, which is the Lamborghini of email marketing, in that it is immensely powerful and infinitely customizable. I've heard that sometimes people feel overwhelmed by all the choices and power and don't know where to start. But hey, I don't use all the things my MacBook can do, either, right? As a not-very-techy person, I can tell you that starting slow and simple works just fine, and then you can always make things more complex as you grow.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Having Keap is like having the world's most on-the-ball executive assistant, because it automatically sends appointment reminders, follows up on failed credit cards, welcomes new clients and helps me stay in touch with former clients and prospects.

And it's the last one - staying in touch with former clients and nurturing prospects until they are ready to buy - that has really transformed my business. How many times does someone hand you their card and say, "I'm interested in your work. Please stay in touch." And then you don't follow up right away....and then you worry that it's been too long....and then you can't figure out what to say.... and between one thing and another, you have let that prospect slide away, and that business card just sits in a pile on your desk, mocking you. Ammiright?

Keap solves that problem 100%. Sometimes I have people enroll in my classes that have been on my list for nearly TEN YEARS. But because I stay in contact with them via Keap, they stay warm until they are ready to buy.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
What I like best about Keap is the robust feature set and frequent updates from the Keap product team. I've also had excellent experiences with both sales and support. I recently had to migrate from an existing platform to a new one and the process was smooth. I also like the campaign builder. I appreaciate the dedication to upgrading and improving it that I've seen in recent years since the start of the monthly updates. I haven't thought about switching platforms since that time. It seemed like a couple of years ago the team got a lot more serious about customer satisfaction and it shows!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Similar to learning a new operating system, Keap is complicated and takes time to get used to. But by now, I've been using it long enough for it to feel familiar. The downsides of using Keap are the broken upsell functionality and lack of order form options that competitors have. But I believe these are in the process of being addressed. It would also be nice for ALL features to exist in Keap Max Classic - I believe this is already in the works too. I do worry that Keap Max Classic's UI will change and I'll have to relearn where things are when I don't really have time for that.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If someone is considering using Keap, I would tell them to sign up for the free trial and immediately start playing with the campaign builder. I'd tell them to download a campaign template that seems interesting and start tinkering with it. I'd also have them try out the email editor and landing page builders so they could see how powerful the platform is right out of the box.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm solving the problems of marketing and email automation, keeping track of customer data, outreach to my audience, and leveraging an online content library solution (CustomerHub). Keap is pretty much the crux of my business and I do all my business intelligence with it. I have used Keap to create courses, drip-fed content delivery, invoicing, quotes, and email campaigns.

review_question_answers.answer: If someone is considering using Keap, I would tell them to sign up for the free trial and immediately start playing with the campaign builder. I'd tell them to download a campaign template that seems interesting and start tinkering with it. I'd also have them try out the email editor and landing page builders so they could see how powerful the platform is right out of the box.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: I'm solving the problems of marketing and email automation, keeping track of customer data, outreach to my audience, and leveraging an online content library solution (CustomerHub). Keap is pretty much the crux of my business and I do all my business intelligence with it. I have used Keap to create courses, drip-fed content delivery, invoicing, quotes, and email campaigns.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
In my opinion, the heart of an automated marketing system is the campaign builder. The graphical interface makes it easy to see how each campaign is structured. The reporting shows statistics so you know how each element is performing. This is a complicated product with lots of features. That requires highly trained support staff. I've gotten very good help troubleshooting issues that were mostly my lack of knowledge and experience. In other words, it's often like a mini-training when you call for support.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Compared to some competitors, it is more costly. But, it also has more features. It used to be that small businesses and startups were priced out, but the new Keap options now address that issue.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you are looking for full-service CRM, marketing automation and ecommerce in a single solution Infusionsoft should be on your list.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use the software to run marketing funnels. Many are very similar and I can copy an entire campaign, a sequence, or a specific email to make building new ones get up and running fast.

all_reviews.review_title: Keeps me organized and grows my business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It is as close to an all-in-one tool as I have found.  I love that I am not as scattered across multiple tools to run my business.  It has an online version and an app.

I have had conversations with the Keap support chat line and had any issues solved quickly.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I do look forward to an upgraded email builder that I hear is coming.  Sometimes the app seems slow.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
This is a well-priced CRM.  I set up too many products and services at first.  Set up general products and then customize them on your quotes and invoices.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am able to get paid so quickly. I have had a conversation, sent a quote, converted the accepted quote to an invoice in less than three hours on a few occasions.  It is so easy to get appointments set  - and it integrates with my calendar so I don't double book!  I have a Pipeline set up so I know where my clients are in my process. I love that all of the information from my clients are all in one place - all emails, texts (to my Keap #), quotes, and payments are all together.  I feel so much more organized and follow-ups are much easier for me now.

It is so easy to scan a business card into the app and immediately connect with new prospects.  The scans are accurate.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent sales and marketing automation suite for businesses who are looking to scale
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
As someone who likes to map out and manager their own customer journeys, it's really important to me to be able to customise the way I attract and gather clients. Other tools always want me to follow a wizard and do things in a certain order. The ability to be able to just jump into automations and map these as I go is a huge time saver for me and is why I'm so quickly able to create and launch new campaigns.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I look forward to a day where the landing page builder is more advanced and able to handle sales funnels as part of Keap. Teamed with appointment date and time as a field that can be used for field timers, this would be the ultimate all in one tool for my business.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
CRM and sales pipeline management to track and manage leads
Email nurturing and broadcasting to make sales from my existing database
Automated sales processes and upselling to increase my CLV
A marketing framework to build my business around with the implementation for Customer Lifecycle Marketing

all_reviews.review_title: Good Solution but Still Some Gaps
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
SaaS, easy to use, on-line support is fast and efficient

What do you dislike about Keap?
Excel exports have sufficient information but it would be nice if you could set the order of the columns and save that. Integration to Outlook wasn't good to begin with and is now not sufficient to meet our needs. We have a couple of users (CEO) that want to work mostly from Outlook but they really can't do that any more.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make sure to develop a robust set of your business requirements before making your product solution. Also, ensure you have a solid selection process for evaluating different options. We did a poor job on both of these and are still paying for it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Primarily used as part of lead generation and to track our sales opportunities. Data integrity is much improved.

With such a powerful tool, if you are not using it all the time it can be cumbersome to learn and feel like you are mastering its capabilities. Keap continues to make improvements to make the learning curve easier.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap is Secret Weapon for Sales Professionals and Project Managers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Automated communication using the pipeline is great for staying on task and keeping customers and colleagues abreast of where you are in your sales funnel.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I wish you could CC or BCC an email address when programming email campaigns.  This would help me integrate Keap with SalesForce.

Also, if Keap could make it less technical to integrate an existing email address into their emailing feature, that would be helpful.  I feel like the process for proving you have a right to send emails from a Keap integrated email address could be easier without giving up any security considerations.  This is only a small consideration, though.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap keeps you organized in your sales or project management process and reduces the workload by automating admin tasks, such as email follow-ups, or email notifications.  The visual kanban approach is excellent.

all_reviews.review_title: The biggest bang for my CRM buck
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is easy to use. The set of tools is quite extensive, but I find them very intuitive. Some CRM software is laden with their own proprietary jargon, but the Keap modules are logically named. Since the toolset is robust, I've been able to drop two other subscriptions, further increasing the ROI for Keap.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There's not anything I'm especially unhappy about in Keap, but I did struggle slightly with an automated email sequence. However, I was able to quickly get help and get my automated campaign up and running.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's been great to automate prospect drip campaigns. Now when I add a subscriber to my email list, Keap sends them a good introductory stream of emails letting them know I understand their unique problems and can provide them value.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is fantastic because it allows me to organize my business all in one place. From prospect and client data, quotes and invoices, and historical actions. Not only that, it offers the power of automation helping me send messages to the right person at the right time with relevant content.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Most of the features I had been disappointed with have been improved upon since I started using the tool and especially in the past year.

Some features are not available in Canada or globally, SMS broadcasting and automation, not including taxes automatically on invoices, limitations with customizing appointments and appointment automation with the built-in scheduler.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Any problem I solve once in Keap, is solved repeatedly and ongoing using automation in the campaign builder.

I might forget I need to send that follow-up or reach out to a prospect or client, but Keap doesn't!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It does all the things that I need it to do and more. I can send emails, invoices, appointments and it sends follow-up emails on my behalf. I can set up automation, projects and create broadcasts. I'm still learning the system. I love the automation feature.  I send contracts and documents to my clients.  I can set up an automation to move them through a process for sessions and classes as well.  It's made my life so much easier.  I can set it and go. I love that my contacts are all in one place.   I can track my leads, add tags and track everything.  When I send a broadcast communication the system tracks everything so that I know how many were sent, how many were opened, and how many were not sent.  For my lists, the system also tells me how many emails are duplicates or incorrect.  That saves a lot of time and I don't have to work with blind spots.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I would like to have the ability to send documents that require a signature via KEAP. Right now I have to send via Adobe sign Docusign.  That would add another level for me.  I think they were exploring the possibility of adding this feature but I haven't been informed that it's available at this time.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I recommend taking advantage of the training that is offered.  I was able to work with the trainer to work on several projects with their assistance.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm a one-man show right now and I can set things up to take care of daily tasks.  I LOVE that  I can use one application instead of 3 or 4. I used to use Paypal to create invoices and send notifications to my clients.  Then, I would have to remember to send a follow-up email or a reminder for payment.  KEAP does all of this for me. Having one application that performs multiple functions is great.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
For me, the fact that Keap allows me to get a clear picture of my business on one dashboard is what I love best. For my clients, it's the fact that this app does it all.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There are some tweaks that I'd love to make to the way your company is represented and edited across the app, but overall, I think there are enough hacks that you can do to make it look exactly how you want to display your content to your audience.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automating our sales pipeline and we also use this tool for email marketing, text message marketing and more.
