all_reviews.review_title: KEAP is best in class for scaling businesses to create and end to end customer journey.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love how I can automate the entire customer journey. I've used other CRMS that are great at marketing OR customer service but not both. With KEAP, I am able to map out the entire journey and give my customer service team the ability to efficiently service clients.

The API is pretty easy to work with so that we can hook in or create any tool we need.

KEAP lite is a great place for businesses to start. It is then easy to grow up into the Max version as the business grows. As a consultant, the challenge of moving someone off of their stater tech into the tech that is going to take them to the next level is my job. Starting with KEAP lite makes the  journey less expensive and time consuming.

What do you dislike about Keap?
KEAP gives you the ability to do ANYTHING but that also ends up being a challenge without the right guidance. I would recommend starting with lite so that you don't get overwhelmed with features. Work with a consultant who can help you see what you actually need rather than the shiny objects of everything you can do with the software.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Having one single source of truth. I work with scaling businesses and they often have many different pieces of their tech stack. KEAP allows us to have one place for a single source of truth thus saving our sanity.

all_reviews.review_title: After 7 years, Keap is still the best CRM solution for my business.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I appreciate the all-in-one email marketing, follow-up, and landing page/shopping cart solution in one place.  It really is a robust platform.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The learning curve can be steep at times - however, you get what you pay for and the live support has been great.  I have a VA that also helps me - and honestly, as a business owner, I shouldn't be doing it all myself anyway.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Consider working with a trained VA with this tool.  If you want more than just database management, but also the ability to accept payments and the ability to have landing pages, that makes Keap a more strategic choice.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's hard to remember every step to onboarding new clients.  Keap is helping me save time by automating some of the steps and assigning things to team members.

Tracking where prospects are can also be tricky.  I'm automating some of the follow-up touchpoints with new prospects and sending myself reminders.

I'm using the landing page feature for additional revenue sources.  It's easy to use.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Customization, integrateable into other systems, easy to use, easy to start a project and get it going without needing to complete it. When I initially bought this product, I did so instead of hiring an assistant to keep track of incoming and outgoing emails as well as following up with prospects. Keap (formerly Insufionsoft) definitely gets the job done and doesn't ask to take lunch breaks!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Doesn't offer some features that to me are basic- like being able to copy a form or duplicate a campaign element into a new campaign. Also, there is a limit on the # of custom fields you can create which is a bit ridiculous. I offered to pay more $ to add more customer fields, but apparently this is not possible either. The email templates are ok, I wish there were more formatting options. There used to be an image editor built in, but they got rid of it for some reason.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Know what you need BEFORE you start looking for a CRM. It's easy to get distracted by all the things Keap can do... just make sure those things are what you need.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Recurring credit card payments can be glitchy at times. Benefits are integrating other 3rd party apps like mailing out post cards or creating a customer portal

all_reviews.review_title: Keap is great CRM for small business!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I've been using Keap Max Classic/Infusionsoft since 2015 to manage dozens of direct response lead generation and follow-up campaigns. In combination with PlusThis, and Zapier I'm able to integrate with all the third-party applications we've ever needed and their technical support is always eager to help.

The Ecommerce functionality works extremely well and integrates easily with both Stripe and WePay for credit card payments.

In short, Keap helps serious entrepreneurs and small businesses get organized, follow up, and automate their processes to create efficiency, grow their business, and free up valuable time.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap Max Classic is a very robust CRM with a tremendous capacity for automating the details of complex campaigns.  It's not for the start-up business.  There's a learning curve and it will take time to become proficient, but well worth the effort in the end.

The new landing page builder is graphically better than the original, however, tagging is more complicated and submission notification is no longer available.  The workaround involves creating additional steps in the campaign sequences.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Keap is the #1 marketing automation application for serious business owners who invest in lead generation and want an efficient system for tracking leads, follow-up,  converting clients, and generating referrals.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
With dozens of direct response campaigns running at any given time, Keap ensures no one falls through the cracks and that the right person in our office is engaged in our prospect/client journey every step of the way.

In short, Keap helps serious entrepreneurs and small businesses get organized, follow up, and automate their processes to create efficiency, grow their business, and free up valuable time.

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing features, ease of use and timely customer support makes this a no-brainer.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
So far, for all of our business needs we have been able to keep everything within the Keap system, only having to use webhoooks to connect to our training vault and using a 3rd party doc signing program.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There are a few features/options we tried to make work, but they don't exist yet. That being said, we have been able to add them to the "future work list" for future developments.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automation, automation, automation! We are using this as a tool to more systematically recruit and hire new people for our team. Being able to automate the process of licensing as well as having multiple touchpoints throughout the pre and post-hiring process makes it feasible to ensure proper care along the way. We also then use it for follow-up onboarding and training. We also use it to track activity for our recruiters and the performance of our different leads.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap or Infusionsoft is My favorite "employee".   An employee that gladly takes on more work for me!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
What I like best about Keap is how it can automate so much of my small business.   Unlike other software that forces you to adapt the software to your business, you adapt Keap to the uniqueness of your own business.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Reporting could be better with Infusionsoft, but since it is open API and has a large open marketplace of apps you can easily find an app or export data to get the trend reports you are looking for.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Study the company and people behind Keap.   The quality of the product is an outcome of the culture.    I looked at glassdoor.com and read the employee reviews.   Keap's leadership cannot be anymore genuine and committed to wanting to serve entrepreneurs and small business.    The resulting product and service is exceptional, and will remain exceptional if they maintain this focus.   Their number one business performance metric is not financial - but a "word of mouth" score.   This is the best litmus test.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
No prospect or cold lead is ever forgotten.   All our clients are much more engaged with us and systematically refreshed of our value and solicited for referrals.    Keap markets and runs our business while we sleep.   We do easily 10x the follow-up we never did but that we always wanted to, in the fraction of the time it would have taken us to do it manually or with old CRM type systems.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I signed up DURING a launch and had no idea how to get started. I fast-tracked the training and my onboarding coach helped me set up my whole funnel sequence, which was super helpful in understanding how to use the software going forward. It worked like a charm! Everything went out when it was supposed to and my results were amazing! While I am just learning the TRUE power of Keap, I can't wait to explore what else is possible!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap is not cheap! My initial reluctance was the investment. However, because I had the opportunity to see how powerful the software is during my launch, I can clearly see the value! You really do get what you pay for. Keap is an investment worth making if you are serious about email marketing, proper sequences, and powerful follow-up and sales systems!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you need a powerful CRM and marketing tool, that helps you stay organized and shows you where your money is, this is the right investment to make.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
My last launch before Keap, was very labor-intensive when setting up all of the emails that needed to go out, Keap makes this process easy once I understood how it worked. I plan to be creative in finding more uses for Keap. One of the features I like is the way it tracks where my money is!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap's customer service has been outstanding. Additionally, even though we are probably using 50-60% of its capabilities, Keap saves us $10,000s/year in administrative and marketing costs while removing much of the human error from repeat processes that can be automated.

What do you dislike about Keap?
While they have made upgrades in the UX, the design is clunky (for example, emails and contact records) and the speed of the site is slower than we desire. It has also been difficult for our data analytics vendor to extract analytics data.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Keap (or any CRM with marketing/administrative automation) is going to require intense concentration at first and dedication to its long-term use. Unless you are a coder or polymath, you are not going to understand it immediately. Keap's training and customer service are very good. Rely on them at first. Once your campaigns get humming you will be absolutely 100% happy to did it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
8 years ago I started with the end in mind. When I started my business, I intentionally went with Keap because I knew that if I handled all of the administrative functions standard in our business (M&A, so for example, getting NDAs signed), I would burn out and never be able to grow. Keap has allowed us to scale from $350,000 in sales to $3,650,000 last year and likely closer to $4.5MM this year.

In short, we started by automating administrative functions like reminders to sign NDAs and reminders to our team to follow up with buyers. We then extended it to our marketing campaigns by building drip marketing sequences to stay in front of prospects. We have thoroughly enjoyed being able to integrate Zapier / Slydial to leave automatic voicemails for buyers and prospects.

We are continuously learning new ways to utilize Keap and overall we are very pleased.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap has powerful features for email automation, but you need to put in time to learn it.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like how quick it is to get an easy automation up and running. Literally just a few clicks, copy and paste your emails, and you're good to go.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There's no easy or obvious way to see open and click through rates for easy automations, or to compare open rates across different broadcasts, or even just export this analytics data so that it could be analyzed elsewhere.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If all you need is basic email automation, this platform might be a bit too expensive for your needs, but with the right training it seems like it pays off with all of the advanced stuff you can do with Keap.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email automation to sell online courses. We have implemented the automation and had sales as a direct result.

all_reviews.review_title: Not as easy and powerful as promised and marketed
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
This is a good tool if you're a small startup/entrepreneur with a small budget who wants an email tool to send out auto-responses triggered by website trigger events.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I was initially very excited about Infusionsoft. They promised a lot of powerful capabilities and that they'd be able to support a quite advanced automated sequence I had in mind, but when it was time to implement they lacked the tools necessary. Design options are also quite limited. During my few months with them, I had three or four different reps. Their employee rotation seems to be very high.
The lesson of the story is, if you want advanced tools, you have to pay the premium price.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
They didn't solve my problems. I cancelled the service.

all_reviews.review_title: It just doesn't break - it works
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It is so solid. I've used other programs that are "just like Keap only better", but the problem is, they're not - they break, automations fail, I have to creat patches and fixes to keep the other software running. With Keap, I don't. It works. It runs. It doesn't break. It is so robust.

You can do so much with Keap. You can automate and systematize so much. I can multiply results of my marketing and sales and client fulfillment, and generate much more revenue while keeping clients happy. I love systems, everything I do is about building systems, and Keap is by far the best platform I've used (and I've used a lot of them on various projects). All new programs I've standardized with Keap. I don't want to work with other platforms because I don't like to have to fix things. I want campaigns, blasts, automations, memberships, to all run flawlessly, and I get that with Keap.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It takes a mindset change to go from crazy mode to creating systems that do all the hard work. This can take some time to get used to.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
They are at least 5 years ahead of their competitors. I've seen clients with systems that are "just like Infusionsoft only better". While they may be better in one area, they are not better than Infusionsoft. Infusionsoft is superior in critical areas where those others fall short.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
More leads, more sales, better follow up, and less work because systems I built are doing all the manual grunt work my team and I used to do. It's so nice having a business that can be scaled. It takes work, but suddenly it becomes reality instead of a far-fetched dream. My sales have gone up and I have great client relationships. I can focus more on the customer, solving their problems, and selling more.

all_reviews.review_title: Great CRM/ Sales/ Marketing Software that Addresses Most of My Pain Points + Makes My Life Easier
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It has a built-in appointment scheduler.
**I select open days and time blocks and clients book meeting slots that work for both of us. No more back and forth emails! I can send appointment scheduling links via emails from my desktop, laptop, phone, or put a scheduling link on my website.

My contacts are organized on an intuitive dashboard.
**I can see (for each contact): status (prospect, client, or other), appointments, invoices, emails, tasks, and notes. If you have more than one person on your business team, everyone can see a complete picture of each contact. I can also carry out any of these tasks from this dashboard which I love. Contacts can be uploaded individually, in mass, or by scanning business cards (via mobile app).

Keap provides you with a free second phone number to use as a business line (so I don't have to share my personal cell number with clients)!
**And you can send unlimited texts to clients and track all communications and tasks on Keap's mobile app.
**I love that you can also create frequently used email templates to easily send as SMS or email messages and you can send appointment links for lightning fast response to prospective or current clients after calls. The mobile app lets me run my business from my phone.

My revenues are increasing using Keap because I am converting more prospects to clients!
**Keap keeps me organized so no one slips through the cracks. This has resulted in converting more prospects to clients.

Keap makes me look more professional.
**I have received many compliments from clients when I switched to Keap. They love the ease of scheduling appointments, paying invoices, and getting quick responses for automated processes.

You can build campaigns to automate follow up emails.
**For example, I have developed a campaign that automatically sends a response email to a prospective client when they fill out my webform (which takes them to my appointment scheduling link). The system also adds a task to my list so I remember to review their webform in advance of our call. This function is huge in streamlining repetitive administrative emails and has automated my initial client pipeline saving me time.

I can run reports to evaluate my business.
**It is powerful to be able to use that data to increase my prospect to client conversion rate and my overall sales.

The price was right!
**As a small business, I love that I can pay my fees on a monthly (instead of annual) basis. There is a one-time coaching/ system set up fee to help you set up your system--but they were willing to work with me on this too. Keap's willingness to work with small business owners was a big selling point for me. Other software systems were not willing to budge.

Customer service is responsive and top notch.
**I have multiple ways to get help if I need it: calling tech support, chatting online, or calling my Customer Service Manager. I also had an expert coach assist me with some of the more technical aspects of the set up.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There are a few technical issues I've had with Keap:

1) For example, when people pay via credit card, the system masks the name of the payer so it's not as easy to tell who has paid me and I have to do a little more sleuth work to confirm.
2) It takes some getting used to setting up a campaign to automate my emails and processes, but I am a newbie at this, and I bet this is true for all CRMs. I just learned that Keap is launching a new easy automation builder which should help a ton.
3) The pricing may be a bit high for some small businesses at $149/ month but it has been worth it since I am converting more clients with this CRM--so for me, the system ends up easily paying for itself.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
1) Saving time by automating my sales pipeline (ex: I can set up automatic emails to follow up with potential clients that haven't responded to a sent quote).
2)  More organized system of sending out marketing emails.
3) Easy to see all client data in one place (invoices, emails, payments, etc.)
4) I am converting more clients.

Keap's willingness to work with small business owners was a big selling point for me. Other software systems were not willing to budge.

Customer service is responsive and top notch.
**I have multiple ways to get help if I need it: calling tech support, chatting online, or calling my Customer Service Manager. I also had an expert coach assist me with some of the more technical aspects of the set up.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
There are a few technical issues I've had with Keap:

1) For example, when people pay via credit card, the system masks the name of the payer so it's not as easy to tell who has paid me and I have to do a little more sleuth work to confirm.
2) It takes some getting used to setting up a campaign to automate my emails and processes, but I am a newbie at this, and I bet this is true for all CRMs. I just learned that Keap is launching a new easy automation builder which should help a ton.
3) The pricing may be a bit high for some small businesses at $149/ month but it has been worth it since I am converting more clients with this CRM--so for me, the system ends up easily paying for itself.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
1) Saving time by automating my sales pipeline (ex: I can set up automatic emails to follow up with potential clients that haven't responded to a sent quote).
2)  More organized system of sending out marketing emails.
3) Easy to see all client data in one place (invoices, emails, payments, etc.)
4) I am converting more clients.

all_reviews.review_title: Incredibly Powerful System for Small Businesses - - It's Been a Game Changer for Me!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I am a longtime user of Keap (started when they were Infusionsoft):

1. The incredible amount of flexibility that Keap allows so I can customize for the different parts of my business:
- Individual Coaching
- Group Coaching
- Digital Products

2. Customer Experience and support:
- Customer Experience
- Tech Support
- Live demonstrations and sessions for small business!

I was wowed with how supportive and helpful the Keap Team has been! They are invested in your business success!

What do you dislike about Keap?
At first, I was overwhelmed by the choices I had in the system, but I built what I needed part by part and Keap's customer service and tech support is incredibly supportive and has been instrumental in my success! The Keap Team is incredible to work with! They truly want to see you succeed! Their weekly web training meetings are incredible and allow you to ask live questions and get on the spot help! It's amazing the level of support they provide!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have a complex business offering multiple products, some sold through channel partners! Keep has allowed me to customize my sales funnels, product delivery, customer support and channel partner interaction, all with one product! I wouldn't be as successful without Keap and their team! I can do all of this as a solopreneur and I am astonished by how much I can accomplish with Keap! As I scale my business I am extremely confident that Keap will allow me to realize my dreams!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love how easy it is to use the system. Training was a must, however, Matt was brillant, supportive, patient, and knowledgable. He made sure I had everything I needed to know and where to find it if I realized later I had a question.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The only thing I disklike is the limited options of payment processing integrations. I use Square and have for a long time, but Square doesn't have an integration for Keap. Instead, I had to open a new account with another company. Not a bad thing, but not the easiest.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Look for a company that not only satisfies your organizational needs, but also one that is present when you need them. I cannot tell you how important it is to have a company that answers your calls, responds to your emails, etc. Keap is a company that *listens!* They care about you, not just your money. Sincerity is a precious ethic.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Time! I am solving the problem of time! No longer do I need to retype email broadcasts every time I want to send a new one. No longer do I need to manually set up appointments for new contacts. All of this is done for me! Keap makes it so easy to quickly do everything I need to do. There are limitless possibilties with their automation system. When a potential client emails me via my website form, an email is automatically sent back to them that allows them to book an appointment with me then a second is sent (after booking said appointment) with information they need to know before going into said appointment. All of this happens without me ever needing to take the time to manually respond. It's such a life saver.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent Marketing Automation Platform (User for over 10 years)
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap makes it easy for me as the marketer for a small business to send broadcasts, automate campaigns, and tag contacts. I've been able to create and run any marketing campaign I can dream of with their tools and don't see that changing.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The most current downside I'm experiencing with Keap is their lack of PII compliance. If you run Facebook ads and use Keap forms, Facebook will mark your account in violation of their terms because Keap passes personal information in the url. Keap is aware of the issue, but it is a very low priority currently. It makes me nervous that my Facebook account could be jeopardized.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm solving mostly lead gen and customer follow-up and training with Keap.

all_reviews.review_title: An important tool for our business growth
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap enables you to create both complex and simple sales automation campaigns.  I use it for daily personal communications and much larger marketing campaigns.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The learning curve has been steep. The move to Keap helped simplify the interface and make it more intuitve. Keep in mind, advanced use requires advanced training and experience.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Adopting a new CRM is a major commitement in both training a discipline. I've worked with a numbr of platforms from basic $39 a month one pagers to mamoth ERP packages.  Your success is really a function of your personal discipline and commitment to learing the software you're using. Keap contains the elements you need. Oher software may do one thing or an other better or easier, but on balance I still continue to use Keap and recommend it to others ahead of other platforms.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
its primary use is email marketing/drip campaigns. It is stil one of the best tools for conditional triggers/fileters.  While it doen't do everything in house, integrations for specialized funtions are readily available.

all_reviews.review_title: Smart, functional and intuitive. Works as a sales manager!

What do you like best about Keap?
Campaigns are excellent, and the complexity of the whole app is mind-boggling. I really would have no problems with recommending Keap. I would recommend going to the Keap university if you get the chance. We have been using the system 8 years and still feel we are only scratching the surface of what it can do

What do you dislike about Keap?
Support rarely seems to know the answer to questions. Although they have improved the campaign launching, I still get extremely nervous when launching a campaign that the logic won't work but that is more a comment on me than the app! I also think there is more that could be done with the design ability of the campaign emails.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I would recommend going on the Keap university if you get the chance. Also immerse yourself in the help section and instructional videos

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer relations. We mail out monthly newsletter, manage client 'journeys' and interrogate our database based on unique tags. I also use the system to manage my day to day, with tasks and reminders created to prompt me when to make calls. My director can monitor this to evaluate performance,

all_reviews.review_title: Keap Is A Must Have For Freelancers
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is a tremendous value for the money and has an incredibly simple learning curve. As a former hubspot customer, once I tried Keap, I made the switch and never went back.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The only downside I can think of is that the mobile app and desktop app can sometimes take a little while to sync data from one to the other.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Do it. It's an absolutely amazing tool for businesses, especially small businesses or freelancers. Work with a partner if you need a springboard to get started.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing Automation, CRM, Marketing Campaigns, and data management. The campaign builder is one of the best on the market and very easy to use. Keap's text message marketing campaign software has changed the way I think about marketing and allowed me to gain a competitive edge.

all_reviews.review_title: Vast capability...and seems to be improving & growing all the time
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It allows me to do really basic things, but I can see how I can become more and more sophisticated in using it. I've a ton to learn and I can see that they are regularly doing upgrades and additional capability all the time. I also really love the customer support - have generally found it to be excellent. Even though it's not by phone, I really appreciate the online videos and screenshots they produce to facilitate the answer or solution.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is so much to learn and really not even knowing where to begin learning (as in which thing to learn) was a real blocker. I just couldn't work out where I should start. How do I know what I don't know? I would have loved some tutorials at the very beginning on 'email deliverability' and all the things that impact that (I didn't even know it was a thing when I signed up for Keap - I am a novice) because now I am having to go back and fix a lot of things I could have avoided.  I know that's a tall order because it's really teaching business practices which is probably not in Keap's role and responsibility!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Building up a relationship with my ideal customers and being able to communicate en masse. Making sales directly. Integrating different apps to automate things.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I started with Keap Pro and really loved the canvas and campaign builder. I wanted a robust system that would adapt to my changing needs. The online training really helpful, and the help desk was fantastic when I got hung up.  But when I started using a shared campaign that had been built using Infusionsoft, I realized the time and date functions wouldn't work in Keap Pro. I wanted the functionality of Schedule Once, so I upgraded to Infusionsoft Max Classic. I really like the ability to add features. It's working so smoothly now.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I asked the questions about the differences between Keap Pro and Max Classic, but I didn't really understand the explanation. If I'd known about the time/date problem for those using Schedule Once, I would have gone to Max Classic right away.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am looking to automate as much of my business as possible. Keap helps me do that. It stops emails when the desired goal has been reached. It sends out ongoing client feedback emails so that clients are always monitored without my direct attention at every stage.

I think the integration tools with my website could be much better. The plug-in on word press is outdated and one-dimensional and their is no automation trigger to send emails to people who didn't open them! There are also no lists but tags instead. My tags are now cluttered.
It's also very difficult to figure out how to automate a double opt in for anyone who comes into our database.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: We have shaved off hours of frustration and sending emails manually. With Keap and their training we now have full autonomy of our CRM and email marketing.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap has a great follow-up process where I received a call from an authorized representative that had interfaced with one of our clients who was having issues processing payment. The Keap representative called me with the customer information to let me know about the issue and I followed up with the customer and completed the payment transaction.  The Keap support team is great!

What do you dislike about Keap?
We use the affiliate center but we have noticed that it is somewhat limited. I hope there are plans to upgrade that portion of the Keap site as many companies are moving to affiliate marketing.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We utilize the automation sequences throughout our entire business and Keap allows us to build, optimize and scale our campaigns in every part of our online funnels. This has helped us to lower the manual tasks associated with our customer experience and support teams through the use of automated tasks.

What do you like best about Keap?
The drag and drop functionality of the campaign is nice. It's always you to reformat or move the flows around vs software like Drip that populates the placement on your behalf. This is a big complaint I had with Drip because it made the workflows so large and hard to navigate.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Takes a lot of clicks to update your emails and campaigns. Makes creating or updating campaigns more time-consuming. The filtering on the contacts could use some work as if you filter and need to update the search requirements you have to start back at zero vs just updating the previous filter.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Trying to have a source of truth for all emails going to our customers. This was an improvement and enabled more functionality than our previous platform.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
There's a lot of potential with its robust capabilities.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The original Infusionsoft was EASIER - until Keap came along and decided to complicate it. There is potential for this platform to do so much - but it's not easy for users - especially new ones, or non-techny ones - to navigate. The automation is confusing - you keep having to go in and out of windows to do the next step. Good luck trying to manually add an email list - you have first designate it - and THEN you can add it to an existing distribution list. UGH click me OUT of here!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
One of the departments uses Keap, to auto-schedule appointments for clients. However, you need a pro to build the templates - a novice can't create it - and therein lies the problem.
It's very good once the automation is created. That's pretty much the benefit.

all_reviews.review_title: Work in Progress Keap Wants To Help
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
As we have geared up, we find additional ways that Keap can help us. Recently we instituted the link between our email program and link. You put a new customer in, and next thing you know, all old emails are moved into Keap.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Trying to learn how things work. Sometimes the info is hard to find.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We cannot put information under the Company, only the contacts. We have many clients that have multiple employees with different responsibilities. VP Of Sales, President, Multiple Sales People, and they all have info that should be processed from the Company level.

DBA names are not handled properly.

It cannot show an individual in more than one record. If he owns two companies, there is no way to show this.

all_reviews.review_title: Love the power of this CRM - Saves me time while helping me grow my business!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love Keap's ability to automate repetitive parts of my business. My prospects and clients receive regular contact and nurturing. No one gets forgotten and I can delegate parts of the process to others for support!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap takes quite a bit of training to get your processes up and running. Having a point person who is fully trained and knowledgeable on the software made a huge difference for me.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Organization - All of my leads are captured and nurtured in one place
Lack of time - I'm able to delegate tasks like writing emails or entering contacts
Effiencies - Processes can be copied  and reused which saves my staff tremendous amounts of time
Best practices - Every Campaign gets better as we learn and refine our processes

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The personable customer service. During the tech age, automation is a wonderful addition making implementation of tasks easier and quicker. But if you need assistance getting started or resolving a problem, today you are often met with clueless bots, which do even understand your issue, much less provide a solution. The representatives in Keap are attentive, knowledgeable, effective and live. I actually enjoy talking to them, instead of being apprehensive about asking questions

What do you dislike about Keap?
It is still sometimes complicated and requires patience and a certain level of technical knowledge. But, as I mentioned, if you get stuck, there is someone to help, a big improvement over many CRM systems. Search systems can always be improved (e.g., sometimes what I am looking for does not exactly fit what the system searches for).

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
To develop easy, repeatable pipelines for sales of products and acquiring and storing leads.  It is helping me automate actions (e.g., thanking people for order, delivering receipt or certificates in exchange for emails, etc) that I use to do manually.

Keap looked good at first but then it showed its true color, gread for money only.

What do you dislike about Keap?
We agreed to try out Keap for $79 per month.  Then a few months into it we are being charged $280 per month.  We called Keap and they refused to give us our money back.  We called AMEX or American Express, which we have a platnuim card and AMEX still stuck us with the charge.  Totally uncool.  What's even more uncool is that Keap had a bunch of kids running around trying to set up calls and meetings to demo this product and not once did they follow through with anything.  It's a shame that I'm that upset after dealing with Keap that I had to voice my opinion.  All said, we lost out on a couple grand.  Shame on you Keap.  #keaplookingforabetterCRM

Unfortunatly, they are not solving anything.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
For a one-person operation or start-up, I love that Keap includes a business phone number so you can avoid making your personal cell number public and know if calls are personal or for business. The option to text clients is also amazing. This, along with the pipeline and automation features are well worth the investment.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It has a wide variety of additional features  (email marketing, invoicing, checkout forms, online bookings, etc.), but I've found that the features are very basic and not customizable.  There native integrations for many other more robust programs, but then the "all-in-one" software appeal is lost.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I think that Keap could be amazing at steamlining lead management for small businesses, but I eventually chose to go back to my previous system because I utilize customizable online proposals and contracts, which is a native feature there.

all_reviews.review_title: The Dashboard for Your Small Business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
What I've seen from Infusionsoft (now Keap) over the last decade is a strong focus on small businesses. They decided early to not expand into Enterprise which means that they can focus on real businesses that are beyond shopping for software likes it's a consumer item.

They do well for startups and micro-enterprises though they don't compete for the freemium models so prevalent today. That means that customer services, training, expansion and exponential growth for my businesses are their focus

What do you dislike about Keap?
A solid platform like Keep's is a powerful battleship. There where you want to be for safety but not as agile as a tugboat.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Invest in your business. Spend a little time learning this and the ROI will be tremendous

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
automating my businesses so I can enjoy my life

all_reviews.review_title: Perfect tool for the job at hand.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
For Marketing and Sales Automation there is no better tool available than Keap. The combination of features and usability is the best thing - you get a bunch of tools but you don't have to have a PHD in Software Engineering to work out how to use them.

Having been using Keap for close to 10 years now it has been great watching this platform evolve and develop, thay are regularly adding in new features and functions.

What do you dislike about Keap?
When you choose a tool make sure you are choosing the right tool for the job. Keap absolutely shines as a marketing and sales automation platform, and the CRM is more than enough for most medium sized business. If you were running an enterprise level company that really needed a CRM then maybe consider using another tool (and still use Keap for your marketing and sales automation)

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you are considering using Keap I would recommend you partner with someone to get you started. This will make sure you hit the ground running, from there you can teach yourself the platform quickly and build some amazing automated campaigns. Before you know it you'll be doing it all yourself (if you want to)

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's pretty simple, we have a machine that runs and turns leads into customers whilst we sleep. Setting up, and dialling in, automation gives you the freedom to work on your business whilst Keap works in your business.

all_reviews.review_title: BEST CRM I'VE EVER USED. WHY? IT HAS THE BEST USER EXPERIENCE!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Personally I really really like the UI/UX of the CRM. The simplicity behind the CRM is insane. I use this as an all in one and it's just so darn good as a CRM. I recommend for anyone and everyone UNLESS you're in an industry that has more specific CRMs like being an attorney, or a financial advisor, etc.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The email automations are a bit cancerous sometimes. There's this issue that when I finish creating a template and then I preview the email. when I receive the test email in my inbox I see a bunch of code where the display text is for the email before I even click the individual email and open it up. I spent so many hours fixing my email automation templates so the code doesn't show.

Keap/InfusionSoft team! Y'all need to do something about this!

Also, I literally went into live chat multiple times when I was encountering email automation issues at the time. I was #1 in the queue, and no one was there to answer me? What kind of customer support is that? I literally sat in the waiting line room for like 30-60 minutes and NOTHING. MULTIPLE TIMES!

Customer Service is a must guys.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Invoicing. Pipeline tracking really helps too. Appointments and the booking link is so darn convenient.

all_reviews.review_title: Great CRM with excellent automations and pipeline tracking
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is intuitive and easy to use, and I like the visual dashboard which helps keep me on point.  The automations and pipeline features will assist with consistent follow up and help generate the revenue that gets lost when the follow up process breaks down. The onboarding and customer support has been terrific so far!

What do you dislike about Keap?
The only cons so far are user-related, lol... I need to practice more to create the more advanced automations, as you obviously want to get those set up right the first time.  Otherwise it's been terrific.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a small organization we suffer from breakdowns in the follow up process when things get busy, so Keap's automations will help keep us on track. The pipeline feature is also excellent for providing a clear view of where customers are in the sales process.  I also appreciate the quick overview of customer information available by adding custom fields to the initial viewing screen.

all_reviews.review_title: Best CRM App I have worked with
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap has been very helpful to our company by automatizing processes like campaigns, emails, quotes and invoices.  In addition, We are able to easy follow the stage of our projects and keep on track of every step involved in our service.  This way we have been able to not only saving  valuable time for other activities while keeping our company on budget since we do not have to open any extra position to perform this kind of activities.
Another good feature about Keap is that we can easy schedule in person and online appointments with our clients by sending them the invitation for them to choose their most conveninet time. As a complement, we included a landing page in our website that redirect our clients to our schedule for they to easy book their appointment without even call or email us.  This booking process is set with reminders sent to the clients and to the company to ensure the effectiveness of every appointment.  Our clients love the convenince of this system.
Finally, I want to mention how important it is to get access to the tasks section that helps to completing  taks and following up with clients and suppliers always on time.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I dislike a few details in the invoice section.  It doesn't allow me to add a common payment method in Canada called e-Transfer.  This is a transfer due through the bank by sending or receiving the money using an email address registered in the bank with the account.  Also, I am not able to select the day when the payment was due.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap has solved the timing management problem that we had in the past and has improve the response time of our company.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The ability to import and tag contact makes it quick and straightforward to categorize and manage contacts when sending emails. You're also able to easily export contact tags into a CSV file, we use this to send our sales reps who are actively engaging with our digital communication. It's also very easy to scale images in emails to your liking, in other email platforms I've used, you've only been able to select "banner, fit, large, medium, small." It is also helpful that keap stores that images we've used previously in communication, for easy access later. When we created a new templated email, our header and brand images convenient to get a hold of.

What do you dislike about Keap?
When having multiple boxes on the same row, if one of your items is an image and another is a more extended text box, it leaves a lot of white space. This can be tricky to play with, and I wish you could wrap text around an image. We once sent an email that got through Keap's Spam checker, but it was received in our clients spam box. It usually is very thorough, so this is something that surprised us.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Great to use to manage contacts, you're able to include a lot of information for each, as well as custom fields specific to your industry. May experience problems if your company would like to send out more creative-looking broadcasts.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's easy to see our engaged customer and click rates as a whole, helping us better understand what makes our customers tick. With Keap, we've learned to link every image and place to add a link. We used to only add links to buttons, but over time Keap has shown us our engagement is higher when we add links to our images as well.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?

You're also able to easily export contact tags into a CSV file, we use this to send our sales reps who are actively engaging with our digital communication. It's also very easy to scale images in emails to your liking, in other email platforms I've used, you've only been able to select "banner, fit, large, medium, small." It is also helpful that keap stores that images we've used previously in communication, for easy access later. When we created a new templated email, our header and brand images convenient to get a hold of.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like the fact that Keap is available on all of my devices and I can very quickly access my calendar/availability realtime. Since using Keap, I have not missed meeting appointments and more prospects have reached out to me to schedule meetings.  It has completely eliminated phone calls and emails back and forth tryiong to schedule meetings! Great time saver!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Feature wise, I'd like more eblast capability. There are several steps involved and I'd like a simpler, drag and drop approach- I'm not strong in setting up sequences et cetera. I'd also like ALL of the emails on my server to be connected to specific Keap contacts. In the technical area, the only issue I have is the app doesn't format to landscape view on my tablet or cell phones - it's always in portrait view - not a major issue though!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Follow-up, follow-up, follow-up. When contacts call, text or pay invoices in Keap, my response and follow-up is excellent! Keap has streamlined my follow-up by keeping track of important conversations I have with prospects and clients. This has replaced the cost of having a virtual assistant keep track of all of my follow-up responsibilities.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I've used several email systems Mailchimp, ActiveCampaign, Klaviyo and Keap is hands down the worst of them all. Compared to these other systems, there's not really anything I like about it. I have heard that Infusionsoft itself is good, powerful software - but the cut down version they call "Keap" is a big miss

What do you dislike about Keap?
Let me be very clear about this. They say that there are no lock in contracts and it is month- to-month. But there is literally no "cancel" button in the dashboard. What they have is a "schedule a call to talk to us about cancelling" button. So I clicked this and then had to wait DAYS before somebody from Keap emailed me trying to convince me to stay with them. I told them that I didn't want a call but just wanted to cancel my contract before my next billing cycle (which was a week away). They told me that they couldn't cancel my next bill because I hadn't given them 10 days notice!!!

So BEWARE signing up to Keap, they make it REALLY hard to cancel and, if you are like me, you will get stuck with months of extra billing for a service you didn't want.

There is no excuse for a company to have this kind of unscrupulous cancellation policy these days. It reflects on the ethics and morals of the company. I do not support Keap in any way.

Not only is it the least intuitive, most clunky email system I've ever used (it just feels like a cut down version of their real product, Infusionsoft) but the company has no ethics.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Honestly, either go with their full product (Infusionsoft) if you really need it, or if you need a lite weight email system go with Mailchimp which is much better value.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I was trying to run an email marketing system for my destination wedding business. But Keap was WAY more expensive than Mailchimp for the same functionality. There were no benefits so I cancelled (which they made really hard)

What do you like best about Keap?
I have to say Keep Pro & Infusionsoft are truly essential when it comes to creating a scalable business. After signing up it has replaced nearly all of my software for invoicing, email funnels, sales crm, quoting etc. The amount of stuff you can automate is truly incredible when you properly learn how to use this powerhouse software. Works perfectly with Zapier too. I have set up an extremely complicated and advance sales funnel for my own agency and it works like a charm. One of my favourite funnels I made: once a contact accepts quote, invoice is automatically sent and once it is paid they're automatically sent 5 onboarding emails.

To be honest it is quite expensive for Infusionsoft, but when you look at the amount of time it saves it's actually a steal.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Just do it. But make sure you spend a lot of time learning how to properly use the full power.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Client onboarding is as simple as the client paying the first invoice. I have clear systems in place. I have an incredible marketing funnel for my agency behind the scenes.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap (Infusionsoft) has Always been there for ME
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
No matter when I call for help, I reach someone who is totally there for me. This time it was quite a puzzle about an affiliate and billing that I hadn't encountered in 10 years of being with Infusionsoft. He worked until we solved the puzzle and then asked if he could help with anything else. I really can't say enough about Infusionsoft's support. I just wish other services I use were as exceptional.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Hmmm, I can't think of anything I dislike except maybe some small things. My business runs so smoothly because I'm using Insusionsoft, and if there's a glitch, they help immediately. I know I'm supposed to give a dislike, but immediate help when you need it is vital. When I'm busy, I don't have to wait for an email response which always brings up another question. One on one help that's always there is important to me.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
The software is amazingly robust, and unless you love to delve in and learn how to use it, I'd delegate it to someone. I didn't have that luxury, and I have to say it's gratifying to jump in and just do the things you need to do with the software. There is a learning curve, but for me, it was well worth it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft pulls so many different aspects of business into one system. The biggest benefits are how easy using Infusionsoft has made running my business so I can focus on other things. The automation and the campaigns I can build are a lifesaver that works behind the scenes to keep my customers engaged.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: Hmmm, I can't think of anything I dislike except maybe some small things. My business runs so smoothly because I'm using Insusionsoft, and if there's a glitch, they help immediately. I know I'm supposed to give a dislike, but immediate help when you need it is vital. When I'm busy, I don't have to wait for an email response which always brings up another question. One on one help that's always there is important to me.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Keap:
review_question_answers.answer: The software is amazingly robust, and unless you love to delve in and learn how to use it, I'd delegate it to someone. I didn't have that luxury, and I have to say it's gratifying to jump in and just do the things you need to do with the software. There is a learning curve, but for me, it was well worth it.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Infusionsoft pulls so many different aspects of business into one system. The biggest benefits are how easy using Infusionsoft has made running my business so I can focus on other things. The automation and the campaigns I can build are a lifesaver that works behind the scenes to keep my customers engaged.

all_reviews.review_title: Very useful for my small business. I would recommend to whoever is on the fence!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like that it's all automated, and once it's set up, I don't need to do anything! It works really well to do my follow ups with leads and bring in more leads. It seems seamless, and my patients seem to love it. Especially our follow-up campaign. We have had very positive feedback.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There's a learning curve to it. I'm glad to have coaching! It can get a little complicated when you first start, but it gets better as you use it. I would recommend using some type of training on it (I have used Paul Gough's training, but Keap has training available also). There's a lot of work before being able to start, but once everything is set up, it's great!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I feel that anyone who is on the fence should try it out. I highly recommend using the training provided. But any small/med size business should have this program. It's the best out there! Try it out, you won't regret it!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's bringing in more leads in the clinic. I feel we are getting a better patient experience out of it. I am also using it for staff training. I have a campaign where new staff goes through different videos when the first start. It has been helpful.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It allows me to compile my emails off my website and off my Shopify POS.  Since 70% of my business is off my POS this is critical.  I feel that the email broadcast platform is easy to manage.  The importance of this has been magnified during Covid when I have relied on my customer database to stay in business!

What do you dislike about Keap?
My only dislike through the 8 years I have used it,is that when I add emails and contacts that I have gathered legitimately that I have them hold emails and slow them down to look for issues.  I understand it is a compliance issue.  It is the only issue I can think of in my 8+ years.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Great Customer Service/Knowledge Reps

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Contacting my customers following purchases and throughout the process of using my product is critical.  Set it up one time on Keap and it works 24/7.  With Covid my business model began to change immediately and the email database of customers really paid dividends.  The ability to reach them effectively and quickly has kept us in business.  WE changed up our factory to build Face Masks instead of our regular magnetic pockets and our business surged due to being able to reach our customers.

all_reviews.review_title: Does more, for much less, and is infinitely customizable
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
This platform allows a beginner to start building simple yet meaningful campaigns within minutes. As their skillset improves over time they are rewarded with real scalability that allows for super complex multi-faceted and automated marketing campaigns.  Everything works together like you would expect it to. Unlike solutions provided by Salesforce that buys up companies to expand the toolset but poorly integrates them. Infusionsoft aka Keap doesn't cost thousands just to set up basic functionality.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Reporting features are geared toward less ambitious marketers. You have to spend some time export data from multiple reports in xls format to get everything you need in one place.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Verify that its reporting capabilities meet your organization's requirements. This is not something they will change for you after implementation. I am Hubspot certified and spent years with Salesforce. This is by far the solution that makes the most sense across a broad. number of indurties

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead capture, management, nurturing, reporting, and forecasting. I was able to improve lead quality with better forms and conversion through the automation of many sales touches. Expensive leads never fall through the cracks.

all_reviews.review_title: My Partner, Infusionsoft, Makes Me More Than I Am On My Own
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft multiplies my efforts by whatever number I may have. Instead of needing another hundred hands, Infusionsoft lets me use one set of hands to tend to everyone simultaneously. We are the One and the Many. I am one person, one company, with a data base of many. I am one Infusionsoft partner in a crowd of many. The only way to be able to make an impact on the many is to have a group impact. With Infusionsoft, I have that...and more. And with their tech support, even if my learning curve is a bit broader than I wanted, their staff is there to reach down and pull me up to the levels I strive for.

What do you dislike about Keap?
As a graphic designer, I feel hampered by the new Broadcast feature. I like nestling images into copy. Now I must put images atop or beneath copy. This distances my point from its illustration. As a teacher, I bow my neck at this restriction.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
You never regret going with the best...ever. I will tell you that this software is complicated and difficult to master, but so is riding a fine horse or baking a souffle. The tech support they offer makes ALL THE DIFFERENCE between too hard and I can do this.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
With all the workshops and programs that I offer, it is hard to keep the information coming in a steady stream to my data base. I have used the power of Infusionsoft to take this OFF my list of concerns. Thank you very much.

all_reviews.review_title: Best CRM and Marketing System Ever!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the overall ease of use of the whole platform. I enjoy the tagging functionality as well as the ability to create custom fields. Also every time I call every employee is very helpful. I have worked with many different CRM in my working years and I have found Keap to be the most robust and well rounded of all of them.

What do you dislike about Keap?
the emails that go out sometimes end up in junk mail and I wish you could move some of the custom fields to the main screen instead of having to tab over. More custom fields would be awesome if there was a way to do that even if it were an add on option. I also wish there were some additional trainings on some of the campaigns that are created by other people. Often it is just a template and then I have to figure out how to best use it.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you are looking to find a CRM that can handle not only your contact management needs but also your marketing needs then Keap is the best platform I have found. I have had experience with many other platforms and this is by far the best. I don't say this lightly. In a world where we are all striving to have the best tools at our fingertips. Not only does Keap make it easy for you to customize and make changes but the speed at which they do business and help you implement changes is far worth it and I would encourage anyone considering something different than what they are using to at least try Keap out. You won't be disappointed.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I do all of my monthly marketing through Keap and I have realized it helps me stay better organized. Tagging helps me to parcel out the different types of customers I work with as well. We are about to add some users and it will be nice to have better organization and communication between all of our team members moving forward as well.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: I love the overall ease of use of the whole platform. I enjoy the tagging functionality as well as the ability to create custom fields. Also every time I call every employee is very helpful. I have worked with many different CRM in my working years and I have found Keap to be the most robust and well rounded of all of them.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: the emails that go out sometimes end up in junk mail and I wish you could move some of the custom fields to the main screen instead of having to tab over. More custom fields would be awesome if there was a way to do that even if it were an add on option. I also wish there were some additional trainings on some of the campaigns that are created by other people. Often it is just a template and then I have to figure out how to best use it.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Keap:
review_question_answers.answer: If you are looking to find a CRM that can handle not only your contact management needs but also your marketing needs then Keap is the best platform I have found. I have had experience with many other platforms and this is by far the best. I don't say this lightly. In a world where we are all striving to have the best tools at our fingertips. Not only does Keap make it easy for you to customize and make changes but the speed at which they do business and help you implement changes is far worth it and I would encourage anyone considering something different than what they are using to at least try Keap out. You won't be disappointed.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: I do all of my monthly marketing through Keap and I have realized it helps me stay better organized. Tagging helps me to parcel out the different types of customers I work with as well. We are about to add some users and it will be nice to have better organization and communication between all of our team members moving forward as well.

all_reviews.review_title: Awesome streamlined system for any sales pipeline!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
1. Automation! This has saved my team countless hours of typing the same responses or copying and pasting templates.

2. Easy to pull data: this has been HUGE assistance for our organization because any data we did have on lead capture, conversion rates, etc.. were all manually tracked. Lots of room for error in that. Infusionsoft helps ensure fewer mistakes are made and numbers are more accurate.

3. Easy for an entire team to share work: I like that I can keep track of what my sales team is doing pretty easily, and they are also able to see the work that each team member is doing. If anyone needs to pick up with a lead, it is easy to do because everything is noted, tagged, and is marked accordingly with who completed those items.

What do you dislike about Keap?
1. It takes a long time to get the hang of how everything works. I am a nerd when it comes to learning new software, so it was an enjoyable process for me. However, it definitely took more time to learn the ins and outs of Infusionsoft than any other software I have used before. I am pretty sure there are things I still do not know or utilize to their fullest potential. I also recognize this dislike is not something that could easily be fixed because of all the great features Infusionsoft offers.

2. I wish we had the capability to message multiple people within an opportunity in the sales pipeline. The way our pipeline works, we have multiple people who need to be contacted within each stage. While we have managed a way to make this work for us, it would be easier if it was part of the natural functionality of Infusionsoft.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
1. Data tracking and compiling
2. Better sales pipeline monitoring: it is fantastic to be able to gain a quick snapshot of where our leads are in our pipeline instead of reading through gobs of notes/emails to figure it out!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the ecosystem.  There are really helpful people in the facebook group as well as other groups, and tons of integrations from the partner ecosystem.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I wish Infusionsoft was a bit better with B2B.  Everything is so contact-centric that it's a bit difficult to keep track of all interactions with a company, as opposed to a person.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I gave a high rating on ease of use because once you know how to use it, it is INCREDIBLE how easy it is to set up customized, complex processes.  However, if you've never seen Infusionsoft before, YOU NEED HELP OR TRAINING.  This is a robust piece of software.  You can't just pick it up and figure it out.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Holy crap.  This is a huge list.  Infusionsoft does SO much, and if there's a particular feature you need that Infusionsoft doesn't have, you can find an integration for it.  We're using Infusionsoft with AppointmentCore, Graphly, and LeadPages (although the new landing page builder might replace LeadPages).  So... lead gen, autoresponder, nurture, sales pipeline management, sales rep management, dashboards, lead source ROI tracking, customer communication... our business revolves around Infusionsoft.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The automation process of email marketing is super easy using Infusionsoft. The many different ways you can "tag" contacts helps track ROI on different campaigns and ensures only certain communications get sent to the contacts within that specific campaign. It's easy to build landing pages, pull reports, and track your metrics.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft doesn't give you the options to include an "update your preferences" link in the email marketing portion. They only offer an "unsubscribe" link, which unsubscribed the contact from all communications, rather than allowing them to choose which type of communications they want to stop.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are solving the problem of not previously tracking our ROI on organic campaigns from email marketing. We have realized that quite a bit of our business comes from our email list, and tagging contacts is helping us keep track of those!

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful but could be more intuitive
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I really like the landing page builder.  It is one of the easier features to use.   The automation shows a lot of promise and proves to be powerful once you learn how to use it.

I also love the chat support option!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Features (especially within marketing automation)  are hard to understand and often difficult to locate.  I am not sure that the site mapping really makes sense.  If I need to use a feature that I don't use often, I find myself searching around to locate it.  Very frustrating!

I also find the support documentation and videos to be lackluster.

The last thing I will mention (because it related to the above comment), the Keap/Infusionsoft bit is very confusing and frustrating.  I don't understand (I'm not a developer), why there can't just be one with the legacy files seamlessly integrated with the newer features all in one place.  I even had a support chat experience where the support person wasn't clear on the version I was using.  He was showing me a  process in a page that didn't look anything like mine.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Keap is a powerful tool, but you get what you give.  Expect to spend a lot of time trying to learn the many features.  Don't be afraid to ask Chat Support for help...they are great!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Problems usually related to marketing automation and some of the CRM capabilities.  Also, some WP website integrations are not great.

When I get good coaching on how to use the marketing automation features, they are powerful and effective!

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
I really like the landing page builder.  It is one of the easier features to use.   The automation shows a lot of promise and proves to be powerful once you learn how to use it.

I also love the chat support option!

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
Features (especially within marketing automation)  are hard to understand and often difficult to locate.  I am not sure that the site mapping really makes sense.  If I need to use a feature that I don't use often, I find myself searching around to locate it.  Very frustrating!

I also find the support documentation and videos to be lackluster.

The last thing I will mention (because it related to the above comment), the Keap/Infusionsoft bit is very confusing and frustrating.  I don't understand (I'm not a developer), why there can't just be one with the legacy files seamlessly integrated with the newer features all in one place.  I even had a support chat experience where the support person wasn't clear on the version I was using.  He was showing me a  process in a page that didn't look anything like mine.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Keap:
review_question_answers.answer: Keap is a powerful tool, but you get what you give.  Expect to spend a lot of time trying to learn the many features.  Don't be afraid to ask Chat Support for help...they are great!

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
Problems usually related to marketing automation and some of the CRM capabilities.  Also, some WP website integrations are not great.

When I get good coaching on how to use the marketing automation features, they are powerful and effective!

What do you dislike about Keap?
What I don't like about KEAP is how the dashboard defaults aren't the best for tracking your day. They're not bad, but they're also not the best. You have to customize them.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
KEAP seems pricey, but it does a lot of things at once. Primarily, it can help with marketing, sales follow up, online store functionality, and B2B sales. Pick 2 of these, use KEAP for them, and you're getting your money's worth. If you use it for more, you get even more value.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are using KEAP to track bulk orders, track our Sales tasks, and be our shopping cart for bulk purchases from our online store. The automation is very helpful for this.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is POWERFUL and FEATURE rich. Great for small companies just starting out and companies with more complex needs! Keap really helps me powerful segment specific customers so I can address their needs and be sure to serve them ONE to MANY.  It's easy to just do email marketing, but the power of marketing automation and segmentation is that you can use tags, triggers, campaigns to serve people precisely the content (or solutions) that they want. It should also be noted that Keap is NOT just a TECHNOLOGY company but has a genuine focus on serving small businesses and making them a powerful success!

What do you dislike about Keap?
The early versions had been a big challenging to learn AND sometimes the best things in life take a big of time to get used to, like a car or bike! then you love it!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
To be able to SEGEMENT my fan base! As a very small business owner, I can only do so much. And the power of automation is that I can do MORE with LESS in LESS time!

all_reviews.review_title: An easy to use, all in one solution
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The user interface is much easier and more intuitive than most of the competition. Keap has all the features I need, helps keep track of everything going on in the business and has tremendously valuable automation features. It goes beyond being a CRM and genuinely saves you time while also increasing your conversions.

What do you dislike about Keap?
They don't have a built in dialer, which would be nice. I would also love if said dialer would record the calls to easily playback at any time.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Buy the annual plan to save money

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap helps organize everything in the business. It is a full blown CRM which helps you maintain and service client relationships, set reminders for yourself, segment your client types and send differentiated mass emails to each type, you can text message within the platform, and most importantly you can set up amazing landing pages and lots of automation quite easily and intuitively. Great support team too.
