all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
As a small business owner and massage therapist Keap has truly helped me manage my business and alleviate a lot of tasks from my agenda. With their top-notch training to teach you how to use the software, you can go as deep as you wish with the vastness of their CRM and marketing automation.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Truly my only dislike currently is that I have to add attachments to emails one-by-one as opposed to a collective group all at one time. It's so minor, I can hardly label it as a dislike but this review is requiring me to leave something as feedback! I've contacted Keap and they've been excellent at responding to feedback.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Try it. Then buy it! Hands down the greatest business investment for a tool like this since opening my business 20-years ago. It's been significant in sustaining and growing my business.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use their software primarily for:
- CRM - appointment booking, email, treatment notes, birthday notifications, contact info
- Automation - a sequence of automated emails revolving around my newsletters, book marketing, new patients, new leads.
- Reports - I can ascertain data tracking for leads, patients and market specifically to those populations.

all_reviews.review_title: As entrepreneur and marketing consultant I have experienced how well the platform KEAP works.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
There are many things I like, but what I love working with is the campaign canvas and email sequences.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I experience trouble to use tags when working with outside third party elements.  As such having an online course with an other payment system as added to KEAP. I have an Holvi Bank online store and find it difficult to intergrate this with KEAP. Also working with API's is a maze too me still.
Plus finding use to work with the Pipeline module,  that is an unusual workflow and have not grasped its functionality.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Keap Pro by Infusionsoft is an key aspect in your business as a CRM and marketing tool. It is clearly an very powerful tool that deserves your attention. Even though it already has been made more compact then Infusionsoft. But still it needs learning curve time. So sole entrepreneurs will see this as a GoTo tool for their business , it does take time to fully be implemented in your business and needs. Positive side for me
..its an joy to work in and with ;-)
Last thing to add for European customers. KEAP team is working harf to also set all features in use for European markets. Unfortunately not all is applicable (as the so for example the text message function)

But never the less I highly recommend you to give KEAP CRM marketing software a honest try and I am confident that you are going to love the KEAP benefits.

Kind regards,
Bastiaan Anthonie Baaij
ceo : Bastiaan Baaij Well-Being
www.bastiaanbaaijwell-being.com
Finland

Creating email templates,  landingpages + webforms...love these snippets.

all_reviews.review_title: If you like eliminating repetitive tasks, Infusionsoft (we use the older product) is very useful!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Easy to learn. Good phone support. Lots of extendability through third-party applications due to the fact it has been around a long time. Third party applications are well-supported.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I do wish that custom fields weren't used in place of software objects. Having objects (and therefore, an unlimited number of objects per account as opposed to 150 custom fields) would have been useful for us. Not a deal breaker, though, as we were able to find workarounds.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It's good for maintaining an automated sales pipeline, and it scales perfectly from what I have experienced. If you have the ability to learn half-decently and don't want to pay for expensive custom development, then Infusionsoft is a good product...assuming you don't have some really odd needs.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We send all of our automated emails through Infusionsoft. A lot of complex logic for management of accounts gets solved by Infusionsoft. Our workflow is conducted through Infusionsoft (tasks are automatedly administered through the system, and an employee's work day is dictated by tasks). Our information is in one place that is easy to access as long as you have an internet connection, which makes remote working for our team a possibility (and is used).

all_reviews.review_title: Keap is a FANTASTIC CRM+ that grows with you
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It grows with you. You start with basic CRM functions in Grow, then move to more advanced business functions with PRO and finally to a complete campaign manager for emails, snail mail, and with integrations SMS. The help desk via chat is incredible. The few times they could not solve my issue or point me to another integration for a solution they were able to get the developers to work on a solution. It also integrates with all my existing apps like WordPress, Elementor, Memberium, etc.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Many functions require the purchase of an app to complete the function. The most dislike is that there are some functions (calendar, phone, SMS) that are available at the PRO level that are NOT available in Infusionsoft (the gold standard) so when you upgrade you lose some functionality (but they are working on that). The only hard part, is that Keap has no rules, no bounds. You can do nearly anything you want. And this freedom can be confusing in the beginning. The training however is getting better, with suggested best practices.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Start with Infusionsoft Boot Camp, built into the program. This is a great overview.

Then go take the Box Out Marketing training for Infusionsoft. In particular, the Way will help you get started in a method that reduces the potential for confusion!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have automated almost everything. It even tracks my notes when I call a client (that I enter after the call) . The automation saves me a lot of time. Rule of thumb: If you do something more than 3 times a month ... automate it. Just starting? Start with 3 times a day. Then 3 times a week. Then 3 times a month.

all_reviews.review_title: A great solution for small business to align marketing and sales
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap is a no-code CRM tool that allows small businesses to align marketing & sales activities. It offers widely used features and functionality supported by higher end marketing automation tools.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap lacks interoperability with widely used no-code Content Management Systems for small businesses that need to publish marketing content on their company website or blog. It also lacks integration and support to optimize published landing pages for search (SEO).

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I recommend you have experience setting up email marketing campaigns requiring multiple follow ups. You also need a way to quickly increase number of prospects into the CRM.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap helps small businesses increase and track prospects through its CRM functionality. It helps us perform lead acquisition and retention for prospecting.

all_reviews.review_title: Love Keap - all my stuff in one place!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love how it is integrated and how all the modules work together.  I had been looking at purchasing & trying to manage the same data on several different non-integrated websites or websites to accomplish what I can on Keap!

What do you dislike about Keap?
I ran into a problem trying to load triggers into a campaign (landing page) when dealing with scheduling photo sessions.  I wanted to offer times for several mini-sessions (15 minutes) each day for two days in a row.  The location was different on the second day and it just wouldn't work.  Very disappointed.  There is a help desk record of this conversation - if you could look into it, that would be great!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem I am solving with Keap is that I had been keeping all my details (clients to call, appointments, emails that need sent, etc.) in my HEAD for so long and my business was getting busy enough that this method was NOT working at all.

Now, when I meet someone new at a networking event, I know they'll get warm & welcoming emails from me automatically.

Now I have a business phone number (although the caller ID doesn't work) and that's huge - I love that my text messages & emails are kept in the CRM for quick review before I chat with someone.

Now I can keep in front of my contacts with a nurture campaign while I am off on a photographic adventure or just relaxing with my family (which didn't happen before).

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Campaign builder is the top of my list. It is so much easier to automate marketing with a visual builder.

What do you dislike about Keap?
InfusionSoft's is clearly targeting smaller businesses that don't push their system to the limits. Once we grew our list above 500,000 things started to get wonky and above 1 million it was unacceptable.  There are underlying intermittent code issues that are hit more often when you stress the system with more data and more traffic. For example, it wasn't even possible to delete a large batch of contacts without crashing our member websites because of hitting api limits. The built-in delete process uses up api calls and our member websites also rely heavily on api calls.  Even more problematic was the fact that the campaigns became less and less reliable as the intermittent issues with goals not firing became more frequent. And then there's the InfusionSoft email gestapo. InfusionSoft is NOT on your side when it comes to email deliverability. You can have an absolutely stellar overall spam rate-which is the only thing InfusionSoft data will show you-and still get an automated nastygram threatening to shut down your email sending if you don't fill out a form. And the team that could look deeper and provide more information won't answer the phone, come to the phone or communicate at all without a ton of effort trying to break through the walls to reach them. All that said, I still think InfusionSoft is the best game in town for small businesses just breaking into online marketing. I actually do recommend it in this case. No CRM is going to be perfect. You'll always be required to work around limitations.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Watch the tutorial videos before you decide to buy.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We automated our marketing including segmenting, multiple entry points, multiple exit criteria, etc. We also built a lot of our program delivery using Campaign Builder. All of our emailing and commerce were done with InfusionSoft also. We are in the process of transitioning out of InfusionSoft into a much more complex enterprise level stack of products. If InfusionSoft was stable and reliable under the stress of our volume we wouldn't be moving. But it is way more expensive in our new world. InfusionSoft is a great product for the price if you are in the right size range.

all_reviews.review_title: Incredible value and still a lot of potential
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
First of all, gorgeous interface design.
The support is really helpful and also the sales team found a solution catered to my needs.
I like the fact that I have a single interface with:
1) email marketing
2) contact management and appointments - really useful and simple to use contact management.
3) pipeline - like the one in Pipedrive. You can also automate certain tasks once a contact gets into a stage.
4) payments - really useful to set up recurring payments too.
5) seriously advanced automations - Keap just introduced easy automations but learning how to do an advanced campaign pays off in the long run.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I don't like that you can't modify nor translate the text in appointments, invoices and the automatic confirmation emails in general. I would seriously need this feature as I work in a non-English speaking country.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Just be aware of the translation/language issue if you are working in a different country as this lacking feature may redefine your expectations.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm solving the fragmentation of having different tools for different purposes. Previously I had to connect them manually.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It is so flexible that you can very easily customize it to fit your needs. The Campaign Builder is a very in-depth tool that allows you to segment leads and customize nearly every part of the customer experience with the timing of emails, reach-outs, hard copy mailings, and much more. You can also use the custom widget tool to create lists for lead segmentation and track those lists in real-time. We use this for our sales pipeline and to keep the total client experience documented.

What do you dislike about Keap?
A bit of a learning curve, it takes a bit to figure out how to do everything. If you want to use InfusionSoft to it's fullest, you need to have some training or read up on all of its features. Additionally, there are sometimes glitches or tags that won't tag, etc. However, the staff has always been very responsive to any issues in the past.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I recommend that you use a training service to get started. I know BoxOut offers something called the Academy that I've heard very good things about. Also, there are many InfusionSoft certified partners that are also very helpful for setting up campaigns such as SixthDivision. You can get IS to do exactly what you need it to do but it will take time!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We track our entire sales pipeline in InfusionSoft. Our new clients are entered as contacts using a webform and we use the Campaign Builder along with tags to move them through the pipeline. We also segment the leads using tags and have slow-drip campaigns set up for repeat engagement. We also have other software integrated, such as Formstack, Docusign, and others.

The ability to create complicated campaigns and triggers. Also we love the ability to use our own API's within the software its self

What do you dislike about Keap?
The only thing we found as a disadvantage to using Keap is the fact that once you use the platform you are tied or married to it. Trying to switch to another platform is very difficult.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you need an enterprise solution and don't want to hand-code various features such as a drip system or a campaign manager then Keap is for you.

With Keap we were able to solve issues of tying various software together. We were able to make a seamless integration instead of piecing many software platforms together to achieve a common result.

all_reviews.review_title: Best CRM and Marketing Platform I have ever used, I recommend it to everyone!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Campaign Manager, hands down. In today's world, instant contact is very important with Campaign Manager, we are able to set up so many different streams to make sure the client is getting the most accurate information that is related to them. With the implementation of tags, possibilities are endless. The drag and drop makes not only being able to visualize the contact stream effectively, but it is amazing when you are able to show bosses, or clients a visual of what the marketing process will look like. They then understand exactly what you are doing and how you plan to implement that process.

The new business line has made a big difference in my communication as well, it is always nice when you are able to separate your personal life from your business and know when a client is calling vs something personal.

We also find that the API functionality is quite strong. If there is something that we need to accomplish and can't seem to do that within the program, there always seems to be a way to make it work with the API.

Keap has been very strong at getting back to me with questions or concerns, and have always gone the extra mile when I need something from them. I am happy to work with Keap, and I am looking forward to doing that more and more with every company I work with.

Keap has become my first priority every time I start a new position. It is a staple in my toolbox, that I will always have because with it, I keep breaking sales records.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I find that the contact search in Keap is a little buggy, it seems like I have been losing contact information for people I deal with a lot. Nothing has been too extreme, but it is a little annoying. Also, implementation of emails, a lot of companies are just using basic IMAP servers, there is no real way to implement communications with these kinds of emails. With the new messaging inside Keap, it would be very nice if we were able to send I text through the Campaign, instead of having to use a third party like success engine. Then if people respond, it's all in Keap, and we wouldn't have to go to another app.

The email builder is quite effective, but it would be nice to have a little more control over the design, for example in MailChimp you are able to insert a background image and put elements over that image, like a title or buttons, you are able to to create more of responsive design this way. Currently, we photoshop the image to have a button, which is fine, but not amazing when shrunk down on a phone. It would also be nice to have control over things like border-radius, and padding of elements.

Finally, I wish you were able to customize the Keap dashboard like you can in InfusionsSoft. It would be better to have the information you need at your fingertips when it is needed.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make the move, don't wait. If you are worried about the setup, their team will guide you all the way.  I have switched to Infusionsoft 4 times now, and never once have a lost and data. If you want more sales, you need to use Keap

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Every time I start working with a company, they have no way of instantly getting information to the client. As soon as we implement, and there is an instant response to the customer, I always see between a 20-30% increase in Revenue. Keap has allowed me to grow company sales and therefore gain a lot of respect within the companies I work. We are also solving tracking. Before Keap, many companies have no way of really understanding how their marketing efforts are working, keap and infusionsoft have allowed me to tag clients based on where they come from. By going this I can see really accurate numbers on how well our marketing efforts are working. 9 time out of 10, Keap more than pays for itself, because it helps me expose areas of advertising that we are spending unnecessary dollars and eliminate them from our marketing budget.

Further, Keaps webforms make implementing contacts directly to the CRM a breeze. Many problems that companies face is that employees do not add contact information quickly or effectively. But with keap, we are able to make sure that those clients are directly imported into the CRM with no delay.

all_reviews.review_title: The complete package to run your business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap truly is a centralized location for just about everything you need to run your business. I liked having my contacts, my invoices, my quotes, my marketing automation, and even a phone number all in one place! I never had to leave the web version or the app on my iPhone to get things done. And then when they released the phone portion of Keap, it literally is the BEST way to put everything into one place.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I'm a freelancer, and with the pandemic and business slowing down, the price of $100 was too much for me each month. Unfortunately, I had to find something cheaper. I wish that Keap was just even $25 cheaper. I would have been able to Keap (pun intended) it then, however, the price was pretty non-negotiable. I also didn't like the fact that they have a huge signup fee, which they say is used to pay the coach that you get when you sign on. These coaching sessions were a little long and honestly could have been done via youtube videos. Then I wouldn't have to pay the sign-on fee, but I understand these people have to make money too. And the last thing I didn't care for was the year-long commitment that you had to sign. I think contracts in this type of industry are archaic and unnecessary, especially when you are dealing with a product that helps small businesses like myself.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Defintely think about the pros and cons of using Keap, because you will be locked into a year long contract that you have to pay $300 to get out of. Overall, I think its an outstanding product that completely solves the problem of being able to run your business from one central location/app. There has only been one other program out there that I have found, and trust me, I have SCOURED the internet and used hundreds of programs, looking for one that does what Keap does, and the only other one is twice as expensive.

I recommend Keap 100% as long as you are committed to using it for a year or more.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I was able to get rid of having to use 10 different apps or web apps to run my business. Keap definitely gets the concept of making ONE place where you can run your business from. I loved that! This way I could keep track of the entire sales process in one place instead of having to write my proposals in one program, then send my invoices in quickbooks, and then do my marketing automation in a third program. Zapier can help link some of these programs and software together, but not as seamlessly as having it all in one central location.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft allows for massive automation muscle. Our company is able to streamline its processes with leads, sales and customers with this automation. Infusionsoft also integrates well with a number of programs, including our website, ecommerce, and membership area so our workflow is easy and accurate.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is a pretty steep learning curve when first using Infusionsoft. It can be pricey to get the set up and coaching required to have the Infusionsoft app working with the campaigns, integrations, etc. needed for a busy business. Also, it takes quite a bit of time to train new people on the app.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I would recommend working with a professional to help set up the app to best suit the organization. Taking part in training is well worth the investment for the utility, effectiveness and ease of use.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to streamline our administrative bits and pieces using the all-powerful internal forms. These internal forms are a life-saver for efficiency. Infusionsoft also allows us to have our remote team connected well. We benefit from this efficiency as well as through codifying and streamlining our processes for leads, purchases, upsells, etc. It is convenient to have all of this in one place, whereas before Infusionsoft we had to use a number of programs to do the same thing.

all_reviews.review_title: It's not just the application it's the support behind it.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The application's campaign builder is a solopreneur's dream because it has automation built directly into it.  However, I believe an application is only as good as the support it has behind it.  The reps, coaches, and other support team members are the best because they care about the small guys and know what we face on a daily basis.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Wish I had unlimited coaching hours.  Also, the templates in the campaign builder could be better... considering how many users actually use it I'm sure there are some really good workflows already built and can be tweaked for the individual business purpose.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automating my lead generation and follow up activities as well as general organization from an administrative perspective

all_reviews.review_title: Custom marketing automation for any business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like how you can customize landing pages without having to have knowledge of coding. It's been an essential tool in marketing to our prospect database, but also our existing customers to keep them up to date with new system enhancements, new product offerings/ integrations etc.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There have been some issues with being able to pull task note reports. You can't search for contacts without tasks, so I had to pull a report of all contacts with tasks, then create a tag to apply to those that don't have tasks. We've also had some issues with deliverability of emails, but working on cleaning up our database for those that truly aren't interested. It's ideal to start with the most up to date data and not import a bunch of outdated contacts

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have benefited from being able to send quick emails through email broadcasts very easily in real time, or scheduled out for a later date.

all_reviews.review_title: It's a valuable marketing service we use often
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
That fact that it can register email addresses and other contact information automatically at anytime. We can sort our contacts into different groups and tag people for certain email campaigns. The programming system for the campaigns is very visual and easy to use after some extensive experience.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Making the campaigns run in a custom way can be difficult. Even when we contact Keap's support team, we can't always create the types of flows and actions that we want easily. It takes a good amount of technical knowledge to know how to set up campaigns in an intricate way.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Do lots of research, because there are many similar software with vastly different price points and features.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We can acquire more sales leads and other interested parties for a wide variety of products, events, services and basically anything we're trying to push. It cuts out a huge amount of time from interacting with people individually. We can also create emails that are engaging.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap (Infusionsoft) is a robust platform but may pose a challenge to some users
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like that Keap has a lot of functionality that is useful for both marketing processes and internal processes.  I have used Keap for a number of my clients in multiple industries.  Realtors have a special affinity for Keap because of the ability to consistently engage with their leads and their prospects before, during, and after the sales process.

I have also had much success with Infusionsoft as a tool to facilitate membership sites and learning platforms such as Memberium and LearnDash.  Infusionsoft provides the functionality that we need to manage users and course progressions.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I believe the Landing Page builder could use some improvement.  I also think the e-commerce platform is very lacking in design functionality.  Without the addition of a third party like Spiffy the Infusionsoft Order forms are ugly and do not have high converting elements such as effective upsells.

There are also glitches in the system that happen at random times.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I think it would be wise to find a trusted provider before implementing Infusionsoft.  GetUWired is a great agency that has extensive experience in implementing Infusionsoft/Keap.  A trusted implementation provider can provide you with the setup and training that you need to be successful.  There are often times when people purchase Infusionsoft and do not use it to its full potential.  Having a trusted partner guide you through the process will make implementation more successful and adoption throughout your company more successful.

Training is also important so that everyone working within your Infusionsoft application knows what tags do what, how the campaigns work and how contacts flow through the system.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft provides us with the tools we need to facilitate our Learning systems.  There are some really cool engagement items that we can use to keep people involved in courses.

I have also used Infusionsoft for marketing campaigns.  The marketing automation features allow me to put a lot of communication on autopilot allowing more focus on other areas of the business.

There are also glitches in the system that happen at random times.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It's a full optional instrument to make marketing in the best possible way, very flexible to follow all specific strategy on Landing pages, nurturing, referrals catching, up sell and cross sell funnels and so on. What I like is the easy way to get integration with other software used in the business, for example to manage admin issues or some specific marketing issues. With notes, tasks and opportunities you easely check what your sales agents are doing, what customers are willing or complaining, at which step is the single deal with a specific customer. You have immediately the situation under control and you can immediately made decision on how do manage the single matter. You avoid delay on replies to customers it's very very easy to start new funnels on a specific customers target, once a new offer is ready.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It's not a question of disliking something, but, for sure, due its complexity and due to all its features, Infusionsoft is not an easy software to be learnt: you need a coach to make you start with it first, and to help you on improving your knowledge and to implement all your marketing strategy needs. Once you have understood how to do,it's like shooting fish in a barrel! :)
And I really appreciate the live chat with the technical assistance because they are able to solve any problem just in a few minutes!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Just remember it's strongly suggested to start with a personal coach to learn how to use it in the right way. It's really better doing this, because you will make it easy. But if you don't want to follow my suggestion or you don't like it, it's ok: you have a lot of videos that can explain you how to use it. Just have the patience to watch them and learn how to do.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Infusionsoft now we are able to follow all our customers needs without forgetting any activity or job related. It's very useful to have all Company Departments connected and focused on customers. With the marketing automation system, we are finally able to have recursive business and to push customers to buy what we desire, depending from our commercial goals and budgets. Using tags it's very helpful to personalize customers history and preferences, or to start a new sales funnel. if you need to create a Landing Page, it will be ready in a few minutes, just using and adjusting one of the many templates you have at your own disposal. And everything you do is always connected to CRM database... what else?

all_reviews.review_title: Too Complicated - Hidden $$$ you'll spend thousands more...
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I thought it was going to manage all of my CRM, Email Marketing and Reporting...but in order to interface with the Infusionsoft/Keap platform I needed to continually hire experts who tried charging me $3,500 per month on top of what I was paying Keap.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Way too complicated. When you sign up, included in your set up is the cost for an expert -- who you think is working for Keap...but they're an independent contractor who is being paid a cut rate to get you up and running.  After your set up, they will charge you THOUSANDS to fix and adjust your account.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Don't use this...it's very complicated and gets expensive unless you're a "certified partner". The email system is clunky and the CRM is outdated.
In addition to needed several plug ins, you will need to create zaps to get all of this stuff to work, which made our site very complicated and cause functionality conflicts.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
ZERO - they actually made it worse... for example- my email deliverability was not good - in fact there were a few months where the links in my emails that had the Keap training code (which was all of them) were seen as MALWARE by google chrome. Keap took NO accountability, even though they sent me a support message detailing the issue.

Instead I had to hire ANOTHER "certified expert". Even in my review here titled "They Hung Up On Me"

https://www.softwareadvice.com/crm/infusionsoft-crm-profile/reviews/ They suggest hiring a certified expert. Your  account manager is a sales manager -- and the support they offer is a little more than helping you reset your password.

all_reviews.review_title: infusionsoft / Keap used in successful marketing business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The automation capability using Campaigns, and ease of use for basic functions, as well as the customizable Dashboard.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The reporting could be a little more intuitive. I would also like to see more customization available in reporting.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are segregating our customers by interest and purchases, and automating workflow sequences for processes. The ability to schedule Tasks at appropriate times, based on actions or activities, helps us manage a large number of clients with our fairly small staff.
By reviewing the process and systems we have in place, we can easily find bottlenecks in our operations and address them. Automation / Campaigns is a great tool to help us avoid overwhelm, and also ensure we don't let important details fall through the cracks.

all_reviews.review_title: Very complicated and terrible customer service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Nothing! I had a terrible experience. The software was very complicated.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Their sales approach was extremely misleading and built the impression that the software was simple to learn and use. They did not disclose the amount of time required to learn the software system and their coaching is very inadequate. Be prepared to do your own research / youtube-university on how to build the system you need for your business. In my business, there simply was not enough time to learn the system in order to put it into practice.

0/10 for customer service. In June I called to cancel my subscription, the customer service representative confirmed over the phone that the subscription has been cancelled but since my account was pre-paid that it would continue until the pre-paid time expired. Well, the account was not cancelled and they are refusing to refund the 2 months subscribed that I had asked to be cancelled. Also, be prepared to be sent a bajillion emails and if you don't read all of them you may miss the one that states that the account is set to "auto renew."

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're going to use Keap, be prepared to hire or set aside sufficient time to learn and build your system

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
No problems were solved. Keap only added problems.

all_reviews.review_title: Good value for money but sometimes complicated to use
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The dashboard is great as you can add your own saved searches and reports. I also like the fact we can add customised fields and tags. We use the landing pages a lot and the sequences which are quite sophisticated. The email campaigns are reasonably priced too. The software is quite easy to use for the sales side. The sequences and landing pages are more complex to use. There are many integration features too.

What do you dislike about Keap?
We have set up customised fields with lists of values, but we cannot correct any values in the list or re-order them. It doesn't feel like there are relational tables driving this data behind the scenes. We also can't group things in reports so we end up setting up lots of different reports to get a different mix of information. For example we'd like group totals and subgroup totals on the value of opportunities. Doesn't handle UK VAT very well so we leave it off quotes which isn't ideal.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We can keep track of sales opportunities very easily and each sales person knows who they should be phoning. We make full use of the automated sequences to trigger a sequence of emails when a lead starts a product trial. This saves the sales person having to remember to send timely emails, they can concentrate on making the sales call at the right time.
On the marketing side we also use scheduled email sequences to send email broadcasts to our database which we can segment with tags.

International date formatting is not consistent across the module and credit management is more difficult (and time consuming) than it needs to be.  Awesome that they have recently integrated with Stripe and wouldn't it be even more awesome if they one day made it multi-currency?

Keap makes low touch email marketing campaigns look personal and local to each country we market into.  It allows us to maintain personal contact with tens of thousands of prospects and hundreds of customers at any one time, all from the comfort of our own home.

The ability to create campaign and to easily setup funnels for many applications.

For example you can setup your warning and pulling stock from your website if you are running low. I have to create a all sales report and make fake sales to be able to pull a column into the report just to see where my stock is. For an online solution this is pretty archaic and some basic specific reports that will help you see what you have based off all your products would be pretty straight forward.

We originally used Keap (Infusionsoft) to manage participant registration and preparation for our healing retreats.  We like that the software gives us the ability to intuitively design and modify workflows. Because of our success in this project, we're moving to Keap for all of our CRM needs (volunteer management and donor/sales cycle management as well).

What do you dislike about Keap?
We really don't have any complaints.  Anything outside of the software's scope, we have been able to address with integrations of other software.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use the software for intake (registration and preparation monitoring) for participants who come to our healing retreats.  The workflow has been designed to monitor participants from contact, through various steps of preparation and information, to attendance.  Because of our success in this project, we're moving to Keap for all of our CRM needs (volunteer management and donor/sales cycle management as well).

all_reviews.review_title: To win, you must effectively DRIVE performance of your leadsources, processes, people, and offers.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The customizability and flexibility are most powerful. It's an advantage to be able to try new leadsources or hire new reps and to immediately KNOW their performance levels.

Whether it's tinkering with the conversion process to improve conversions, developing staff to improve conversions, and/or determining best allocation of marketing dollars... Power resides in real-time, objective performance data of leadsources and reps across all funnels and business.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Downsides for me, someone who builds a lot, are the load times within campaign builder and dashboards. It's tolerable. :)

Also, have had many issues with native leadsource field being overwritten within campaign builder even though it was set to not overwrite. Not a big deal unless you're running 3,000 leads per month... then it can be quite a headache. Support fixed but then it started to not put anything into the field if it was empty... been a pita.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Keep it simple as possible in the beginning. Be open to paying for help when ready to experience real power out of Infusionsoft.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Knowing what is actually causing leads to convert has been invaluable and makes running a business fun again. :)  Also, knowing why leads are not converting is a major competitive advantage.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft is a full CRM management tool that allows to only create, organize, and configure your contact list but also market to them as well. It's email marketing functionality really allows you to target your customer anywhere throughout the product life cycle. It's email marketing campaigns allow for complex logic and supports drip and nurture campaigns. Infusionsoft also makes it easy to set up conversion funnels and integrates with various other third-party tools.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I like the legacy interface vs the new upgraded interface a lot more. It was a lot more intuitive and functional.  Infusion soft has a vast array of functionality however the UI does not do a good job of making it easy for the user to use all that functionality. Also, their forms stylization leaves a lot to be desired as well as the email builder which is extremely limited.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
The Legacy dashboard is still more user friendly than the dashboard redesign.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problem we solve with Infuisonsoft is CRM management and email marketing. It has worked well for us as far as IRL/Virtual event email management. We integrate it with various other event registration platforms which helps us automate email marketing campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: A Super Comprehensive Email & Marketing Solution!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the flexibility to create campaigns and with the tools, goals, custom landing pages, tags, reporting, etc in the builder; you can really make a campaign function exactly how you want it to work! Even if there's no specific tool to achieve an outcome there are always work arounds and you can chat with support ALWAYS to get help! Additionally, having an account rep to help you with your email deliverability is awesome. They provide a ton of insight and suggestions on how to get emails into your target markets inbox. There are so many functions and features and you have to master a few at a time but im always learning about new pieces that i can use to enhance my deliverability and reach!

What do you dislike about Keap?
The one thing that comes to mind is that i miss the email image editor. I do have Photoshop to adjust images but I did like that I could make small quick changes right in Keap/IS. Regarding email I also wish the drag and drop wasn't so boxy and a little more cusotmizable. I dont know HTML really so drag and drop is my goto. Also - the dup checker. My team sends me multiple lead lists from different lead sources and at times contacts may have slightly different info but maybe the same email or the same phone. Some how we still dont catch dups and people get irritated when they get 2 SMS or 3 of the same emails. I know it cant be perfect BUT if there was just a phone number check field... I think that would be helpful for us anyhow.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Super flexible and comprehensive solution that allows you to mold your marketing campaigns into exactly what you need for your individual business and market. It stores data, allows you to lead track, pull all kinds of reporting, automate email campaigns and so much more. If you've never tried Keap - try it now! It'll save you money, time, and streamline your efforts to grow your business!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Consistent communication with our database. Because we use IS/Keap we've noticed more return client business, ppl are keeping out brand on their minds because they're seeing us more often in their email inbox. We were using a vendor before for email blasts here and there and it was costly, so our bottom line is better too with Keap!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Ability to tailor to my systems / processes to optimise automatable tasks

What do you dislike about Keap?
Can't integrate with Xero for invoicing.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Administration / back office activities diminishing daily - the best is scheduling meetings: I simply send a link for either 15min enquiry, 30 min exploratory or 1hr coaching session to my clients to arrange (no more to-fro ping-pong of emails) - saves me so much time. And having tasks in Keap means working from one central to-do list aligned with my appointments.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Definintely the automation that can be set up - You can have delay timers, automated notes and emails, create opportunities in certain stages of the process/pipeline, and much more! We have been able to build the system from a basic template to be able to best suit our business. It is easy to add more people to the team and give them the accesses required. There is still a lot for us to wrap our head around - we have been using Infusionsoft by Keap since 2017 and still do not feel we are using it to the fullest potential.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Just the look of it I guess - could be more visually appealing. Also, sometimes if there is a LOT of automation trying to process at once, it can slow down the entire CRM. Sometimes when creating a landing page or building a marketing email, the flexibility you have with certain fields or images is limited. Would be good to be able to move things around more freely.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Give it a go! When you first start setting up the automation it may look intimidating, but once you wrap your head around it, you will love it!! It will be worth the work you put in.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automation - this erases some of the human error that could occur. Privacy - able to limit content that is seen across the users - i.e they can only see their own clients, or they can work together on one client using access privileges. We use this most when two users in different teams are working on a mutual client.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the phone app, I love the calendar integration, and most of all I love the email automation. It's taking my business to the next level. I like that the plans are designed for small business owners and it allowed me to get my foot in the door with automation without having to pony up for Infusionsoft.  I like that my clients can put themselves on my calendar -- it saves me a lot of back-and-forth communicating with them. What is amazing about the phone line is that it syncs with the email contacts, so if someone has emailed me prior to phoning me, I can know exactly who they are.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is a learning curve, for sure. It takes some time to set up. I have tried to get friends to sign up for it and they were daunted by the learning curve, and the price. And the time investment required to make it work right. Also it can be very slow to load which is a bit of a pain when doing things that require clicking around.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
if you decide to put in the time to set it up and learn how to use it, it will easily make itself worth it to you.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I love the way that keap allows me to stay in touch with my clients and stay top of mind. I love it that I can remind myself to follow up with people and offer more personal service.

all_reviews.review_title: Online marketing automation with amazing features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
We can automate a wide range of useful online marketing features that let our flow of marketing contacts and content happen smoothly and on a frequent basis. I we can set many key variables in regards to email send times and add keywords to contacts that can trigger custom actions within the Infusionsoft account for account updates and email-sending activities.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft has performed great and doesn't have many weaknesses as far as capabilities go, but the pricing is a little steep compared to many automated marketing software for small businesses.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The automation features and easy-of-use offered by Infusionsoft has made it a remarkable marketing platform that helps us to reach out to lots of leads and achieve conversions without having to initiate direct contact with any of them. Of course, we can follow up with calls and emails, but much of the time, we can complete sales or gather lead data without additional communications.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The marketing automation is the best feature in my opinion.  A CRM is a CRM in some ways, but the marketing automation is what operates best compared to others in the market.

I also really like the ease of use.  The campaign builder in particular is highly intuitive.  Even as someone who had little to no experience setting up complex funnels, I was able to figure it out, because you simply drag and drop different goals and sequences and then fill in the blanks.

I also love that's it's more of a one-stop-shop than other CRMs.  I'm using it to help trigger internal training sequences when someone new joins the team and also to track sales commissions and referral partner payouts.

Lastly, I appreciate the abilities they offer to create shopping carts and to easily integrate with my website to allow for ease of checkout for customers and they even have their own merchant services platform that is helpful in making it easy to collect payments.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Mostly just little features here and there.  I need more control over permission settings over custom fields (for instance) or, especially on the campaign builder,

I don't like how I can't create automations around opportunities or move opportunity stages.  I can only create opportunities but I can't do anything else.  Little stuff like that that just would make it more robust.  I think is somewhat of a major issue and it's forced me to come up with creative solutions.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Get it if you're looking for the best software for marketing automation.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing Funnels
Sales Team Tracking
Lead Nurture
Internal Training
Payroll Tracking

all_reviews.review_title: This has been a powerful and responsive automated marketing system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
There are many automations in Infusionsoft that we can add to our email campaigns that are useful for staying in contact with our email subscribers. I like that Infusionsoft goes beyond just standard email marketing and distribution and provides us with a wealth of analytical tools and campaign programming options. There are many nice email designs we can choose from that can appear in standard computer and mobile email clients.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I feel that the pricing is a little on the steep end, but Infusionsoft can definitely have a good return on investment if used properly. However, getting it to work effectively can take many months of trial and error and follow-up configurations to fine tune.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I think it's important to dig into all of the capabilities as much as possible when you first start using Infusionsoft. Initially, we mainly stuck to simple email distributions that were straightforward and distributed once every few days or so, but we were able to make the emails more effective by adding tags to contacts based on their actions.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to get new signups to our email newsletters that we can use to promote events, services and anything else we need to announce. We can establish direct contact with our subscribers rather than going through a broader system like social media or paid news distribution services. We can save on the cost of publishing press releases with expensive media services.

all_reviews.review_title: Keap has outstanding marketing campaigns we can launch quickly
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
There are many templates that we can use to get new email marketing campaign started quickly in Keap. There is also lots of flexibility when it comes to adding new actions or editing actions in our existing campaigns. We can add updated data at many different points along our campaign workflows. Each contact's profile contains loads of information fields that we can use to analyze each user's background and set them up for email campaigns that best fit them.

What do you dislike about Keap?
For more advanced campaigns, it can be complicated the set things up smoothly in Keap. The customer support has been fantastic when it comes to general issues, but when we work with many different actions and looping campaigns, the customer support often seems to be somewhat inexperienced when it comes to helping us through those complex type of campaigns.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Keap can work extremely well for pain-free automated marketing, especially if you are limited in staff that can create and maintain marketing campaigns that are run each day or weekly. I would recommend not sending out emails at off hours or during the weekends. I would use the setting that allows you to send out emails the next business day.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have launched many successful automated email marketing campaigns with the Keap platform. We are able to view instant data on the interactions that our contacts have with our emails and website. The data allows us to reconfigure our email campaigns to for work better each time we send them out. There are many extensions for our Keap account in the Keap extensions marketplace, so we're not limited to the features that are available in the standard Keap plan.

all_reviews.review_title: Still new to the CRM world but it's incredible learning everything Keap can do
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like having one place that organizes so many contacts.Once you get into a groove of how to organize your pipeline, you can move through follow ups pretty fast.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I do wish there was more flexibility in certain areas. I would rather have a check box section to count my "touches" instead of rating how "hot" they are. Many sales happen between the 5th and 17th touch so I would like to track that more easily.

I also wish clients could be added and then able to see instantly. Everytime I add a new contact I have to wait 10-15 minutes to add anything to their notes/opportunities.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Set aside the proper amount of time to learn how to use it. The learning curve is steep but if you can take the time to watch the videos it makes life a lot easier.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Creating notes for all my conversations helps me a lot when it comes to making the customers feel taken care of. I also like that it will connect with a phone system to keep things in one place.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It is an extremely robust tool. I love that it can be used to handle tons of information for contacts with great segmentation tools that can be used for marketing campaigns and email broadcasts. The campaign builder is easy to use and provides quick reporting. It is very versatile for all of our clients' needs. The landing page builder is solid and easy to use. You can use it for automations with contact management, for email campaigns, and more. The email builder is also extremely simple and emails always look good and are mobile-responsive.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I'm not a big fan of the web forms that you can use. I wish there was more customization available for JavaScript forms so I wouldn't have to manually add HTML code every time I need to update a form. Also, the lead source tracking is not great. The tracking code doesn't pick up lead sources very well from internet sources. The UI is a little old-school, but not too bad. The level 1 support team is also very subpar. We know more about the product than they do, so conversations with them are typically frustrating.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft is a great tool to use as an agency and recommend to clients. It has basically all the tools you need to do marketing and manage their contact database.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Solving customer relationship management, email marketing, website forms, lead source tracking, generating leads, and even an eCommerce store.

We have been able to create automated marketing campaigns that generate leads for clients while we're able to work on other things. It makes email building so simple and worry-free.

all_reviews.review_title: Marketing Manager Using This As An Email Service
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The tag groups are actually really helpful since we using this mainly as an e-mail service and keep it separate from our CRM.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The data clean up seems to take a while. When i'm importing and cleaning large lists it seems to be a pretty slow process which leads to some bottlenecks in my workday. I wish this process was quicker, so i could spend less time looking at the pending screen while my data is being scrubbed. Also, the campaign and e-mail builder is a bit frustrating and I find it hard to produce clean and professional looking e-mail campaigns.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're looking for a decent e-mail service with CRM capabilities, this is a great platform to do so.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's a great way to keep track of e-mail contacts and create tag groups. I like importing and tagging certain contacts as it gives me a way to segment our audience and send specific emails to specific groups.

all_reviews.review_title: You Get What You Pay For: A Low-Rent CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The canvas feature of the campaign setting. Automated emails are pretty easy to set, and setup of the platform is easy.

What do you dislike about Keap?
You have to batch download contacts from the CRM, which takes hours. Their customer service is non-existent and hard to reach. You cannot easily download your CRM contacts, so be prepared to spend > 1 hour on exporting. Their API system is awful. And they hold your data hostage when you consider switching CRMS.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Do not sign with Keap, you get what you pay for. They keep you from being able to easily access and maintain your data, which is a huge red flag.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
CRM & marketing automation for our small business

all_reviews.review_title: Keap - Not Ready for Prime Time
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Being able to see Task status on the home screen was quite nice.

What do you dislike about Keap?
We identified five debilitating bugs in the first two weeks of use that rendered the program 90% unusable. The integration with QuickBooks did not work. Everyone had to have Admin privileges to be able to design landing pages and email templates. The touted Outlook integration turned out to be only one-way. All clients duplicated multiple times. When you delete the duplicates they immediately return.
Campaign Builder is broken. 404 errors when accessing Keap created landing pages.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
A very innovative product that once mature will garner much attention. We plan on circling back in six months to a year to see if the majority of the bugs have been squashed with all intentions of jumping back on board.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were hoping to use the innovative quote and invoicing features that were supposed to be integrated with QuickBooks however client names did not match up automatically between the two requiring you to manually match payments.

all_reviews.review_title: A immensely complete email marketing and sales nurturing application
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I mainly like all of the automation that we can set for the email workflow. We don't have to sit in front of a computer and craft emails and then send them out to a list through regular email accounts. Infusionsoft does a good job of getting our emails through so that they are actually read by the recipients. With today's spam email environment, it's very important to distribute emails in a way that follows an accepted procedure and can actually get through spam filters. I also like the email templates, which are formatted for most mobile devices.

What do you dislike about Keap?
We have created many campaigns in the old legacy system, and getting them to work on the new platform is tricky. Sometimes we will have to create certain designs from scratch in order to maintain the same designs that we had in the legacy system. I wish that Infusionsoft would convert more of the older designs by default so that we can continue to use them in the updated system.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It seems like Infusionsoft is one of the more expensive email marketing solutions, but I think it can be very effective and pay for itself at some point. I would try to make the most of the initial training session in order to maximize the value of your account.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft has given us an outlet for acquiring new contacts and leads through opt-in forms. We can customize our opt-in forms and place them in our website to match the design of existing branding materials. To edit and add forms to our website is really easy and that is something we really needed since we don't have a lot of time to dedicate to technical issues. Our contact list from Infusionsoft is very valuable. We use it for many different marketing campaigns in and out of Infusionsoft.

all_reviews.review_title: An excellent tool to automate sales processes
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
One of the features I like best about Keap is its receptive email generator, as it has a wide range of prefabricated templates that I can configure very easily and I can also create my own custom templates to add to the library. Another aspect I like is the way it allows me to segment contacts and automate processes based on information obtained from tags, APIs and custom fields.

What do you dislike about Keap?
What I don't like about Keap is that due to the latest changes they've been making to the platform there are a number of modern marketing functions that it can't handle natively, so we need to implement other tools to cover these deficiencies and manage the data more effectively.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Keap is a great tool that will help you in the growth process of your business.  It is a software that has many functionalities to automate most of the processes, although it requires spending some time to learn to master its operation, it is worth the results you can get

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
For our team Keap is the perfect automation + CRM software, as it has a variety of features that make it one of the best in the market. One of the functions that we use the most is the creator of campaigns which offers us different ways to achieve any result we want to achieve in a campaign in addition to the amount of configurations it has is amazing. On the other hand the support of Keap is solid and generally satisfactory, plus that the community of users who use the software has been a key resource, when we wanted to learn to manage certain features

all_reviews.review_title: It's a powerful system, although not for everyone.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The advanced workflows. I like the "new" email broadcast drag and drop templates. The legacy ones were clunky and a pain in the butt.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I dislike how complicated the automations can be compared to other systems. It takes a lot longer to learn to use the system. I've been using it for many years and I'm still learning new things. The landing pages are buggy. I avoid using them, preferring to create the pages on WordPress. The promo codes could have a cleaner set up. The sales totals in the sales reports (and the widget) include failed payments and returns, which gives an inaccurate total. It would be nice to have more options to be able to subtract these from the totals.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're not competent with technology and you don't have the time to delve into the commitment of learning how to use Infusionsoft (it's called "Confusionsoft" for a reason), you will need a good Infusionsoft support person or team.

The system isn't for everyone. I've recommended some not use it and recommended others to stay with it, depending on their business. It's expensive. If you're making less than $100,000 per year, you may want to consider something else, with the goal of growing into it. I'm not a certified Infusionsoft consultant/partner, so I get nothing out of pushing the system on people who it's not right for. I've seen it pushed on people who were not ready for it and some who would never be ready for it. They struggled with the cost and not getting an ROI, with not understanding how to use it (or not being able to afford help to use it), they didn't use all of the features they had and maybe didn't need them to begin with - and maybe stopped using it altogether while still paying for it, and after all that money spent on it (possibly keeping it for several years), they cancel it and start over with something else.

However if you have a large or quickly growing business with steady or quickly growing profits, it may be an important system to get in place to continue to support your business needs.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It is ideal for larger businesses and entrepreneurs who need a more powerful system to run their business. We use it for email marketing, selling products and programs, affiliates/referral partners, etc.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
What I like about this tool is that as we complete the processes of the campaigns, Infusionsoft establishes labels that allow us to track progress and notify us so that we can be aware of the next steps to follow, so that we always have control of our campaigns, this is something that gives us peace of mind.

What do you dislike about Keap?
My only complaint of uphold is that it can be so complex because of the amount of functions it has, it can be overwhelming to learn to use it completely. On the other hand, I believe that the native mobile application is very limited in its functionality, for the rest I do not have any other negative observation about this software.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
This is an ideal tool for digital marketing professionals. It is one of the best that exists in the market, since it has better implemented functions than others of its competitors in the market. Once you start using it, you will not want to change it for other software.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft is a good product, it has helped us keep in touch with our customers, as well as track the campaigns we do on Facebook and other processes related to our marketing work. We have even been able to integrate it with a programming system, so that when a prospect makes any action that we want in any of our landing pages,it is confirmed by email and its records are automatically updated in the CRM.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Keap's data analysis is top notch. Assuming you set up your campaigns and tags properly, understanding where your contacts come from, receive from you, and end up is easy! Keap also has a great dashboard feature that allows you to navigate your main tasks or priority easily.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Keap is not the most intuitive CRM system out there and lacks in user experience. Building out email campaigns can be a pain, having to zoom out so you can see the full screen or use specific commands to scroll around. Keap is very literal, which is necessary for proper function, however it leads to many frustrating moments of figuring out where you went wrong. However, once you have your campaigns and system built out, Keap provides valuable insight.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're interested in starting up a Keap account, remember that the learn curve is steep but once you understand Keap, there are no boundaries to where you can take this CRM. Also, it's probably wise to ask for help at first -- the customer service team is very good but finding a local expert to go over it in person is probably ideal.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keap solves automation problems that other softwares were not capable of solving. Keap gives extensive breakdowns of data and is completely customizable depending on what you need data on.

all_reviews.review_title: Keeps us plugged into contact activities and lets us reach out to them effortlessly
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft has many custom options to help make marketing campaigns work better for our particular services and promotions. There is a good amount of user data we can see streamed on our dashboard at all times. Many of the data streams link directly to contact data to help us quickly view background information and recent activities of any particular contact. The campaign programming interface is very visual, which I like, and doesn't require much technical expertise in order to set up and maintain smoothly.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Getting the campaigns set up and tested to work properly can take a significant amount of time to plan and execute. Infusionsoft tends to update their system with new features and push some older features into a legacy section that doesn't always work well with newly-programmed campaigns. It would be great if some if the legacy features could be moved to current systems without having to create them all over from scratch.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
The high price point might be a big barrier to entry for some users, but the value Infusionsoft can afford to your business could be substantial enough to justify the cost.

all_reviews.review_title: A very solid automated marketing platform that helps to nurture leads
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the ton of possibilities Infusionsoft offers, as well as its functionality. The interface is just simple and easy to use. It's easy to adjust Infusionsoft to our individual needs in business - the customization for emails and analytics is just breathtaking compared to other solutions I've experimented with. I was able to create a lot of action calls in Infusionsoft thanks to the lead database management. I also learned a lot about process flows and how it's related to making your business go forward.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The Infusionsoft platform does not store documents by itself. It does not have live chat tools, and it does not allow to scan business cards, or identification cards for staff. Nor is it integrated into social networking platforms. In terms of databases, Infusionsoft does not work well with them, it is about databases of properties. Neither does it allow to manage SEO.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft is a software focused on offering a very pleasant user experience. It is excellent for search marketing and email. In addition, your inventory manager is very broad. Its use is highly recommended to perform customer service analysis, and to manage web forms. It also works pretty well to create emails that are triggered by events.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The nurturing processes of potential clients are very easy to customize for us in Infusionsoft. Infusionsoft handles sales funnels, quotes, offers, evaluations of potential customers, marketing campaigns, and much more. It can be said that it is a very complete client management and marketing platform. It is also excellent for working with large databases.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It's one CRM that packs a lot of features. From one portal, you can manage your entire database and create complex sequences. I love being able to pull a client's phone number by typing the first few letters of their name and having their number visible on the right-hand corner of the result preview.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The user interface could be better. I wish it were a little more intuitive. A good improvement would also be more robust user sorting features. The tagging feature can sometimes be glitchy which can complicate things for our clients, causing them to miss out on items we promised.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make sure you get proper training before managing completely on your own. I'm pretty tech-savvy and I have to reach out to our support team often.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Infusionsoft for email blasts and tracking. It's been useful in helping us track a client's relationship with us, past purchases, and communications received. Thinkific and Thrivecart integration is also very useful for eCommerce.

all_reviews.review_title: A fairly powerful marketing platform with smooth automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The email campaigns are a fantastic feature of Infusionsoft and probably the most valuable thing for us in the platform. We can create emails and send them out, then choose to add them to our marketing campaigns to be sent out automatically. The way that the emails are sent out are very customizable. They have a drag-and-drop grid that we can add certain actions to. For example, we can set a clock to wait 3 days after someone signs up before sending them an email about a promotion or anything else. That's really fantastic! We can set many campaigns to match the needs of many types of contacts.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Though I like the graphical tools that Infusionsoft by Keap provide in the email marketing section, I would like it better if there were more text-based programming systems that would help to give us a more precise view of all the actions taking place and the algorithmic information involved. The graphical tools in the current email programming grid are difficult to work with on certain screens and virtually impossible in mobile.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If your budget allows for it, I think Infusionsoft by Keap is a great way to go since they have a helpful support team that can walk you through the times when you might run into problems. You should definitely have someone on board in your team that has a reasonable amount of technical expertise to deal with the day-to-day issues.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I used to have to compile email addresses for many different sources through manual means of either having them enter their information in a web form, writing their information out on a paper form, or getting their contact information through a call. Infusionsoft allows us to generate web signup codes that can add contacts to specific marketing list, which tremendously helps to streamline the email distribution process. We can get more meaningful emails sent out to people and also receive metrics on the interactions that are contacts have with the emails.
