all_reviews.review_title: Not what it used to be....
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like the ability to automate my leads path depending on what actions they take or don't take.

What do you dislike about Keap?
That for the past 3.5 or so years they have implemented no significant updates to its native Infusionsoft platform but instead choose to put most of its efforts into a brand new platform that is like the little sister of Infusionsoft.  This made no sense to me and left me with dated/buggy software that now I have to justify to my clients why I recommended it in the first place. There are no (or very little) reporting features that actually are helpful. Considering it's now 2019 and mobile phone data is not even being used in Infusionsoft for texting OR for comparing if a contact is unique or not baffles me.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Be sure to review all your requirements in detail and see it working before committing to Infusionsoft. If you're looking at using any appointments or calendar features, Infusionsoft has very little to no solutions. For example if you want to have appointments in Infusionsoft for clients and want to see those in your calendar...be prepared to have zero mobile functionality. Infusionsoft is not mobile so be prepared to be zooming in / out and swipping to see a lot of your data. And reporting is a nightmare!!!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We do have automation running but there are significant pieces that either don't work or don't exist in a sales pipeline.

The automated email campaigns in Infusionsoft are the feature that we utilize the most. The data we get regarding user activity is also very helpful for us to gauge the success of our email campaigns and sequences. The programming feature is very visual and doesn't require coding or other technical processes that are highly prone to error. We can basically drag action points into sequences and connect arrows in an intuitive way. Whenever issues arise, which they often did in the beginning, the customer service was patient and informative enough to either fix the issues, or give us alternative implementation suggestions.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft has a training process that goes over very basic account procedures that I would consider mostly unnecessary to go over. There are many online website resources and videos that can help us through most of what they go over. I would rather Infusionsoft look more directly at our marketing and client service needs in order to help create actual campaigns with us in a more thorough way.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
The cost is on the higher end when it comes to CRM software with these kinds of features, but I do think it can be extremely effective and lead to increased business when used with care and attention.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft gives us tools to place forms within our websites and links on social media that allow leads to sign up for our newsletters and other services. It's a great tool to get people to sign up for consultations and other meetings that may lead to conversions. The account portal has many different sections that give us access to much data involving campaign feedback, client details and tagging data. We have been able to stay connected more to our existing contact base and have a door that is always open to new leads.

all_reviews.review_title: An effective online marketing platform with fantastic automated tools
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like that Infusionsoft helps to automate some of our primary marketing processes. We can quickly create professional quality signup forms to add to our websites or landing pages. The forms can be used for a wide range of enrollment purposes, such as newsletters, events or appointments. We can add tags (like new lead, client, attended event, etc.) to contacts that help us to organize and manage our contact lists and newsletters. We can customize emails based on tags to help ensure emails are relevant to the recipients.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The price for Infusionsoft is quite high compared to other similar services. Though I think Infusionsoft has more capabilities in terms of customizations and automations, the main features of the software, in terms of how our contacts are acquired and emails are sent out, are very similar to lower cost services. If you want to get the most out of Infusionsoft, you'll likely need to work with an Infusionsoft specialist that has a good understanding of CRM and programming.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Though Infusionsoft has a somewhat high entry price, I think there can be a ton of value for those that really dive in and create intricate a well-planned campaigns. If you're not working with anyone that has a solid CRM software background, you'll probably need to spend a significant amount of time learning about the Infusionsoft system and testing campaigns.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft has been an extremely helpful platform for automating many of online marketing activities. It also allows us to create meaningful content that can be segmented across a different contact groups. We have generally been able to have higher conversions on most of our marketing campaigns through Infusionsoft. We can create marketing content that is high quality, easy to create and responsive to contact information and interactions.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft has made our lives MUCH easier.  I am a salesman who makes a living primarily by selling "internet leads."  Infusionsoft allowed us to set up a program that automatically generates constant contact with our prospective clients.  I am far from an expert on anything relating to computers, but I can easily specify the messages that I want to be sent and I am even able to personalize the messages to provide the specific information that I want to be included in every communication.  The introduction of automatic texting and emailing has increased my set appointments by at least 15% through our first couple of months.  The customization is incredible - It is very easy for even a novice to setup.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It would be beneficial if certain features on the dashboard automatically refreshed instead of us having to do it manually.  There were some initial issues with lead importing, but that has since been fixed.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If your company utilizes emails and texts for communication, Infusionsoft can be a massive time-saver.  The customization is amazing.  We are still tweaking how, what, and when we communicate with our clients, but the program frees up hours each week for us.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are able to reach roughly 50% more potential quotes than we could before we started using Infusionsoft.  The benefits of automatic introduction and followup letters, texts, and an easy to use tracking system help keep the entire team organized.

all_reviews.review_title: Great if you know what you're doing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The software is quite complex. We had a third party marketing company set everything up for us in Infustionsoft and it is so easy to use. I love the automation that is provided by Infusionsoft campaigns. I also love how it can be integrated with so many other software that companies might use.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It is very complex if you don't have to time nor are tech savvy to figure it out. Thank goodness for the third party company that was able to build our campaigns for us. I'm sure if I had the time to watch all the instructional videos and play around with things I could figure it out but a lot of small businesses like ours, where one person wears many hats, it is hard to find time to do those things.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you don't have a tech team and don't have time to learn the software yourself, I highly recommend hiring someone to build your account for you. Once it is all set up, it is a godsend.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
A safe place to keep client data, automated email campaigns, congruency with multiple software we're using. It saves me so much time to just go in and change a tag on a client and it automatically changes the campaigns and emails being sent.

all_reviews.review_title: We can automatically obtain new leads and send them regular emails
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Though Infusionsoft is now a part of Keap, the general service hasn't really changed much, which is very good. Infusionsoft has always provided easy tools that allow me to set up marketing campaigns that essentially run automatically. One of the main automated features I like is the email newsletters. I can set them to go out to specific groups based on tags and background information, so my contacts basically get a tailored marketing experience.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The setup process was more complicated that it needed to be. Looking back on everything that was done and what I learned during the initial training, I think Infusionsoft could have definitely trimmed down much of the live training material and provided us with more support geared towards our specific business goals.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I would probably not recommend Infusionsoft for those that would suffer greatly with the cost, because I'm not sure it could be worth it in the first few months. Those that can comfortably afford it though, should definitely give it a shot.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Infusionsoft to send out emails to contacts, which includes leads and customers, and to view insight on the interactions and interest our contacts have in the emails. Infusionsoft's email design tools have made creating emails much simpler and more interesting that if we used our own design tools. The templates are great and we can save sent emails as templates to save time creating similar emails.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
After using Infusionsoft which is now Keap for over 12 years, I'd have to say the campaign builder. The automation process is relatively simple to use as in the steps. There are many MANY ways to funnel a marketing or sales campaign and since today's world has access to everything online, there must be a way to constantly find ways to integrate or making it easy to connect.

What do you dislike about Keap?
the sales side of it is ok. I wish it was better. It seems that it's mostly used for Marketing purposes. There are sales components but for the price, it should really be better at it and be able to provide an easy method for creating something simple like a custom invoice.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make sure you need something this powerful before making a huge investment into this product. If you're looking for just email campaigns then I wouldn't recommend it but if you're looking to have this be your place for all marketing/sales, then try it out. It does take time to build but like a house, the better you build it, the stronger it will be.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Problems I've solved have been creating a fast campaign that I need to go out. Having the campaigns built, templates, custom emails done; makes it easy to select, create and publish a campaign. So in other words, if you take the time to build your armory, it'll be easy to get things out.

all_reviews.review_title: A very complete digital marketing platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Once we set up our marketing campaigns, it didn't take much day-to-day attention to keep our marketing efforts running smoothly. Even though some campaigns can be complex and prone to error, simple and straightforward campaigns that basically just collect contact info and send out emails are usually effective and easy to implement. It's very easy for us to access real-time data about user interactions and the status of campaign flows for particular contacts.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I feel like there should be more advanced built-in tools. It can be very complicated and confusing to set up certain campaigns from scratch. It would be helpful if there were more templates or campaign snippets that can be used to implement advanced campaign actions more quickly and easily. Using Infusionsoft on mobile doesn't give us the full capabilities that we get from managing our account through the main website version.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It may take some time to get smooth and thoughtful campaigns running, but the time you put into the initial setup phase can be well worth it in the long run. I'd encourage new users to look into case studies and try to implement what has worked for companies with similar business plans.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I can stay in touch with contacts with little to no effort on a regular basis. Creating emails is simplified and structured for a variety of platforms on desktop and mobile. They have many quality email templates for us to work with, so we usually don't have to spend much time designing and editing new emails. The user data has given us a tremendous amount of insight into our contacts' backgrounds and interests. We can not only use the data in Infusionsoft, we can use it in other marketing campaigns and new business activities as well.

What do you like best about Keap?
I like being able to send automated emails (including automated series of emails) -- the Campaign Builder feature.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It's extremely difficult to learn to use, at least the Campaign Builder.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
When we got started, we paid a consultant to train us to use the Campaign Builder. I'm sure that saved us a lot of time and effort, because it's extremely complicated.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We send automated emails to subscribers at the point of subscription (including an automated series of onboarding emails), at the point of failed payment, and at the point of subscription cancelation. We also send one-time emails, either "now" or "scheduled for later" to notify subscribers of new features, etc. If the automation weren't possible via the Campaign Builder, there is no way we could provide professional communication to subscribers.

What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft is a good way to keep all your contacts organized in one place. Infusionsoft offers a variety of useful features including email campaigns and email broadcasts. I use the email broadcasts to check in with my clients who are located all over. I can also send out important updates to all my clients or just a specific group of clients that I tagged in Infusionsoft.

What do you dislike about Keap?
In my experience it is very easy for contacts to get duplicated within Infusionsoft. This can lead to confusion when viewing a contact. It is fairly easy to resolve them, but can be quite time consuming if infusionsoft cannot detect all of the duplicate contacts.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you have a lot of clients that you need to keep organized or would like to set up email broadcasts and campaigns to multiple groups of clients, Infusionsoft has useful tools to do that and more.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft allows our business to keep everything organized in one place as far as contacts. Multiple departments are able to view the contacts, create opportunities and add notes. It is a great feature to be able to track who is interacting with a particular client and see if they have been receiving, reading, or clicking

What do you dislike about Keap?
The one thing I dislike is the shopping cart set up part. It just doesn't seem very intuitive. I feel they could streamline it and make it a lot easier to use.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I believe if you are a company who is having issues finding a CRM tool that meets your needs and exceeds your expectations then Infusionsoft is something you should definitely consider.

Keeping up the relationships with our customers. We have tons of relationships with out business and Infusionsoft helps us manage those relationships and get important news out to your current and potential customers.

all_reviews.review_title: It's like a nervous system for our email marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft by Keap, which was just Infusionsoft when I started using it, has many features that allow us to obtain new contacts and send out emails to them in an orderly and deliberate way. Instead of just stating time intervals for initiating actions, we can tell the Infusionsoft system to send out certain emails only on certain days at certain times. There are many other conditional statements we can set to meet specific needs. Once we learned the basics of Infusionsoft, it was quite easy to navigate through and create new forms, emails and campaigns.

What do you dislike about Keap?
When we set up an one-time email to go out, there's no way to just click on it and edit the email and other settings. We basically have to create an entire new email and delete the initial one. There are several inefficiencies like that throughout our accounts control panel. They're not ridiculously problematic, but they can be annoying and take up time.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft by Keap is one of the better email marketing tools in my opinion. It can do a boat load of work for you and make your interactions with your contacts seem personal and attentive. If you want to send many emails out with the same format, you can generate email templates from emails that were previously sent.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft is at work all the time for us. It can constantly be in touch with our contacts and react to their requests instantly. We don't have to make manual updates to our system to stay in compliance with email marketing regulations. The templates Infusionsoft offers are a great way for us to create professional and effective emails in little time. Infusionsoft provides us with excellent contact interaction data so we know when they do things like subscribe to certain email lists and click on links.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like Infusionsoft's breadth of automated tools that help our clients acquire leads and keep in touch with them. They provide valuable training calls with us and our clients to make sure we have a solid understanding of the system and can work out any kinks during the first few months of usage. The newsletter design tool has many quality business templates for us to use along with its many customization options. The customization options are intuitive and relatively easy to use. We can simply drag email sections like the header, body fields and footer right into place. There are simple text editing options within each field that are similar to text editor options in document editors like Microsoft Word.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Implementing intricate campaigns that react to many variables can be confusing and prone to errors. Even when we seem to set things up correctly, campaign sequences will sometimes stop or not continue through the process as expected. Though Infusionsoft can be helpful for many basic issues, they can often not have solutions for our particular campaign issues.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Though the cost for Infusionsoft can be a bit high for smaller businesses, it can save you lots of time and make your online marketing efforts much more efficient. If their basic system isn't sufficient for your needs, there are many great third-party applications that may increase the capabilities of Infusionsoft.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using Infusionsoft allows us to acquire quality leads through our website and social media. We can also automate emails to go out in designated intervals about specific topics. We can give tags to certain contacts that allows them to receive only emails we feel are most relevant to them. The automated system saves us lots of time from having to manage campaigns and send emails out manually.

Email marketing, and the ability to store customer information.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Customer service, inability to CANCEL your account from the admin / billing area of the site. It is ridiculous in this day and age that you have to contact a company to cancel and then wait 48 hours for them to contact you to try and stop you from cancelling.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Avoid this company, super difficult to get started. Campaign manager is very difficult to work out. We spent thousands on external developers to assist in setup.Then when you want to cancel you basically have to beg them to let you CANCEL your account. No way of actually cancelling direct from the back end either?!!! This is a JOKE!!!

Not applicable

all_reviews.review_title: A great CRM with everything needed to grow my business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Moving my company to Infusionsoft CRM was one of the best decisions I made since starting my business. The ability to automate and integrate the CRM into each and every step in the sales process is amazing.
The biggest challenge I had initially was to figure out how to use Infusionsoft to its full potential but that's why I think Infusionsoft is so good, it has many features and ways you can customize so once I setup the funnel using the various tags and features I was able to create a clean, transparent funnel that all users share and use seamlessly.
I also love the ability to integrate Infusionsoft with other software like wordpress, zapier etc. so it makes it truly unlimited.

What do you dislike about Keap?
One thing I wish I could do is use the invoicing system to create invoices for my clients without the need for another accounting/invoicing system

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I think Infusionsoft can provide any business all the necessary tools to grow but it does require a bit of determination at the beginning. even though they have very good support and training I found it a little intimidating at first so it took me a while to completely embrace it.
Once I did, I can't even imagine using something else. Once you learn to use it you can do so many things with it and the only barrier becomes you and your ability to utilize it to its full potential.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
the ability to develop a funnel and control a large volume of leads in a transparent way with multiple users gives me the power to generate more leads therefore get more business

all_reviews.review_title: Meet Infusionsoft, your new 24/7 "employee" that never gets sick or takes a day off work!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
One of my favourite features within Infusionsoft is the CAMPAIGN BUILDER. I love that you can create intelligent workflows that dynamically alter the messaging and actions applied to your contacts. I particularly like the drag and drop user interface -  it makes "seeing" what you're building so much easier.

What do you dislike about Keap?
With great power comes great ... oh wait, but seriously - with this much power you get a lot of options, and this means that it's tricky sometimes to remember where to find things in the menu system. My workaround is to create a custom menu so it's not too bad.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you want or need the ability to have email sequences automatically start, stop and change then I suggest you look closely at Infusionsoft.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use it to FOLLOW UP FLAWLESSLY with every single contact I make. It allows me to network and manage my time more effectively because NOT ALL LEADS ARE CREATED EQUAL and I use Infusionsoft to weed out the weak leads and time-wasting tire-kickers.

all_reviews.review_content:

I didn't have much of a social media presence either.  But with the amazing training I continue to receive, I feel so much more confident with taking my business online.

Automation.  From being able to immediately follow up with new prospects, to creating landing pages to capture prospects on my various social media sites.  It allows me to automate follow up with my team an to quickly send out messages to all my contact list.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The customer support is good. It's easy and quick to get hold of them and they help solve your problem fast.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I can't fathom the plethora of 5 star reviews and in honesty they must be paid or false reviews for the most part.

As a marketing manager, my top priority is consistent branding and design for all of our outgoing communications and achieving this using infusionsoft's email builder is entirely useless. Often times brand fonts cannot be changed - leaving you with a standard New Times Roman font that feels very 90's. The ability to design is very limited and clunky - even with their new drag and drop email builder. From using plenty of email marketing platforms in the past this is very disappointing - be aware that this is certainly a CRM with a shoddy email marketing system plugged in. You can however build emails using HTML code which allows for much more design freedom although it's simply not practical - it leaves you training a team on not just how to use an overly complicated CRM and email marketing platform but also giving a crash course on HTML and CSS code in order to edit communications and templates.

Secondly, the email marketing automation is actually not that bad - flowchart style and easy enough to edit once you've spent a couple of weeks using it, talking with support and watching training videos. However, it is still limited in functionality and purely based on contact tags - this means that building a simple marketing campaign - 'if contact engages X email, send similar email. If not, then send alternate email' - it becomes an absolute nightmare.

Plugins and integrations are aplenty - which is great - but also unnecessary. You should bear in mind that although infusionsoft may be a cheaper price than other all-in-one CRM's you are going to need plenty of additional paid add-ons and plugins/integrations if you are going to get it anyway near performing well. An all-in-one CRM should be exactly that - All -in-one! Jack of all trades, master of none for the most part.
There's also a lack of integration which alternative CRM's do offer - such as GoToWebinar, Zoom Webinars etc. which means that you'll have to export your webinar attendees, upload them into infusionsoft with an 'event attended' tag and then check for duplicates and merge found duplicates in order to add any new contacts from webinars/events/downloads etc. It takes a long time, it's frustrating and is completely needless. Most CRM's merge duplicate contacts automatically, but not here.

Finally, reporting is a pain to get right. There's a lot of information but it's scattered around across hundred of different tabs and areas of the platform that you'll often find yourself struggling to find the same report you found the week before - even after over a year of using the platform! It's confusing for an individual and especially for a small team.

To summarise, Infusionsoft has everything right on paper but when you delve into the platform everything that sounds great in the first instance is actually limited by something completely unnecessary. As your business grows you'll find yourself drowning in contact tags, way too many campaigns, hard to find reports and all manner of other things which you just wished did something ever so slightly better. It's not the worst platform in the world, but I'd suggest not falling for the snake oil reviews and fluff they present across their website. If you're a small business I'd stick with a free and separate CRM like Hubspot free and integrate something like mailchimp or campaign monitor as your email marketing platform - at least until you're big enough to afford some of the more expensive All-in-one CRM's.

Hope this helps!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
For us as a growing business we moved from separate tools in order to get our contacts and marketing reporting and info all in the same place. We also wanted the option to be able automate some of our marketing nurture campaigns. Using infusionsoft allowed us to use to lead scoring function to pick up on engaged contacts and be better educated to directly approach interested prospects. However, we are lucky enough to be a tech business with coding wizzkids who wrote separate scripts and HTML/CSS code for these emails to work as expected. It's doable, but perhaps not worth the time and effort - almost 2 years down the line an we're still struggling to use the platform effectively.

review_question_answers.answer: The customer support is good. It's easy and quick to get hold of them and they help solve your problem fast.

Automated marketing and following up with people after events.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for people who know what they're doing in marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft allows me to do just about anything I want to do with email marketing. Not everything is super simple or ready out-of-the-box, but I haven't come across anything excessively difficult either (and I've done some very non-standard things).

What do you dislike about Keap?
There are a few small things I don't like. For example, the ways to let people manage what content they get isn't great if you'd want to let people self-segment. It's absolutely doable, but it could be done better. I'm also annoyed by the lack of built-in A/B testing options for campaign sequences. I get around it with an add-on, but it seems like something that should be built in by now.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It's most likely the best option if you're going to do marketing seriously. The alternatives I've seen (mostly by working with other tools with my clients) all have major issues. Infusionsoft has issues, too, but they're minimal compared to tools like Ontraport or HubSpot.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use Infusionsoft as my only CRM and email marketing app. I can do marketing better thanks to it (compared to some basic-level tools like MailChimp), which obviously leads to more profit.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft is one of the best products I have ever used!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Ease of use.  Infusionsoft is VERY user friendly and incorporates various aspects of my customer profile so that I am able to see all information on my customer in one place.  It's amazing!  The fact that Infusionsoft offers training on how to use all of the great aspects of their product is icing on the cake.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I have not really experienced any aspect of Infusionsoft that I dislike.  We have worked through some issues, which has been a learning process, but customer service does a good job of helping us through each issue.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Take the training and keep your notes in a notebook so they don't get lost.  The training is a must in order to understand the premise of Infusionsoft.  Once you understand the direction Infusionsoft wants to head, it is much easier to use the product.  I LOVE Infusionsoft!  Also, take the time to play in the Sandbox.  If you know what you are doing from step 1, Infusionsoft will work better for you.  Training and practice are a must!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft has allowed us to incorporate various aspects of our business into one place, which has saved us a ton of time.  We also have up to date information on hand for all team members, which saves us the time and aggravation of trying to figure out who has done what with each customer.  We all see the same customer profile with the most up to date information available.  We are able to offer a better customer service experience because of the tools Infusionsoft has available for us to use.  We have also been able to put our marketing focus where it needs to be with each customer because we are able to see what they are actually interested in vs what we hope they are interested in.  All in all, Infusionsoft has helped us to become a better company all around.  We are more focused on the important aspects of running a business rather than playing who did this, who did that, let's catch up games for half the business day.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Without a doubt, what I like best about Infusionsoft is the level at which you can automate practically EVERYTHING! We have a huge list of subscribers, live event students and high-level coaching students and just two team members to handle them all. We could never do it without Infusionsoft!

What do you dislike about Keap?
The biggest challenge I face with Infusionsoft is getting folks to understand that it's not NEARLY as complicated as they think it is. We could be automating even more inside of our business if our virtual assistants and support staff were more comfortable with the platform.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Personally, I think the best way to learn to use Infusionsoft is to just play around in there and see what happens. It would be nice to see easier access to pre-built campaigns and other things that would make it easier for folks to dive right in. I also hate the fact that it's next to impossible to copy products, order forms, etc. with any ease.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The biggest problems Infusionsoft is solving in our business is minding the gaps. If you're relying 100% on real-life "touch points", I promise you, there are people on your list being overlooked or otherwise ignored. And that can cause serious issues when your products START at $2,500. Since we've moved all of our products (not just the digital ones) onto Infusionsoft, we've had a lot less folks falling through the cracks, and therefore, a lot less refund requests and chargebacks.

all_reviews.review_title: Works well for our mid-sized business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
This software was a bit of a learning curve but now that we're using it regularly I can't imagine our business without it. We coordinate several emails a week that must go out to a variety of both employees and customers. I love the tagging system -- it allows me to create "sub-groups" so that I can easily isolate smaller groups of individuals without arduously adding them one-by-one.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I would like for it to be a little more "foolproof" for our less tech-savvy individuals. I also don't like the "clunkiness" of trying to create emails that are based on a template. The title and user then have to be changed again.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Do your homework. Make sure it will be compatible with your company's other programs or that there are work-arounds. Also be sure at least one or two people within your organization are trained to use it properly.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We're now able to easily communicate and share files with those outside of the core group within our staff. On the client end, we have been better able to track which emails are receiving attention and which go unopened.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft offers such a broad range of functionality. They always seem to be adding more. The thing that I like the most is the ability Infusionsoft provides to run your entire business out of one application.

When things do go wrong, Infusionsoft's technical support responds with the level of care that you would expect from an in house employee. We couldn't be happier.

What do you dislike about Keap?
We occasionally struggle with the reporting barriers created when trying to run searches between different tables. Opportunities, contacts, payments, orders, etc are all segregated in sometimes frustrating ways.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you have a small to mid sized business, Infusionsoft is an absolute must. Infusionsoft allows you to build any sized marketing campaign at any imaginable level of complexity.

The financial tools are amazing. From shopping cart to monthly reporting, I can't imagine trying to run a business without the tools that Infusionsoft offers.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We utilize nearly every functionality that Infusionsoft offers. Infusionsoft is used to manage and track our sales floor, affiliates, even customer service.

Not only does Infusionsoft offer some very powerful marketing tools, we use internal forms to provide and track internal company communication relating to customers. It has allowed us to improve departmental efficiency by a great deal.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I am one of those people that likes human contact for assistance. Anytime I call in for help the support team is patient and helpful. They have answers and if they dont know they go ask someone to get the answers for me. I have yet to get a support team member that is difficult to deal with. They all have such wonderful personalities that they can keep the crisis I am having at the moment seem like a cake walk. Then suddenly everything is fixed and back to work I go.
I would also like to say that when they have to send a support ticket to the advanced team they are just as nice and follow through as well as the initial team member.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The hold music is AWFUL! Is it possible to at least have some kind of music other than the same tune over and over. It is brutal. The only other thing I can recommend is having a payment plan for the course you give to become a IS expert.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Use your tutorials when getting started and if you are going to be the admin you may want to invest in the Infusionsoft Course  - become a certified user. Do not try to wing it!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The issues this business would have without Infusionsoft would be running campaigns and billing for our 400 clients. It is so helpful to be able to mass email all of them or get historical data for any new direction we may want to go for the next campaign.

all_reviews.review_title: Great client management and automatic emails for a small business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
We've benefited immensely from the CRM functions and email workflows. These have allowed us to easily keep track of our clients and to send out our scheduled emails to them based on several different  specifications and workflows.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I wish it was an application that you install and not a web-based service. I find myself closing out of the browser often and accidently exiting from Infusionsoft. If it was software, I would feel more confident in its overall stability and performance.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I would recommend utilizing the several hours of training that Infusionsoft offers, since it connects you with a real person who has experience and they help you get the ball rolling for your specific needs.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our small business is for cinema advertising and we have hundreds of clients (and only 9 employees) that need reminders, updates, and other information on a weekly basis. Using the CRM and email features save us a lot of headache and time. We've been able to free up many hours of typing repetative emails in several departments including our motion graphics, sales, account managment and trafficking. We used to have requests or changes that got lost through the cracks, but now we have several safety nets in place thanks to the several of the key features in Infusionsoft. Our time is spent much more efficiently and our clients are happier then ever before. We always thought that keeping up with hundreds of current and thousands of past clients was going to be an impossibility, but it doesnt have to be difficult.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent digital marketing capabilities with handy automated tools and features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft has many templates to help us get started with sign-up forms, campaign structures and email newsletters. For a digital marketing platform with advanced customizable capabilities, Infusionsoft is generally easy to use with a support staff that can help you through confusing issues. I like how Infusionsoft has many automated tools that allow us to set up campaigns and then the system compiles new contacts and then sends out emails in an orderly and meaningful manner. It's great that we can add multiple campaigns and make them each more relevant particular topics and groups. Infusionsoft allows provides valuable data about email opens, link clicks and other user activity.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There are certain campaign structures that can be daunting to set up properly. We will sometimes use third-party extensions that don't alway connect smoothly. Some of that is due to issues related to the other software or service, but can still be complicated nonetheless. Once you start getting into more advanced campaign functionality, there may be lots of experimenting with trial and error since there may not be a solid road map for your particular campaign structure and settings.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
valuable solution that works at all hours of the day for you. I'd pay particular attention to the email timers to make sure that emails get sent at a reasonable day and hour for your particular client. I think that makes the emails seem less like mass automated emails, which should make contacts more likely to open, read and respond to them.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have used Infusionsoft to set up highly interactive and responsive digital marketing campaigns to help with promoting services, events and our company in general. We can also use it for standard notifications and more email reminders. It's been an amazing platform for us to store contact data with extensive background and activity history. We can simply look up the contact and find a wealth of notes about them to enhance calls, meetings and emails we send to them.

all_reviews.review_title: A CRM system that can actually do everything I need.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Few CRM systems give me the control I want over my automations and campaigns like Infusionsoft. I've been super impressed with how much control I actually have over how I set up my campaigns and integrations. The possibilities are truly endless for my business now.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is a STEEP learning curve to Infusionsoft, and it's very easy for beginners to break certain processes when they don't know the whole system. I personally do NOT like how integrated contacts and affiliates are. Currently, if you delete a contact, all sales information is also deleted, including commission data for affiliates who referred the sales. This makes it impossible to trim dead weight off of a list if they've made a purchase in the past without affecting affiliate ledgers.

I would also like to see improvement with deliverability and ease of GDPR compliance. ConvertKit tends to land my emails in my subscribers' inboxes more often, and their GDPR compliance process was almost completely hands off, which was SO great. It's very difficult to identify EU subscribers on my list without paying a ton more money for add-on services.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
This is a great option for anyone who really wants to explore building a consulting/service-based business OR for anyone who owns a membership site and/or owns a thriving blog/digital marketing business. It's a fantastic choice if you want more of your business automated so you can focus your efforts on doing what only you can do.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I absolutely love how Infusionsoft works with membership sites. Automations and integrations are really where Infusionsoft shines. I also love how much control I have over my subscribers' contact records to really see where they've been in my system and where they're going.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: Few CRM systems give me the control I want over my automations and campaigns like Infusionsoft. I've been super impressed with how much control I actually have over how I set up my campaigns and integrations. The possibilities are truly endless for my business now.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
There is a STEEP learning curve to Infusionsoft, and it's very easy for beginners to break certain processes when they don't know the whole system. I personally do NOT like how integrated contacts and affiliates are. Currently, if you delete a contact, all sales information is also deleted, including commission data for affiliates who referred the sales. This makes it impossible to trim dead weight off of a list if they've made a purchase in the past without affecting affiliate ledgers.

I would also like to see improvement with deliverability and ease of GDPR compliance. ConvertKit tends to land my emails in my subscribers' inboxes more often, and their GDPR compliance process was almost completely hands off, which was SO great. It's very difficult to identify EU subscribers on my list without paying a ton more money for add-on services.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft enables our little company to look big - takes care of so many administrative functions
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
We're a retreat center. Before Infusionsoft, if someone inquired about our services, we had a laborious process for following up. Once we automated, we were able to make sure we touched every single lead repeatedly. Our bookings increased immediately.

What do you dislike about Keap?
If I want to change an email in a sequence, but people are already in that sequence, they won't get the newly edited email. It wasn't this way when we started; we'd just re-publish the campaign. This frustrates me as I create email series.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
We saw improvement in our bottom line right away, even when we were new at using Inufsionsoft. My boss is pretty techy and without him, it would have been a hard conversion for the rest of us. After 3 years, we paid $10 K and sent my boss  and 2 colleagues to Arizona for a makeover, which took our use to the next level.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We convert more leads. We also follow up better with the people who book us about their particular needs: how many rooms, meals, set-ups, etc. It makes us look better to customers when we're well prepared for them. They way we have things set up, Infusionsoft's forms give customers a timely way to communicate their needs and expectations with us.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft is a Comprehensive but Overwhelming All-in-One CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft does everything you'd expect and more; this is both convenient and overwhelming. It's very easy to integrate with virtually any other service you use via Zapier, whether that be a Wordpress website, a reputation management platform, etc.

What do you dislike about Keap?
While Infusionsoft does everything you'd imagine and more, onboarding is a big time commitment, and may still leave you feeling overwhelmed due to the sheer robust nature of the platform.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
The learning curve is steep, so be prepared for that. I am the only person using it at my company, which probably adds to the difficulty I've experienced, so learning along with a team might yield a better (though time-consuming) result.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
At its most basic level, Infusionsoft allows us to capture leads, tag them appropriately, track their lead scores and overall engagement, and communicate with them. It also allows us to plan these communications strategically and automate email campaigns.

all_reviews.review_content:

I am excited all the great email marketing options and I was nervous that I would need to figure it all out on my own. The 3 sessions with the marketing consultant have been very helpful and Tech Support has been amazing! They have walked me through the initial set up and my first email launch! I learn best when someone holds my hand through each step and walks me through it. I'm so grateful for such great support! And can't wait to learn more!

What do you dislike about Keap?
My only frustration is that I have been so busy with other things that I haven't had as much time to put into learning all the Infusionsoft tricks and tools!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Utilize Tech Support!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Before Infusionsoft, one of my problems was sending out emails to over 550 contacts through gmail. If you send an email to too many recipients, gmail identifies the email as SPAM and won't allow it to go through. So I was sending the same email to 20 people at a time! That's over 25 identical emails! Plus attachments! It was SO TEDIOUS. Now, with help from Tech Support, I created my first campaign and two emails were sent to over 550 people 3 days apart. It was beautiful! With a little more practice, sending out emails will be super efficient!

What do you like best about Keap?
Once you find your way around, it's fairly easy to create and distribute multiple emails/campaigns customized based on your company's criteria. Easy to create and save templates so you're not having to start over for each campaign; plus, the ease of making a few simple changes for a fresh look.
I love the ability to track emails and the specifics of how they're tracked; if they're opened, what was clicked, who clicked what, etc. It makes it easier to look at the data, determine the trends and see where you need to take your marketing next based on the latter info.

all_reviews.review_title: In only a few months it has already changed the interaction with our users.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Automation of messages for follow up and forms to get a better scope of customer profiles. All this integrated with the Infusion CRM works perfectly. It's easy to use, and great for team projects. Infusionsoft has one of the best-designed user interfaces in the marketing automation industry. Their visual campaign builder makes crafting even the most complex of nurturing sequences both fun and intuitive. Thanks to  a combination of over 300+ apps in the Infusionsoft Marketplace, their API, and their Zapier integration, you can connect Infusionsoft to hundreds of third-party tools. Infusionsoft uses universal tracking, which makes it easy to keep track of a contact's behaviour across multiple marketing channels.

What do you dislike about Keap?
In comparison with our previous email marketing solution I find that Infusionsoft is very limited with the templates and customization options of messages. Not being able to use CSS, more HTML and so few "group" options in email designer / blocks was big downer for our transition. Infusionsoft doesn't have any native integrations with third-party tools. While they do have a marketplace with over 300 apps and extensions, many of these require an additional ongoing cost.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Great solution for the cost. Easy to use, easy to manage with other team members.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Mostly automation of marketing email and CRM. Automation of messages for follow up and forms to get a better scope of customer profiles. All this integrated with the Infusion CRM works perfectly.

It's easy to use, and great for team projects. Infusionsoft has one of the best-designed user interfaces in the marketing automation industry. Their visual campaign builder makes crafting even the most complex of nurturing sequences both fun and intuitive. Thanks to  a combination of over 300+ apps in the Infusionsoft Marketplace, their API, and their Zapier integration, you can connect Infusionsoft to hundreds of third-party tools. Infusionsoft uses universal tracking, which makes it easy to keep track of a contact's behaviour across multiple marketing channels.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: In comparison with our previous email marketing solution I find that Infusionsoft is very limited with the templates and customization options of messages. Not being able to use CSS, more HTML and so few "group" options in email designer / blocks was big downer for our transition. Infusionsoft doesn't have any native integrations with third-party tools. While they do have a marketplace with over 300 apps and extensions, many of these require an additional ongoing cost.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Keap:
review_question_answers.answer: Great solution for the cost. Easy to use, easy to manage with other team members.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Mostly automation of marketing email and CRM. Automation of messages for follow up and forms to get a better scope of customer profiles. All this integrated with the Infusion CRM works perfectly.

The best part of integrating Infusionsoft into my business is saving me time by automating all those daily repetitive tasks.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is quite the learning curve in order to figure out all that's possible, but the Infusionsoft team provides tons of examples on how to.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Take some time to map out what you do during your sales process from lead generation, nurturing and keeping happy customers. Pinpoint the most crucial steps or those that would make the biggest impact in your business. Then find a resource for training and jump in with both feet! Consistency is important and apply what you learn right away even if it's just a sample/test.

As I begin automating my business I realized there's so much more that can be automated allowing me to more spend time learning and focus on more ways I can be of better service to my customers.

all_reviews.review_title: The Best CRM & Autoresponder I have ever used
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the ability to be able to set up fully automated & customised campaigns that really meet my customers where they are at. With the extensive ability to use tags, custom fields and others to trigger decision diamonds so that every client can get a unique experience based on their actions (Or lack of actions). Also, their support team is always willing and ready to help with even some of the most technical questions that you require. I had someone help me troubleshoot a campaign the other day that spent almost an hour working with me doing various tests till we got all the aspects working correctly and efficiently. 100% top notch support!!!!!

What do you dislike about Keap?
The lack of 'stats' for the new landing page builder. IT would be great to see numbers on how many people landed on the page, converted... I know this can be done with Google Analytics and other tracking but it would be neat to have it all in one place.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Just do it! Really, I have used over 10 different CRM"s and Autoresponders within the last 10 years and by far Infusionsoft is simply the best and most complete in almost every area. The support is great, the product is fantastic and they are constantly developing & improving. On top of that, they are more focused on delivering than they are on the price. When I started, I was paying $299 and they now offer me more service and support whilst dropping me down to the $99 plan 2 years later. Showing that they care about their customers and not just their profits.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Delivering a better quality sales 'Funnel' and sales pipeline that is unique for each different client. It really helps us to deliver great service, keep in touch with them and do 95% of it automatically without us needing to keep on top of it.

all_reviews.review_title: The best CRM all in one marketing system at an unbelievably low price.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It does everything I want it to do, at a very amazingly low price.  The training is great, phone support is excellent and the system is easy to learn.  I have everything in one place Landing Pages, CRM, Email Marketing, all automated.  This saves an enormous amount of time.  Thank you InfusionSoft!!!

What do you dislike about Keap?
I am using the system to market events. When someone registers for an event, I would like the system to to automatically put it on the attendees Google calendar or whatever calendar they are using.  There might even be a way to do it and I just haven't figured it out yet.  I have only been using this for a couple weeks and I've been focused on building out my landing page and email marketing pieces..



Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I highly recommend Infusionsoft.  I looked at many of the other options out there and nothing can even come close to infusionsoft. If you are a small business owner and want to market your products or services using a CRM, Landing Pages and Email Marketing and a very affordable price, then this is the absolute best thing on the market PERIOD!!!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I was looking for an all-in one system, but they were way out of my price range.  As a result I was doing everything piecemeal.  It was cumbersome, not automated and not very effective.  Now I have an amazing system that enables me to automate my entire marketing program. Landing page, CRM, thank you for registering email, followup emails to the event, then follow-up emails after the event. Everything is mail-merged and personalized for the clients.  It is all very professional and makes my company look very professional.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Without Infusionsoft, I would not be as successful as I am. It also saves me a ton of time and helps with consistent messaging. Once a campaign is set up, I can reuse it. I have two campaigns that I've been running for the last two years that have converted the majority of my customers. Occassionally, I will tweak the campagin and make it better, but I haven't had to redo it yet. My campaigns are customized and do exactly what I want them to do.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There are a few things I'd like to see improved, but for the most part they've done an amazing job! I think reporting is getting better, but it could be better. It also takes quite a bit of time to set up. Sometimes campagins can be very complicated and large depending on what you're trying to accomplish.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Once you get it set up, it works really well. It's the time and dedication that's needed up front that's difficult.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Conversion from leads to customers without needing customer support. It's very automated and once it's set up, I can move on.

all_reviews.review_title: Would you like to stream line your business process?
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
You start with one click... and automation process begins the touch points with your customers.  As you know it takes 6-8 touches to convert a lead to a customer.   Every lead get the same personalize consistent message, you can set tasks, follow-up reminders, email delivery, add membership platforms, sell products with a single click.

This system allows you to track the sales process so that opportunities do not falls through the cracks.  You are provided with comprehensive customer information and tools to prioritize and make the right sales call that closes the deal. As a business consultant; I started out as a customer, but for many of my clients it is a must have resource as I love helping small business simplify their busy lives and make more money and InfusionSoft is your best right hand!

What do you dislike about Keap?
It is a comprehensive system,  if you are not a tech savvy person hire a certified InfusionSoft Professional to help you. It is worth the money!  If you are a tech savvy person you may need to do some training.  But again they system is worth it!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Think about all of the manual steps that you have in your business today... its a dream come true!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
You can do more with less time.   You are not limited to having to reminder yourself to do things, you can set the times and let the system do the heavy lifting for you.

all_reviews.review_title: Perfect tool to help the online retailer grow their business!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I personally love the drag and drop campaign feature because it is so easy to use.  The visibility I am able to gain from the campaign stats allow me to see where everyone is at any given moment which in turn allows me figure out where to optimize and refine the automation to enhance my ROI.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There are not many things I don't like about the software but I do think that the online storefront could be slightly more robust.  In doing so, people could have a one stop shop instead of looking to integrate a custom cart but the caveat to that is people like me would be out of work.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft is very robust in many ways and has a ton of bells and whistles.  There is no way to tackle how to use every portion of the software overnight.  The best bet is to take on sections in bits and pieces to not overwhelm yourself.  Once you have a really good understanding of a couple items, the system in my opinion is super easy to use.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are a third party plugin provider that links online shopping carts to Infusionsoft.  We help online retailers growth their online store by utilizing features of Infusionsoft.  In doing so we can provide customers with ROI tracking and other advanced features.  In turn, the Infusionsoft customer  is gaining valuable information with deep data that segment's and target's the right audiences at the right time through their online store purchase data.

I think that this is a wonderful foundation for so many marketing opportunities. I think the possibilities are unlimited, I only wish I had more time to work on them.  The marketplace opens up a world of extending infusionsoft to meet so many different needs.  Generally it is a user friendly app once you spend a little time with it.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I dislike the billing system or lets say we are bending the auto-billiing system capabilities to meet our needs and its not working well for us.   For the email builder, it would be nice to set the cell sizes on tables.   As a small business owner, I have to say the software is certainly more robust than I think any small business owner has time to learn.  It has taken me a couple years to dig in and really see the potential and I don't think I have scratched the surface.   It just takes time to learn.

If you are a small business owner and go with Infusionsoft get a developer or someone to show you how to use it so you can truly see the potential. its very robust but being a small business owner, I don't have time to learn it on my own as much as I would like to.

Infusionsoft allows us to build detailed, behavior-based sequences which consistently makes us a whole lot more money. How? Through the use of tags -- rather than lists (like most email providers) -- we can track every action (or inaction) our prospects and customers take with us. Rather than merely blasting broadcast emails, we use surgical precision in communicating with our audience. And it makes us more money.

all_reviews.review_title: Endless potential, but not for the faint of heart.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love having everything under one roof, CRM, email marketing, e-commerce, fulfillment, reporting, etc. I know that I am only using a tenth of what the system can do, especially in terms of funnels and campaign functionality, but the more comfortable I get, the more I realize how much is possible.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The complexity and non-intuitive functionality. There are things that seem incredibly basic (and that are easy to use in other systems I've tried) that are either impossible or require so many complex steps or integrations.  I have also found the support chat very uneven in terms of ability and willingness to assist (phone chat has been a much more positive experience).

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Create more intuitive pathways. Allow support chat to actually help customers make chages and fix issues - the silent videos they send are often hard to follow and not helpful  - while other software companies I work with will do a screen share and actually walk me through my issue step by step, much more helpful and empowering.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email marketing, CRM, ecommerce.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like that Infusionsoft is able to track so much meaningful information about your customers. It allows you to see which subscribers and customers are engaged with your product, email broadcasts, and within funnels.

The reporting is great and the ease of use when setting up order forms, special discounts, and products is second to none.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Sometimes the navigation can be a little tricky. You really need to know where to go, otherwise you need to go all the way back out to the dashboard and back in to get to where you need to be.

It would also be great to have an easier way to view dated information, like having a 'next day' button. If you're looking at products sold through a week, you have to enter each date separately, rather than being able to skip through.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I would go ahead and give it a shot. Easy to use and has the functionality to cover pretty much everything.

Product sales, order forms, customer reporting, email campaigns, email broadcasts.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Loving the automation capabilities and how its improving my home based business. It saves me time and is super professional, easy to learn and has so many more options to use to take your business, whatever it is to the next level.
I love that the templates are already there and you can literally create new, fun and attractive advertising within 20 minutes and reach millions of people who need the product or service that you have available. The training courses are phenomenal and would cost me thousands of dollars if I were to hire someone or pay someone to do this work for me. The Coaches are professional, helpful and up to date on the latest trends and advertising methods. You can literally create a new strategy for your business and have support and test your ideas without losing thousands of dollars on an idea that may or may not be attractive to your market. The expertise is incredible and the fact that they share all this info that other companies make you pay thousands for with no guarantee that it will actually work.

What do you dislike about Keap?
No dislikes at all. Thanks to all the free trainings, chats and online groups, there's tons of support and no reason not to improve your business. Even by using just 5% of the features I've seen a huge difference in my business. There are so many options to improve your business no matter what you do. As a network marketer who runs a home based business and is a full time Mom, I am able to connect with potential clients all over the world, provide them with information and reach so many more people than I could running my business the old fashioned way.
It does take a commitment of start up time but it is well worth the time investment for what you will receive in connecting capabilities and advertising.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Just get started and in less than a year you will see a massive difference, even if you just apply 5-10% of what they offer!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automated emails, campaigns, coaching series...saves so much time and offers so much value to your clients and potential clients! I've also been able to share this info with my Team and show them how automation can improve their business and save them time throughout their day and free up more time to spend doing things they love with those they love but not miss out on opportunities.

all_reviews.review_title: The best all in one CRM on the market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft just works. I've been using it for 7 years and am continually pleased with its functionality and adaptability.  I work in many Infusionsoft applications for many clients, and I love being able to say, "Yes" to their desires nearly every time they ask me if Infusionsoft can do something. I particularly enjoy working in the campaign builder and using that logic to build campaigns that trigger based on contact activity and non-activity.  I also enjoy the functionality that we have when integrating with other software programs via the API.  Finally, the tech support at Infusionsoft is absolutely incredible. I love Infusionsoft!

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is very little I dislike about this product. If I had to choose, I would say the reporting features could be upgraded, but even with the limited reporting features, I can still get the data I want 99% of the time - because the software is so flexible.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I highly recommend Infusionsoft.  There is no other software that has it's capability. And be sure to take advantage of their trainings and support.  Like any complex software, there is a learning curve, but there has to be - in order for it to be the great product that it is.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?

I also enjoy the functionality that we have when integrating with other software programs via the API.  Finally, the tech support at Infusionsoft is absolutely incredible. I love Infusionsoft!

all_reviews.review_title: A streamlined marketing platform that is relatively easy to manage
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like the automated nature of many of Infusionsoft's features. We can acquire new contacts through web forms and have regularly scheduled emails sent out at set time intervals. Infusionsoft has many professional and effective email campaigns and templates that can get users started quickly. There isn't a need for a technical background in order to set up and run Infusionsoft campaigns effectively. The support team is very involved in getting you acquainted with the system and can help walk you through many common problems that may arise.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft can be a very complicated platform to work with if your campaigns are very intricate, especially if it integrates third-party applications. Getting nodes and actions aren't always as straightforward as linking the arrow from one node to the next. Certain campaign formats, like looping campaigns, may require lots of trial and error to make sure they run effectively. Infusionsoft's support team may not always be equipped to help you through complex campaigns.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I'd recommend Infusionsoft for small to medium-sized businesses that want to reach out to a large contact base without devoting a ton of daily resources to the effort. If you do sign up with Infusionsoft, I'd suggest checking out Infusionsoft's default campaigns and testing your actual campaigns thoroughly, especially if you consider your campaigns and contacts to be very important to your business. Even though your published campaigns might show no errors, emails may not be sent so unforeseen reasons such as extension conflicts. You can set up test campaigns with short intervals to make sure emails are actually received and formatted the way you intended.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our company uses Infusionsoft to acquire new leads and to deliver automated emails at regular intervals. We can specify different emails and intervals to use to different campaigns, which is helpful when tailoring campaigns for particular audiences. Infusionsoft provides useful data about many actions such as link clicks and email opens, which allow us to refine our campaigns for higher conversions. Infusionsoft doesn't require a great deal of technical or programming knowledge, so we were able to get up and running quickly and don't really have to devote much time to software maintenance.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft is the backbone to my sales and marketing efforts.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Our entire sales and marketing strategy is based on emails. Infusionsoft allows us to add, tag, and automatically follow up with prospects quickly and easily. We've dialed it in so well at this point that infusionsoft is basically our top sales person lol..

What do you dislike about Keap?
This is going to make my review sound fake but I can't think of anything and I've been using it daily for 4 years. Only thing I can think of is that we needed to get a separate software (Asana) for project management. But I mean... Infusionsoft doesn't make my breakfast either.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you operate a small business, this tool is your best friend. And I'm not even using 1/10 of it's capabilities. We happily continue to build into this software adding more and more contacts every day. No hesitation - it's working great for us.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Standard CRM, email marketing automation, sales funnel.

Literally every day we have multiple leads who have responded to our emails. Now of course, you have to be able to write a good email too. But if you can, this thing can really take a work load off of for you. Worth every penny.

I like how easy it is to set up email campaigns and tag contacts for certain campaigns. Searching and merging contacts is also very easy. I also like that I can see EVERY person that has opened an email, reported it as spam, or opted out of the sequence.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I don't like that Infusionsoft can't auto-delete duplicate contacts. I also don't like the certain features with setting the email to go out at a certain time. Sometimes I set it to go out at 3:30, but I'm not done with it until 3:45. When I click publish, it should automatically go out rather than just not going out at all.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I would only recommend this product to businesses who need to send out mass email campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: A tool that "does it all," but doesn't teach you HOW to "do it all.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft has all the components we wanted in a CRM - ability to track touchpoints and data about customers and prospects throughout their journey, AND the ability to automate drip campaigns and marketing messaging.

What do you dislike about Keap?
We had a lot of difficulty with our import, and wound up spending a LOT of time onboarding and cleaning up our data. Every contact has tags attached, but in order to send an email broadcast, we have to create a whole separate tag just to attach it to the email. Automation has been a difficult process, and support has been underwhelming.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were hoping to bring together our CRM needs and our marketing automation needs in one place. It has been helpful to see past marketing communication and the status of various opportunities in our pipeline.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love process and organization.  Infusionsoft allows me to organize my business behind the scenes and then not even worry about it.  It runs and keeps my clients organized and full of information and education.  And it keeps them on task for meetings and homework.  This takes a huge load of work off of my shoulders.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusuionsoft is not completely user friendly.  It can take a bit of time to learn how to use it and I certainly don't understand the power of it yet.  But I know someone who does and she helps me make it everything I need it to be.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It is worth the investment and any initial headaches while learning the software.  I also highly recommend you find a IS partner to help you with initial set-up and training.  It changes makes everything so much easier.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It runs my entire business behind the scenes.  It allows me to be task driven.  I have it set up so tasks trigger me to complete certain items a key places in my programs.  It allows me to have several different offerings for my clients depending on what they can afford financially or where they are in their health journey.  Everything I work on with them is captured in IS s I can go back to review it at anytime.  It's awesome.
