It's simple, intuitive and combines all aspects of our business ... including digital marketing ... into one platform. More importantly, we were able to customize Infusionsoft to fit the specific needs of our company.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I had to dig for this one ... Changing my login password every few months. It's no big deal really.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If your business has special requirements, work with an Infusionsoft integrator. We've been working with Get-U-Wired for two years. They customized Infusionsoft to work for our company.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed a platform that could manage ALL aspects of consulting and business training company. It tracks what services/courses clients purchased and deducts them as used. This is essential as we must track deferred income for tax purposes.
All digital marketing is on Infusionsoft.
Automation of essential client communication, reminders, onboarding, etc.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
User-friendly and very efficient software tools for email marketing. I have seen many successful companies using this product which gives me a confidance in using this product. This platform is way better than other existing e-mail marketing platform. However, it's bit expensive as described below in "what you dislike" section.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Expensive compared to other e-mail marketing platform. Also, there should be video tutorials included for troubleshooting.  Every time I contact infusionsoft for a real marketing related issue, they advise me to hire a professional with paid service. Anyway, I am paying a significant amount of monthly subscription every month and all the services should be included there in the package. In addition, i am really having a hard time capturing leads using this product. No one is signing up on my lead capture page irrespecive of my several try (using different layout). When I contacted infusionsoft about this, they provided 2 free calls to solve this issue. However, the discussion we had was very superficial and was not at all helpful. At the en of the second call, the customer care representative advised me to avail paid service where I will have better chance to improve my landing page. That does not make any sense to me especially when I am paying a lot for this product and infusionsoft should be able to resolve all the issues without refereing me to a third party.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I will NOT recommend. It's expensive and as per as training is concerned it's not complete (should have more troubleshoot videos).

Generating and capturing leads for e-mail marketing.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool that does the leg work
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The best feature is the ability to create as many landing pages as I need. As a start up business, I can test different pages to see what works and building landing pages is now relatively easy thanks to the software. Also I cannot ask for better customer service (specifically their live chat service). They're always there when I need them.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The software can be a bit overwhelming at times because it has so many features. Sometimes it's not very intuitive. However, every time I came to a point where I get stuck or simply don't understand something, live chat representatives are there who not only infusionsoft gurus, but patient and will work with you until you figure it out.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
My biggest recommendation is to use the coaching offered by infusionsoft. It will cut the learning curve and will get you in business faster while being more effective in your marketing approach.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Without infusionsoft, building an email list and organizing it with tags would be a daunting task. I'm realizing how much time and effort the software is providing me after I see customers being walked through a process without me having to be there.

A bit counterproductive, but it's a small bother, compared to all the benefits Infusionsoft app gives me.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft has been a game changer for our business. We were a small boat canvas business and while we had figured out the marketing end of things, finding enough hours in the day to followup and close sales was a struggle. We had enough time to do all the quotes, but once the quote was done, there never was time to contact the customer again to see if they had all the information they needed to make the purchasing decision.
We were using an autoresponder to pump out a generic newsletter that was trying to cover all of the bases but it wasn't specific to each individual's needs and interests.

When we switched to Infusionsoft, we set up campaigns that were interactive so, based on the client's actions, they received all of the followup info automatically. As soon as we did that, our closing rate doubled.

We continue to grow and on average our campaigns and followup sequences send out an average of 30,000-50,000 emails per month so we can focus on bringing in new clients, doing quotes and processing orders.

Honestly, having Infusionsoft handling our customer followup is like having 2 extra employees.
Did I mention that there are just the two of us running this business and we are now one of the largest boat canvas dealers in North America?

That is the difference Infusionsoft can make for your business.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is definitely a steep learning curve when you first start using Infusionsoft but help is available.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you take the time to learn the system it will be very beneficial to your business. There is a learning curve and you should plan to dedicate a certain amount of time for setup.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I think I have covered most of the benefits we have seen in my comments above. If you find there aren't enough hours in the day to provide customer service and followup quotes, then you need to automate. It will pay for itself very quickly.

I like that this CRM works intuitively. It retains the information on a contact that you need in order to stay in constant contact and is essential for the life and progression of small businesses. I like all the features, even though this system is mighty robust and can be confusing at times once you learn it, it is so worthwhile.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There's often bugs and known issues that come up, nothing too major as I've learned to bookmark the page to know ahead of time if the site is down but nothing too terrible. I do dislike how complex it is, I feel it could be a little more user-friendly for the typical user that doesn't have too much tech savvy skills.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The addition of contacts, leads, companies, and opportunities on this is great. I can schedule calls, input notes, invoice and forecast is incredible. I wish I could Infusionsoft my friends and family. It's really an incredible tool. I can assign tasks and move leads in different stages. Total game changer.

all_reviews.review_title: Decent product, terrible billing dept., and poor enterprise evolution
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The product is fairly easy to use, standard feature sets and easy automation. Good integration with Wordpress.

What do you dislike about Keap?
1) The billing department is nearly useless. I switched my company from a single account spanning three countries to two separate accounts after discussing options with Infusionsoft billing/accounts. We agreed to keep pricing the same, and split up the users across the two accounts (and actually reduced the users to keep the pricing the same). That was five months ago and we are still getting double billed.

2) Infusionsoft made the strategic move from trying to be in the enterprise market to the SMB market. That's totally understandable, but they left all of their enterprise level/legacy clients behind without much effort to continue providing services, updates, etc.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're a SMB they may be great, but otherwise I would say that you are better off exploring other options.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email automation, automation, CRM management.

The ability to track all clients, no matter what step of the process they are in.  I absolutely love the fact that I can go back to each individual client and read what is going on with that person, no matter who has been involved in the process.  I am able to keep track of any outstanding balances on invoices. That in itself makes this program worth it.  I also really enjoy that there is a mobile app with this software.  It makes pulling up contact information while not in the office that much more convenient.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I do not have any complaints at this time. Everything that I have used, has been excellent. Once I figured out how to use the functions I am currently using, it has been a breeze.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
When implementing, give it at least a month before really giving it an opinion.  It took a little time for me to figure out and get used to using all steps of the process.  I still don't use every feature that infusionsoft provides.  That is not because I don't feel like I need to, but because it takes time to figure everything out and how it works. I am very excited to get in deeper and utilize all functions.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keeping track of past due accounts. I really like the ability to add both generic notes and more specific notes.  This allows me to not have to remember exactly what is going on with each client based off of memory.

all_reviews.review_title: I tripled my conversions for August 2018
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I've been using InfusionSoft since the early days of the red & black logo. I became a partner in 2015. In August 2017 I pivoted my business and was no longer a partner. I was no longer using InfusionSoft or any other CRM for that matter. I know the value of time and automation processes. InfusionSoft does too.

In August 2017 I had no processes in place, and I only had two new clients that month. Fast forward to July 2018, after talking with Jillian Littlejohn about the progress of InfusionSoft and all the changes they have made to their Partner Program and the application itself, I thought I give it another go. Jill made me an offer I could not pass up.

My first year anniversary for my new business was fast approaching, and I wanted to double the number of people I worked with coming into this new year, so I quickly built out a 3 month follow up campaign for sales appointments, I completely automated my onboarding process and I created a WOW campaign to make sure my customers were happy with my service.

In August 2018, I did not double the number of new clients; I tripled the number of new clients for that month. Yes, the automation worked like a charm. In less than 30 days I on-boarded 6 new clients.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I don't like that I have to use a third-party paid application like Zapier to have my Calendly appointments added to my prospect list. I do this manually.

I also wish that the iPhone Application (I'm still on the legacy version of IS) would allow me to work in my internal forms so that I do not have to be on my computer for sales calls.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Yes

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
I've been using InfusionSoft since the early days of the red & black logo. I became a partner in 2015. In August 2017 I pivoted my business and was no longer a partner. I was no longer using InfusionSoft or any other CRM for that matter. I know the value of time and automation processes. InfusionSoft does too.

In August 2017 I had no processes in place, and I only had two new clients that month. Fast forward to July 2018, after talking with Jillian Littlejohn about the progress of InfusionSoft and all the changes they have made to their Partner Program and the application itself, I thought I give it another go. Jill made me an offer I could not pass up.

My first year anniversary for my new business was fast approaching, and I wanted to double the number of people I worked with coming into this new year, so I quickly built out a 3 month follow up campaign for sales appointments, I completely automated my onboarding process and I created a WOW campaign to make sure my customers were happy with my service.

In August 2018, I did not double the number of new clients; I tripled the number of new clients for that month. Yes, the automation worked like a charm. In less than 30 days I on-boarded 6 new clients.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
I don't like that I have to use a third-party paid application like Zapier to have my Calendly appointments added to my prospect list. I do this manually.

I also wish that the iPhone Application (I'm still on the legacy version of IS) would allow me to work in my internal forms so that I do not have to be on my computer for sales calls.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful CRM for small businesses with plenty of features
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft keeps track of our customers in the CRM portion. I can tag clients, see their purchase history, review what emails they've received and processes they've been placed in, and more. It organizes our marketing: The Campaign Builder lets me produce wonderful custom flows.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The new Landing Page builder is great, but lacks some capabilities that standalone landing page builders have. For instance, I cannot copy elements from one landing page and paste into another page.

The software is so complicated that the learning curve is steep. They offer training to help with that. And their customer support is great.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft saves us from having a bunch of different programs: a CRM, an email sender, a campaign builder, a payment system. It's all in one.

all_reviews.review_title: Many features for basic and advanced campaigns
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Being able to attach contact tags through manual and automated functions is a standout feature for me. The tags allow us to sort through different characteristics of our contacts. We can add tags for a variety of things, such as how the contact was acquired, what their interests are, if they clicked a certain link, and basically anything else that matters to your business.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The price is relatively high. When we try to create complex campaigns that integrate third-party applications, things can get very tricky and may take a while to get working. To make sure everything is integrated smoothly may often require the expertise of an outside specialist.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
While the basic Infusionsoft can be very powerful, you should explore the application marketplace to search for apps that can bring even more value and time savings to your Infusionsoft campaigns.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We can keep in touch with our contacts on a regular basis without devoting a ton of human resources. Infusionsoft's automated features allow us to acquire and maintain meaningful information that enables us to create content that may be more engaging to our contacts.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The tracking links, order forms and product set up is easy to use. It is also easy to integrate other software into these order forms. I use these three functions the most but I also set up automated emails based off customer purchases. This is super easy to do as well and has been working excellently for me.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The cost  seems to be a little higher in comparison to other systems that I have seen. The cost is based on the amount of contacts that you have in your system but for smaller contact lists (such as myself) it would be nice to have the cost lower until you get up into the 2000 contact range.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It can seem a little complex at first but I can tell you, you're never alone. The customer service and on screen chat is super helpful and patient with all of your needs.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use the tracking links all the time to help myself and affiliates track traffic that each sends to the site. It's easy to use and takes a lot of the work out of it for you.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I started using Infusionsoft back in 2013. From the beginning, I have always loved their support. I can always get a hold of someone through their online chat feature or on the phone if I really need to. I have never had one of those experiences with them where you get frustrated because you can't actually talk to someone to get an answer to your problems.

The product has also come a long way in just these few past years. They are continually improving it and releasing amazing updates! It's so satisfying after giving feedback to actually see the recommendations you give being acted upon. You can really tell that they want to serve the small business community and are continually doing all they can to stay focused on that priority.


What do you dislike about Keap?
The two things I would like to see changed are their dashboards and their reports. Both have decent capabilities right now but it would be sooooo much more useful to have them be more customizable. They can feel limited when you really want to get in deep with them. However, there are integrations for dashboards and reports that allow you to do more.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Like others have said, this product is perfect for small businesses. If you are already a big business you will probably want to look elsewhere. However, if you are starting small and plan to get big, Infusionsoft is still a good place to start. Eventually you will have to migrate to a new system though.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Infusionsoft I am able to track interactions and data on my contacts all in one place, send emails to customers and leads, set up email and landing page templates, segment my leads and customers, set up automation to save time and nurture leads, and make sure none of my leads fall through the cracks. It really sets you up for more success if you use it properly.

all_reviews.review_title: The Ferrari of CRMs, but requires learning curve
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
You can literally automate anything you want in your CRM from clicks, actions, drips, campaigns and most importantly connect them all together.  Furthermore, you are able to integrate with many other platforms using a combination Zapier, IFFT or Infusionsoft's marketplace.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The price is high for what you get, but if you want the Ferrari of CRMs, you have to pay up.  This it not the CRM to use if you just want to send emails every week or month.  It's not worth the money, but if you want to automate your funnel from prospect to closing, this is worth every penny.  Of course, as long as you convert.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Look into the marketplace to create more automations in your business.  Not worth the money if you just want to send monthly news letters.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead filtering, Prospect automation, sales funnel management in real estate.

I love the campaign builder and the tagging power.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The email builder still is a bit glitchy and would like to be able to adjust text inline.  The API is a dog's breakfast and needs to be completely rewritten.  The store isn't very good and as such, I need to buy plugins to generate mobile-friendly pages.  Also, the sales funnel is so far behind the other industry tools I don't even sell it or use it. Integration with Stripe is non-existent.

all_reviews.review_title: Great CRM that covers all the bases and comes with excellent support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I really like the ease of campaign building and the many functions offered in Infusionsoft.  I have found it easy to use.  It also has a lot of features my business is not using yet, but I am glad for that as it seems that it will be a great tool that will continue to grow with us.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I dislike that when going into campaigns to make quick changes I have to stay on the page I made a change to for a minute or two until it autosaves.  In the past I have made changes that I thought were made successfully only to find out they did not save properly.
I do dislike that multiple team members cannot be in a campaign at the same time.  I don't know if this can be remedied, but we are a remote team and often it is helpful if multiple team members can look at a campaign at the same time.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft has everything you need and the chat support and webinars etc are very helpful as you learn to use it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
With Infusionsoft we are building our list and communicating with the members of our program.  It is very helpful to our organization.

all_reviews.review_title: An excellent CMS platform for small businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like how quickly we were able to get up and running with Infusionsoft. They provided us with straightforward instructions and training. The user interface is easy to navigate. If I have problems figuring out how to do something, I can easily look up articles with tutorials on how to work with different features.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Once you start adding more automations into your campaign, things can get pretty messy. If you're not experienced in programming, you can easily break campaigns. The publishing system won't always detect errors, especially when you're working with third-party party plugins. To be safe, you may have to hire a specialist, which is an added cost.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I think Infusionsoft can benefit almost any business. The pricing is a bit high, but it can be well worth it if you use it properly and often. Much of the effectiveness will come down to the actual services you offer and the way you create your marketing materials.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft has given us a platform to automate many of our core marketing systems. We can add new leads through signup forms on our website and send them periodical emails that we can create through templates. They have tags and other customizations that allow us to filter through contacts in a very specific way.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
We completed a trial version of New Infusionsoft and it was extremely user friendly and had most of the functionality we required for our small business in Australia. We were excited and keen to get started.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The basic feature of cc and bcc emails and an email template library did not exist.  We were assured that these features were there but just not visible on our trial version.  After asking for proof, I received screenshots showing this function.  I enquired why it did not look like my trial version and was told that after I signed up it would all be visible.

The moment I signed I determined this was not the case and emailed to ask what I was doing wrong but received no response.  After speaking with our allocated coach I was told that the New Infusionsoft did not have the functions I had been assured were.  The coach arranged for us to be switched over to Infusionsoft Classic.

Unfortunately, from a user perspective, I felt this fell far short of the trial version I had spent many hours testing. I found it to be clunky and was less than impressed.

Without having imported any data or set anything up I contacted my rep outlining the problem.  Again, no response.  I sent emails requesting if and when this functionality may be available - still willing to proceed if it was imminent.  Again, no direct response.  I sent another email requesting a cancellation of my account. Again no response.

For two weeks I have had no direct response to my request only a one line email requesting I suggest a time for a call.   After attempting to schedule calls on a number of occasions, no-one can be bothered to actually make a call to me or respond to my emails requesting a cancellation of the account.

The service levels are totally unacceptable.  Being a global company, surely they should be able to service multiple time zones without delaying 4-5 days between communication.


Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Double check the information given to specific requests and make sure you have assurances that you can cancel if the product does meet the promised functionality. Make sure this is discussed up front and who to contact if you want a response

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Despite have been billed for the first month and the onboarding we have not even bothered to set it up or book our coaching sessions.  My view is that if Infusionsoft is willing to mislead customers before they sign up and then ignore their questions once the deal is signed, this is not a company that I want to do business with.

all_reviews.review_title: Inspirational.  A great product, backed by knowledgeable, enthusiastic people.  I love Infusionsoft!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The package is generally easy to use and navigate, integration with our e-commerce and payment system was easy.  We were quickly up and running with our first campaigns.   Our on-boarding was excellent, quickly getting su through the basics and allowing us to focus on really getting our first campaigns working.
Infusionsoft has generated a level of accountability within the business that wasn't there before; we can see the results of our campaigns so clearly in the dashboard.

What do you dislike about Keap?
A minor point, but the image sizing set up on templates is a bit hit and miss.  it would be great if templates showed the image size so that you can drop a picture in that fits the design.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Do it.  Business has to connect with its customers.  Infusionsoft provides a great value, easy to use CRM platform that integrates easily.  Its great fun to learn too!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead development.  We're not there yet in realising the benefits because our lead generation needs tweaking, but we can see the pathway.  This will become our core focus in Q1 of the the next (Australian) FY; we have gotten the building blocks in place now.

Customer management; we're ow far better at connecting with our existing customers.  We've seen a four fold increase in online sales since launching on Infusionsoft.

all_reviews.review_title: Complete Package.  This is one of the best software for getting leads and marketing.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
There are so many things to be liked in infusion soft.  First, the tasks creations.  Instead of just setting a reminder on my calendar, I could set a specific task on a specific date.  Never missed anything.  Second, I love the auto emails.  It is set to work on itself without too much effort.  Third, the notification.  Everybody is informed.  Fourth, the tagging.  No need to go back from the start just to check the status of a client.  Lastly, I love the notes.  This is the best feature for me because it is our form of communication with other people involved in the process even we don't actually talk at all.  One can easily what is happening to a client recently and who did the task.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I still find it difficult to create campaigns, especially the complicated one.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
We recommended Infusionsoft to our partners and companies we have interactions.  This is also good to those who have personal online businesses

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Updating of clients information is still one of the hard tasks we were able to solve using infusion soft.  Moving them on with the next process is another thing.  With infusion soft, using tags, we can easily put them in the proper sequence without exerting too much effort.

all_reviews.review_title: Smart, intuitive and usable automated CRM - finally!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It works!  I've tried them all, and Infusionsoft is the one program that does what I need it to do consistently and flawlessly.  Best of all, after a short learning curve and some kind coaching, I can do it myself!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Could have a prettier user interface, but I see that's been addressed in the latest edition.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Get a live demo of the latest version, then work with a Certified Partner for training and implementation.  The added support is worth every penny and will pay for itself very quickly.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keeping front of mind with my prospects and engaging them with a relevant message that promotes sales was my biggest objective, and that seems to be Infusionsoft's sweet spot.  Automated marketing campaigns run when triggered, and I get an alert whenever a prospect takes action. So, I'm always able to pick up the phone and make a call at exactly the right time.

all_reviews.review_title: A very versatile and easy-to-use email marketing platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like how quickly we can get set up and start building campaigns. Infusionsoft has a few campaign template you can use to get a basic campaign going. The templates give you a good understanding of how general campaigns are programmed and help to spark ideas about what you can do in your own campaigns. The user data we can is extremely helpful in letting us know how effective certain emails are. The data helps us to make adjustments to future emails.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Once you start making the campaigns more advanced, like connecting them with third-part applications, the campaigns are more likely to be faulty and Infusionsoft doesn't always know how to fix the problems. You might have to spend more money on hiring an Infusionsoft specialist. The fees are already high, so having to add more fees is a drag.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft can be quite costly, so you should definitely so as much research as you can before signing up. To get the most out of your training sessions, I'd recommend you learn as much about the basic tools and features as you can on your own and then spend the official training time going over more complicated issues.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were able to set up effective email campaigns that would send out emails at specified intervals. Our Infusionsoft campaigns, which are run automatically, allow us to stay in touch with our customers and leads in a way that is generally engaging and not too overwhelming. We saw a pretty sizable increase in website activity and sales since we started using Infusionsoft.

all_reviews.review_title: Overall Good, A few tweaks would make it better
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Automation of emails to clients. Also being able to track what has been opened and what has not.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Referral program is difficult and clunky. Missing contact fields, like their instagram profile name. Running reports I can't always get all the info I need in one report, like an IP address in a sales report. The shopping cart needs a lot of work. You should see the number of promotions we have set up b/c of the limitations in how they can be created. You almost have to use another program, like woo commerce or shopify in order to have a functional storefront.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email automation and follow up is a breeze and has been a life saver for us.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft has turned a not for profit business  around
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The Functionality is great - it delivers what Infusionsoft claims and certainly meets my expectations - which I  have to admit  are high.

The implementation  Support  is awesome - from signup and the introduction at the beginning, right through to support for  advanced functionality. The success my last client has gained from implementing Infusionsoft has extensively exceeded my and their expectations. I could not have done it without them.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Getting advanced functions heard, understood  and addressed is often hard.
It is impossible to meet all demands - I get it - however sometimes I would need to push for the support staff  online chat to go and ask the senior team for input. When they went to do this , I always received  the answer - " no we cannot do abc,  but how about we try to do xyz."

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I know there are other software systems that claim to offer what Infusionsoft does -  the issue for my clients and I  is not  "Does the software do what  Infusionsoft says it will "  Rather it is "How will Infusionsoft help me to get the most out of their overall software AND help me implement it into my business?"  In response to this question - Infusionsoft definitely leads the market. Their help and support has enabled my last client to save up to 30% of their  admin costs; increase their people capacity by more than 60% and is starting to help them to build better relationships with their members. Indeed a turnaround for the UK based not for profit.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automation of simple business automation leading to increased productivity because my people  now have the time to think about important issues.

Ability to respond appropriately and personally to member / customer / prospect  interactions  means our communications are relevant, to the point of interest and we get fantastic response statistics and results.

It is a flexible system which means I can be as simple or as complex as my business needs it to be -  and it still works quickly enough for me.
The best part by far of all my dealings with the "Help Chat" team - who I know all by name now and visa versa{(:)} is that in 90% of the time they were able to solve problems or steps I could not work out - and just help me to Infusionsoft working for me. This includes questions from the really silly to really complicated. - all handled well and with a high sense of humour which I need.

all_reviews.review_title: High skill cap, but a very powerful tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft's drag and drop email/follow-up builder is nothing short of spectacular. Their support staff (depending on who you get) is also very helpful!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Sometimes the support staff doesn't think outside the box, leaving you to come up with solutions on your own. The software also glitches out sometimes as your sequences become massive. We have a sequence with 100+ items and it sometimes won't load properly when editing.

Their affiliate tracking data is also very subpar.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft is great for small businesses starting out. It's not as expensive as some people make it seem to make it for the amount of power that you're able to get out of it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed a powerful legacy follow-up tool as well as affiliate tracking for our sales pages. Infusionsoft is taking care of both of these for us, AND integrating with Memberium (our membership plugin) to create a fully customizable membership site.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Client capture and email blast scheduling is so important. Infusionsoft allows you to easily integrate these processes with your website and pos. You can create customer forms, email campaigns, and view analytics all in one place.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It is a bit hard to navigate. This is something that takes a little training. Without prior knowledge it would be difficult to jump in and figure things out. I also tend to have to trouble shoot things a lot which takes time. There are times that I am working on an email campaign and I think I have everything covered but something is missed or forgotten. Also when viewing campaigns, they tend to go off screen and you must re position the screen in order to view your work space.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Look at some online tutorials and test stuff before publishing or sending! It also may seem expensive but ROI is worth it. Especially with all of the analytics.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft has helped us get up-to-date in our email marketing and organization.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft's landing pages and web forms are great.  We also like to look at all of our clients at a glance on the app.  I like the ability to download lots of info easily.  I can get a csv easily of names and numbers only....names and addresses....by tag, etc.  This gets needed info to us very easily.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The forms on the landing pages don't store any virtual field info.  Fortunately I learned this in time.  You must use tags to in order to make any of the virtual fields you add to landing pages usable.  Otherwise, the info disappears.  I am hoping INfusionsoft comes up with a form that shows up on each contact that fills it out (similar to the web forms).

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Use the tag system properly from the beginning.  If you don't start out right, it's a mess.  Fortunately the tech support stopped us from going down the "bag tag" road too far.  We were able to re-group and set up a good system for tag organization and implementation.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are keeping in contact with our prospects much more efficiently and more often.  We have already seen the results of email campaigns with a 30% increase in attendees at our last conference.  We also hope to compile many different databases into INfusionsoft over the next few months.  This would integrate our 3 sub companies that we have to all have info in the same place.  This has been needed for some time.

all_reviews.review_title: It's great if your business is relatively simple
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The campaign function is the backbone of Infusionsoft and what so many others have copied to build their marketing automation upon. Tags are key to triggering actions and make segmenting your contacts as powerful as you could ever hope for.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Since it's been around for 13+ years, there are some legacy systems and infrastructure that limit it in annoying ways.
First, the limit of 100 custom fields is so restrictive, especially when trying to capture robust data on customers through surveys.
The shopping cart is completely useless. Why they haven't updated this is beyond me as it forces companies to use 3rd party carts that have to pass data to Infusionsoft to trigger all manner of follow up and segmentation. The API is clunky and requires pretty advanced programming chops to use it, too. So if you want to integrate something that isn't connected to Zapier, you're going to pay a pretty penny to integrate it.
Their landing pages are lousy, too, forcing many to use a 3rd party app for that, too.
Finally, their throttling of emails has grown to a ridiculous level. If recipients flag an email as spam, they stop the campaign. I've had numerous clients unable to send broadcasts to paying customers because of this.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Work through your entire needs list to explore what features you actually need.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The ability to segment and follow up with contacts in a strategic manner through the campaign builder is very robust.

Finally, their throttling of emails has grown to a ridiculous level. If recipients flag an email as spam, they stop the campaign. I've had numerous clients unable to send broadcasts to paying customers because of this.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft has many great contact management and lead generations. The service is quite extensive with various features and settings that helps you really get a lot from your contact data. We can create newsletters that are sharp a formatted for email across various devices. We can customize the design of forms and uses tags to track contact activity.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft is quite expensive and may not be a cost effective choice for companies with basic email and lead generation needs. It can be very powerful with its automation tools, but setting up the campaigns can be very complex. You must be very careful to look over all the paths and actions with campaigns to ensure it's running properly.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
This is a powerful CRM tool that can be very valuable to your company. It may take some time to see a return on investment, but you should definitely reap some rewards if you're careful about setting up your campaigns.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We can monitor contact activity and acquire referrals in an automated, yet meaningful way. We're able to get our new customers better acquainted with our company with introduction emails sent right away. We can sell products and manage them in a centralized location.

It can be very powerful with its automation tools, but setting up the campaigns can be very complex. You must be very careful to look over all the paths and actions with campaigns to ensure it's running properly.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Keap:
review_question_answers.answer: This is a powerful CRM tool that can be very valuable to your company. It may take some time to see a return on investment, but you should definitely reap some rewards if you're careful about setting up your campaigns.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: We can monitor contact activity and acquire referrals in an automated, yet meaningful way. We're able to get our new customers better acquainted with our company with introduction emails sent right away. We can sell products and manage them in a centralized location.

all_reviews.review_title: Very complete online service for managing and emailing customers and leads
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft makes it easy to add contacts into your account through web opt-in forms that you can place directly in your website, through typing or pasting a name and email into some fields or importing many contact at once by importing a spreadsheet. I can tag specific contacts based on any number of criteria, like Lead from Convention, Website Lead, Asked about A service, Asked about B service, etc.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The price is a bit high. Some of Infusionsoft's basic capabilities can be achieved through other free or lower cost services. Creating and editing campaigns can be very complex, especially if you require a good amount of automation.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
This CRM system can be complicated, but once you set it up, it can be very powerful and valuable for your business. There are lots of tools that let you organize your contact details and give you data to analyze user activity and engagement, so you can adjust your campaigns to be more effective.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We can automate the gathering of contacts and activate email campaigns based on their profile and actions. Infusionsoft is very responsive and flexible and can adapt very well to contacts when set up properly. We're able to quickly design emails with various templates that are pre-formatted for proper viewing in desktop and mobile.

all_reviews.review_title: The Ferrari of Digital Marketing Systems
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Being able to set up a campaign and not have to worry about it every again. Upon mastery of the app, you become a marketing powerhouse. Able to conceive, design, implement, and see sales grow. Just awesome! Their landing pages have grown during the few years that we implemented this product and it is very simple to set up. Their online support is dynamite. They keep listening to the users and improving the services. I'm certain their is more I can add, but, space is limited.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The initial difficulty in learning, but, don't let that deter you. Once you master, it becomes a breeze!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Recommend that when you get an InfusionSoft app that you consider hiring a certified partner to help you set up your app. Additionally, after your app is set up, you should attend InfusionSoft U so that you can learn how to use the app. If you can afford it, hire someone to manage your app so that you can do what you like to do going forward.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
This system allows us to manage our membership and prospect for new members. It handles all our: lead generations, automated email responses, to billing.

I like the tagging system. I only need to have contacts entered once, but they can have as many different tags as they need so they can be on as many different lists as needed. I have also used Constant Contact, and get frustrated that you have to duplicate entries if people need to be on duplicate lists.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is so much functionality in InfusionSoft that I have yet to learn that it's even there/possible. I also get frustrated from time to time because there are things I can't do with the software (I call and talk to support and find things are impossible), but I have yet to find any software that is perfect for all my email needs. For example, if someone opts out of an email, it opts them out from all your lists, not just the newsletter they didn't want.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
How to organize contacts and make sure everyone is on the correct email lists. The nurture campaigns I have been able to set up are wonderful.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft is a must for your business!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love that everything I need for sales and marketing is wrapped in one integrated solution. Beyond that, Infusionsoft makes it so easy to create great looking emails and landing pages based on templates. And they keep adding features that allow me to run actions based on prospect behaviors, like sending a notification to sales when someone visits a certain part of my website etc.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Although the reporting features are robust, sometimes they are clunky and don't give me the kind of visibility I want from the campaign manager.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It's not just a software platform to handle your marketing and sales automation needs. They "get" the challenges of the SMB market and walk you hand in hand to building a scalable solution.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I've been able to consolidate all of my disparate lists into one centralized platform that handles all of my automated communication. And I've added to my list using Lifecycle Marketing strategies to capture leads from website visitors from just about every area. I can run a pretty sophisticated marketing program with just a marketing coordinator part time so it cuts down on costs while helping me build my top line and convert prospects to buyers.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
There is nothing good about this business.

What do you dislike about Keap?
They lock you in contract charging you monthly along with a $500 fee if you try to break out early. If you are unable to take advantage of your software, which is likely, it will be about a $2000 mistake, $2500 if you cut out early.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
High risk. If it's not right for you, you will be punished to stay in and continue paying their fees.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have realized some education benefits, not nothing worth the costs and the hassle of dealing with this company.

If they are right for you, it will probably be great.

If they are not right for you, you will be punished and forced to continue paying for their services for one year, and it will become a dead cost to your business.

Support is friendly, but it is offset by the terrible treatment you will receive under their contracts. I would even go so far as to call that practice predetorial.

Do your research on whether marketing automation is right for you, check out a couple of competitors first, such as hubspot. Watching some videos on youtube.

Infusionsoft, lose the predatorial practices and you might just be a good company.

Otherwise, if you're reading this, stay away from infusionsoft.

all_reviews.review_title: A steep but worthwhile learning curve.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The email automation tools are fantastic and offer a tonne of flexibility. Being able to see your entire campaign and all the component parts as a "map view" (I'm sure there's a more technical name for it) is a feature I couldn't live without. The recent updates to email styling have made Infusionsoft an even more valuable tool for us.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Their CRM is good from standpoint of seeing a complete overview of each lead and their interactions with your company. But I dislike how hard it is to just add and review basic notes - the text boxes are tiny and you can't expand them to easily read your own notes or the notes that others have added. I also wish I could add tasks and notes at the same time instead of in separate screens.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Learn how tagging works and learn to love your tags as early as possible. This will make segmentation of our audience(s) really powerful in the long term.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft solves our main business problem which is sending our automated emails to trial users of our software.

all_reviews.review_title: Outstanding tool, yet requires more-than-average experience to reap true value
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The visual campaign builder is amazing.  It provides the ability to literally DESIGN what the process should be from the moment you acquire a contact (prospect, lead, sale... any level), through to delivery and satisfaction of the customer.  Virtual hand-offs from one campaign to another are both possible and required to make the entire business-process-automation maintainable.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Of late (12/17 - 2/1), spam-bots are winning.  A bot will fill out a lead form, using a legitimate email and a bogus name, creating a bogus contact record.  You send a message (even a double-opt-in confirmation), but it's to a legitimate human who was subscribed by a bot.  The human will flag you as a spammer.  There are steps you can take to stop this, but they require additional, non-standard efforts to implement.

The tool is not hard to use but does require considerable practice and experience to use it well.  Imagine a large Lego set to build a spaceship.  With instructions, a 10-year-old can build it.  But if all you have are the parts (design elements), then it is unlikely that the spaceship is going to turn out well.  But once it's built, even a 5-year old can play with it.  So you really do need help with initial implementation and design with Infusionsoft in order for your own business to fly through the universe.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Don't make the mistake of thinking you can do it all yourself.  The reason Infusionsoft requires a partner to help with setup (Their kick-starter packages) is that they are more interested in your success than in having you purchase the product and fail.  Used well, that kick-start is the best investment you can make with implementation.  It's not like an automotive service-package that you may or may not use.  Rather, it's more like putting gas, oil, and fluids into the car before you leave the lot.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
After designing a campaign that tracked students through a 3-year program with yearly renewal, we found that our billing process had a hole, and many students never paid the next year's tuition.  The Infusionsoft campaign made this visible, netting us thousands of dollars in lost revenue.  The key here is that Infusionsoft is far more than just a CRM.  It's business-process-automation.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft University flipped the lights on for me!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The instructors & partners are excellent guides. They asked the right questions to help me understand how to create solutions for automating internal business tasks; understand how to create a solutions to help pull us out of a stagnant growth cycle.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I wish they provided a link to a re-cap video of the class to attendees. Would help big time when you arrive back home & need to brush-up on a section of the class.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
* Sign up for University before you start.
* Don't rely on the pre-built marketing campaigns at the beginning, invest in learning how Infusionsoft works before you can take advantage of the pre-built marketing campaigns.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
* Internal automation of tasks.
* Creating new leads with an automated campaign that continually feeds in new leads from our website, social media, etc.
* Don't need to hire new employees for a while.
* Frees up more of my time to focus on more important areas of our business.

Being a relatively new user, I am still intimidated by the amount of things that InfusionSoft does, and have yet to really take advantage of the whole thing. I'm working through their InfusionSoft University and I'm sure that will make the world of difference.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
The earlier you can get started with their University program, I'd recommend it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
At my company, we are using InfusionSoft internally to organize, manage and maximize our Sales & Marketing efforts. Once we've completed several campaigns for ourselves, and InfusionSoft University, we're already considering integrating this into our own offerings.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love that Infusionsoft is a one-stop CRM solution for my business. We tried piecing together services in the past, but Infusionsoft replaced them all. I love the campaign builder and how easy it is to work with.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I don't like that you can't create Landing Pages with custom URLs - Not www.landingpage.domain.com, but rather www.domain.com/landingpage

I would like more options for customizing shopping carts without hiring a programmer - a drag and drop designer would be AMAZING

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Don't listen to those who call Infusionsoft "Confusionsoft". It is a very simple product to use  and replaces every other CRM service out there. The company has made some HUGE improvements over the past year or so, including a drag and drop email builder and landing page creator that are just fantastic! Makes Constant Contact obsolete.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
CRM, DRIP campaigns, shopping cart, landing pages, and more

Infusionsoft offers us a one-stop solution to all of our database, CRM, internet marketing needs. We also use it to deliver several online coaching programs (in conjunction with CustomerHub) - it works great. All in all, even though Infusionsoft has a hefty monthly price tag, it also is less expensive than piecing services together! Plus, it's great to have one support team to  work with if and when we do run into problems.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft has saved us so much time and so many headaches
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
We love how it takes the human error element out of the mix.  It sends our customers the information they need, when they expect it.  We also use it for project management along the way.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The invoicing module needs quite a bit of work to compete with other companies when there are multiple products and different tax variables like Resale Licenses or Non/Profits and churches but if you have a simple sales pipeline, it should work great.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you learn how to set up campaigns on your own, it's invaluable and you can do so much.  We still only use it to about 50% of its capacity.  Our goal is to use it to at least 80% of its capabilities this year.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have employees coming in at different times who are no longer waiting for the other employees.  Most importantly it automates our follow up increasing our sales and retention rates.

all_reviews.review_title: Still the best for recurring e-comm subscriptions
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The title says it all. I've tried all the difference e-comm software out there for setting up and running e-comm businesses with recurring subscriptions and Infusionsoft is the most cost effective and powerful.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft is lagging behind in mobile responsiveness. Their storefront is unusable! You'll definitely need to setup your own storefront using WordPress and Inpressto. That combo with Infusionsoft is a very powerful and simple to manage e-comm system.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
In 2017 & 2018 Infusionsoft has refocused on product development and improvement and it's getting a lot of needed enhancements.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Recurring order subscription management is so much easier with Infusionsoft! If a customer call and needs to change their subscription details you can do that right in Infusionsoft. In most other systems you have to cancel the entire subscription and create a new one which includes recapturing credit card data. What a pain! Also other systems like Shopify won't do this natively so you end up buying extra add-ons.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the automation that Infusionsoft provides. From onboard campaigns to marketing campaigns you can easily transition leads and customers on the buyers journey.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I would like to see more development email builder, the reporting system, and the de-duplication process. Some more basic features and HTML abilities in the new email builder would be top notch. The amount of data IS has is staggering, but getting to it is somewhat of a pain. You really need to rely on 3rd party apps, such as Graphly, to really pull out the good data. Removing duplicates is a hassle, and when you import contacts there isn't a de-duplication step built into the upload process. It doesn't look for duplicates and it doesn't try to avoid duplicates records. It just shoves the duplicate record in and leaves you to manually do the de-duplicate process.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Be prepared to learn because there is a learning curve, especially if you are coming from something like MailChimp or My Emma, just and email marketing system, but the value is worth it. The better automation, CRM, and email marketing system that IS offers is worth it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I've been able to use IS for both external marketing automation for events and campaigns as well as internal automation for different processes that we have. It's been great to be able to employ it for different scenarios.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
My favorite thing about Infusionsoft is the endless capabilities to customize your setup specifically to how it fits your business.  You're able to enter in your contacts and easily connect with thousands of people without having to put a ton of thought into sending individual emails.  Once they're in the system, they are receiving specific emails that help stay connected and in the front of their minds.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The only thing I dislike about Infusionsoft is that if you have multiple people on one account, it can get a little confusing to keep track of who is who.  When your team starts is dumping in all of their contacts together and it get's up to the thousands, potentially tens of thousands of contacts, it can get confusing on who's contact is who's while looking at the widgets.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
My recommendation to other users considering infusionsoft is to have campaigns in mind - probably a few campaigns for different tings.  Example:  we have campaigns for buyers, sellers, tenants, landlords, potential clients, VIP clients, and much more.  Each has a specific plan on reaching out to connect.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft has relieved a little added effort in making quick contacts by using email campaigns.  Not only that, using great content has pushed some of my pipeline up by 6 months, which is obviously great for business.  Ultimately, Infusion soft has helped me get reconnected, stay connected, and stay at the top of mind of my contact database.

Stores tons of contact data that you can organize into different groups and tags and use for personalized emails for specific events, promotions, news, etc. Has many useful and easy to use tools for designing forms and newsletters. Lets you track campaigns and user interaction in a very complete way. Can setup very precise campaign actions based on user activity like opening emails or clicking links.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Some if it can be very technical so you might need a professional to come help implement certain campaign setups. Some designs are very rigid so if you really need to match forms to the look of your website, it can sometimes be difficult to do. The price is somewhat high.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you have the budget for it this can be the main service for all your CRM needs. You can also save data to use in different platforms if you need to be flexible. It's difficult to see how anyone couldn't benefit from using this software. Many great tools and third-party extensions to leverage the system.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Managing customer relations, automating communications and pushing content out to contacts in a very pleasant way. We save time and contacts only get periodical emails so they're not bombarded. We've gotten more positive feedback and conversions this way.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Has a ton of features and tools to get a solid CRM setup going and automated. Has Marketplace with plugins, extensions and such like schedulers, event calendars that integrate with data in your Infusionsoft account. Can set up campaigns that keep your customers, clients or leads in the loop indefinitely. Campaigns can react to actions by your contacts and logs instantly. You can use data to create new campaigns or redirect campaign path for specific contacts based on their actions or user profile.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I had some older campaigns set up that were outdated after systemwide updates. We can usually access older legacy features but they don't always mesh will with the current overall system. Though there are lots of online resources I sometimes get stuck with certain campaign setups that are difficult to work the exact way I want.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Kind of expensive but can be well worth it for just about any business. You can set it up to send a specific intervals to you don't bombard your contacts, which is one of the most problematic issues with email marketing in general.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Managing customers, clients, leads and other contacts is really easy with this platform. There is great detail and tools that allow us to levarage all kinds of data and tailor interactions with each contact. Saved a bunch of time and kept us within regulations.

The project manager assigned to help me get up and running is an external consultant.  Her training is in marketing campaigns - not in the set up and running of Infusionsoft.  Her training started at creating a campaign, not in setting up the contacts.  It's been a bit confusing - not unworkable - just a bit challenging.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
When you purchase this product, your support comes from external marketing consultants who don't necessarily have experience as an administrator of the product.

CRM; HIPAA secure communication; timed messages/alerts; client satisfaction surveys

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
InfusionSoft allows me to manage thousands of contacts through a complex tagging system. I am also able to send e-mail messages to these contacts based on their tags, create campaigns that upload and tag contacts and send them automated messages, and track e-mail metrics through detailed reports. I am also able to customize my e-mail marketing templates to my needs.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The only difficulties I have had with InfusionSoft revolve around technology glitches. There have been a couple times where the formatting of my e-mail messages, after they are sent, is altered slightly. They do, however, have a great customer service platform and a live chat option. People are always available to help. Unfortunately, sometimes they simply told me the problem was a glitch they were working on fixing and not something they were able to deal with right away.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I would definitely recommend Infusionsoft. Aside from the few technological glitches I experienced with the software, it has been a great service and immensely helpful to my business.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
InfusionSoft helps me solve a multitude of business problems. I can manage all of my contacts in one place, send e-mails to my contacts (or select contacts) using templates that are available on the platform or templates I created myself, generate complex campaigns, and check for duplicate contact records all in one place.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It has incredible capabilities for campaign building and email marketing.

What do you dislike about Keap?
To do anything is SO VERY COMPLICATED! I'm very computer literate and I'm pretty sure every person on their customer support staff knows me by name at this point because I have to call them to do literally anything I've never done before. It's very frustrating. I can't imagine in this day and age that something so massive and with so many uses could be so un-userfriendly.
In ecommerce, all purchases are listed under the credit card holder name so customers cannot make a purchase for anyone else, which happens frequently in our company. And the card readers, which are $50 each, do not accept debit cards or Canadian credit cards. We found this out the hard way, during a 500-attendee event we were running this month, in which half of the attendees were Canadian.

I could list many more examples but I'm so tired of how unhelpful this program has been from the start I'd rather not dig up all the time and inconveniences it has caused us.

I was encouraged to attend their 3-day University, starting on day 2, saying it wouldn't be a problem to catch up. I did attend, but even as a person whose job it is to frequently learn new computer software and systems, I feel as though without day 1, none of days 2 & 3 really stuck - they all built on day 1.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you have a need for email marketing and campaigns, take university and use the software non-stop until you understand it backwards and forwards. Take the extra class. I know it works for those purposes. Do not use it as an e-commerce platform. It's just not worth the hassle.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Honestly I think we have been trying to fit a square into a round peg.
It has not solved our problems. It has increased our problems, and dramatically increased the amount of time spent on each task we thought we could use Infusionsoft for.  It has only allowed us to make sales and collect information from customers, and even a "quick report" has proven to be extremely complicated.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: It has incredible capabilities for campaign building and email marketing.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
To do anything is SO VERY COMPLICATED! I'm very computer literate and I'm pretty sure every person on their customer support staff knows me by name at this point because I have to call them to do literally anything I've never done before. It's very frustrating. I can't imagine in this day and age that something so massive and with so many uses could be so un-userfriendly.
In ecommerce, all purchases are listed under the credit card holder name so customers cannot make a purchase for anyone else, which happens frequently in our company. And the card readers, which are $50 each, do not accept debit cards or Canadian credit cards. We found this out the hard way, during a 500-attendee event we were running this month, in which half of the attendees were Canadian.

I could list many more examples but I'm so tired of how unhelpful this program has been from the start I'd rather not dig up all the time and inconveniences it has caused us.

I was encouraged to attend their 3-day University, starting on day 2, saying it wouldn't be a problem to catch up. I did attend, but even as a person whose job it is to frequently learn new computer software and systems, I feel as though without day 1, none of days 2 & 3 really stuck - they all built on day 1.

all_reviews.review_title: Affordable and Well-Executed Alternative to Marketo
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft has a lot of great functionality similar to Marketo, Salesforce Marketing Cloud and other best-in-class marketing automation tools, but it's more affordable than those products without compromising much on usability and features. If you've used a marketing automation tool in the past, it will feel pretty intuitive and be relatively easy to transition.

What do you dislike about Keap?
As a former Marketo user, the campaign builder functionality is a little weak. I can do most of the things I want using the tagging system, however this requires a lot more manual work and data management on my part. Infusionsoft has a little way to go to be on par with the ease of automated campaign creation found in other similar tools.

The email builder is very easy to use, but is also very restrictive - you set three text styles (with a choice between about 10 fonts) and can't customize specific blocks of text. You can't export the HTML of an email you build in the builder. If you code emails by hand, you can do that with the HTML email builder, but the drag-and-drop builder is probably default for most, and severely limits your options.

Technical support in Infusionsoft is easy to reach through the chat feature, however I've found that I know quite a bit more about the product (even after just a few months of use) than the support team, so when I need answers about more technical issues, I have to look elsewhere.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft is a great product that continues to get even better. It does have some shortcomings, but the team seems relatively responsive to customer feedback and I feel confident any current issues will be addressed.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm using Infusionsoft for marketing automation. My campaigns are primarily email-based, but I've also used the voice broadcast feature, which was a unique and effective way to reach our audience. I'm using the tool to help automate communications, as well as trigger internal tasks that happen on a recurring basis. Benefits and tangible impact on our organization remains to be seen.

all_reviews.review_title: An incredibily cumbersome product to use
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The software does match up customer/prospects who provide their email with initial visits so we know where they are coming from.

What do you dislike about Keap?
- The system is cumbersome to use, both for novice users and power users.  Our novice users cannot get anything done and given up, and as a power user I find it takes about 50 times longer to do anything useful in Infusionsoft than if I had straightforward database access like SQL.  Its quicker to download everything to a csv file and edit in Excel on my desktop.
- The email system is overly restrictive about us sending emails to anyone who complains.  We have given up sending emails through Infusionsoft, and instead download the database and send email through another email provider that is less anal.
- Infusionsoft support is completely useless.  I have never gotten a useful answer from them, and most of the time they don't even understand the question. The answers on stackoverflow are much more accurate and informative than wasting time with Infusionsoft support.
- Using the product just seems to be constant annoyances - like the fact that their automatic signoff does not seem to be based on idle time, but just clock time.  So you can be in the middle of clicking menus, and all of a sudden get logged off due to 'inactivity'.
-

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We initially got Infusionsoft working to run trickle campaigns for out trial users, and that is about all it seems to be good for.

We have tried to use it for email campaigns, but it keeps on getting in the way, and we now use email senders.  We also wanted to use it for subscription renewals, but keeping the subscription data updated and accurate in the Infusionsoft is just more trouble than its worth.  I originally thought that was because we hadn't spent the time to sort everything out, but after spending more time in the second year of our contract, we have pretty given up and will be looking for another solution.

all_reviews.review_title: A great service which has improved my bottom line
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
What can I say?  The campaigns have allowed me to automate so much of my marketing and customer support and has saved me the cost of an extra member of staff.  The email broadcasts and the ability to sell via infusionsoft are also good but it is the campaigns which are the killer app.  THe 24/7 online help service is great too.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Occasionally it can be a bit inflexible.  Plus the order forms are not really mobile friendly so I have to use an addon service.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
You will need to put in a bit of effort to master this software but it is well worth the effort

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing, customer onboarding and support, email broadcasts - for marketing and my newsletters.  It is also connected to my online service so new members can be activated automatically and get their login and welcome emails.  Using Infusionsoft gave me a permanent increase in sales and income.

all_reviews.review_title: Intermediate/advanced user - with a 4 years experience
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Campaign automation is the Ferrari feature and the one with the biggest potential but even the obvious, easy-to-use features are still excellent, especially the sales pipeline. The system is very flexible and intuitive to use. The sales pipeline is often underestimated but it can bring in real money when sales team start using it properly. Another feature that's great is the API links. You can pretty much bolt Infusionsoft on to any cloud-based platform, especially websites so you can kick off automation based on web forms.

What do you dislike about Keap?
User admin is a bit clunky, could be better but it's not bad. Automates tasks that wouldn't get done. It means that tasks are absolutely reliably carried out every time so nothing gets missed. To get the most out of the system, you really need to invest time and effort into learning it properly although you can get a huge amount of benefit from really easy-to-use features too. It's worth taking the time to get the most out of the system though.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're prepared to put in the effort, the rewards are huge

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft automates tasks that wouldn't get done otherwise. It means that tasks are absolutely reliably carried out every time so nothing gets missed. It's easy to see what engagement you're getting with your prospects and customers, so ultimately leads to more sales.
