all_reviews.review_title: Solid Product For the Right Business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft is affordable and provides some pretty powerful marketing automation capabilities. The integration/partner network is impressive.  The landing page builder has come a long way.  You can make a sharp looking page in Infusionsoft now, which previously wasn't the case.  The all-in-one nature simplifies things vs having disparate systems.

What do you dislike about Keap?
While the automation builder is pretty good visually and easy to use, it's kind of limited.  There's a small number of behaviors you can automate off of compared to some other solutions. The reporting is kind of weak IMO.  Biggest gripe is the lack of customization on the CRM portion. Why can't we hide fields and move them around on the layout? A simplified CRM layout would make the product more usable.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you plan on being a big business, Infusionsoft probably isn't the ideal choice in the long run.  If you plan on staying a small business, it's a solid choice.  There's a lot of options in this market though, look around first.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
An affordable marketing automation and CRM system that could be deployed quickly.

all_reviews.review_title: good CRM for a small company
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
My favorite feature is the use of tags instead of lists to manage contacts. It may seem complicated at first, but it gave me much more flexibility to group and segment contacts.

I also like their landing pages which are easy to create and to embed on my website. They also offer templates and I can reuse landing pages I created in the past.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Some basic things are not so easy to do. For instance, I cannot create a form to capture contact info without creating a campaign. Since I don't always use forms for campaigns, I don't see why I have to create one.

Reporting is robust with many options but it's not very clear what each option does exactly. I'd like something more straightforward and even a wizard to guide me through different steps to generate reports. Also, it's not easy to share data with my manager who doesn't use InfusionSoft.

Tags can be challenging because several people can create different tags for the same purpose.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make sure you really need the features you are sold. We're not using everything and we only have a few users but we pay for 5 licenses.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps me manage contacts, I know where they come from and which landing pages or emails they read.

I can easily send emails to thousands of people and track results.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft is top of the live for Small Business Automation!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like how much I can do with Infusionsoft.  I can find value in some of it's simplest features, and then I can dig in even deeper and build custom campaigns that automate so much of my business!

What do you dislike about Keap?
With all the power that comes with Infusionsoft, you kind of have to understand how all the pieces fit together.  I've seen that it takes some people more time than others to understand how it all comes together.  However, I haven't seen any other system that can do all that Infusionsoft does in a better way.  I've used some enterprise tools, and those were Far more complicated to use and set up.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft is the top of the line automation tool.  It is powerful and thus it will require at least an investment of time.  If your business is ready for automation, it is well worth the cost, you won't find anything better for small businesses.  You can put together other solutions ala cart, but in the end you'll have to invest just as much time and constantly worry about all the integrations and timing.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I use a lot of "workflow automation" meaning that I have to do a lot of things in my business over and over again. I use Infusionsoft to automate those tasks.  I click a few buttons, and the task is completed (Sending emails/invoices, etc).

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Although I haven't dug in as much as the other reviewers, I like how Infusionsoft's boiled down the creation and visualization of your email campaigns to their simplest and intuitive form.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Their reporting feature needs some work. We've sent a handful of email broadcasts through IS, looked back for reports (with open rates, etc.) and found nothing. I asked about this via live chat (great feature) and their response was essentially "Sometimes this happens. We're working on it."

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're looking for a small to medium sized CRM, Infusionsoft is a sufficient option. I think their biggest strength is their customer support. Whether it's via live chat, email or phone, they're constantly on the ball and continue to impress us with how far they'll go to train and guide us on not just their product itself, but digital marketing in general. We've encountered some minor problems with day-to-day usage (missing reports, content formatting), but I don't envision switching to another CRM anytime soon.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft allows us to quickly and efficiently communicate with our diverse customer base. We've realized that messaging with a more personalized touch can drastically increase open rates and interest in the subjects we're discussing.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusion soft is a great program to use.  It is very easy to navigate, and it has made my marketing and sales operations significantly easier.  Especially when it comes to my ad campaigns, the prospective client  gets automatically added to the designated category, which would allow an automated email campaign to be sent out at designated intervals.  It has even made sending out mass emails significantly easier in a much better format than Mailchimp.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I don't like how I have to change my password every90 days.  however, I totally understand that. I wish it worked better on Safari as well (the email campaign feature).  I cannot create the emails in Safari, but I can do so on Google Chrome.

I wish the automated text messages did not show that it was automated (subscribe/unsubscribe option)

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Figure out what your purpose is when it comes to CRM.  This is my 2nd CRM and I am very satisfied and do not plan on switching over

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
marketing automations- sales funneling, automated drip email campaigns.  coordination with advertisements on Facebook.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft helps business owners run smarter and more profitable and productive businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like the campaign builder in Infusionsoft. It helps me lay out the steps of each piece of communication with my clients in a way that I can easily see and monitor. I also like the dashboard which helps me see the things I need to track at a glance as soon as I log in. I also love that my Infusionsoft ID lets me log in to all of my clients accounts as well as my own in one place. Duplicating sequences and pieces of sequences in campaigns helps me to get things done in a shorter period of time. Productivity at its best!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Some of the reporting is less than simple. We use the campaign builder a lot and the email reports don't show everything we want in one report. We have to compile some things manually. I also don't like that order forms are not available outside of campaigns. So if you forget where you put something you have to find it.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Learn how to use it in the way you need to use it. Or get support from someone who uses it well. It's easy to use when you understand how it all works.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Recurring payments are big with my clients and me, and that is great to never miss one that is due. Or to have automated actions that can take place when someone's order doesn't renew so they can be reminded or removed from a sequence or membership level. Copying campaigns and forms and emails also makes things very simple for a user, to duplicate complex campaigns or recurring events like webinars or launches.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Value for a Medium CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like that it has the capabilities of a larger CRM but isn't as complicated as an IBM similar product may be. Easy to import contacts from email services like mail chimp and constant contact.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I think what would make the infusionsoft product very valuable is a template import feature that allows you to easily upload contacts from mailchimp and other email services that match automatically with infusionsoft contact detail tags. Also the ability to transfer lead scoring by import and email open rates and other valuable history data. I wish there were more plugins with wordpress and other websites that made the infusionsoft platform more user friendly for woocommerce stores. I am using infusedwoo for a client and it doesn't solve all of the issues I am having. I also wish it was easier to incorporate affiliates with the same client. There is no way I see to use infusionsoft affiliates with woocommerce in an effective manor.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you are looking for a cheap but valuable CRM then here it is. Yes there are some things that is lacks but this also isn't several thousand dollars a month. You get a little more then what you pay for with this product and I see that as a win.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use infusionsoft as an email and campaigning solution for ourselves and clients. The benefits include staying in contact with customers and potential clients and using zapier with facebook lead forms to help turn prospects into customers. We can also keep notes about current clients in infusionsoft so the management team has a better overall view of clients that are serviced and recent updates to keep us all on the same page.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Automation through Infusionsoft has benefited our business in many ways. Being able to group and send communications and actually see if the attachments have been opened has benefited our communication division. Additionally, being an "in the field " industry any automation helps sales stay "in the field".

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft's mobile app isn't functional enough for our group. It loses notification abilities that are functional online. Our group is very mobile and needs to have full contact/task notification abilities on the mobile end. Logging into a computer to notify their manager about a note that was documented isn't feasible when they are in the field.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have solved the issue of sending communications and sensitive information to people that are no longer customers. We have also improved our automation process when following up on leads from events.

all_reviews.review_content:

I like its power, the ability to drive automation through tags. The ability to have so many integrations.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Nothing is perfect -  i would prefer more integration.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make sure that you have a clear path to integration with your other softwares. Consider spending hiring a strategic consultant ahead of implementing this. It is wonderful in that it solves MANY problems and keeps you from losing prospects. Helps you maintain customers. But it takes a powerful strategy to implement successfully. You will get the basics in the kickstart. You will probably need help.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The automation of the product and its scale (and ability to share on social media); if you're trying to run segmented campaigns to different prospective clients for slightly different branches of your business, this is an excellent choice. It also has terrific ability to automate follow-up within your organization, such as reminders to different staff about follow-up tasks and phone calls

What do you dislike about Keap?
Can be difficult to customize, not very user-friendly or intuitive

If you have the need to segment your marketing efforts and to automatically delegate follow-up, this is an excellent choice

all_reviews.review_title: Small Business need look no further!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The collaboration of learning provided by Infusionsoft University that facilitated growth.  Nothing beats chatting to others and being helped or offer same.  It was great to have so many experts from IS and other partners there to guide us as needed to succeed. Simply amazing stuff!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Snacks need to be more on the healthy side.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
1. Add up your hours to run all the different softwares and then add the price per month.  As Gerber said you need to be working on your business NOT in it.  2. Prepare content, content and more content.  3. Find a qualified IS partner that is FUN for you to work with.  All the partners seem very knowledgeable so get one that you can relate to. 4. Budget for a year, not a month the BOOM you will sky rocket.  5. Get some video equipment, you will need it to start.  Budget about $400 to start small.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are transfering all our "other" CRM, Landing Pages, affiliate programs and eCommerce all under one roof with Infusionsoft.
Benefits abound, central data, connectivity and support support and did I say support yet?

all_reviews.review_title: Like a Dodge Viper, Infusionsoft requires commitment and some muscle to get it in the right gear.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the community involved with Infusionsoft. The Icon event was amazing. There's a lot of cool features and perks to having Infusionsoft. I really like the campaign builder. Clate is an amazing guy and I would love to see what features he adds to IF.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I purchased Infusionsoft over a year ago and have still yet to understand all the aspects of running it.

We have a few support options 1) Spend time learning it yourself 2) Hire one of Infusionsoft's Partners at a steep cost to teach you in a hands on workshop or monthly retainer of $300 a month on top of Infusionsoft software costs. 3) Hire someone else to do it completely.

So, the options that looked enticing to me since I want to learn it is to pay $300 for the education monthly from a third party and to upgrade to E-Commerce for $300 a month. I'm looking at $600 a month on software alone which, can get expensive for a small business. That doesn't include all of the plugins like if you wanted to integrate a calendar, membership, and more. It is really like having the keys to a Dodge Viper and not knowing how to get it in the right gear so, it just sits in the garage.

I like what Infusionsoft is doing with The Greenroom and Knowledge Center by adding more supportive articles for small business.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you are a business doing 500K+, Infusionsoft may be right for you as long as you can afford to have an employee going through Infusionsoft University.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I've been able to automate my business more. I haven't been able to utilize it to it's fullest potential but, I believe in Clate Mask and the product and I know I'll figure it out.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I wouldn't waste my time writing a review unless I was vehemently angry at something is junk company did. I like that I now know what a completely incompetent group of humans are behind this program, and can share with this community and warn against wasting time, money, and sanity.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Where do I even start? I should've seen the signs when my account manager was unable to stick around long enough to answer some questions I had on the capabilities of the platform. If you have any inkling of how email marketing works, absolutely stay away. This program has glitches, their customer service chat team is useless - trying always to catch you in a "gotcha" moment when you figure out how to solve things for yourself. If you're an e-commerce retail business, and maybe you want to display products you sell, there are no functions to do this. Campaigns are overly complicated when they should not be, trying to implement logic into any of these things rarely work. The data reports you receive are good if you ONLY want to see what your open/click rate is. But if you want to see which portions of your emails are being clicked on - good luck. Let's say you want to increase your deliverability by not sending to people who never open your emails anyway - GOOD LUCK. That report is almost impossible to find. The customer service team will tell you whatever you want to get a positive answer: i.e. I asked if we could upload a .gif image onto the new builder: I was told "yes! no problem!" ... wrong. I found a work around, and they took credit for it. If you know anything about email marketing best practices, you're not going to be able to do any of them with the new builder (also the only mobile friendly way to build an email). On a more basic level, if you're someone who needs to multitask, you're going to find that that only causes more problems. No AB testing, so you end up creating your own lists (of which you need to export to .cvs, split yourself and re upload --- making your "contact count" sore (because why would a platform that touts expertise dedupe?) --- and then send multiples of what you want to test. Try sending these at the same time in different tabs: you're going to send your contacts double the emails.
Their deliverability sucks. They don't let you have your own whitelisted name (company via infusionmail) - etc. etc.
Needless to say, I canceled our account (something you have to request, and then wait for one of their even more incompetent customer service team members to contact you during your work day to deal with that). However, my company is paid up through the end of the month because of how long it took them to get to me - and you can't just be done without them talking to you first - FINE. I have more time to sort through the junk data they provide, get all of my contacts out of there, and move my stuff over to my new platform. NOPE. I tried to sign in and they have completely deleted all my accounts regardless of the fact that I have PAID almost $1,000 for this month to not even use this program for anything other than storage of contacts.
I emailed and called them, only to be told "oh we're working on it." OK. But. I paid for it. So... What now?

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Get your act together.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Solved the problem of identifying the worst qualities of a CRM/ESP platform.

all_reviews.review_title: So powerful, once you have a handle on it.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love how much Infusionsoft can do...it helps with email blasts, follow-up tasks/reminders, automated responses, file downloads, etc.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I dislike how confusing it is out of the box. I inherited the software from another employee when she left and I took over and it took almost a year, an ICON attendance, and a Foundation session to finally feel like I have a decent handle on it.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
My recommendation would be to take advantage of the free training and try to get as involved with things like the GreenRoom and additional plug-ins as you can!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The automation options are a huge bonus, especially with small teams. Also, the reminders/tasks are amazingly helpful! I get to spend my time creating content rather than thinking about follow-ups, the system will tell me who I need to follow-up with and when.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft is one of the best all-in-one CRM and workflow management tools out there.  I like that you can use the software for both email marketing campaigns and the status of matter I'm working on for a client.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It's an expensive program to start out with.  It requires a significant upfront investment and high monthly fees.  I think I should have held off on purchasing Infusionsoft until my business had grown a little more, instead of implementing it from the start.

There are also a lot of things Infusionsoft doesn't do well, such as their e-commerce functionality and their form-creation function.  I thought that Infusionsoft would be a complete solution for me, but I ended up needing to patch together a number of third party programs to create the solution I really needed.  The upside is that most programs interface with Infusionsoft through Zapier, so there is usually some way to accomplish your goal, although integrating third party programs can add a lot of unnecessary complexity.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It is advertised as an all-in-one solution, but I had to use several other programs and integrate them with Infusionsoft to create the type of functionality that I wanted from one platform.  That said, as far as I can tell, it is still the most comprehensive CRM/workflow solution out there for the price. They are completely dedicated to growing small businesses, which is evident in their customer service and products.  The customer service is great.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I'm a lawyer and use Infusionsoft both for marketing campaigns and to manage matters I'm working on for clients.  I think using Infusionsoft to automate workflow is where I see the biggest benefit, and also where Infusionsoft stands out from other CRM programs.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
When first starting out in the online world, I saw some of the bigger players using Infusionsoft so I thought it was great -- I mean even Damon from Shark Tank endorsed it so it must have been great -- nope. Just great marketing.

What do you dislike about Keap?
1. We run a subscription site and for almost a year, Infusionsoft never billed a good amount of our customers yet could not explain why not -- all while still charging us the monthly fee.
2. When we asked for a refund of our charges, we were ignored for over a month until we threatened to tell our extensive social network to run in the opposite direction of Infusionsoft
3. Email delivery was lackluster
4. Financial reporting was terrible - which is why we were unaware of the non-charging
5. Affiliate program was difficult to understand and reporting was terrible
4. We lost over $10k

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Don't do it. Go with Ontraport or ANYbody else!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We thought we were automating our processes but in reality, our business was made more complicated. Don't' get me started on their campaigns.

all_reviews.review_title: Heavy duty sales automation but do you need it?
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Automation of emails triggered by customer or prospect actions and / or triggered by time passing
You can hook it up to your website to capture stats about sign ups etc which is quite cool because you can then display them in the dashboard that you see when you first log on to the product.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Reports are difficult to define (for me anyway) and it's expensive for a company like mine which is quite small

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Take a long hard look at the product before committing - make sure that you understand the cost particularly if you have a large database of customers and leads - the price can be punitive but you are kind of locked in because it is a big effort to move away.  Make sure also that you will use all the features - we dont which is part of why I have a jaundiced view on the cost

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer and prospect tracking and nurturing

We've definitely got some love back from the customers

The topic was Social Media and CRMs.  The instructor talked about the varying levels of CRMs and placed Infusionsoft as the "Cadillac" of CRMs.  It was nice to be able to raise my hand and talk about my neighbor in Chandler all the way on the east coast on how it helps me be the market leader in the east valley!

all_reviews.review_title: Great for automating response emails for a variety of circumstances--in theory.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like the idea of Infusionsoft. It certainly lends itself well to the marketing arena. I like that you can automate cascading email responses for a wide variety of scenarios and that the interface is somewhat visual.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It's complicated software and there's a huge learning curve. It seems like the more complex a campaign is, the more buggy the system can get. I dislike that the process can be complex. It's hugely dependent upon people inputing the correct information. If one piece is not accounted for or input incorrectly, the whole process can fail. Because it is more complex, errors tend to happen a lot more often than expected. Even after a steep learning curve, it didn't appear to save time, given the number of incorrect emails that were sent out. I found it was no less work than managing bulk emails at the end of the day. It appears to work best when you have a simpler campaign with only 4 or 5 steps.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Even with the training courses, you'll want to use this daily to maintain familiarity with it. Once the steep learning curve is conquered, I hear it's fabulous software.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We thought we were solving email responses to particular services rendered. Unfortunately, 20% of the time, the wrong email was sent out, even when the correct code was used to begin the process. Most recently we were attempting to integrate Infusionsoft with a third party software (Dentrix)  that we were told would work together.  It took a month to work out the bugs, leaving us 1 month behind in our roll-out schedule. If we'd have known, I'm not sure the client would have chosen to go with Infusionsoft.

When is the new landing page builder arriving?????

all_reviews.review_title: Great tool but not without issues
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like being able to set up campaigns that run the full year making sure the customer is kept in the loop. With proper tags I can see that things are running smoothly.

What do you dislike about Keap?
1) Support. If you are in the US I am sure that support is much better but being 9 hrs ahead of the IS HQ I am usually stuck with the total waste of time 'Chat Support'. Two years ago support would have gotten 5 of 5, today I would give it one star at best.
2) The platform is about 5 years behind the times. Powerful but the look, usability, and feel are dated. If they don't get on this in the next year or two I would expect serious competition to start circling.
3) They remove useful tools, replace with simplicity, and then pat themselves on the back for their own awesomeness. I can write a book about the lack of flexibility in the new (1 year) email builder that was stripped of most of the designing strengths. When they added the ability underline text 4 months in (seriously) they cheered themselves to no end. How email builder was rolled out without the ability to underline is a headscratcher and I am never going to stop complaining about the removal of the HTML snippet.

***Sorry, it's always easier to remember what you don't like than what you do.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
For the price and what it does, we have yet to find a better solution. I believe in the product but wish they would work harder on fixing current problems rather than rolling out new tools. It does take some time learning the ropes but there are lots of great tools, webinars, and people willing to help. It's a great community.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have annual contracts that need reminders about renewal which we automate through IS. Our renewal rates have greatly increased once implemented. Running an NPS campaign we are able to judge satisfaction and uncover problem areas that make be festering.

3) They remove useful tools, replace with simplicity, and then pat themselves on the back for their own awesomeness. I can write a book about the lack of flexibility in the new (1 year) email builder that was stripped of most of the designing strengths. When they added the ability underline text 4 months in (seriously) they cheered themselves to no end. How email builder was rolled out without the ability to underline is a headscratcher and I am never going to stop complaining about the removal of the HTML snippet.

It's like our one-stop shop. The integration abilities are quite dynamic, and allows us to automate so many tasks and items that would otherwise take up too much time to do manually.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The mobile app is in desperate need of an overhaul. The camera function would often crash, and can only scan a certain number of cards at a time, as I believe they are still manually transcribed into the CRM.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Get training, soak up as much knowledge as you can, review changes often. It's nicknamed "confusionsoft" for a reason, but once you get a firm grasp on the platform, the sky is the limit!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Running campaigns and client engagement. The tagging feature is super convenient as we can literally classify contacts into certain campaigns with a click of button, or attributing another tag. The automation features have introduced a more feasible way to scale, through automation and integration with our other platforms.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft is a powerhouse of a machine. It's open API allows you to plug almost anything into it. It's price point is incredibly reasonable for what it accomplishes.
It's the perfect tool for a company with a sales process, sells something digitally, or has a ton of contacts to manage and monetize.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft is not easy to just jump into. It takes real time to learn, and it's most effective when you pay for someone else to build your ideas out.
If you think you're just going to be able to sit beach side and let Infusionsoft bring in the money right away, you're delusional. If you're mad that the system didn't work right away for you after a month, you're also delusional.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Please don't think this is an easy to jump into software. Have the resources - time and money - to invest in it. Once you do, the ROI is amazing.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Infusionsoft for all lead capture and nurture. We also use it for our Sales Pipeline via mobile. It's easy for our sales team to manage their opportunities via the app. We also have been able to track where leads are coming from, and track conversion back to those referral sites. We now know where to invest our time and money in regards to advertising and social. Some platforms work, some don't.
We also track our conversion process stage to state. By using this feature, we were able to troubleshoot bottlenecks in our sales system, optimize, and convert higher. It has definitely been worth it to train the team, and implement.

What do you dislike about Keap?

If they would be able to compete with the likes of constant contact and email sending services, it would really put Infusionsoft over the edge.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The number of options available per contact is helpful, and I especially enjoy the file box option to upload related files to each contact. The email campaign templates are very well designed and plentiful and have the option to be sent immediately or at a scheduled time. They allow for a customized dashboard which is helpful.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The user interface is not as friendly as I would hope. The email campaigns are difficult to set up and there is not a lot of integration with other programs I utilize. You are not able to view all of your notes at once - the appointment box opens a little but is not helpful if you are currently on the phone with a prospect or client. There is an InfusionSoft store but a lot of the decent tools you need to pay extra for - and it is not easy to view your active funnel.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Check to ensure other software your company is utilizing has the ability to sync with InfusionSoft. If you are looking for a software for email campaigns, InfusionSoft does offer a lot of great templates. The campaign itself can be difficult to set up but they work well. It also offers the ability to tag based on behavior, type, etc which is helpful when segmenting your database.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Monthly newsletters to prospects are scheduled and sent through infusionSoft. It is easy to set up and the generated reports help to identify who is opening and click our call to action - which is similar to most if not all CRM systems. Having the file box for contacts has been extremely helpful when working remotely or needing to find quick information.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: The number of options available per contact is helpful, and I especially enjoy the file box option to upload related files to each contact. The email campaign templates are very well designed and plentiful and have the option to be sent immediately or at a scheduled time. They allow for a customized dashboard which is helpful.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: The user interface is not as friendly as I would hope. The email campaigns are difficult to set up and there is not a lot of integration with other programs I utilize. You are not able to view all of your notes at once - the appointment box opens a little but is not helpful if you are currently on the phone with a prospect or client. There is an InfusionSoft store but a lot of the decent tools you need to pay extra for - and it is not easy to view your active funnel.

review_question_answers.answer: Check to ensure other software your company is utilizing has the ability to sync with InfusionSoft. If you are looking for a software for email campaigns, InfusionSoft does offer a lot of great templates. The campaign itself can be difficult to set up but they work well. It also offers the ability to tag based on behavior, type, etc which is helpful when segmenting your database.

Having the file box for contacts has been extremely helpful when working remotely or needing to find quick information.

all_reviews.review_title: Great Product for Small Business or Solopreneurs
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
There are many bolt on's that allow you to do pretty much whatever you need. There is also an open API that allows you to connect any custom software you might want.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Steep Learning Curve. The landing page builder is weak at best.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It's a great software but you really need to be dedicated to it.  If you don't have time and need something fast then use clickfunnels. If you have someone one staff that can focus solely on infusionsoft then definitely go for it.  If you are a large company then I suggest Adobe Marketing Cloud.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Retention marketing and funnel management have improved greatly. We have two full-time programmers on staff to really get the most out of it though by linking our analytics package and communications bolt on's and then we custom code landing pages.

all_reviews.review_title: Great sales & marketing software for small businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The drag and drop campaign builder is by far my favorite feature, but I also love that I have everything related to contacts in one system (CRM, Campaign Builder, and ecommerce) so I get a full record of my contacts.

In other words, the segmentation available in Infusionsoft is really good and allows me create hyper-targted campaigns and follow-ups based on my prospect's and customer's behavior and purchasing history.

The community of other users, partners and apps is really good considering this is a tool built for small businesses.

You can find my full review of the software here: http://www.blickdigital.com/ultimate-infusionsoft-review/

What do you dislike about Keap?
2 main things: There's no ability to split test emails and/or campaigns and the reporting isn't very good. There's a lot of little things here and there that pop up, but for the most part, those things can be fixed with 3rd party plugins.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Continue learning and have someone as a dedicated person who will be the admin and marketing person. Otherwise, it will collect dust.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Centralizing a place where I can store my contacts and see a history of the marketing and sales. The tool allows me to automate follow up with prospects and customers.

all_reviews.review_title: Lots of features but can be very complex.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I really like how customizable emails are within the campaign platform. It's also really great how in depth the tagging system is so you can really keep track of those who buy from you, click on your email links, etc.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It's very complex for anyone who is looking for something simple. It's definitely best for anyone who has email marketing experience and is willing to go through some hours of training to learn the software.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Consider if the higher price is worth an all-in-one CRM and email marketing platform. If you don't have a lot of time to set up a new email marketing platform, don't switch. It takes quite a bit of time to really set up some pretty email and comprehensive email sequences. But it can really improve your business.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Our emails are now all automated and it's very nice to be able to tag all of our customers according to what they've bought or how they've responded to our email marketing.

This is not an ordinary CRM. Infusionsoft can be custom programmed to deliver highly responsive campaigns and workflows. The campaigns can send reminder for you and your team or the client at each phase of the deal, or keep leads engaged and mindful of your presence on the back end without your active involvement.

What do you dislike about Keap?
though it is a graphical interface, the programming concepts are often counter intuitive.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
The programming concepts are counter intuitive. Conditional elements should be more logical like IF THEN statements. For example there is no way to do loops without resorting to workarounds with tags.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Constant contact with leads and clients. Automatic workflow reduces the chance of missing  a step of forgetting it.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful Tool - Can be a bit Clunky at Times
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
By far my favorite part is the email automation. You can set up journeys for your customers to take that will lead them through an automation funnel, and react based on their interactions with your marketing. We also love that the API allows us to automatically send new customer data into the system for easy integration.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The WYSIWYG email editor can be a bit constricting at times. If you have a specific look you're going for, it's not always easily achieved. I spent many hours hacking away at workarounds to do what should be simple tasks. UI could be updated, looks a little out of date.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Be ready to put in the time to get this software implemented with your systems and be patient when building out your automation flows.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We mainly bought Infusionsoft for the ability to automatically add new users and start on-boarding them immediately. Combined with the cross-sell and up-sell abilities, Infusionsoft can be a powerful tool.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent for small business marketing automation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Small businesses often can't afford the likes of Salesforce and Marketo but they need marketing automation to convert leads effectively. Infusionsoft is the best all-in-one CRM/marketing automation software for the starting price of $199/month.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The analytics tracking is not ideal, however, you can input a lead source and there is ROI reporting. If you want complete analytics with the original source for paid advertising and organic search tracked, you just need to add Wicked Reports.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Most small businesses don't realize they need more than a CRM; they need affordable marketing automation, including lead nurturing by behaviors, responsive landing pages and web forms. Infusionsoft's marketing automation is excellent. It's CRM is easy to use. The ecosystem of services to integrate, add membership sites and analytics is also excellent. You can do everything the "big guys" can at a fraction of the price.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Most small businesses wonder why their advertising isn't working when the real problem is that they aren't converting the leads they get. I have seen businesses grow by 30% or more in one year by capturing and nurturing leads in Infusionsoft. I use Infusionsoft for my own marketing and I've experienced even more growth than some of my clients have.

all_reviews.review_title: Great software automation tool (but with some headaches)
all_reviews.review_content:

The campaign builder is quite flexible, however  you need to really understand how it works in order to create more complex campaigns. The tagging system also allows for great flexibility and adaptation to business and reporting.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The reports are awful! It gets a little better with the built in dashboard (that may be an headache to set up) and with the possibility to plug in a third party dashboard.

The campaign builder is terribly slow, so arm yourself with a lot of patience if your are going to frequently create or adapt campaigns

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Prepare a tag naming strategy, the system relies heavily on tags and without a naming strategy it gets hard to manage.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation at affordable price. Lead scoring and qualification

all_reviews.review_title: Mass e-mail for marketing - great in theory
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Their training and customer service/support is top notch. They are quick to respond, you do not have to pay for additional support and are incredibly helpful.

What do you dislike about Keap?
This software is not easy to use, at all. It is not user friendly, it is hard to replicate if you are waiting significant amounts of times between campaigns and has a slow learning curve. There are also some small feature that make using the software difficult, like when importing and selecting contacts to send your campaign to you have to either select all or select none. It's very irritating when trying to stagger a campaign.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make sure the person using this software has tech skills and has a lot of time to devote to the campaign building.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
This software has enabled us to create a mass contact campaign and stagger it so our sales team isn't bombarded by too many inquiries at once. It also allows us to send multiple follow up emails automatically.

The workflow process was confusing and limited in capabilities. We really wanted more customization for what we were paying per month.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make your rep walk you through specific functionality you are looking for before you buy. The cancellation policy is really bad and we're going on 2 months trying to cancel still with no resolution.

Our goal is to simplify more complicated sales processes for clients. We've found other automation software to be more customizable and cost-effective than this. Mailchimp has really stepped up their automation game and we've decided to move more of our clients to that platform.

It's Campaign Builder is amazing. It allows you to automate your marketing in a whole new way. It's simple enough for anyone to use, but sophisticated enough to do some real, heavy-duty marketing automation.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It's sales funnel support. Tracking where someone stands in the sales process is doable, but clunky. It's cumbersome to store meaningful information. If it integrated with Google things would be a LOT better.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automation. We've been able to track hot prospects and reach out at opportune times due to the tracking Infusionsoft provides.

all_reviews.review_title: Lots of possibilities, but not very intuitive
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
There is so much you can do with Infusionsoft that we haven't even tapped into, so all that opportunity is exciting. The support team is GREAT!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Every step takes so many clicks! Creating an email campaign takes forever because you're constantly having to go back and forth between all these different areas. There is also no easy way to get a report of opens, clicks, etc. The reports that are produced are not visually appealing and are hard to understand.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Take a lot of time to explore all the features.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Content marketing has been our biggest use. We are also using it more now for lead follow up/sales.

The platform would be good for really small businesses who are just starting out. It's a good starting point.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The platform is not built for anyone who has experience deploying automation campaigns. It lack flexibility in template design and customization.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Do you research and compare features, functionality and price.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation. We were able to launch the campaign for our client, but it took a lot of extra work to get the platform to do what we needed it to. We ended up creating a lot of assets outside of the system due to the issues in customization of template, etc.

all_reviews.review_title: Sophisticated Sales and Marketing Processes Made Easy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft allows you to lay our complex sales and marketing processes in an easy to understand way with their campaign builder.

What do you dislike about Keap?
While the processes are able to be set up in an easy manner, it is time consuming to build them all out - especially if you have a lot.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Be sure to know your needs before looking into Infusionsoft. Make sure the campaign builder, email builder, etc. are actually what you need. Infusionsoft has a lot of features and it can be overwhelming if you don't know what you're looking to accomplish.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing nurturing and inside sales processes. With Infusionsoft, we are able to create a seamless process from top-of-funnel lead to client.

all_reviews.review_title: Great value for a great price!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
InfusionSoft makes it so easy to make beautiful e-blasts as well as landing pages. Setting up the automation is very easy, it is just the creative part that is tough for us. However, they have many great automation templates to start you out. Also the customer service has been great, we had on boarding, then a free marketing consultation after a few months.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I am a Mac user and the only complaint I have is they do not currently have a plugin for Mac's that get your email to sync in the CRM system. They DO have one for PC's just not Macs yet.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you need a great CRM with Marketing Automation at a great price, InfusionSoft is the way to go. I love they have a big network of small business owners that use the system to help onboard you.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
InfusionSoft helps us keep our contacts, and sales pipeline in order, but the biggest benefit has been the marketing tool. We haven't utilized the automation as much as we would like to yet, but the beautiful e-mail templates have been great to stay in contact with our customers.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
We're still playing around and only using part of the capability. Learning curve is not small - but then again neither are Salesforce or similar products. There's tons of information on the blog - if only we had time to watch the videos... My team is looking forward to knowing more, and doing more.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Getting the system setup. The initial on-boarding person was helpful - maybe too helpful (i.e. wished we had had more time to tinker on our own, rather than being given solutions).

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Prepare before your implementation call - ask questions so you know exactly what path to take. Don't rush implementing but rather plan out your strategy and path thoroughly.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
e-newsletter dissemination and customers tracking.

all_reviews.review_title: I am truly shocked of the poor customer service & software limitation
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
infusionsoft is an ok software with surprising limitation in the eCommerce section

What do you dislike about Keap?
infusionsoft is an ok software but DON"T you dare get the Kick Starter campaign. I spent $2000 and got very basic training and I was left with no finished campaigns or any help after my Kick Starter campaign hours has finished ... here's my feedback of my last 3 month of interaction with infusionsoft software & staff

My Kick Starter coach was not well informed or experienced in my business area and didn't have clear recommendations for me, we ended up going around and around in circles, with very little to show as a result of the time I have put into this.

I was always rushed and told on every call that we need to move fast ... How do we move faster when I am not provided with relevant recommendations?

When I complained and asked for refund of my Kick Starter money, my account manager didn't care and had very little to offer for compensation and asked me to pay extra $200/h for extra help

infusionsoft has surprising limitation in the eCommerce section, apparently you can't do simple stuff like adding a link to accept terms & condition on order cart without spending $1000 to ask a developer to give you a custom code in addition to so many things that seams very basic with any other eCommerce platform ... I am currently using WooCommerce and I find it 100 times better than infusionsoft eCommerce

Finally .... I am truly shocked how come a multi million dollar company like infusionsoft treat their customers like this and would not recommend this software to anyone specially if you are a small business or don't have much of technical experience

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I would not recommend this software to anyone specially if you are a small business or don't have much of technical experience

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
sales funnel automation

What do you like best about Keap?
The ability to track so many different things, including campaigns and also works as a CRM. I like the support available - if I ever didn't know how to use it, which was almost always, then there was support on the website I could look at to get some help.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It's super complex, so it takes some time to get in to. I find it to be a very complicated software but thankfully there are lots of tutorials and help pages! Also, it's SO expensive to get, especially the upfront initiation fee, so it's not realistic for small businesses to use.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Really read up on it and check out the tutorials/support online. There's SO MUCH available to use in Infusionsoft, you just need a little training and a little nudge to be able to use it to its full potential.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?

What do you dislike about Keap?

all_reviews.review_title: Tough learning curve, but extremely powerful software.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The API allows you to really customize and work with data in whatever way makes the most sense for your business.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The API is throttled to prevent users from overloading the system, which is good and forces you to code efficiently (or inefficiently for some workarounds), but the limitations don't scale with the size of your business. If you're paying for 500,000 subscribers, you should be allowed to use more API calls. Also, it'd be nice if the throttling was more transparent. The systems should allow me to see how many calls I have available/have available through my app dashboard or through an API call.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
This is an excellent product, but get someone else to set it up for you. Someone with experience building campaigns, and preferably someone who can work with Infusionsoft's API.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
This software allows us to automate every piece of communication from our company (e-mail, direct mail, texts, voice blasts, telemarketing phone calls, tasks, etc.

I am not sure why I seem to have some faith in this product considering my experience has been poor.

Make sure you have time to spend with set up as the team at infusionsoft does not play well with others.
The software is pretty much being self taught as the paid for services did not get done by infusionsoft.

none yet

all_reviews.review_title: Extremely flexible, responsive, and easy to learn
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love this platform. I was tasked with learning it at a previous employer, as they had been outsourcing the work to a very expensive consultant. I was able to learn and re-build our marketing tracks in about 4 months. It's got a drag-and-drop interface and simple controls. The support is EXCELLENT (instant chats with an employee) and is a big part of why I like the platform.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It's simple. There's nothing like Salesforce-level integration without LOTS of third-party apps, and I still think it's not even close. That being said, this wasn't really an issue for us, and since it costs a fraction of what Salesforce does, it's well worth the money.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Attend ICON in Phoenix next year. I learned so much about what was possible there.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed an automated marketing system that crossed platforms and devices, tasked employees, and was able to send both mail and email. We also use it for our online sales, but only so much as it integrates with Shopify.

all_reviews.review_title: Fantastic "small" CRM software for small to medium sized businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Extremely powerful tool if you know how to utilize it properly! There are a ton of integrations with various softwares and continuous improvements happening.
Even without your own "IT departement", you can learn Infusionsoft to help your business reach the next level.

What do you dislike about Keap?
You have to take some time to get into this and ideally participate in an online or in person class. There are a lot of short cuts and "tricks" that you can learn from the prose, but it does take time.
Some of the interfaces are not as intuitive as you would hope and it gets a bit convoluted at times. Certainly not a system you can teach yourself in an afternoon... Need some serious tech affinity.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It takes some getting used to the in's and out's, but if you take the time to get trained properly, this is a very powerful software that can probably do a lot more than what you were initially using it for...

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer relations automation, marketing, sales and P&L tracking.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love that I can easily keep tabs on all of my clients and employees at the click of a button. I can check to see if they have received their emails and make quick notes as needed.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Every now and then, the campaigns can get a bit faulty. Additionally, some people on their customer service team have been rude when help has been needed.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I would be sure to attend some Infusionsoft trainings so that you know everything that Infusionsoft has to offer!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The biggest business problem Infusionsoft is solving is marketing automation! We can easily send mass emails to our clients and employees. We can also assign tasks to different members of our team at the press of a button.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: Every now and then, the campaigns can get a bit faulty. Additionally, some people on their customer service team have been rude when help has been needed.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Keap:
review_question_answers.answer: I would be sure to attend some Infusionsoft trainings so that you know everything that Infusionsoft has to offer!

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: The biggest business problem Infusionsoft is solving is marketing automation! We can easily send mass emails to our clients and employees. We can also assign tasks to different members of our team at the press of a button.

all_reviews.review_content:

What do you dislike about Keap?
If you dont have crm automation background, Infusionsoft can be confusing as they offer different options for different usage since it's a vast software.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you would like an all in one software for your crm, ecommerce and marketing efforts, this is for you. However, you may need assistance in setting this one up.

Membership subscriptions and payments, email marketing, database management.

I realized that I could just tick on one trigger with Infusionsoft and most if not all could be done automatically.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It's very easy to add a new user; it's easy to see basic information about a user without going into their full file.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It is not intuitive. The customization features can be great, but inconsistent. We have the same features customized across 10 different accounts, and when I go to look up/add information, half of them are in different places (and/or places that make absolutely no sense).

You can't search across accounts even if you own them all. We run multiple communities and it is frustrating to search for someone and either get nothing or the wrong information because they're "actually" in a different account.

The email broadcast is painful to use, and the updated version did not translate well from the previous iteration. I can't find any of my old templates easily, and have to revert to the old version constantly - adding about 3 more unnecessary steps to an already tedious process.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It can be very valuable to smaller companies/user bases, but if you are looking at the potential for rapid growth, it is NOT the system you want to use. This is not an enterprise level product, and is not very compatible outside of SMB.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use this for account management of thousands of members across over 1 dozen communities.

all_reviews.review_title: Very Powerful Marketing Automation, Contact Information, and E-Commerce Platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft's automation possibilities are amazing.  It goes way past simple platforms like aweber, mailchimp, constant contact and even activecampaign.

You can take a contact all the way from optin forms to fully tagged and segmented marketing campaigns and finish the job with an order form waiting for their credit card all in one piece of software for a reasonable cost.

Then, you can keep them happy afterwards and even offer other products to them in a fully automated way and save yourself tons of time.

Selling products, either digital or physical, is a way to create a passive income which is income not based on your time.  This is the true path to wealth.  IMHO.

Infusionsoft helps you do this.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is a definite learning curve to Infusionsoft.  Because of this, there is usually an up-front cost involved so you have someone there to hold your hand through the initial learning phase.

The user interface is not very intuitive but I understand that the company is working on a simpler interface for the regular peeps who are not married to their computers.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make sure you connect with someone who knows infusionsoft before you purchase it.  Ask for a demonstration of all three elements: CRM, automated campaigns, e-commerce.

Take a Udemy course for $25 to $50 and learn the basics before you spend money on consulting help.  It will save you a TON of money.

Allocate a week to just learning how to use it before you MUST create a campaign in a time crunch.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Instead of hiring lots of VA's, I am spending time to automate various things that require my time.  I am also creating marketing automation to bring people into an online training system AND am using it to better provide engagement of the students in an automated way.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
As a long time Infusionsoft user, we have seen the product (and the company) evolve over the years. Their continued focus on the small business space has been key to our continued use of the application. By fostering a community of third party app developers along with third party subject matter experts, Infusionsoft is always getting better.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There were features like responsive email support and advanced drag and drop campaign design tools that newer apps in the marketplace had before Infusionsoft did. Reporting tools are also on the weak side but we address that by exporting data and writing our own.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft has a steep learning curve, but the benefits are worth it. Make sure you do a good job of cleaning your data before migrating into Infusionsoft.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Marketing automation is the key tool we use Infusionsoft for, with CRM functionality coming in a close second. By automating may aspects of the marketing process (both pre and post sale) we are able to devote more resources to providing our clients with amazing levels of service. Using third party apps that connect Infusionsoft with Magento, our ecommerce platform of choice, allows us to provide our clients with a fully managed, feature rich, ecommerce / marketing automation platform.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Custom reporting is about as flexible as they come because of their tag creation process and the ability to save searches. If you set things up in advance you can basically track whatever you want even if there is not a built-in report for the information you want. My boss has always been very specific with information he wants and sometimes it is nitty gritty. We used Salesforce for a period but customizing to specific things was really hard and sometimes just not possible.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Their Campaign Manager needs better reporting. There is no way to easily see how your automated emails are doing (clicks, opens, etc) without a lot of custom set up for your own custom reports. Since the idea is to use the campaign manager to automate your marketing, it's odd to me there is not more built-in reporting to go with it.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If Analytics is your primary objective, this tool may not be for you. It's primarily a marketing automation tool, but it is capable of everything else (analytics, sales, CRM)

all_reviews.review_title: Best small business CRM system on market
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like how the software is so straightforward. It's, of course, complicated as it has so many tools in it, so you need the time to understand it, but in the end, it's really worth it. The support is just perfect! I love them a lot. They are always there for us and help with everything. Infusionsoft is always ready to improve and innovate. Every month we get an update about what is developed to make our lives easier. They listen to their partners and users. And put their heart into their goals of helping small businesses succeed.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It's a little bit complicated, even though it's straightforward as I wrote it above. Highly recommended to hire an Infusionsoft Certified Partner to help you make the most out of your software, set you up everything and teach you about the ins and outs of the software. Then you can manage it yourself easily and get the best return on your investment.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Better to hire an Infusionsoft Certified Partner to set up your system quickly and teach you to use it effectively. It will be a significant return on your ROI.
You can still reach out to the support. I love chat support. They are always online to help when I need them. And you can find great learning material online also, so you can learn the basics.
A partner can help you also to save some money with their advice. Maybe you don't need to sign up to the biggest package if what you need can be done with an advanced campaign.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft helps to automate many things, and it's amazing. You can plan your whole business marketing far ahead and automate it. It's perfect for fixing follow-ups. Helps the sales team or person to know where to put their focus and just do their job with less manual work. It saves time and energy.
You can even automate your coffee delivery. :D
It has marketing, sales, CRM, e-Commerce platforms with referrals.
I'm focusing on hoteliers, hospitality business owners & managers. They can get more returning guests with well-built campaigns. Build a better relationship, more referrals and pay less third party commissions. That's loads of value in one software.

You can still reach out to the support. I love chat support. They are always online to help when I need them. And you can find great learning material online also, so you can learn the basics.
A partner can help you also to save some money with their advice. Maybe you don't need to sign up to the biggest package if what you need can be done with an advanced campaign.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
Infusionsoft helps to automate many things, and it's amazing. You can plan your whole business marketing far ahead and automate it. It's perfect for fixing follow-ups. Helps the sales team or person to know where to put their focus and just do their job with less manual work. It saves time and energy.
You can even automate your coffee delivery. :D
It has marketing, sales, CRM, e-Commerce platforms with referrals.
I'm focusing on hoteliers, hospitality business owners & managers. They can get more returning guests with well-built campaigns. Build a better relationship, more referrals and pay less third party commissions. That's loads of value in one software.

Automating lead generation.

all_reviews.review_title: Did not satisfy business needs and clear that customer satisfaction is not a priority
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft was easy to turn on initially.
The sales team found it intuitive to create and mail to prospects.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The API integration capabilities are not actually what are advertised.  We could not make the integrations work well enough to execute our marketing campaigns.  We were assured during the sales cycle that if the tool did not work for us, we'd be able to cancel the contract ans stop payments, however, when we reached out to cancel, we were told there would be a $3500 fee.

We were then told by "Revenue Retention Specialist" that theya re not interested in helping unhappy customers fix the problems they are having, so I'm left with no choice but to let peope know via this review that  the should enter into Infusionsoft with eyes wide open.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Don't be fooled by the low price - please be aware of the limitations before you go in.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were trying to automate our direct mail.
We were able to automate our sales out-reach process. The sales team found the interface intuitive.
However, the full automation of the communication with our current users was not possible.
We wanted to execute trigger emails - etc.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Feature range is broad (marketing automation, CRM, email marketing, etc)  The tags are great allowing for complex filters and customer journeys.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Some features are shallow. For example no split test for email content or subject lines.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Great automation features for less money than most.  Good for small businesses.  If you do $5MM+ per year, get a more robust platform.  Lead scoring is good, but we could have benefited from a more robust scoring system.  Occasionally system is buggy and will display incorrect data or lead to breaks in automation. Customer support by phone is great! They will walk you through using features and help you with challenges. Has more capabilities than most realize as you can even create some "hacks" with some ingenuity to accomplish things the system does not advertise it supports.  Examples are SMS and email subject split-tests.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Great for lead nurturing and lead scoring.

all_reviews.review_title: Outstanding service and automated email system
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusion soft has a great marketing trolling system set up to where it can send out auto generated emails to help with trickle marketing. It adds a great service to the program and allows you to spend your time focused on other things instead of when and how to send out the emails. It takes some time to completed the set-up but overall it helps you to stay focused. My father used to say, "If you don't have time to do things right the first time, when are you going to have the time to do it again"? Infusion Soft helps you set up your systems right the first time and not have to worry about the subsequent actions.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusion soft can be a very confusing software system to use. You have to be able to spend some time to learn the system and if you don't you end up more confused later on. It is one of the software programs that I use that has taken more time to learn that any other program.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you want a system that is already built for you, and takes the headaches out of the marketing and creating trickle email systems, this is the right system for you. If you like to do everything yourself and waste your time re-inventing the wheel, then this is not the system for you.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are solving the tracking of email system, trickle marketing emails as well as follow up emails with leads. It has helped us to keep track of all the details, and progress of our leads.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft works well enough for managing our database. Multiple log-ins allow multiple parties to be able to view updates, program registrations, etc. The ability to build forms that interact with our website is fantastic.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Email marketing is somewhat restrictive with Infusionsoft. The email builder is clunky and we have had issues with rogue punctuation marks showing up in the middle of words. When our CRM analyst has reached out to customer service about this issue, she has repeatedly been brushed off and told it wasn't an issue on Infusionsoft's end, they can't identify the problem and that the problem is on our end. It's not possible for that to be the case. It appears to be an HTML issue.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Database management, segmentation and email marketing are all business problems we're solving and benefits we have realized.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft is my most valued small business tool!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like the versatility of Infusionsoft provides for our company.  We do all of our marketing automation through Infusionsoft, our sales pipeline management, payments and collections, employee performance metrics, new customer education, customer satisfaction surveys, customer referral programs and a host of other valuable tools to help us operate at peak performance.  We have been using Infusionsoft for many years and it has truly become the technical hub of our company's operations!  Many of our prospects and customers have complimented us on our automation and frequently ask us to duplicate our own systems for their own use based on their experiences!  We have also developed great relationships with the professionals and service providers at Infusionsoft HQ.  I think they are the finest company I have ever had the pleasure to work with... How can you not be grateful to a company that has provided a platform that directly attributed to your success? They are great!

What do you dislike about Keap?
Years ago, the learning curve on Infusionsoft was far harder than it is today and there were not nearly as many provided resources from infusionsoft compared to what we celebrate today.  I am glad I stuck in there and learned to rock the system to it's fullest!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
When deciding if Infusionsoft is a good fit for your company, speak with someone that has been successful with the system.  Infusionsoft did not solve all of our problems over night.  We have committed our selves to this system for our company and have responsibly learned what is needed to leverage Infusionsoft to help our company.  I can say that the time and effort spent working on our systems in Infusionsoft has represented effort that has been repaid many, many times over again.  The system stimulates a new and creative way to approach business automation and as a new Infusionsoft customer you should plan on embracing some change and plan on dedicating some constructive time to your success.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Lead Capture, Lead Follow up, Educational Automated Sales Funnels, Ecommerce payments, Reporting, Sales Pipeline systems, Referral Programs, Testimonial collection, customer satisfaction surveys, new customer education, newsletters, the list goes on and on..  The benefits are that we have combined nearly all the necessary technologies our company uses to a single and powerful system.  It is convenient and has allowed us to expand our creativity in regards to how we do business.  I cannot express the strides we have made as a small business due to Infusionsoft. What our infusionsoft system does for us could not be duplicated or replaced with 5 additional full time employees in any proximity to the efficiency that it provides.  That is a ton of savings!
