The benefits are that we have combined nearly all the necessary technologies our company uses to a single and powerful system.  It is convenient and has allowed us to expand our creativity in regards to how we do business.  I cannot express the strides we have made as a small business due to Infusionsoft. What our infusionsoft system does for us could not be duplicated or replaced with 5 additional full time employees in any proximity to the efficiency that it provides.  That is a ton of savings!

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Vice President of Business Development and Co-Owner

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
This program does A LOT and integrates with a lot of other programs. It is all pretty easy to use and they are constantly working on improving the functionality and intuitiveness of the program. The customer support team is fairly easy to get in touch with and has always been able to help me solve my problem within a short period of time.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It is extremely expensive and does not integrate with all of the programs I use. I still don't fully know how to use every aspect, but am learning as I am going. The email builder in beta is very nice, but is missing some pretty important functionalities such as customized opt-outs, the ability to change the color of text without applying the change to the entire email, and more. I hope these changes are implemented soon.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are automating more processes, which is resulting in more sales.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
If I must say, the low price is the only thing I like about Infusionsoft. Although, that's a stretch to say the word "like" in the same sentence as Infusionsoft.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Let me count the ways!!!
Poor support.
Oversold the capabilities.
Very poor training.
Poor implementation.
Can't manage 'accounts' well.
Problems with emailing lists.  Many of our contacts get blocked by infusionsoft on email blasts. Infusionsoft routinely throttles back our blasts so they take forever to finish.
There are so many things we can't do, that we could keep this list going,
We have to jump through hoops, like cutting and pasting to pull a list of contacts out from Infusionisoft.
I'll have my IT Director fill out one of these with more detail.
We are looking at switching to Dynamics or Salesforce.  They're expensive, but at least they work.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Keep looking. There are better solutions.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft is like dragging a big anchor.  We spent so much time to get our data show-horned into Infusionsoft, that it was a big waste.  The cost of the system is irrelevant to the overall opportunity cost. The CRM is awful. the marketing engine is a joke.  Company is inflexible.  They change the rules on a regular basis.  We never know what to expect when we log in.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft's all-in-one feature set is pretty handy for us. The marketing automation is definitely one of the best in the market for small businesses.

Using Infusionsoft has helped us automate a lot of aspects of our business and marketing processes.

What do you dislike about Keap?
As we're non-US based, it's still a very US-centric offering. While they're starting to cater more to their international clients it's not going as fast as I would like consdering I've been using them for at least 8 years now.

The app can be very sluggish at times and log us out at various times during our working hours which is usually when they run updates to the app since it is not their working hours but I think they're trying to manage this better.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
There are two camps I see with Infusionsoft, some find IS too complicated to use/setup but in reality I felt it was easy to setup and has a lot of feature sets that we rely on that others do not have.

The user base is constantly growing and IS have many big name Internet marketing clients using them so that's a good thing to have.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
infusionsoft allows us to automate many business and marketing processes without the need to hire staff so it has been highly beneficial to us.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Managing Director & Global Head of Marketing

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft: Managing CRM & Long Term Nurtures
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
How marketing, e-commerce and CRM are integrated in the same software. Great way to build campaigns and implement them with our team of saes agents.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Lacking some features in the campaign builder such as creating actions of inactions (ie. unopened email %). Also, Infusionsoft glitches frequently from what our team has experienced.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
There is a lot to learn and new features constantly being added to the software so make sure you are up to date and use their free support as much as you can! They always put effort in helping you when you're stuck.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
To maximize the use of long term nurture/email marketing by the masses without overly bothering our prospects and/or clients. We are making use of our already existing database so we can spend less to gain more sales.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft Is More Trouble Than It's Worth
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft can hold a lot of data and it has an incredible amount of features. If you're well equipped enough to figure out where they are and how to use the features, it could be a great product. However, it is not easy to use and doesn't have a lot of positive features. If you're willing to put tons of time and energy into learning the system, then you might get something valuable out of it.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It is NOT user friendly or intuitive. Many features seem almost "hidden" because they are so hard to find. Working with our current sales pipeline requires lots of fighting Infusionsoft's system. It is not simple to understand or to learn. I have been using it at my company for closer to two years and I'm still unsure of how to find certain pieces of information or how to set up certain features.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Don't buy it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use it for our sales pipeline and for automated emails, but we haven't seen much benefit. At this point we just feel stuck with it.

all_reviews.review_content:

I enjoy the integration with Outlook, as well as, the simplicity of tracking leads through our sales cycle.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The Notes text area is really small, and not expandable. It is difficult to file through a lot of notes in such a small area.

I would highly recommend using Infusion Soft to any business that wants efficiency in their organization. We implemented Infusion Soft earlier this year, and have already seen a wonderful ROI. We are now able to track all efforts from our Sales Team, as well as, account for the interactions with our Customer Support team. Infusion Soft has helped us manage the rapid growth of our small business.

all_reviews.review_title: InfusionSoft has helped my business grow substantially in a very short period of time!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
My favorite part of InfusionSoft is having the ability to get to know our subscribers better while recording the information so we never forget! Personalization is incredibly simple with InfusionSoft.

What do you dislike about Keap?
My least favorite part of InfusionSoft is the e-commerce portion. If InfusionSoft and Magento or Shopify would partner, they would rule the world!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Stop thinking about switching, take action now. You will not regret it. My first month of launching I had already paid for an entire years worth of InfusionSoft through the sales I made.

My customers are much happier than before because they do not receive promotions for products they already purchases unless I choose to send it to them.

Segmentation is the way of the future (really the NOW). What ware you waiting for?

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Business problems being solved:
1. Automation completes simple tasks and gives me the time I need to focus on other part of the business.
2. The ability to collect as much info from a contact as they are willing to give, really helps me talk directly to an individual subscriber rather than a group.
3. Analyzing data is much easier now that I can put custom stat widgets on my dashboard.
4. Task management and distribution is much easier than before since InfusionSoft has an efficient way to assign/manage tasks and set due dates.

Benefits I have realized:
1. Customers are MORE THAN WILLING to give you feedback if you just ask.
2. Sending custom messages to portions of my subscribers, rather than one single message to the entire group, is much more beneficial to myself AND the subscriber.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
campaign automation is powerful and effective.  infusionsoft is upgrading their email formatting and editing with a new beta release, which is a good thing.  the "classic" email formatter/editor was clunky and inadequate.  however you cannot put an HTML clip into the new editor at this point, which is a limitation.

the support is first rate.  almost without exception the support team are professional, knowledgeable, polite, friendly, and on their game.  their hours of availability seem to change, however and i'd be hard pressed to tell you exactly when phone support is available and not.  chat has been OK, but not of the same caliber and phone, in my experience.

the customerhub platform is a competent membership site and seems to be well integrated with infusionsoft and we have hundreds of members on the platform.  you can store files, videos, audios, etc. to which you can control access by members.  or you can link to vimeo or some other video server system.  it's pretty simple and intuitive and has been useful for us.

speed and uptime have been good although this varies pretty widely from browser to browser.  i have found chrome to be the most consistently successful browser.  email delivery seems adequate, but the system does not provide the detailed breakdown that an SMTP provider like Sendgrid or Mailgun would provide.

What do you dislike about Keap?
incomprehensibly, there is no real time interface with USPS for providing accurate shipping costs to customers who buy physical products.  that means infusionsoft's store/shopping cart is useless unless you are willing to flat rate all postage, or only sell virtual products.  i have been complaining loudly about this for more than five years at every level of the company i could access, but no joy.  my impression is this is a marketing/technology company and it doesn't seem that there is any real awareness of or interest in the mechanics of actually shipping real stuff to real people.  i don't have any other explanation for it.

meanwhile, i have to pay for and support a whole different shopping cart system, and to add insult to injury, pay for an expensive interface between my shopping cart and infusionsoft.  we do about 1/3 of our business internationally so mail is the only practical shipping option for us.  practically every other shopping cart system on the planet uses the USPS API to provide real time shipping costs to the cart's customers.  i fail to see any legitimate reason why infusionsoft does not provide this in their cart.

the companion system, customerhub, again inexplicably, provides no stats whatsoever regarding member behavior.  you cannot call up a report to see who has bought a membership but never logged in, or who hasn't logged in in three weeks, or any other time period.  there is no customerhub reporting at all.

nor is there any way to tie infusionsoft's campaigns to automate a response to customer behavior, e.g. an autoresponder message like "Thank you for signing up on our membership site.  However, we noticed that it's been seven days since you purchased your video and you have not yet logged on to view it.  Please let us know if you are having technical difficulty."  There is no tracking customer access history to understand frequency and recency of interaction with the platform and ability to tie that back to campaigns.  we cannot monitor a customer's progress through our online courses, for example, to be able to engage them with support.  I do send out an email 24 hours and 7 days after an online video purchase to do a reality check that someone is logged in successfully, and an amazing percentage of the time I get a personal response thanking me for my follow up.  imagine what we could do if we had customer interaction history with their products?  this is an important blind spot.

overall, the system works well.  it is large and complex.  some of it is designed for sales teams, which isn't relevant for us.  being as large and complex as it is, some of the operational processes inconsistent, probably as a result of having been built by different programmers or teams.  not a big deal, but it does add to the complexity and steepness of the learning curve.

They have been making some efforts to improve the aesthetics of the platform in recent years, which it needs to look more modern and up to date.  amazingly in this day and age, safari on iOS is not supported.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If there is one thing I have learned in my many years of working with computers, it's how essential quality support is for getting the most out of your platform and maximizing your productivity.  The companies that I can call or chat with at 2AM, or are thoughtful enough to provide an automated call back if there is a long queue ahead of me for support earns a lot of loyalty from me.

infusionsoft is an industry leader, maybe THE industry leader, which means more related platforms have built integrations for it more than they have for many smaller competitors.

infusionsoft has been successful, is well funded, has big name wall street backing, so they are unlikely to leave you hanging because they grew too fast and ran out of cash.  like all systems, it has its limitations.  it's not the cheapest platform out there, but it should do the job for most email and web-intensive businesses.

they seem to try hard to solicit feedback from their customers, but i can't say they have responded much to my primary issue that i've complained about for years.  but i'm told they have a new product evangelist on the top management team, so maybe that will change.

Reliability and uptime have been excellent.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
i like to think of infusionsoft as an adaptive autoresponder.  it allows us to provide specific automated responses when customers purchase products or services.  there is certainly much more we could be doing in that regard, but for a two person operation, one of whom is full time on content creation, personal bandwidth is a significant constraint.

We have invested quite a lot of time and effort into the platform and overall, the investment has been worthwhile, with the exceptions i have noted above.  really the quality of support is probably the strongest glue that keeps us with them.

the support is first rate.  almost without exception the support team are professional, knowledgeable, polite, friendly, and on their game.  their hours of availability seem to change, however and i'd be hard pressed to tell you exactly when phone support is available and not.  chat has been OK, but not of the same caliber and phone, in my experience.

nor is there any way to tie infusionsoft's campaigns to automate a response to customer behavior, e.g. an autoresponder message like "Thank you for signing up on our membership site.  However, we noticed that it's been seven days since you purchased your video and you have not yet logged on to view it.  Please let us know if you are having technical difficulty."  There is no tracking customer access history to understand frequency and recency of interaction with the platform and ability to tie that back to campaigns.  we cannot monitor a customer's progress through our online courses, for example, to be able to engage them with support.  I do send out an email 24 hours and 7 days after an online video purchase to do a reality check that someone is logged in successfully, and an amazing percentage of the time I get a personal response thanking me for my follow up.  imagine what we could do if we had customer interaction history with their products?  this is an important blind spot.

overall, the system works well.  it is large and complex.  some of it is designed for sales teams, which isn't relevant for us.  being as large and complex as it is, some of the operational processes inconsistent, probably as a result of having been built by different programmers or teams.  not a big deal, but it does add to the complexity and steepness of the learning curve.

They have been making some efforts to improve the aesthetics of the platform in recent years, which it needs to look more modern and up to date.  amazingly in this day and age, safari on iOS is not supported.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Keap:
review_question_answers.answer:
If there is one thing I have learned in my many years of working with computers, it's how essential quality support is for getting the most out of your platform and maximizing your productivity.  The companies that I can call or chat with at 2AM, or are thoughtful enough to provide an automated call back if there is a long queue ahead of me for support earns a lot of loyalty from me.

infusionsoft is an industry leader, maybe THE industry leader, which means more related platforms have built integrations for it more than they have for many smaller competitors.

infusionsoft has been successful, is well funded, has big name wall street backing, so they are unlikely to leave you hanging because they grew too fast and ran out of cash.  like all systems, it has its limitations.  it's not the cheapest platform out there, but it should do the job for most email and web-intensive businesses.

they seem to try hard to solicit feedback from their customers, but i can't say they have responded much to my primary issue that i've complained about for years.  but i'm told they have a new product evangelist on the top management team, so maybe that will change.

Reliability and uptime have been excellent.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer:
i like to think of infusionsoft as an adaptive autoresponder.  it allows us to provide specific automated responses when customers purchase products or services.  there is certainly much more we could be doing in that regard, but for a two person operation, one of whom is full time on content creation, personal bandwidth is a significant constraint.

We have invested quite a lot of time and effort into the platform and overall, the investment has been worthwhile, with the exceptions i have noted above.  really the quality of support is probably the strongest glue that keeps us with them.

all_reviews.review_title: Ready to grow your business? Outstanding results available with Infusionsoft IF you put in the time!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like the opportunities for marketing automation, post-purchase follow up and lead generation programs ALL in one system. This allows you to continually gather information about your prospects and shoppers, the links they click, their preferences, purchase history and more all in one place.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft is a great solution but does take an effort to learn and setup. I would like to see better one-on-one account management with regular check-in's to make sure that the Infusionsoft customer is happy, has all resources they need, helps with introductions to consultants for further help, etc. This may help get people shifted over from old systems and confidently using Infusionsoft faster and avoid the burden of paying for old systems (Constant Contact, MailChimp, 1ShoppingCart, SugarCRM, Shopify) AND Infusionsoft simultaneously for several months.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft gets easier and more efficient to use as you gain familiarity over time.  Once you build the systems it is so easy to replicate the idea for new products or programs. Talk to an Infusionsoft Certified Partner (ICP) https://marketplace.infusionsoft.com/home before making the transition and investment. See if there are ICP's related to your field to help make your transition process as quick and efficient as possible.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
These are my favorite features to help automate business processes and follow up.

-Ecommerce Management, Post-Purchase Follow Up, Abandonded Cart Sequences
-Lead Magnet & Lead Generation Sequences
-CRM
-Email Marketing
-Transactional Emails; based on links clicked, purchases made, credit card nearing expiration, etc
-Autoresponders: Welcome Offer, Drip Content, Update Preferences Form (to segment contacts)
Behavior:

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like the endless possibilities this software can create.  I have been using Infusionsoft since 2008 and every year I seem to come up with new and innovative ways to connect with my customers in each of my 3 businesses and create phenomenal experiences for them as they interact with my companies.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I wish we could select the option to have the duplicate record checking go by date of birth and first name.  That would make a HUGE difference for one of my companies.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Be committed to investing the needed time to learn and implement it.  The upside is that it is robust and there are many ways to accomplish your goals within the program - the downside is that when you have something robust, it takes time to learn.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Business 1 is a coaching program for children - in that business we are cutting admin labour costs by 60% because we can use Infusionsoft to do online registration, billing, send receipts, and then email reminders to parents as well as the evaluation. All of this used to be done by the front desk staff manually - one by one for each child and we register about 350-450 kids every session which is a 3 month term.   It works wonders for keeping parents informed about upcoming class sessions and summer camps.

Business 2 & 3 are in the mortgage industry where most people begin to shop online.  Infusionsoft has been vital to our ability to capture and educate leads which builds the vital trust required for them to choose to do business with us.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft is the BEST personal assistant money can buy
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
As the sole Marketing Director in my company, the best thing about using Infusionsoft is it's ability to streamline and organize my tasks, my patient communication and my patient follow ups. With an active patient base of about 3,000, it would be next to impossible for me to continually add and update contact records on my own. Infusionsoft communicates directly with my practice management software and seamlessly adds and updates my contact records without me lifting a finger. This frees up my time to generate content, set up follow up campaigns and stay in touch with our patients on a daily basis. The segmenting features allow me to tailor my communication based on anything from the patient first visit date to their current pending treatment. We've also been able to set up some "set it and forget it" auto campaigns for things like patient birthdays, anniversaries and referral thank yous. It has truly been the one tool that allows our marketing department, with a growing patient base, to stay successful without adding investments in additional human capital.

What do you dislike about Keap?
One of the biggest frustration comes from being in the minority group that utilizes what once was the dentma bridge. There aren't many support staff members who understand how the bridge works with infusionsoft so it can be difficult when setting up new campaigns and needing some technical support.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make the leap and try it out! It has the ability to really streamline your current processes allowing you more time to focus on those tasks that generate the most money for your business.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The biggest business problem we are solving is the gap in patient communication between visits. Infusionsoft allows us to stay front of mind with our patients even though they are only present in the office every 6 months. We are also able to create more specific and personal touches when communicating with our patients which makes the difference between our office and the one down the street. The benefit of consistent communication is a better retention rate for our existing patients.

all_reviews.review_title: We doubled our sales with this one tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like that this system makes it possible to put everything in place to convert a prospect into a buyer and then it runs automatically. Before we put this into practice, we were losing prospects because we were so busy running the business that we did not have time to follow up on quotes and close the deal. By the time we would get some time freed up to reach out to them personally they had gone to the competition or had lost trust in us.

Now we are in touch with them immediately and are able to deliver more product information to them in a timely manner. We are able to spend time on the phone with prospects when they are hot and have their credit card in hand.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There are a few small features I would like to see added but one thing I have noted is that Infusionsoft listens when you recommend changes. We have been a customer for about 5 years and new features and fixes are being added regularly.

There is a pretty big learning curve when you first start using this system and most businesses do not implement it fully. But if you take the time, and even attend one of the training sessions, you would be amazed at just how much this software can do for you.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I know this is a big step in terms of financial/time investment to setup and learn this software but, trust me, you will be glad you took that step because now you can hit the ground running and never look back.

When you can fully automate all of the stuff that eats up your day and free up time so you only have to focus your time on the stuff that makes you money, you will see your business grow. It can't help but create success.


What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
As I mentioned, the time savings is huge for us. Freeing up time to close deals has meant we were able to double our revenue within the first year of applying Infusionsoft as our CRM.

Since then we have found ways to work other features of the software into our customer service and marketing to generate even more leads and enrich the customer experience.

I can't recommend this service highly enough. It has been a real game changer for us and I know it would be for pretty much any business.

all_reviews.review_title: Excellent! Customer Service Is The Best I've Found!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Customer Service is without doubt the best aspect of the product. The live chat has helped me on numerous occasions. There is a number of people who have always been there to help. When we call on the phone ye guys are also very helpful and friendly. There is a real family feel to this company which I like.

Also, the email broadcasts are quite handy for my line of work.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The editing system in the email broadcasts....a lot of the time I would delete a line and the format for the whole email would change meaning I would have to reformat everything. Can be time consuming!

I do have an issue with why our broadcasts are sometimes stopped and the reason we are given is "high spam content" but when it is not spam, and it never is, this is confusing. Also what is the number of people that need to complain for it to be deemed "Spam? "

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Perfect for a small business, which is what it is aimed at. Clean your lists if you plan on mass email broadcasts. CRM side of it is easy and reliable. Although I have encountered problems. the customer support is excellent and I would highly recommend this software to anyone really.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The mass emailing has solved our problem regarding reaching hundreds and thousands of people.

The benefits are obvious, as our company has grown through means of mass emailing.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
We made the switch to InfusionSoft about 6 months ago and it has been fantastic.  We went from a cobbled-together system with lots of moving (and breaking) parts to something incredibly streamlined.  It's easy for me to set up the marketing side of things.  I can test and evaluate what's working easily, and I can roll out new products quickly.  Plus, my customer service team has been able to really ramp up how well we serve our customers.  Tech support is quick and easy, plus we *know* if a customer has or has not gotten what she needs.  Also love how well InfusionSoft integrates with our membership site.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There was a learning curve for Infusionsoft, no doubt, but it was not insurmountable.  Going through some online tutorials with my team helped us all get up to speed.

It does sometimes feel like there are a lot of steps to get campaigns up and running, but duplicating proven campaigns helps speed that up.

I wish it were a little easier to create attractive emails.

We also sometimes have checkout issues with the shopping cart, but IS tech support has been able to help with most of those.

Also, I felt the sales team was SUPER pushy and almost rude when we first started looking into InfusionSoft - finding an IS certified partner was a MUCH better fit for us.  Internal Tech support has been great, however :D

We LOVE the Outlook plugin and find it frustrating IS hasn't upgraded it to work with Outlook 2016 yet - getting that working will earn BIG brownie points because my CS team can upgrade to Office 2016.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If your business can afford it and you want the flexibility of campaigns, tagging subscribers/customers, and great tracking, it's a good move.

I definitely recommend going through InfusionSoft training - we used a 3rd party course and it was great for us.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We lost all the disconnect because InfusionSoft has most of it built in!

I can now actually track if my emails are converting, something that is HUGE for a email-based marketing business like mine.

I can also filter customers by tag to ensure I'm not overwhelming my subscribers and customers or sending them through the same campaigns over and over.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft allows the two of us to deliver a very professional and highly polished experience to our customers. The software is reliable and always getting better. We can do so much in our back office that just wasn't possible in our pre-Infusionsoft days. We've spent the time getting to know what the platform can do and we have reaped the rewards.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The Help articles are a little too general and to get more specific advanced Help you have to dive into the forums looking for answers.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Get up the learning curve. It is worth the investment.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Allows us to keep our staff lean. Staffing is a big issue and this makes our team more powerful without adding more people. We've also been able to totally integrate with our training platform (Thinkific) and our conversion funnels (DIgital Marketer) and that makes us very happy.

all_reviews.review_title: Using IS for client portal to learn on our members site
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The ease of being able to find someone when I'm looking for their tags and access.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Our logins for our members do not seem to work too often. We are integrated with Infusionsoft, Imember360, Wordpress and Learndash and it seems that there is always a miscommunication at some point between them. Update passwords and login info through WP sometimes do not carry into IS. Sometimes when tagging users in IS to unlock access for a specific course, it does not travel through and talk with WP causing there to be a lockout. Chat time takes forever to get through the sue and about 75% they are helpful.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If it's your only platform working with wordpress, then I feel it is good. However if you have other platforms, I would really look into them and ensure they are ok to integrate with IS before wasting much time.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are trying to solve how to better build our campaigns to make them easier on our end as well as for our clients. We do not want to bombard them with emails al the time to building and rebuilding our campaigns is key.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft is the BEST Client Management Tool
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like the way the software keeps all my clients and leads in one place. The call back reminders on my dashboard keep me accountable. My mind is at ease knowing I will not lose track of my prospects or my client list.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I feel like the dashboard can be confusing. I don't like that when a lead from a previous month that becomes a client disappears from the dashboard. I wish I could look at the previous months dashboard.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I highly recommend Infusionsoft for all your client management needs. It has made my life easier and organized!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have solved several business problems with Infusionsoft.
1. My phone calls to leads are followed up with an email
2. All my clients are in one place whether they are prospects, active or inactive. I can market each group separately or together.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like that you're able to create automated campaigns. The e-commerce options are also helpful when selling products. You can create codes for specific products or provide a total discount.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It still feels new so sometimes customer service has no idea what you're talking about. You can usually hang up and call/chat again and end up with someone else that's more knowledgeable. They also have items that are no longer in use but they keep them active because older customers are still using them. This was from a customer service agent. When I asked why do you still have it then, is it useful for something else. They said they just do for those that started with it, to just not worry about it, I was trying to integrate a form that we created and had to re-create it in another part of the program.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Don't be shy about reaching out for customer support. Some of the help center and videos have old information so you'll think you're doing it wrong when you don't see your screen matching the visuals but its most likely a change that someone forgot to update. They also try to get you to pay for training after the few hours your allotted after paying for it. Not worth it, in my opinion.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Email campaigns and integrating an e-commerce solution.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
There is very little to like about this software. The marketing campaign editor is pretty ingenious, but it is let down by the other parts of the software.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is so much to dislike, I don't think I could cover it all. All the features that we needed were touted to us by a sales rep, and what we got has been nothing short of a nightmare.

Alarm bells first went off when their team were migrating data from our old CRM and I had to teach them that the reason the data was messed up after it was imported was because they had used Excel during the process and it had messed with the formatting of the data. I should have backed away then.

Email marketing is poorly implemented and results in very poor delivery rates - despite Infusionsoft's insistence to the contrary (they look at delivery to the end server, not delivery to the inbox), the real world results are very different, and complaints about this have been flowing in and frustrations vented on the public forums for years, and nothing has been done. After switching to Mandrill (a 3rd party transactional email service that required software development to integrate with Infusionsoft) delivery rates are considerably better. Our customers are now actually getting their order confirmations and other important notifications they need. This is just the tip of the iceberg in terms of Infusionsoft's inability to properly handle email.

Bugs bugs bugs. Over the last couple of years I have found several bugs that have cost us dearly in terms of sales. I have been able to consistently recreate them and provide examples to technical support. Unfortunately their tech support is completely incompetent and NONE of the issues I have reported have ever been resolved, and they just don't get back to me about it. With one issue in particular I was told that "because the issue occurred while testing the feature, and not while using it live, nothing more will be done to resolve it" !!! But I had to test it before I implemented it, and I'm glad I did.

Thankfully I'm a developer and have spent countless hours developing software with the API so that we can have the features we need that we were told we would have by sales people at the beginning. But even that doesn't allow us to escape from the incompetence of this company completely.

We are located in Australia, Infusionsoft servers are located in the US as far as I'm aware. Rather than organising servers so that clients are grouped by geographical location, they all just seem to be lumped together, so when they perform maintenance or backups or whatever they do in the middle of the night in the US, the performance impact for those of us who are up and working can be severe. Infusionsoft will perform painfully slowly, and API operations will time out. Our business grinds to a halt in the middle of a working day. Not to mention they don't understand that different countries have different timezones, so one has to constantly do calculations to make sure emails are scheduled for the correct time and other timestamps are correct.

The only reason we haven't moved to another CRM is because at the moment we just don't have the resources to do so.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Don't do it. Save your time, money, and sanity, go somewhere else. Make sure you read reviews of any product you are considering, and get access to a demo to test everything before you buy.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
There have been no benefits to us moving to Infusionsoft, it hasn't solved problems for us, it has created them.

all_reviews.review_title: If you're a small business you're missing sales if you're not using InfusionSoft.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love how I can automate so many of the manual marketing and sales tasks for myself and my team. I love thinking of new ways I can use InfusionSoft to save time and convert prospects into customers.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I can't wait for more ability to customize their broadcast templates for my automated campaigns.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're a small business and you're not using InfusionSoft, you are leaving money on the table. Do yourself a huge favor and call them right away.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I work in a relatively antiquated market where using cutting edge technology like InfusionSoft can mean the difference between growing and shriveling. Automating sales training and follow up along with email marketing automation has changed how we interact with our clients and partners-in the best way possible.

What do you like best about Keap?
The freedom of Infusionsoft is its best feature. Once you get through the basics of the platform, you realize that you really can do just about anything you want.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Not as many out-of-the-box tools as I'd like, but they left all kinds of tools in for our coders to access via API

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
This is an evolving product, not a stale thing that you have to accept as-is. We love the additions that Infusionsoft keeps bringing to the table!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have used Infusionsoft to solve all kinds of marketing funnels and complex campaign designs. Additionally, with the awesome Infusionsoft App Marketplace, we can combine 3rd party apps to really get what we need done. We use Infusionsoft for e-commerce, marketing campaigns, and our CRM and love it!

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft packs a lot of power and potential as a marketing and communication tool. For someone like me who finds it a challenge to keep on top of tasks at the best of times, Infusionsoft's campaign designer and automation features are a real life-saver.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The learning curve can be steep, though, despite the relatively intuitive interface. Be prepared to spend time learning how to harness the potential of the software. Pricing is a bit on the steep side as well, so it may be wise to set benchmarks to see whether you are truly seeing a return on your investment.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Be prepared to spend time learning it to its full potential.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automation of marketing to and nurturing prospects fantastic. Once set-up, time savings are great.

Pricing is a bit on the steep side as well, so it may be wise to set benchmarks to see whether you are truly seeing a return on your investment.

review_question_answers.answer: Be prepared to spend time learning it to its full potential.

review_question_answers.answer: Automation of marketing to and nurturing prospects fantastic. Once set-up, time savings are great.

all_reviews.review_content:

The idea that the product could be set up and used to grow the business contacts and interaction with customers

What do you dislike about Keap?
It does take an effort to learn and setup. I would like to see better one-on-one account management with regular check-in's to make sure that the Infusionsoft customer is able to start and get on with the inital set up.  I managed to input approximately 6 contact manually and quickly realized the system was not for me and my small 1 person business. Suitable helps with understanding and setting up was lacking and i experienced very little differentiated support based on my limited experience and knowledge of this type of system. considering the astronomical cost of the product I realised  within 2 weeks it was not for me.
The cancellation process is extremely floored  and again very confusing.  it could be made faster and simple to avoid the burden of paying for several months even when you have verbally told the sales person and representative and email them both explaining that you want to cancel.  However if it stays the same infusionsoft can take money from you for not using the product.  I undedrstand there is a name of this kind of behavior .

BE WARE IF YOU ARE NOT FULLY COMPUTER AND CRM LITERATE YOU MAY FIND IT VERY CONFUSING AND TIME CONSUMING.  YOU MAY ALSO FIND THE SUPPORT CONDESCENDING AS YOUR LEVEL AND SKILL DOSE NOT MEET MOST.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the customer service. Not only is everyone committed to mutual success, but feedback is taken to heart and made into actionable changes. Every update that gets pushed out makes something a little easier.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There are a lot of different ways to accomplish the same goal (applying a tag for a contact, as an example). It can get confusing when establishing processes or training internally.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Previously, we had no real lead follow up or drip email campaign. While we're still building the foundations of these programs, it's easy to see that our communication with our customers will not only increase, but will be optimized.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
My favorite part of Infusionsoft is the workflows and campaign builder. Infusionsoft says their culture is a strength of the company and it shows with their support team. I've often have rave worthy experiences with Infusionsoft support. Infusionsoft also makes integrating with other tools like PlusThis and Wistia easy. We integrated MailLift's handwritten letters intro Infusionsoft's workflows to automate personal outreach without ever leaving Infusionsoft. Oh, and the price point for Infusionsoft is perfect! Exactly what I think a good marketing automation tool should be priced at ($200 - $500 per month).

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft if bulky and difficult to setup. Once setup, it's not the most user friendly. Sometimes slow. Also because Infusionsoft is such a broad tool, it's difficult to use all the pieces properly (they try to do too much in my opinion).  My #1 disappointment is their onboarding program. $1000 and so little value :( While it sounds like I am hating on Infusionsoft, I understand what they are building and doing is very difficult and they still do a better job than most other tools out there. We switched from HubSpot to Infusionsoft!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Learn workflows!!! Get your hands dirty and learn workflows! Check out SixthDivision, The API Guys, Infusioncast, and Infusionsoft Workflows.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Infusionsoft for the CRM and marketing automation needs of our business.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft is an amazing product, it has transformed the way we do business.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
What I love about Infusionsoft is the seamless integration with my sales team. The way I can have leads flow into their pipeline and from there control the communication throughout the pipeline automatically!

What do you dislike about Keap?
I do wish that the interface for creating the emails and landing pages was a little more intuitive. For example, I wish that I could insert a PDF and have a preview populate that links to the original PDF. I also have run into some limitations when building campaigns, for example I was trying to build an internal form to save time with emails that I am constantly sending out. There is just one piece of information that changes each time. So I created the form with the thought that once submitted it would send the email to a list of people, but that isn't possible.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Pay attention during training, its not as intuitive as you might think heading in!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have an incredibly lazy sales team, so by automating mundane activities, it has helped increase their sales without them having to do too much.

all_reviews.review_title: It saved me untold amounts of time by combining 5 processes on different platforms into ONE! Plus!!!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Wow! That's difficult! First I love it because it gave me my life back. I was spending untold amounts of time adding information to 5 different systems. Infusionsoft integrated them all and now everything flows.
* I also love that I can broadcast to any number of segregated lists.
* I bill automatically every month for many subscriptions and Infusionsoft takes care of it all.
* Simple things like being able to set up tasks and appointments with reminders.
* I have campaigns set up that take care of a myriad of tasks when people buy products and subscriptions. Or, cancel. All is now done automatically instead of having to go through a long list to set someone up for our training or cancel a subscription.
* We used a campaign to do an extensive research project. There were 50 moving parts that Infusionsoft automated.
* There's many more little things that just make life so much more productive but one of the first things I mention is the support. No matter when I call the person very happily works to get my question answered whether it's very simple or complicated. That's one of the most important things to me because no matter how good a product is it's just a fact that with out great customer service it can become a nightmare.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I know this isn't possible anymore but it's a fond memory. I've been with Infusion soft since very close to the beginning and when I called support they used to say, "Hi Linda! I have your account pulled up!" How's the campaign building going or what ever I'd talked to them about the last time I'd called.

Really can't think of anything I dislike!!! It still has the, "I care about you and your business feel even if they don't recognize me!"

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Think I answered that in the first question:)
The office is more productive, customers are better taken care, I have the peace of mind that something on my list of things to do for a customer was not missed, billing is automated completely with every detail of the sale and every piece of information about a potential client or customer is at my figertips.

all_reviews.review_title: Hard to learn, great when it's running
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Once the system is set up, the possibilities seem endless. I run a printing and design company and we created a processes where customers would get automatic emails when their order was moved along each stage, when it was put to print, when it was shipped, etc.

What I liked best is the automation and the fact that there's no other system that does everything it does, all in one aspect.

You can plug in the code into your website and create automatic drip campaigns for potential leads. I created a process in which I could send out estimates to multiple vendors, all with the same information, but separate emails.

Also, their customer service team is AMAZING. They will stay on the phone with you for an hour or two, if needed, to get everything running and functional.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There's a reason people call it "Confusionsoft." It's not easy to get up and running. In fact, it's quite laborious. I spent 50-60 hours developing all the processes we needed to make our platform work. Also, it can be quite expensive.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Be prepared to have up to two people learn the IS software and how to make it work. That way you have a back up. Not everyone needs to know how the software works on the back end, but that it works on the front end.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed one click email solutions to customers, letting them know where their order is in the process. We needed drip marketing campaigns. We needed a vendor estimate request application.

support

Constant having to buy other services to fill gaps in the platform adding THOUSANDS of dollars in expenses per year.

No one click upsell! How can a marketing platform not have a one click upsell?!

Order forms are hideous and not mobile compatible. That makes the order forms ancient.

Also Certified Partner commissions are not worth my time to sell the platform. It becomes a second tier priority.

Inability to edit email confirm text in other languages

Recommendations to others considering Keap:

all_reviews.review_title: The perfect CRM for business at an affordable price.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The best part of Infusionsoft is that it will do 90% of what you need your CRM to do, and doesn't cost you an arm and a leg. The remaining 10% that your business needs can be done via the API or through a 3rd party provider you can find in their marketplace.

I have been with 3 companies now that use Infusionsoft. The first one, we had 270k contacts and an annual revenue of $12 million. We did all of our marketing, subscriptions, support, sales, you name it, through Infusionsoft.

What do you dislike about Keap?
My main issues with Infusionsoft has really worked itself out over the years, bugs and update procedure. I have used Infusionsoft for almost 6 years now. I have been there to witness the software itself mature, and there were some bumpy patches where updates would break our API reliant software, there were a lot of bugs, etc. This is to be expected with new software and they have bent over backwards to fix and improve over the years.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Real estate agents do not have the adequate training to keep up with marketing in the current age. Infusionsoft gives us a platform to market to, and provide content to the real estate agents out there who need our help.

all_reviews.review_title: Don't trust them. Wait, there's something else for you to buy!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
From what many people have told me, it does everything you want it to.
For those of you who remember 1ShoppingCart, just because people say does everything does not mean it's good.

What do you dislike about Keap?
1. You can't trust Infusionsoft.
1a. The sales person gave me incorrect information: "You've got everything you need". to find out I ALSO needed to buy 'customerhub'.
1b. Finally, I escalated my case to a manager to promised he would take care of me. Nope. He called me once a week to tell me he didn't have answers to my questions.
2. Don't buy their $1,500 fast-track implementation package.
2a. I made it clear I wanted someone specializing in ecommerce. They gave me someone who had no clue about commerce.
2b. They told me importing my products should take 3 to 4 days. A month later, some stuff was done.
3. Elizabeth Pitt, Infusionsoft's "Chief Customer Officer" might want to look at her job description.
3a. I called her office to explain my situation and how I fell through the cracks and no response.
3b. I called again to say I was going to do a charge-back unless someone called me - nothing again!
4. It's expensive for a small business.
4a. to really get it all to work together, you have to buy 'customer hub', another monthly fee.
4b. There's more to buy! Just look at their marketplace.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Do this ONLY if you have the money to hire an external (Not infusionsoft) consultant. One company that recommended Infusionsoft told me their implementation was effortless because they pay $800 / week ($2,400/month!!) for their consultant.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Problem: Consolidating 5 different systems into one: shopping cart, secure host, email, membership, weekly show. Results: Nothing. After 6 weeks of nothing and being ignored, I did a charge back only credit card.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
From what many people have told me, it does everything you want it to.
For those of you who remember 1ShoppingCart, just because people say does everything does not mean it's good.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
1. You can't trust Infusionsoft.
1a. The sales person gave me incorrect information: "You've got everything you need". to find out I ALSO needed to buy 'customerhub'.
1b. Finally, I escalated my case to a manager to promised he would take care of me. Nope. He called me once a week to tell me he didn't have answers to my questions.
2. Don't buy their $1,500 fast-track implementation package.
2a. I made it clear I wanted someone specializing in ecommerce. They gave me someone who had no clue about commerce.
2b. They told me importing my products should take 3 to 4 days. A month later, some stuff was done.
3. Elizabeth Pitt, Infusionsoft's "Chief Customer Officer" might want to look at her job description.
3a. I called her office to explain my situation and how I fell through the cracks and no response.
3b. I called again to say I was going to do a charge-back unless someone called me - nothing again!
4. It's expensive for a small business.
4a. to really get it all to work together, you have to buy 'customer hub', another monthly fee.
4b. There's more to buy! Just look at their marketplace.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Keap:
review_question_answers.answer: Do this ONLY if you have the money to hire an external (Not infusionsoft) consultant. One company that recommended Infusionsoft told me their implementation was effortless because they pay $800 / week ($2,400/month!!) for their consultant.

review_question_answers.answer: Problem: Consolidating 5 different systems into one: shopping cart, secure host, email, membership, weekly show. Results: Nothing. After 6 weeks of nothing and being ignored, I did a charge back only credit card.

all_reviews.review_title: Good but not great--no real advancements in last 5 years.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
All in one software--CRM, email marketing, and some automation capabilities.

What do you dislike about Keap?
This is a company clearly driven by a thirst for profit. They haven't improved the product much in the past 5 years--and they're focused on serving the SMB and info marketers of the world that may not be aware of the new technologies (especially on mobile) that have hit the marketplace.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Look at other, cheaper solutions. Don't think that signing up for this product will grow your business--it won't...You have to have systems in place BEFORE you onboard--and you have to have your automation mapped out BEFORE you sign up. Negotiate the lock-in price that they charge.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
CRM, contact management, email marketing, sales opportunity management and pipeline, etc.

all_reviews.review_title: Bait and Switch...If the product isn't for you, NO REFUNDS!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I'm trying to be reasonable here, but it's frustrating when you work with a company who supposedly cares about small businesses, but then pulls bait and switch tactics to take your money and keep it.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Here's their sales process and how they prey on small businesses with simple bait and switch tactics...

First, the sales call where they tell you everything you want to hear...

Next, they take your credit card # and charge you for the first month of $389.

Next, they tell you about their coaching services and how you need to pay them $1,500 to really use their software successfully...

After you pay them $1,800 you finally get access to  use the software and that's when you realize that everything you were told by the sales rep was too good to be true!

...but TOO BAD the $1,800 is non-refundable! SCAM!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Be very careful about signing up for the Demo Version.  They will not grant you access to the software unless you pay them, or at least in my experience.  At that point, the payment is non-refundable and you are on the hook for additional costs!

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I was looking for a system that could incorporate my sales, digital product delivery, marketing automation all in one system.  They had alot of these features, but the product just wasn't for me...Unfortunately, this was one of the most expensive 14-day trials I have ever seen!

Nothing. Literally nothing. Infusionsoft does NOT do everything like people say. Even the features that it has don't work efficiently.

What do you dislike about Keap?
1. No technical support
2. Misleading sales executives
3. Outrageous prices
4. Terrible, I mean really terrible customer care

InfusionSoft is a big liability to your funds. They ask for fee upfront and their unrealistic customer care makes them one of the worst in the industry. The features don't work correctly and overall it's an incredible waste of time and money.
InfusionSoft partners with high priced companies like PowerPay. You can just go for PayPal. They are inexpensive and their tech support is great.
There are these companies in the industry who, if they have defective products at least give back your money. InfusionSoft lags in that too. Zero ethics. The customer care executive just vanishes if I register a complaint for a refund.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Get another product. If you're big enough then SAP is a good option.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I was hoping to integrate CRM with mail automation service and e-commerce provider. With Infusionsoft it only remained a hope.

all_reviews.review_title: The best marketing automation I have used, awesome support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft is mostly very intuitive. Aside from a few issues we have been having with opportunities and contact records, InfusionSoft is serving the needs of our marketing and sales efforts throughout the entire sales funnel and beyond.
I particularly like the campaign builder. It takes a while to understand the ins and outs, but once you get the hang of it, with the campaign builder you can pretty much automate everything: from links, assigning owners, adding an opportunity to a contact, start/end campaign, send emails, etc. What I really like is the interface. You can upload your own html code or use the word processing-like interface.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Sometimes it seems like Infusionsoft was not created from B2B companies. However, we are able to work around some of the missing functionality.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
separate opp records from contacts and allow more than one contact to be attached to an opportunity

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
everything for marketing aside from landing pages.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
It is really hard to answer this question. The only reason we are still with Infusionsoft is because of the amount of money we have spent with them. After investing over $40,000, we are stuck until we can find a way out.
The only thing we like it for now is pulling up a client' s information and log client notes.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I don't know where to start because everything you do in infusion cost money. I started infusionsoft in 2008. The initial start up cost back then was over $6,000. To be quiet honest, we have spent over $40,000. This is not an exaggeration. We were told we can use Infusionsoft for all our client relationship management needs including setup automation to allow the system to do a lot of the work for us. The program actually creates more work and keep in mind we have 9 staff members. I have hired consultants, used my staff, and tried myself and this system is not working for us. I don't know how anyone can because I'm pretty computer saavy, we have the funds to invest money to make something work, we are patient and understanding, hence still with them since 2008, and they can't seem to make me happy in any way.
Our emails to prospects go to spam. I understand the nurturing system and the excuse they keep giving me. We nurture our list but even our clients don't always receive our emails.
We have tried all their "perfect customer cycle" and everything else they pitch that is supposed to fix all our issues but still no luck.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Do your research, don't fall for the "automation" buzz as this software really drains your time and money. I usually NEVER post these types of reviews but after 7 years with Infusionsoft I would like to share my experience so others don't get the same experience.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Helping families send their children to college while making it affordable.
No benefits other than all our clients information is in infusionsoft to access.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I love the campaign builder. You basically create a sequence of events (send an email, give them a call, etc.) by dragging icons onto a timeline and putting timers and event triggers in between. It allows me to handle leads automatically. It also allows me to create new customer nurturing campaigns. It's very visual and easy-to-use, plus it works! It was by far the most elegant system I tested.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Unfortunately there are many things that I dislike. Infusionsoft offers to import your data from any other CRM, however they really just import the "C", i.e. the contact information. All the history and notes are lost. You can pay to do a custom import, but they will just put all your history and notes into one big section and they become pretty useless.
Also, I just can't believe they don't offer responsive emails... seriously? It's an email marketing system, how can they be so behind? I was able to create a custom CSS responsive email and plug it into Infusionsoft. Since I'm not a programmer and was able to do it, why can't they?
Third, the customer service is kind of a joke. They send me surveys, I fill them and indicate that I've been unhappy and then nobody follows up with me. :/
Fourth, the CRM search window isn't very good. It only works well if you know the contact's first name. You have to go into a query if you want to search on anything else, which is really time consuming.
Fifth, if a customer signs up for a demo AND a newsletter, the system creates duplicate contacts. So the customer gets spammed by two email campaigns and I have to go through a de-duping step once a month. I wish the system was smart enough to just merge two identical leads--and if it is, I have never found information on how to make it work.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I would do your homework and demo as many CRMs and automated marketing systems you can before making a decision.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We are trying to scale our business and Infusionsoft has helped us follow up with leads, nurture new customers and send a monthly newsletter (which would not be responsive had we not created our own workaround).

all_reviews.review_title: Integrated functionality within one tool (CRM, Email Marketing, Lead pages, etc)
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The concept of simplifying integration to transition information from multiple points of functionality centralized to the CRM portion remains the common request of business owners.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The execution of that integration leads much to be desired. Here are a few critical points:
1) Email sending functionality does not properly leverage the same white-listed status as email providers.
2) Reporting at the CRM level is driven by pre-fabricated reports. This would actually be a plus IF there was an appropriate level of sophistication in the reports that properly drove informed decision making. Sadly this is not the case meaning that direct access to manipulate the indexed information within the tool to create your own reports remains the preferred functionality here.
3) The effectiveness of save buttons working to retain the changes made leaves much to be desired. Information at times requires repeat saves. This poses a serious risk to maintaining the integrity of data quality within the CRM. Businesses already require management of employees to follow consistent process in maintaining data quality and this issue compounds that problem significantly.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
The tool is not at the level it needs to be to provide a reliable and affordable integration properly. CRMs are not the only starting point to integrate from. Consider the type of business you run first to understand what technology out there remains critical to delivering your minimum viable product. Choose your focal point for integration based on that assessment.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Simplification of integrating multiple facets of a business to centralize information for the purposes of automation and informed decision making. Great idea if the darn thing worked properly.

all_reviews.review_title: If you are a SME, Infusionsoft is not for you.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The Sales Person follow up with you to close the deal.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft pays $500 referral fees to affiliates. Sales person misleading and false promises at sales stage. They will drag on and not let you cancel the subscription.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you are a SME Look for other product that requires less or no upfront. Infusionsoft uses your upfront cost to pay the affiliates that bring you in. So they entire business economics is not in favour of you.

If you need such a BIG product at the first place. If you are big enough, consider SAP. SAP lives on customer service.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
This product is not suitable for our business. And we encounter lots of issues cancelling the subscription.

Infusionsoft charges $2000 start up cost +$299 per month of service fee. Evan Samurin (the Sales) says if it is not for our company, they will do something to credit the upfront $2000 back to us. After we used it for a month our A/P emailed Evan saying infusionsoft is not for us, Evan says that he will forward the message to customer service. I haven't heard from infusionsoft again, We have followed up with Evan with no reply.

Our company credit card is billed month after month, which forced our company to call the credit card and cancel the card. Then someone from Infusionsoft customer service, Blake Ghormley emailed us saying we have unpaid balance. We asked Blake to communicate with Evan and credit us back for the months that I didn't use. Blake Ghormley disappeared again.

The problem of this product is, Infusionsoft pays $500 referral fee to the person introduce to them. So a lot of contractors will say that infusionsoft is good. But those contractor may only know how to use 5% of the product, which is similar to other lower cost competitors which pays less referral fees. And when you want to cancel, our experience is - they will skip your emails.

I personally would not recommend any company to use their service.
- Most companies would not need such a BIG solution. If you are big enough, you may consider SAP.
- Their $500 referral fee, and false sales promises is not someone would look for.
- Don't worry about cancelling with them, they skip these emails.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The program lets us pull together the key aspects of our sales and marketing processes without getting overwhelmed by data. Many CRM programs sap all the fun out of selling by making it all about the data. Infusionsoft really lets us store and use the data about customers we need but the views are clear and understandable and do not make my reps crazy.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Setting up automated campaigns takes some practice. It is a great feature but I really need someone on staff to be an expert and it is hard to ind that person in the midst of extensive growth - a good problem to have.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I highly recommend this system. There is a definite learning curve for the more complex functions, but most is very intuitive. The resource center to help you learn is truly one of the best I have ever seen. There is a community board where others will help you, and outstanding video library, an easily searchable user manual and chat support that is very good. Everything we need for sales, marketing and e-commerce is rolled up in this rep-friendly product.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We needed a solid CRM to track clients, handle business operations and drive leads to reps. IFS has done all that for us and more. Reps get consistent leads from our website and they can see what customers are doing and have done.

all_reviews.review_title: Total Transformation - move away from the big SAAS to Infusionsoft - couldnt be happier
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Easy - out of the gate - everything just works.
We didnt need to setup multiple API's and addons like the other SAAS

The campaign suggestions or the ability to upload our own from the library is brilliant.

The courses we did with eth implementation team have been invaluable.

We studies at the infusionsoft university and the accelerator and have been able to really hyperspeed up the entire learning curve in such a way that is only explained in terms of ease and speed to market.

The ability to get in deep at the university was brilliant - hands on classroom style was truly essential in terms of being able to get the feel and look of the software.

The accelerator saved us $20k in setup. it cost us $10k, but delivered over $45k in value.

Plus the networking at the events has been brilliant!

What do you dislike about Keap?
I dislike that sometimes things are sometimes slow to update - sometimes the save and load functions in the campaign builder is like dialup speed. Usually, I just go make a coffee and come back in a bit.

OR - I do something else on my TO_DO list!

And sometimes support is not always there - Aussie time.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Figure out what you REALLY need...then review the options

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have totally transformed my lead gen, profiling customers / segmenting as they 'qualify themselves'

all_reviews.review_title: The best CRM for Small Business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The very best part of Infusionsoft is its great automation engine that lets you program, automate and schedule each email campaign or message, based not only on time frames but most importantly, on user's actions.
It's also a very popular platform that easily integrates with tons of other services and platforms.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The only thing I think it's missing is its integration with STRIPE (payment service).
Stripe is becoming the standard for online payments and should be integrated ASAP into the e-commerce module.
As soon as Stripe will be implemented, I will start sending more traffic to the e-commerce module.
A minor missing feature is the responsive email design editor. I'm sure it will be added soon, meanwhile I've uploaded my own responsive design, and using it without any issue.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Take the coaching classes very seriously if you want to master it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
By automating my entire marketing funnels I was able to reach more clients without extra efforts and increase my sales by 78% just from the first campaign.
The followup strategy that I've applied (always in complete automation) helped me also to increase the feedbacks from customers, leads and prospects.
