all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I think Infusionsoft is best for people peddling e-books and knowledge products, that don't depend on presentation or design for differentiation. The campaign builder is cool for long, funnel based sales sequences but less of a differentiator these days, as the ability to create if/then response emails seems increasingly to be a standard feature for email platforms.

Customer service is excellent - no fault there (thanks Goldman Sachs).

What do you dislike about Keap?
I was optimistic about Infusionsoft as it seemed to check all the boxes - but seeing the current playing filed of CRMs and Marketing automation tools out there I am seriously considering moving.

Biggest complaint is that their emails aren't responsive - which in 2015 means your messages look bad on more than half of the devices. Text is way too small on mobile devices and messages don't even look that great on desktop (constrained  width, poor formatting options etc) . They keep saying that they're working on this but no date given for launch. Frankly, their software platform seems too bloated and "mature" for them to easily accomplish this without a total overhaul of the platform

There are serious bugs with certain browsers (ie, chrome, safari) that make working in the campaign builder frustrating.

I've discovered much better automation tools that are tailored  to an e-commerce owners (rare.io for instance) that also integrate directly with our Shopify platform.  Most are also much less expensive and dont require setup or expensive integration. (we're currently also paying $100/month just to connect Shopify with Infusionsoft)

Overall, while Infusionsoft is a fairly mature platform, this is now working against them as mobile takes over.  I think Infusionsoft is going to lose market share to smaller more nimble platforms that do one thing really well, and  integration between tools becomes simpler and more ubiquitous. You will end up with a few platforms but overall it will be cheaper and closer to what you actually need.

PS - It's hard to find Infusionsoft "reviewers" who aren't on the take. Infusionsoft has a very well developed reseller program having been around for a long time.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Beware of Infusionsoft "reviews" - many are written by resellers.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The platform is potentially very powerful but it requires a ton of time and effort to implement, test and troubleshoot campaigns. In our case, I thought this was going to help with our B2B outreach efforts - but have found that high value sales really can't be automated. The CRM by itself is decent but at $200/month there are much cheaper options. I was hoping to integrate everything in one system but looks like it will be cheaper and more effective for us to use the best specialized tools for each job. (currently exploring a combination of Base CRM and Mailchimp)

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft is quite easy to learn how to use. There are short video tutorials. Or for those times when you want a snappy quick answer or advice on a strategy about how to do an entire project (such as merchant banking) there is a whole team of online chat people to bug. There are examples and templates and even the occasional offer of  30-minute face-to-face (via webinex) consultations where you can get an Infusionsoft expert to tidy up your campaigns and fix things you've mucked up, while you watch in wonder.

What do you dislike about Keap?
To get full value from Infusionsoft you probably need to be a mature business. I'm not. I am a start up with no clients. Therefore my campaigns and landing pages simply collect dust because Google doesn't recognise them (for some reason) so they remain silent in searches. This lack of visibility means I can not build my own mailing list and Infusionsoft won't easily allow commercial mailing lists to be used within its system for ethical reasons, which means you HAVE to build your own mailing lists.... which is a slow process.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you have an existing mailing list of clients or potential clients it's a great product.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I've learnt a heap about marketing campaigns. I've easily been able to create professional landing pages supported by a robust system of thank you and conversion emails.

all_reviews.review_title: Love the results I get but sometimes it takes great efforts in time and resources to get there
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The CRM functions where  I can track my interactions with clients and prospects. Total analytics that I can see with my campaigns/emails showing the true effectiveness. I use the task features almost daily to keep up with the all important follow-ups and to-do(s) that I need to get accomplished.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Even though the Campaign Builder has simplified the process of campaign development and implementation I feel I need to have other outside (third party) resources to get the "full" value out of InfusionSoft. But like learning anything in life worthwhile that has great value, you must put in the time personally or hire the competent people to work the system/program for you on a daily basis to get that value.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
It might be a solution to replace many of your other existing systems but maybe not all. There will be some new learning curve issues but the results will be there if you put in the time to learn it well.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Follow-up with leads is always a challenge but we are implementing the automation to handle those tasks. One of the most difficult things is to map out my "whole" business structure to see how we can model it in InfusionSoft for developing automation and campaigns. We are using the program for our systems processes development.

Benefits realized so far has been from the additional revenue generated with the (follow-up) sequences and the marketing campaigns we have developed. I do appreciate the (free campaigns in the Marketplace) to use as is or modify to work with my business needs. These are a real time saver and give our team great ideas to create and launch new sequences.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusion soft is a great way to facilitate communication with your leads. It has tasks and email capability right from CRM.
It has an easy to use drag n drop automation builder. The simplistic design is easy to use and very intuitive.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It is very hard to use for teams. There is no collaboration between team members. The interface can be bulky and confusing to use especially if you use their opportunity object.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Continually communicating with your leads. The system auto emails and communicated according to actions by the lead.
It frees up time to nurture your hot leads while still maintains contact with your cold leads

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like the ability to automate follow-up emails for upcoming events. Being able to set the process up one time rather than having to repeat the process with every new participant that registers.

Snap is also a great feature. Love being able to use my phone to enter business card info into my CRM and knowing that the images of the business cards scanned are being read by a "real" person.

What do you dislike about Keap?
A lot of learning and training is needed to fully understand this software program and you have to be able to be willing to put in the work yourself to maximize the benefits of this software.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make sure that you are willing to make the time to learn the system.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
My follow up with clients and networking partners is improving. The automation process is helping reduce the amount of time I spend sending follow up emails for events and workshops. The phone app makes adding people's contact info that I have just networked, with much, much easier.

all_reviews.review_title: Wonderful experience with people and product
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like that this product is comprehensive and gives you a tool to manage a data base of contacts, campaigns, reports and your calendar all in one. My biggest challenge owning a business is staying disciplined enough to continue to learn the system, put out campaigns and build my database of contacts. Melissa my Infusionsoft marketing associate was bright, energtic, willing to learn about my business and give great suggestions on building campaigns. She even called me right before Thanksgiving to help me send out a card to my contacts.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I dislike that I need to stay disciplined to gain value from this. It is not automatic pilot. Make no mistake if you are paying for this each month you realize you better use it so the motivator is there.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
This is a commitment and you need to stay disciplined. I am in the process of working with an intern to see if they can spend all of their time using this for my company. Because I run the day to day of my business I can get sidetracked from using this tool and then I have to relearn things.  You have to learn the system and use some your marketing savy to develop campaigns but once you get going you will find the value in this.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am a new business and probably bit a little more than I can chew here but I wanted to begin building my list from the beginning and use a comprehensive system so that I started the right way. I didn't want to start by using a different program that only did one thing and then try to transfer all the information to a comprehensive system. I know people who have their lists in 4 locations and are trying to integrate all of that into one now. Do the work now so you won't need to do it later.

all_reviews.review_title: I just can't do it all alone!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
As a small business owner, time is my most precious commodity at this stage.  The ability to have Infusionsoft doing my marketing for me, while I attend to other tasks has become vital to my success.  While the campaigns take some time to develop, the end result is priceless in the automated/behavioral marketing areas of my business.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I have yet to find anything I dislike.  I was used to more flexibility and creativity in email design, but have quickly learned to create beautiful emails in Infusionsoft too.  The only feature I wish it had, was the ability to send text messages to my phone to remind me of tasks that are due.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I am saving TONS of time by allowing Infusionsoft to take my newsletter and continue the marketing process without my direct interaction.  My contacts are beautifully organized and I'm able to keep a handle on the vast amount of projects and tasks.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft is still Confusionsoft and will drain your budget
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Nothing.  InfusionSoft does allegedly provide a number of features, none of which seemed to work correctly.

What do you dislike about Keap?
InfusionSoft is a huge money drain beside the high monthly fee, the "kickstart" upfront fee is outrageous for the benefit received. You are forced to have your training sessions within 30 days whether you are ready or not.  Having to use them immediately keeps you from having a chance to really get into the software and figure out what you need help with.  My consultant gave me two campaigns that had nothing to do with my business.  The e-commerce never worked right and neither did my campaigns.  The tech support team was supposed to look into my campaign issue and never did.  Full of bugs and incredibly complex - a complete waste of money and time.

InfusionSoft also steers you towards highly priced partners such as PowerPay that provide zero value and poor service when you can use PayPal for a fraction of the cost and get great support.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Don't do it - not worth the price or time.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
The business issues that I was hoping to solve with InfusionSoft were having an integrated CRM, mail automation service and e-commerce provider.

review_question_answers.question: What do you like best about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: Nothing.  InfusionSoft does allegedly provide a number of features, none of which seemed to work correctly.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer:
InfusionSoft is a huge money drain beside the high monthly fee, the "kickstart" upfront fee is outrageous for the benefit received. You are forced to have your training sessions within 30 days whether you are ready or not.  Having to use them immediately keeps you from having a chance to really get into the software and figure out what you need help with.  My consultant gave me two campaigns that had nothing to do with my business.  The e-commerce never worked right and neither did my campaigns.  The tech support team was supposed to look into my campaign issue and never did.  Full of bugs and incredibly complex - a complete waste of money and time.

InfusionSoft also steers you towards highly priced partners such as PowerPay that provide zero value and poor service when you can use PayPal for a fraction of the cost and get great support.

review_question_answers.question: Recommendations to others considering Keap:
review_question_answers.answer: Don't do it - not worth the price or time.

all_reviews.review_title: Great for small biz but too basic for advanced marketing pros.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The CRM system governed by Infusionsoft "tags" and the email automatons you can fire based on those tags are really impressive for software this inexpensive. The campaign builder has just as much automation functionality as enterprise-level competitors that are 10x+ the price  (and even more so in some cases).

What do you dislike about Keap?
The email template builder is, in a word, pathetic. It's super buggy and frustrating to customize or edit anything. Lower level email clients that don't even offer automation have far superior design capabilities.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Be weary of their sales team and make sure you see every single function you want in a demo before moving forward. They'll tell you it can do anything you want but it's not always true.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have a huge email list with tons of customer data. Our goal was to segment them and deliver slick, automated campaigns based on their interactions with both our website and marketing campaigns.

However, we have decided to dump Infusionsoft after we realized that they over promised on some features. We asked very specifically if they could dynamically populate an image in the email creative based on a field in a particular user's CRM dataset. They told us we could do this out-of-the box, but after paying their onboarding fees they told us that this requires extra custom coding work. So, we are currently seeking a refund. Their sales team was shady and pushy the whole way and we were very disappointed to find out they lied about a key feature. Plus, as an experienced digital marketer who has used a variety of software products I was generally unimpressed with Infusionsoft once I dove into it.

I would still recommend IS to a small business owner who has little time on their hands/small budget and wants a powerful automation tool. However, if you're an experienced marketer I would pay for a better product.

all_reviews.review_title: Probably fine for small business, but anyone with experience marketing will be frustrated
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Creating forms for my website was very easy. Tagging also works well and we use this functionality to manage email lists. Auto responders and other triggered campaigns seems to work fine

What do you dislike about Keap?
The thing I have been most dismayed by was how over promised I was when it comes to cookies. I installed the web tracking code on my website, and since I saw the web visitor report I assumed I would be able to see who returned to our website. Completely untrue. The only time you know anything about visitor activity is if they fill out a form.

The mobile app is so basic as to be almost useless.

I have also been very surprised by their non-response to the known issue of working in multiple tabs. If you have two contacts or two opportunities open in different tabs, your data gets scrambled. They have known about this issue since Fall 2014 and it still is not fixed. This is a serious hamper to my workflow.

In general I just feel like I was over promised on functionality. I'm aware this software isn't super expensive, but at times it feels like Infusionsoft had some good ideas and just didn't carry them through to a worthwhile conclusion.

As others have said, the Quickstart program is ridiculously priced considering the number of hours you get. I also didn't feel like my consultant adapted well to the fact that I didn't need any basic help getting started.

On the bright side, since cookies mean nothing at all in IS, I'm not too worried about migrating to a new platform at some point in the near future. We won't be losing much!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you are upgrading from Mailchimp of Constant Contact and just want to manage a database and send nice looking emails (or if e-commerce is your #1 priority) this is worth considering, My company probably will save around 20k in this first year since we didn't go with Salesforce/Pardot while we grow as a marketing team.

If tracking and dynamic content is what you're looking for, just forget it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Form routing is working great. I can send a decent looking newsletter and see who looked at it. We're not using the e-commerce function so I can't speak for that.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Zilch.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Campaign Builder is the bomb! It's an easy-to-use tool that allows for visual representation of nurturing sequences. Loaded with features, I spend the most time in Campaign Builder. Infusionsoft also took care to build in multiple safety nets. Before a regular broadcast email can be sent, it must be marked ready and there are then confirmation steps. In Campaign builder, you can build drafts to your heart's content and nothing launches until you mark ready and then click Publish. And, if needed, you can stop the campaigns and remove 1 or more people from a campaign.  I appreciate this feature much more after working in another email platform that had zero safety nets built in. I also like their telephone support. These folks are professional, patient, and thorough. And the ease of setting up new products and purchase actions and using tags provides a lot of customization freedom in list segmentation.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The Reporting!  The reporting is substandard, often inconsistent and error prone (in accounting reports). Many of their accounting reports don't even total the revenue; that boggles my mind and forces me to use my calculator. Their web analytics are cumbersome to use so defer to Google Analytics.  And the email reporting is inconsistent. Sometimes, reporting won't even show up for specific emails sent through the Campaign Builder. Tech Support has informed me they are working on this inconsistency but it's been a few years, and the reporting seems to not be a priority. We can get by with it "as is" but it's not ideal.  I can't say I fully trust the reporting after experiencing glaring errors at times.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Biggest PRO is the Campaign Builder, the ease of building beautiful forms and emails, and the safety net features built in by Infusionsoft so that mistakes in sending are avoided. The learning curve may be longer than anticipated. Ensure your Order settings and Billing actions are set up in to ensure your customers are getting the proper notifications, for when their credit cards are set to expire, etc. Biggest CON... know in advance that the reporting is spotty at best. I understand they are working on it but I was told that 2 years ago and don't see any appreciable improvements in reporting. The numbers in the reporting vary at times. For example, 2+3 might = 6 one time then go back and it could = 7. That's an odd one, I know. And some pages total dollars and other pages don't... no rhyme or reason there and not helpful when trying to report quickly and accurately. And if sending emails through Campaign Builder, which is really the whole point, the reporting may or may not show up for those emails. Tech support recently told me (9/30/14) it was inconsistent and "Sorry, they're working on it." The web analytics tracking, which they upgraded in past year, is worse than before the upgrade. Cumbersome and not worth the effort. Rely on Google Analytics for your research. Be clear on the differences between using Order Forms and using Shopping Cart. There is so much going on in Infusionsoft. Lots of details that need to be set up properly beforehand. Some of the help tips are outdated as there have been upgrades but they are getting better about that. Overall, I enjoy working in Infusionsoft and am hopeful they'll get their Reporting up to snuff sooner than later.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Infusionsoft has been extraordinary for the 3 Infusionsoft-user clients I've worked with who are looking to convert more new business and retain/upsell customers. The nurturing sequences built in Campaign Builder are key to their success. With so much of the process now automated, we're free to expand into other areas of growth.

What do you like best about Keap?
I've used many systems in my career especially since I've spent my entire career to date in the software industry. Infusionsoft quickly proved to be a small business platform that can truly automate your business. Whether you need to get up and running fast or your business is complex and needs to be highly configured, Infusionsoft is still your best bet. It's so easy to setup everything from workflows, opportunities, email templates and even campaigns. The marketing automation and campaign creation was very new to me and I quickly found out how easy it is to setup goals and the workflow needed within Infusionsoft.

What do you dislike about Keap?
My only dislike is that when you search for something, you have to specify whether its a contact or company. Many other systems dont require you to specify that information and just do a 'search all' for you.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Infusionsoft has the tools within the product as well as the marketplace to get the job done for you. Since they love small businesses you can trust that the product works for you and the price will fall in line to meet your needs and budget.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a small business, we needed a CRM. Infusionsoft brought so much more to the table via the marketing automation and the TONS of widgets, apps and plugins available through the marketplace.

Training was terrible and after 3 out of 4 training sessions I had neither a full campaign nor an ecommerce store, in fact that was my first goal was to get the ecommerce done  because what use is a campaign without products to sell??? Please bare in mind im not tech savvy and made this very clear to infusion right from the start.
With one 45min training session remaining I went ahead and had a store designed elsewhere as the trainer neglected to tell me or instruct me that this could be done with infusion so I assumed what I was doing was correct. To cut a long story short when I stumbled across the fact that I could have done this with INFUSIONSOFT I contacted them and they admitted fault and apologised and offered for me to start my training all over again and reduced monthly rates etc. I politely declined and requested a full refund because as a small business I didnt have the time to start again and they had failed me. I was refunded for the last 45 minute training session I didnt receive and a months installment that was taken from my account after cancellation and although they didnt deliver and admitted fault they refused to refund me the full amount a wasted total of over $3000 and to make this go away  they refuse to respond to my emails.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Be careful as there are alot of other honest customers in my same position

all_reviews.review_title: The All In One Marketing Platform All Small Businesses Should Be Using
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I run marketing for an executive coaching company.

I'm the only full time employee running marketing among other things, so I need to have tools that make it effective to run marketing when resources are tight.

Infusionsoft has allowed me to do a myriad of marketing campaigns and experiments that I couldn't have otherwise. From managing our database of prospects and customers, to running full blown marketing campaigns. The variety of plugins that support Infusionsoft make it easy to do pretty much anything you have in mind without hiring an expensive developer.

Pros:
- Variety of marketing tools at your disposal
- Lots of 3rd party support for landing pages, web forms, integrations, etc
- Pretty easy to learn

What do you dislike about Keap?
There are a few areas Infusionsoft is known to be lacking in.

Cons:
- Email builder is a messy tool
- Webform builder is trash. Don't expect your webform design to be pretty
- Customization, although you can do lots of different things with Infusionsoft as it is. You will find at some point you may need certain customizations made in order to run a campaign exactly the way you like (webinar integration, timed offerings, etc)

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Infusionsoft to do anything marketing related. We do lots of marketing functions with it, including building our email list, sending newsletters, running campaigns, and selling products.

It's been an effective tool for selling our services and products as well as building a list.

all_reviews.review_title: Power under the hood. Don't be fooled by the phrase "Small Business Software!"
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft has a powerful automation engine to put in place marketing and sales processes your business is relying on. First, create the marketing+sale business process on your whiteboard, paper, or a napkin. Brainstorm it with your team, and then apply it inside the Campaign Builder of Infusionsoft, Results will blow you away, especially if you implement it with the guidance of an Infusionsoft Certified Professional.

The Automation in Infusionsoft is superb for both automating your contact points with your leads and customers, as well as with your internal sales and support staff.

Disclosure: I am an Infusionsoft Certified Professional.

What do you dislike about Keap?
There is a definitely a learning curve. However, Infusionsoft provides great training resources both FREE and paid. This could be overcome by also contacting the ever-ready to help community of users, and certified partners.

Some of the shortfalls are analytics and reporting. However, analytics can be augmented by other systems and adds ons you can get from their Marketplace. Some free, some are paid. Reporting still needs some work.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Highly recommended. If you run a business, having Infusionsoft is like having extra people on your staff.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps me to track my sales pipeline. It helps me automate a lot of follow-up tasks, email campaigns, and general organization.

The automated and fully customizable process of lead capture from the website, to auto responding, to auto lead nurturing and staying top-of-mind with the prospects is what I love about Infusionsoft.

The biggest value is that it helps me make sure no lead or customer get dropped or falls through the cracks. If Infusionsoft if properly implemented "the cracks" are sealed permanently.

all_reviews.review_title: Powerful platform for Marketing Automation, CRM and eCommerce
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft provides a platform for true automation of marketing functions and integration of ecommerce with marketing.  The Campaign Builder is a visual tool that makes it easy to implement sequences over time.  Being able to drag and drop and copy these functions makes it easy to implement customized and personalized messages to different segments.

The API provides an opportunity to solve just about any issue that might come up.

Some members of our team were sole simply by the mobile 'SNAP' application that lets you take a picture of a business card and then puts the info right into the database making it easy to tag and segment the contact.

What do you dislike about Keap?
With the rapid development of the product it is sometimes difficult to keep up with new features.  There is still some legacy functionality that is not integrate really well but that is more of a learning issue than a functionality issue.

The ecommerce store is great for some uses but not universally applicable to all types of business.

Like many 'cloud' applications there can be a perception of slowness for the app

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Either get started with a good partner (outside of infusionsoft) or get great training for yourself or a team member.  The software is not the easiest to implement and is definitely not great for untrained 'button pushers'.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
1.  Lead generation - developed one new market with just this one tool
2. prospect nurturing - great relationship building tools via email, snail mail and phone
3. ecommerce - online sales of intangible products works really well
4.  customer satisfaction surveys -  reveals follow up opportunities
5.  Webinar promotion, booking and follow is automated and personalized

all_reviews.review_title: The worst software company I have ever dealt with
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Their automated marketing is decent and is the only reason I ever used the software.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Where to begin? Let me give a list:
1) I have submitted about 15 bugs to them over two years. Not one of those bugs has been fixed.
2) Many of my contacts in the crm were deleted due to an interface flaw in their software. They blamed me AND charged me to restore the contacts.
3) Half the time when I ask for an update on feature requests and bug fix status, they simply never get back to me.
4) Bugs, bugs, and more bugs. So many bugs in their program.
5) Here is one example of their horrible interface and how they refuse to fix the obvious: If I set up an email that I want to send to contacts, there is a small button at the very bottom of the email that cannot be seen unless one scrolls all the way down. This button says "Ready to send". Unless you select Yes, this email will not be sent. Even if I attempt to send this email, I get no warning that I haven't selected Yes for that ridiculous setting. I am told that the email was sent. But guess what: The email is not sent. They refuse to call this a bug and will not fix it.
6) When selecting fields for a CRM view there are well over 100 fields to choose from. These fields cannot be searched, they are not in alphabetical order, and there is no rhyme or reason to how they are ordered. It takes so long to create a search as I look through the fields and try to find the ones I want.
7) They claim to have a survey tool. It is so bad that they don't even use it. They sent me a survey about their software using SurveyChimp and not their own software. What does that say about their program?

I could go on and on. Their management there is the worst. Just the worst. They keep trying to add things to the software without fixing anything left behind. They pound you with ads for their conferences, which of course make them money. But they won't fix bugs and they won't listen to feature requests. Stay away from them at all costs.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Staying in touch with my customers and prospects.

What do you like best about Keap?
Possibly nothing was beneficial about this software... From its confusing setup, complicated campaign building and need to hire out for trained professionals - it was an absolute headache.

What do you dislike about Keap?
They don't refund on a month-to-month contract.
So, if it is similar to what happened to our business, where they auto-billed us on the 3rd, but we had tried to cancel our subscription the month prior (and they conveniently have no record of this request) , they will not refund, pro-rate or expedite the cancellation process.
Their management team is extremely hard to contact - trying to get ahold of the cancellation team in order to verify any sort of cancellation process at all is like trying to find a needle in a dark room.
Their live chat is slow and their entire software platform is not built for ease of use, it's built so you have to spend extra time and money training personnel to run it.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I would recommend looking into other platforms if you are thinking of doing all of your mailing, marketing and customer management.
Infusionsoft = Confusionsoft

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Benefits? We went with Ontraport instead. They are built for our business (coaching and consulting) and are extremely easy to use.

all_reviews.review_title: Not a solution for a small business with an existing CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The support and training people were top of the line.  They were always helpful and ready with answers.  The rest of the team was equally great.   They even made the cancellation process easy it only took a few emails and two phone calls to get to Tara the Loyality Manager.  She was very polite and took my feedback like a champ.  By the way, you are REQUIRED to speak with someone before they cancel your account.

What do you dislike about Keap?
This application requires extensive setup so estimate about 20 hour per week over 4 weeks to get it setup.  Once I got to the trainer, he stated that it normally took about 90 days to setup but could be done more quickly if you have more time.   There was no integration with the CRM I have been using for 4 years even through the sales person assured me that one existed.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you are a small business owner make sure you have the resources to handle migrating data and setting up this solution.  This is not something you will get up and fully running in 30 days.   Most importantly, make sure they have integration with your existing CRM.  If they don't I would avoid it.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
My goal was to automate some marketing and convert more leads to sales.   However, with the extensive setup and no integration with our CRM I had to cancel as I couldn't expect my team to enter data twice and still take care of our clients.

all_reviews.review_title: I have a love/hate relationship with Infusionsoft
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The marketing campaigns are really easy to put together in the visual tool called

What do you dislike about Keap?
I keep needing it to do things that it doesn't do (yet). When I was a beginner with the system I was amazed and lost. Now, a few years later, it has greatly improved but I keep finding things I need it to do that it can't.

Any marketing platform that doesn't have split testing built in needs to consider whether it is truly a marketing platform.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
get help when you need it. Don't be afraid to ask questions. Don't be a donor.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Automation is the biggest benefit. Taking any mundane task and building it into the system is one of the best things about Infusionsoft. Even internal processes like HR can benefit.

all_reviews.review_title: Remarkably limited for lead generation and marketing support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The UI is designed well and easy to use. The tools and navigation is intuitive and our team was able to get up to speed on using it pretty fast. Also, like the concept of the visual campaign creation tool. The customizable dashboard is nice too.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The main lead generation features such as the web form maker and the email builder tools are extremely limited and don't work well. The email builder, in particular, is so limited and problematic that I'm exploring other third-party email marketing tools to handle our outgoing communications.

Additionally, tech and account support has become increasingly less accessible. When we first started with Infusionsoft, we had a dedicated account manager which is no longer the case. Tech support tickets are not always responded to in a timely manner.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Business problems:
1) Centralized and accessible client database
2) Lead generation
3) Marketing campaign automation
4) Sales support/opportunity management
Benefits:
1) We have a centralized client/contact database that can be accessed via computer or mobile via the app
2) We currently run all our outbound marketing communications thru Infusionsoft and track opens, clicks, etc
3) We have 4 - 5 marketing campaigns set up in Infusionsoft and tied to web forms that are housed on our site
4) Use Infusionsoft to track our sales opportunities and for reporting to staff

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft for membership sites and campaigns
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I provide tech support for heart-based entrepreneurs.  I have used Infusionsoft when doing work with clients who are using it.   I like Infusionsoft and if it wasn't so expensive, I wouldn't mind having it myself.   I have worked on a couple of membership sites where we used Imember360 integrated with Infusionsoft to provide very powerful control of member access.  I really give kudos to their customer support.  I have spent many hours on the phone with their reps to achieve what I was after.  They are always nice, helpful and mostly knowledgeable.  It is such a complex system, it is possible to get a great support rep who really knows the product inside and out.  Those are nice times!  They have guided me to the best use of their system, rather than just helping me do what I asked. Sometimes there are possibilities the user is not aware of.  Sometimes, I have had support reps who did the best they could, but they weren't sure of the best way to use some latest features.

The system is so flexible and powerful, my guess is that most users are using only a small part of the features.

What I like best is the ability to create very specific campaigns, where emails and memberhip site access is controlled by using tags.  It is kind of fun to make a campaign in their editor and see in a visual form the process you are trying to create.



What do you dislike about Keap?
I dislike the high cost, both for start-up and monthly use.  I don't like that many of the features add on even more fees.   I don't mind the complexity for myself, but it can be hard for my clients to use.  It requires a pretty good effort to be able to actually use the product.  Some of it is not intuitive - when I started to use the system, it was so complicated to just create a simple email that I wanted to send to some people.   I haven't tried to do that recently, so I'm not sure if they have simplified the process more.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
There are some products being offered that focus on the pieces that typical businesses or entrepreneurs need at a lower cost.  Many of those might be a better choice if your business is not super complex.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
I have been solving the problem of protecting access to certain website pages based on actions of the contact.

all_reviews.review_title: Headaches, stress, anxiety + loads of bugs, unreliable programming + incompetent support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The ability to build complex campaigns and the API flexibility is amazing (if you know programming). But that's about it as far as pluses.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Oh man... where do I start??

First of all, their shopping cart is HORRENDOUS. If you have a membership product, stay FAR FAR away. In fact, run as fast as you can AWAY from InfusionsIoft.

In order to cancel a subscription, there are 3 steps. There online documentation only lists 2 of the 3 steps and their support staff is highly incompetent (more on that later). So if you miss a step because you trusted their step-by-step instructions, you'd either get chargebacks or miss out on subscription payments that were supposed to be rebilled or cancelled but were not. In my case, this cost me at least $3000 in lost sales not to mention the chargebacks that occured because of system issues.

Today (Sept 29, 2014) I found one subscription that was still active, never canceled and had all the right settings from FEBRUARY 2014, which was supposed to be billed monthly. However, this customer was never rebilled due to some mysterious Infusionsoft bug. I looked at the order history and guess what? The Infusionsoft system decided to bill the customer on 9/23/14 - 6 MONTHS AFTER the last rebill was supposed to happen. Luckily the customer's card was declined. But just imagine the nightmare that would have been if the payment was successful... refund/chargeback, bad reviews, complaints... And I have hundreds of customers. Am I to review every single file in Infusionsoft's clunky interface to find these bugs? This is just flat out wrong.

Now let's get to their highly incompetent tech support staff. When I see an issue like this, my first instinct is to obviously FIX THE SETTINGS (i.e. cancel the subscription so that the customer doesn't get rebilled AGAIN when Infusionsoft feels like it). But --- if you are going to send this to their support, you CANNOT change a single thing. You'd have to leave everything as is or else they cannot help you because they have no way to check on or replicate the issue. Then, you just have to wait and hope and pray that they will get back to you with a solution before the next rebill date (30 days away) - which would be a miracle.

I've sent them many support tickets and I learned that you have to document everything single thing with screen shots and videos or they do not believe that you even had the issue to begin with. And on top of that, they have never come back to me with a valid solution. I've either gotten "It's taking longer than usual to resolve this..." and never hear back from them again OR "This is a known bug..."  Now, how are you supposed to run your business knowing that the system is just going to randomly fail for no valid reason at all AND nothing is going to be done to fix it??

Their campaign functionality cannot be trusted either. If subsequent actions happen "too fast" (too fast means within 30 MINUTES), then you run the risk of steps in your sequences being skipped and just flat out not running at all. And keep in mind, this happens randomly so you will have no control and you'd have to check everyday for weird bugs that Infusionsoft will never help you fix because the cases are "one off". Last week I emailed Infusionsoft regarding this exact case - no response yet. I've seen this happening in several other campaigns (campaign sequences getting skipped because the previous action happened too quickly), but I've been resigned to just live with all of these "one off" programming exceptions.

Oh and "PayPal integration?" Forget about it. If you need to refund a PayPal client, you'll have to do it twice. Once in Infusionsoft and once in PayPal. What about PayPal eChecks that take a few days to clear? Infusionsoft still counts them as VALID sales on the date of the transaction. Good thing PayPal sends email notifications of these things - because if you trusted your Infusionsoft transaction reports, you'd think the sales are paid for when in reality, they're not.

Reporting and analytics?? Despite all of the headaches and nightmares I have experienced with failing campaigns, I have to say that reporting is THE WORST feature of Infusionsoft. Example: You have a subscription product and you set the system to attempt to autocharge 4 times, once a day. Each time it fails, Infusionsoft still counts that as part of your gross revenue, even though it is ONE payment from ONE customer and the payment didn't go through. Of course, you can add some tags and filters to the report to get it to show the right numbers... but shouldn't the sales reports show the right numbers without having to go through all these extra steps??

The interface is not intuitive - which is why you have to pay $2000 to hire someone to teach you how to use it (aka "Kick Starter Package"). What they don't tell you is if you have a lot of activity going out in your app, it gets slower and clunkier. So even if you're paying a pretty penny for more contacts and users, it'll still get more and more clunky and even slower. Each month, every sales rep in my organization has to take at least one day off due to this system slowness.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If I had known all of the issues that I would have experienced beforehand and how dependent my business would become on such an unreliable system, I would have NEVER EVER considered Infusionsoft.

But if you have a small business (no more than a few hundred contacts) and do not sell a subscription product, it might be okay... Their marketing automation is cool when it works properly. But please DO NOT use their shopping cart.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
In theory, the things that you can do with the system to automate and make your business more efficient is amazing. But in practice, all the bugs and failing campaigns causes a lot of unnecessary stress and loss of customers. It really sucks knowing that Infusionsoft is just not a system that you can trust that the code is good and the campaign/programming will work.

all_reviews.review_title: Helped me to build and then sell my company for 8 figures!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?


Flexibility! If I want to send emails, no problem. Faxes - Done. Internal communications - No problem. Voice mail - You betcha'. No other software can do this - It's not just online marketing it's fully integrated marketing software that even gives you a visual campaign builder to boot!

What do you dislike about Keap?
I wish it was free, but then again I am a cheapskate so I really don't want to pay for anything. But if I look at the ROI on this software I should thank the Gods that it was available to help me build my business at any cost!

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Like anything worth pursuing there is a bit of a learning curve on the front end. But either you learn up front the easy way - When they are there to teach you and it's new and exciting OR You learn the hard way with other CRM software that won't do everything this software can do and lose your pants in lost clients, lost opportunities and lost revenue.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Like I said earlier, fully integrated online and offline and oh yeah, did I mention I had all of my outside sales staff on it too. Scheduling and rating sales appointments and getting me feedback for this national sales effort. I had sales staff in 6 different states and 4 physical locations all using Infusionsoft.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The combination of CRM + email automation in one, at a fraction of the cost of the market leaders.
The visual drip campaign setup is unique, allowing you a better understanding of the automation flow.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The CRM is clunky and slow. Every action requires too many clicks
Email drag and drop editor is very buggy. It took the team x2 the time to create campaigns on I/S, compared with Mailchimp.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Do get a full trial version, and try to use the CRM and send several email test campaigns before making a decision.
Do not commit to the high-price setup+ training cost.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Recording all communications with customer in a CRM
Segmenting customers and sending targeted marketing email campaigns

Unfortunately, he is not near enough to cover the rest of the B.S. artists living there .  Not to mention, it's Super complicated and expensive compared to everything else I tried, which are about 5-6 other far better solutions and companies who will work with you.  There is a reason they are losing so much business to better competitors who are more honest and service-oriented.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about Keap?
review_question_answers.answer: "HOOK" of up-front payment is near impossible to get out of after you find that their system is worse than many other options that are much cheaper, including Ontraport, PWC, Greenrope, and several others I sampled.  Infusionsoft is the ONLY HARD-SELL, NO EXIT, MONEY UP-FRONT out of all these.  Don't risk the up-front time and money on this shark-like organization.  They are smooth and sleek, but they aim to eat you alive.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: Infusionsoft is the only business problem I have had in the near past.

all_reviews.review_title: My business is open while I am asleep
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I've played with many other cheaper systems and wasted both time and money. Once you get your head around tagging and campaign sequences, Infusionsoft is really quite simple. At last a product where you don't have to fit what you want to do around a product's features. This does what I want for my business - and even more powerful now I've upgraded to using CustomerHub.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It would be great if campaigns were editable on an iPad, i.e. With an HTML5 interface. I think the form builder could be more snazzy too. UK support is pretty dire but the US support more than makes up for it. I wish server updates which are done in US time didn't impact so much on UK trading hours.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Make sure you have 2-4 weeks to get your head around it or employ someone who has done it before.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
Since upgrading to Customerhub, my online sales went cash positive within a week.

all_reviews.review_title: Good product, steep learning curve, company is disorganized and lacks integrity
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
If your business requires a lot of email marketing and follow up, you set it and forget it. It is a very good flexible and customizable program that automates all of that.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The company is difficult to work with and less than ethical. The learning curve is pretty steep and their training times are very limited. Be prepared to train very slowly with long gaps between sessions.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
None. The product was over promised upon purchased. We were told that it could meet our needs and provide the tools that we were getting from 2 separate programs in one package AND so much more. Unfortunately I wasted a lot of time with this program. I kept asking my "Success Coach" to show me how to do this certain simple but very necessary task he kept avoiding giving me a straight answer.  When my "Success Coach" got down to the last session and showed me their work around to performing a very basic task, I knew that their product was not for us. They wasted 2 months of my time and refused to refund our money. When I asked them about over promising their product and their money back guarantee, I was told that they had an investment in training and refused to make good on their word. A loss of $2000 is not going to kill me, but I was surprised at their disorganization and lack of maturity and integrity. Don't want the product if I can't trust the company.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft helps me to understand where my focus needs to be at a glance!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft helps me to automate and personalize my email communication to customers and prospects. I just started to use the HOT LEADS function and love it! I am alerted when someone in my mailing list is engaging with my touches, and this allows me to step in, and send a personal email or phone call. The system was designed to help me organize my leads, and then close sales, and I am excited for where it will take me.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The learning curve, but really, it just meant that I needed to get involved with how to set up my own campaigns and application. As the owner, I really SHOULD have a solid understanding of how it all works.

What problems is Keap solving and how is that benefiting you?
We just launched our programs and services (Entrepreneurship Courses Online)  over the summer and have a new membership site (using iMember360). IS has been an integral component for how I run my campaigns see who is working and who is not. I can see who is reading the lessons, clicking on links and opening the emails sent to them so I know which users need more support.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I am working with a client that moved from Zoho to Infusionsoft.  IS is very powerful when it comes to marketing campaigns.  Managing customers and prospects through multiple processes.  It is also great for integrating your Electronic commerce with the system.

What do you dislike about Keap?
I believe that it is lacking in many basic needs of a user for a CRM system.  Updating data is cumbersome.  Many of the things that I took for granted in GoldMine are missing from IS.  Infusionsoft is expensive for a small business.  They recently rolled out an upgrade that wiped out my e-mail templates.  Support has been very spotty and in general not great.  I will say in their defense that this client is not using a lot of the functionality and is probably not using much right.  I would love to see a great implementation to see how this can really be used.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If your main priorities are e-commerce and marketing campaigns then this is a great tool.

all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The best part about InfusionSoft is the mindset that you get into when thinking big picture from generating business, nurturing leads, on boarding new customers, up selling customers and generating referrals.

The CRM functionality for managing the sales pipeline has helped me focus more on following up with leads (automatically and manually).

The visual campaign builder makes it very easy to build incredibly powerful, automated marketing sequences.

I'm sure I've only seen the tip of the iceberg since I've only been using it for a few months, but so far it is wealth worth the investment. I'm currently a one person company and since getting IS, I'm now bringing on enough new clients to hire my first employee.

There is somewhat of a learning curve though. Having the training coach for 4 hours in the first month is great and all, but you're still trying to wrap your head around everything. I've been utilizing the live chat support recently and they've been a great help.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The original training is something that I think can be better leveraged. Although I admit it's partially my own fault, it's a situation where you don't know what you don't know, so asking the right questions and having them show you things that you want might not be the best on boarding process. But there are sooo many things to cover, I don't know how it could be improved exactly.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're ready to take your business to the next level, InfusionSoft is a great platform. It helps with so many different facets. But be ready and willing to dive in and learn by experiencing it yourself.

all_reviews.review_title: Amazing power, automation and eCommerce for such a low cost
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Easy to set up E-Commerce without any of the hassle. Once the gateway information is typed we are ready to sell. This makes PCI compliance a breeze for any small business. The interactive Campaign Builder is without a doubt the easiest tool to learn and teach in the marketing automation space. Within a couple of minutes you can have a simple sequence setup with a lead capture on your website.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Infusionsoft does not do a great job of communicating new feature roll outs. It is more or less just something that shows up in your account at very unpredictable times. But, every 3 - 6 months there are always new improvements to the software.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Get in touch with the guys at Idea212.com. They have a ton of experience in a variety of platforms. They will explore your situation to help guide you to the right solution. If you are not a business that is well organized, Infusionsoft will be a challenge. But do not see this as a bad thing. Systems and organization are important for any business to go.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft is a kick butt automated marketing system for small business owners.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
If you want to build systems for you business then this software is simply the best. It systematizes your marketing, internal processes, client interaction, and can literally help you improve your businesses productivity and profitability.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Currently as of April 2013 I'm not to crazy about their email builder. Yes it has drag and drop functionality which is pretty cool, because you can quickly build a nice looking email with relative ease. However, if you plan on writing your emails within the builder it will occasionally omit letters as you type and sometimes it will change the entire font for no apparent reason. In addition to that I hear that the next software update will totally fix this issue. Which will totally rock. We'll see how goes whenever the new update is made public.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If you're sick of juggling a shopping cart, email marketing, a CRM, and/or a sales system like Salesforce then this is the system you need. It combines all of those into one complete system so everything is talking to each other. For example, if I have an autoresponder with 7 emails scheduled and someone buys my product from my shopping cart it will stop the 7 email autoresponder and start a "new customer upsell" autoresponder series. That's only a small simplified sample of what it can do.

all_reviews.review_title: The new Infusionsoft 2013 release - quick review
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
The new release has a plethora of new features that have transformed what is already a very powerful application. Of note, the campaign builder is excellent with a ton of new drag and drop enhancements.

We have over 30 clients using Infusionsoft now and almost without exception the feedback is excellent. There are occassional moans of course but nothing major. The consistent issue we hear though is the lack of focus and applicability for B2B focused companies of 'brick and mortar' variety.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The CRM capabilities of Infusionsoft, although very powerful and great value for money compared to all others (even some standalone CRM apps), lacks applicabilty for B2B companies. Infusionsoft assumes that your sales force are taking orders online and has no allowance to capture traditional 'sales to business' inventory orders without using the API and even then it is very cumbersome.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
If CRM is your primary focus then make sure that you have checked that the historic orders functions work for you. If you are selling online then its totally applicable to your business, otherwise, its not a great fit at the moment but Infusionsoft are working on this.

all_reviews.review_title: One Great Platform for Automated Closed-Loop Marketing
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft gives you an API so you can even further extend it's functionality with intelligent software solutions. They are committed to helping their customers with innovative new features as well as being highly responsive to issues or inquiries.

What do you dislike about Keap?
It has limited web browser support in it's current version (Firefox is most robust) and from time to time there can be frustration with a new update (though these are programmed quarterly and they announce in advance when things will be changed)

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Have clear ambitions for campaigns you want to set up (think about the areas of your customer service that you want to specifically use Infusionsoft for) this will get you outcomes very quickly. Be prepared for a learning curve even if you're an advanced CRM user - the tagging and tag categories can be a mine-field. Find yourself someone you can go to for building your complex campaigns and pulling together interconnectedness amoung campaigns once your off-the ground and wanting to get sophisticated outcomes from the platform.

review_question_answers.answer: Have clear ambitions for campaigns you want to set up (think about the areas of your customer service that you want to specifically use Infusionsoft for) this will get you outcomes very quickly. Be prepared for a learning curve even if you're an advanced CRM user - the tagging and tag categories can be a mine-field. Find yourself someone you can go to for building your complex campaigns and pulling together interconnectedness amoung campaigns once your off-the ground and wanting to get sophisticated outcomes from the platform.

all_reviews.review_title: Take the time to set it up right
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
I like that all customer intelligence is gathered in one place - marketing emails, shopping cart software, sales force automation, accounting, and credit card processing. They're constantly making improvements on the software. Their support team is VERY SMART and you get high-level answers.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The reports could use some improvement. The Outlook sidebar needs to be updated so it works with Outlook 2013.  I have confidence that they will update soon.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Take the time to set Infusionsoft up right. Think through your options. Work with someone who's experienced because there are lots of hidden features that can add a ton of value....but you won't find these features if you do it yourself without instruction or guidance.

all_reviews.review_title: Robust but with a learning curve
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Everything you need in one place to manage your offerings, customers, affiliates, etc. Detailed options for auto-responders and up-sells. Love how easy it is to give affiliates everything they need in one place to be successful.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Very steep learning curve and can be overwhelming when first integrating it into your business...kind of like drinking from a fire hose if your not careful. But if you can get past that it will save you time and increase your profits in the long run.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
I recommend the product but get the right talent to help you set it up correctly for what you need.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft's product is ideally suited for small to medium sized businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Infusionsoft's integrated CRM/marketing automation product makes it easy to set up and run in a day-to-day setting.

What do you dislike about Keap?
The product has its limitations and doesn't scale well so if your business is experiencing rapid growth or has plans to this may not be the best product for you.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Have a clear plan of what you expect to get out of your CRM/marketing automation software before purchase. After purchase this will shorten implementation.

all_reviews.review_title: Ok for USA clients not so for UK businesses
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Its cheap and has no contract, although this is also a disadvantage when worrying about Data Sovereignty and Prism etc

What do you dislike about Keap?
Lack of UK support, looks like they pulled our of the UK this year and have no local people or local hosting!  Also with no contract option means users in the UK can be left shy of the Data Protection act principals.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Is it marketing or CRM ?  for CRM check out the G2 CRM grid for stronger CRM offerings.

all_reviews.review_title: Infusionsoft- Good for first year and basic capability bad for scale!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Keap?
Its much cheaper than most market alternatives. It has a good e-mail marketing platform.

What do you dislike about Keap?
Its lead nurturing and lead scoring capabilities are terrible and the e-mail templates can consistently break. Not built for companies that want to scale.

Recommendations to others considering Keap:
Good for the first year or so for a startup until you can afford a better product.
